name: Dance Floor Construction
description_book: Come out and help us set up the fabulous floor in the European Dance Pavilion!

name: Wagon Homes
description_book: Period carts and wagons, what adaptations work to make it a Pennsic camping/storage wagon. Includes some of my available resources.
description_web: A discussion of period carts and wagons, what adaptations work to make it a Pennsic camping/storage wagon. Includes some of my available resources. Also, why these are *not* necessarily 'Gypsy' wagons. There are many different uses, from kitchens or showers to sleeping to 'gracious living'. Also, various building materials that work or don't work, etc. A look at my wagons and some of my neighbors after the class, and a map of others who are willing to let you look.

name: Service Dogs in the SCA
description_book: What is a service dog? How do service dogs fit into the hobby we love and how do we adapt?
description_web: What is a service dog? How do service dogs fit into the hobby we love and how do we adapt?

name: Anglo-Saxon Kings
description_book: From Offa to Harold, Redwald to Ethelred, the Kings of England gave us some of the best stories about kings ever!
description_web: From Offa to Harold, Redwald to Ethelred, the Kings of England gave us some of the best stories about kings ever! Just a collection of great stories about Anglo-Saxon Kings. From the earliest kings to the latest, from fighting Celts, to Vikings, to Normans, dealing with queens and saints, these guys had so much energy and wit and craziness an hour is not enough, but I'll talk fast!

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.
description_web: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.

name: Intro to Woodworking: Axe, Adze, Froe, Drawknife
description_book: Introduction to the use of axes for woodworking. Selection, sharpening and safety emphasized, then moving on to drawknives.
description_web: Intro to use of hatchets, axes and adzes for woodworking and wood carving. Since these tools are potentially the most dangerous of any of the tools in our woodworking arsenal, I feel it is imperative that correct safe methods be introduced to our population. Selection, sharpening, handling and safety will be covered. The class will segue into the class on rendering log sections into furniture parts with the use of the froe, drawknife, shavehorse, and spokeshave

name: Range Setup
description_book: Setup of thrown weapons range. Setup will be divided between two days.
description_web: Setup of thrown weapons range. Setup will be divided between two days.

name: Set up:  Amphitheater and Rehearsal Tent
description_book: Set up in Amphitheater and Rehearsal Tent: signs, chairs, and other necessary Performing Arts properties for classes and events.
description_web: Set up in Amphitheater and Rehearsal Tent: set up signs, chairs, and other necessary Performing Arts properties for classes and events.

name: Viking Navigation and the Sunstone
description_book: Early navigation methods up through Viking times, plus the use of sunstones. What the History Channel's 'Vikings' series almost got right - sort of.
description_web: The methods of navigation employed by the Viking navigators are slowly being verified by archaeological evidence. However, the search for answers goes on. This class will present early navigational aids based on discussions with two of the experts in this field: Soren Thirslund's research on the 'Viking Compass' at the Danish National Maritime Museum and Leif Karlsen's and our own research into sunstones. The published works of Thirslund and Karlsen are available from the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde, Denmark. We provide hands-on demonstrations and primary source documentation of these authors’ navigation theories.

name: Wire-Wrapped Jewelry
description_book: Learn the basics of wire-wrapped jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. Bring tools and materials if you have them.
description_web: Learn the basics of wire-wrapped jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. Please bring tools, wire and beads if you have them. There will be some tools available to borrow and some to purchase at cost.

name: Beginner Beadwork
description_book: History of beadwork within the SCA period. Techniques for beading on fabric.
description_web: History of beadwork within the SCA period. Techniques for beading on fabric.

name: The Melon Basket
description_book: The melon basket is pictured in many Psalters and Books of Hours. It's a ribbed basket with God's Eyes.
description_web: Tthe melon basket is pictured in many Psalters and Books of Hours. It's a ribbed basket with God's Eyes.

name: Beginning Kumihimo
description_book: Part 1: Learn the basics of Japanese braiding using the modern foam disk. Students will learn a round, square and flat braid.
description_web: Part 1: Learn the basics of Japanese braiding using the modern foam disk. Students will learn a round, square and flat braid. Uses for, history and names of braids will be discussed. Students may bring own equipment if desired.
fee_itemization: total class is 10.00 if just handout 3.00

name: Henna History and Application
description_book: Learn how and why henna was used in period, and how you can use it yourself. We will mix some henna in class; everyone gets some to try.
description_web: Learn how and why henna was used in period, including traditions, materials, and techniques, and how you can use it yourself today. We will mix some henna in class, which for me (becoming a professional artist) was the hardest part to learn; everyone gets some to use and take.
fee_itemization: One cone of fresh henna paste. You may also take the class without this, or bring your own.

name: Building a Clay Oven
description_book: Hands-on class for constructing a clay oven. Class is in two parts: 1st day building with wet materials, 2nd day finish burn-out.
description_web: Learn how to construct a clay (cob) oven using clay, stray, mud, sand, and recycled materials. This is a hands-on class, please dress appropriately for working with mud. First class day will be laying out the frame and working with wet materials.  Second class day will be finishing the oven with a burn out.

name: Intro to Woodworking: Splitting, Riving, Shaving
description_book: Intro to splitting, riving and shaving. You got your log, now you need to make it into parts.
description_web: Moving on from axe safety, this class covers use of wedges, gluts, froes, riving brake, drawknife, spokeshave, and marking gauge to take split down lumps of wood and make them into usable parts.

name: Set up:  Performing Arts Tent
description_book: Set up in Performing Arts Tent: stage decks and tops, stage back drop, curtains, backstage area, signs, lights, and other PA properties.
description_web: On Tuesday and Wednesday of Land Grab Week, we build the stage, hang curtains, rig the house and backstage lights, and set up the chairs. This starts at about 10 am each day and continues until we are done. Come help us make the tent into a theater worthy of the name!  Bring your cordless drills and other hand tools. On Tuesday we also set up the Amphitheater and the Performing Arts Rehearsal Tent.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: For all levels and teachers. Drills focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Études* for drill; elements from drill used to work in groups.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class.We have three wonderful, new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Beginner Knitting
description_book: Learn how to cast on, knit, purl, and cast off. Feel free to bring your own needles and yarn.

name: The Greenland Gown
description_book: We will explore the fabric, patterns, and construction of the group of extant garments found in a graveyard  in Greenland.

name: What Kind of Viking Are You?
description_book: Survey of women's clothing and accessories during the Viking Age.
description_web: Survey of women's clothing and accessories during the Viking Age. We will discuss basic theories of dress construction and skim through the types of accessories that are appropriate. This is **not** a sewing class, just a survey for women who want to understand the basics.

name: Simply Plaited: 14th-Century Women's Hair
description_book: Theorized period methods of achieving 4 simple 14th-C hairstyles popular in England and France with archaeological & artistic examples. Instructional.
description_web: Theorized period methods of achieving four **simple** 14th-century hairstyles popular in England and France. Period archaeological and artistic examples will be shown/demonstrated. Discussion of the use of modern materials also included.

name: *Chiara Stella*
description_book: Come learn *Chiara Stella*, a lovely *cascarda* from *Il Ballarino*! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.

name: Intro to 6-on-2 Chainmail
description_book: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail. All materials provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
description_web: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail prevalent throughout period across multiple cultures. All materials necessary to complete class project provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
fee_itemization: Sufficient hand-turned & cut enameled copper rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter; to complete class project

name: Bling on a Budget
description_book: Use glass jewels, beads, and metal to add dignity and ostentation to clothes without going broke. Dark Ages through Renaissance.
description_web: How to use glass jewels, beads, and metal to add dignity and ostentation to clothes without going broke. From minor flourishes to full-bore excess, planning and execution, covered by instructor with 25+ years experience working with these forms of embellishment. No purchase necessary. Supplies available for purchase; prices vary depending on patterns chosen.
fee_itemization: Fee depends on choices made. No purchase necessary.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web:
Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater Wednesday 8/6 6-7 pm.
You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Wool Spinning on a Distaff, Hands-On
description_book: Learn the use of the iconic distaff. Distaffs are not just for flax! Learn how to prepare wool to spin and mount it on various styles of distaffs.
description_web: Learn the use of the iconic distaff. Distaffs are not just for flax! To a spinster, a distaff functions as a third hand, holding a large quantity of fiber in orderly condition as she pulls down fiber to fill her spindle. Come and learn about several types of distaff designs and how to mount wool prepared in various ways on them. Great for hot, sticky or windy weather. And if you walk around a lot..... Improve your Pennsic spinning experience. Loaner spindles and distaffs available for students who don't wish to purchase them.

name: Beginning Knotwork
description_book: Learn two ways to do basic knotwork! Starts with interlacing without erasing, and gridding-path drawing. Please bring a pencil with eraser.

name: The Battle of Kleidon
description_book: On July 29th, 1014, Emp. Basil II earned the epithet "Bulgar-Slayer" in a decisive military victory. Much blinding, and a King's heart attack, ensued!
description_web:
On July 29th, 1014, Emperor Basil II earned the epithet "Bulgar-Slayer" in a decisive military victory. Roman sources claimed that 15,000 Bulgars were captured and blinded, with each hundredth man left with one eye to guide the others home, and that their King died of a heart attack upon observing his army.

On the 1000th anniversary of this battle, we will study the veracity of these numbers, the context of the surrounding war, the military tactics used to achieve the rout, and its strategic consequences.

name: *Xia*: The Chinese Knight-Errant
description_book: In China, the practice of chivalry was much different than in the West. But in many key ways it was much the same.
description_web: Join us for a discussion of how chivalry was practiced in China in the Middle Ages.  This class will cover how *Xia* is different from Western chivalry, how it is the same, and ways to incorporate these into your persona.

name: So Many Centuries, So Little Time
description_book: How to pick and research a persona, household, or project. Newer participants and active recruiters encouraged to attend.
description_web: It can be overwhelming to try to decide on a time and place. The relative advantages and disadvantages of different approaches will be discussed, and how to achieve one's own particular goals within reenacting. In this class we discuss the How and Why of picking a period/persona, setting realistic goals, and then achieving them.

name: Beginning Galliards
description_book: The galliard is an aerobic 16th-century pan-European dance. Come learn the basics!

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Middle Eastern Dancing for All Shapes and Sizes
description_book: If you love to shake your shimmy or want to try dancing for the first time, come out and join us.

name: Juggling 101 (Beginner)
description_book: Learn to juggle three balls in the most simple pattern. Equipment available for use or purchase.
description_web: The most basic 3-ball cascade juggling. Juggling balls will be made available for use by the class and may be bought afterward from the instructor. Juggling sets range from $5-$10.

name: Mead Begins with Bees
description_book: Class covers site selection, reference material sources, basic equipment, wooden wares needed to set up an apiary, all before you get your bees.
description_web: Class covers site selection, reference material sources, basic equipment, demonstrations on wooden ware construction.  These are the things you will need **before you even order your bees**.

name: How to Wrap a Sari
description_book: Discussion of several methods of wearing that new sari.

name: Intro to the ADA
description_book: How the Americans with Disabilities Act works with the hobby we love. Ideas on what to do and how to do it, as well as what not to do and why.
description_web: How the Americans with Disabilities Act works with the hobby we love. If you are autocrating an event, or just wondering what your options are under the ADA, here are ideas on what to do and how to do it, as well as what not to do and why.

name: Beginning Inkle Weaving
description_book: Learn the basics of Inkle weaving. How to warp an Inkle loom and how to achieve some of the basic patterns. Bring your own loom and 2 colors thread
description_web: Learn the basics of Inkle weaving. How to warp an Inkle loom and some basic patterns such as the chain and the flower patterns. Students should bring their own loom and at least 2 colors of thread, preferably cotton.

name: Buttons: Woven in the Diagonal Ottoman Style
description_book: Learn to make the diagonally-woven buttons like often found on Ottoman kaftans. Note: there is a lot of manual dexterity and patience needed.
description_web: Many Ottoman buttons are threads woven on the diagonal over an oval wooden base. Come learn to make these Ottoman-style buttons. Note that there is a lot of manual dexterity and patience needed! These buttons are not easy to make. There will be a limit of 10 kits.
fee_itemization: kit includes needle, wax, floss, and bead bases to make several buttons.

name: Prostitution in SCA Period
description_book: History of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 A.D. Topics include contraception, garb, law, and the organization of brothels.
description_web: A survey of the history of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 A.D. We will be covering such topics as the formation of red light districts, brothel management, contraception, municipal laws, church law, and the garb and identification of a prostitute within this time period.

name: An Introduction to the English Sonnet
description_book: Brief overview of the development of the sonnet during the English Renaissance. We will discuss ways to read and comprehend sonnets more easily.
description_web: A brief overview of the development of the sonnet during the English Renaissance. Although moderns frequently identify Shakespeare with the sonnet form, he was far from the only sonneteer of the Renaissance or even the most well known. The course will cover some of the major poets and developments in the sonnet tradition and work through ways to read and comprehend sonnets more easily. We’ll read poems and talk about some conventions and tropes of the genre. No previous knowledge of sonnets or Renaissance England required. A handout will be provided.

name: Four-Couple English Country Dance
description_book: My favorite ECDs are for four couples and feature beautiful floor patterns rather than complicated steps. *Hyde Park, Faine I Would, Dull Sir John*.
description_web: My favorite ECDs are for four couples in a square, and feature beautiful floor patterns rather than complicated steps. We'll cover *Hyde Park, Faine I Would If I Could*, and *Dull Sir John*. No experience required, but it helps.

name: Building a Better Fighter
description_book: Better understand the mechanics of the basic blows in SCA combat so you can adapt them to your style. In armor, with weapons preferred.
description_web: Better understand the mechanics of the basic blows in SCA combat so you can adapt them to your style. Gain power and precision, while reducing fatigue and avoiding injury. This class will primarily focus on sword and shield techniques, but lessons can be applied to most weapon forms.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Shakespeare Wrote Shakespeare
description_book: An examination of the evidence that Shakespeare wrote the works attributed to him. Skeptics welcome.
description_web: Some doubt that Shakespeare of Stratford wrote the works attributed to him. An examination of the evidence reveals not only that Shakespeare did indeed write Shakespeare but also many fascinating things about Elizabethan life, in court, in the theater, and in their everyday world. Skeptics welcome.

name: Commenting on Letter of Intent
description_book: Heraldic letters of intent (in and out of kingdoms) can always benefit from trained, or less experienced, commenters. How can you help?
description_web:
Commenting on letters of intent: How I learned to stop worrying and love heraldry.
Heraldic letters of intent (in and out of kingdoms) can always benefit from trained, or less experienced, commenters. We will discuss how to provide helpful commentary. For heralds or aspiring heralds.

name: I Feel Pretty and Period
description_book: A discussion of (generally later) period beauty practices, both from the perspective of "What they did" as well as "What can we safely do."
description_web: A discussion of period skin care and hair care practices, both from the perspective of "What they did" as well as "What we can safely do."  It is no secret that period skin care and hair care recipes often involved mercury, lead and arsenic, but there are also some great recipes and tools that Scadians can use to further their immersion into their persona.

name: Beginner Dance: English Country A
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn simple English Country Dances.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

name: Survey of Middle Eastern Clothing
description_book: Compare Arabic tunics & wraps with Central Asian-based (Seljuk, Persian, Ottoman) coats & pants. General history, schematic patterns. For men & women.
description_web: A comparison of two basic historic dress systems for both men and women in the Near and Middle East: (1) Arabic-based tunics and wraps; and (2) Central Asian-based coats and pants, as worn by Persians, Seljuk Turks, and Ottoman Turks. Includes general history, schematic patterns for garments, some discussion of women's veils and head coverings and men's hats.

name: The Renaissance Barber-Surgeon
description_book: The instructor will use reproduction medical tools and facsimile texts to explain medical and surgical techniques and the role of the Barber-Surgeon.

name: Persian Gardens
description_book: This class will cover the basic tenets of Persian garden design, cultivated plants, and ideas on how to translate this into a home garden.
description_web: This class will cover the basic tenets of Persian Garden design and plants known to have been cultivated. In addition, I will offer ideas on how to translate ancient gardens into a contemporary setting.

name: Being Period Is Cheap, Fun and Comfortable
description_book: Methods for maintaining a period persona, kit, or camp without breaking the bank or dying of plague.
description_web: In this class we will learn and share systematic methods for keeping our kits, personas, and camps authentic while limiting cost and staying safe and comfy. The How, Why, When, and What of period-correctness will be discussed. People who do not consider themselves capable of authenticity for financial or other reasons are especially encouraged to attend, as are people who may have tips to share with others. Certain periods will be discussed as examples but any period or culture can use the systematic methods that will be described.

name: Beginner Dance: 16th-Century Italian A
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn simple, late 16th-century Italian dances.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn simple, late 16th-century Italian dances. Possible dances: *Contra Passo, La Castellana*.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.

name: Finishing Woven-Wire Chains
description_book: Discussion and demonstration includes drawing the chain and various end finishes and clasps.

name: Persian Culinary Plants
description_book: Find out the range of edible plants available in Persia. This will cover cultivated and wild plants as well as availability and scientific names.
description_web: There's more to cooking Persian food than the plants you find at the grocery store. Find out the range of plants in Persia that were available and edible. This class will cover a comprehensive list of cultivated and wild plants. I will also discuss US availability, accurate scientific names, and more.

name: *Chigi* Dances
description_book: Come learn dances from one of the earliest manuals of 16th-century Italian dances. All experience levels welcome.
description_web: Come learn dances from one of the earliest manuals of 16th-century Italian dances. All experience levels welcome. Possible dances: *Rose E Viole*, *Spagnioletta*, *Contra Passo*.

name: Basic Weaving: Emphasis on Tablet Weaving
description_book: Hands-on weaving using cards to produce a decorative woven band. Adults or older children (age 12 and up with parent).
description_web: Learn a few tablet weaving basics and begin weaving on pre-strung cards. Students leave with ability to reproduce simple bands on their own. Handout included in material fee. Adults or older children (age 12 and up with parent).

name: Long-Armed Cross Stitch: Attractive and Authentic
description_book: More than just a background stitch in Assisi work, it goes faster, and is prettier, than common cross stitch. Versatile and widely used late period!
description_web: More than just a background stitch (as in Assisi work), it goes faster, and is prettier, than common cross stitch. In late period, it was used on a broad variety of household objects, often to beautiful effect. We will do the stitch, then look at photos of widely varied extant examples.

name: *Kenjutsu*: The Art of Japanese Swordsmanship
description_book: Dojo-style class, covering basics of Japanese sword. Japanese practice sword or equivalent (wood or metal) required. Limited loaners available.
description_web:
A traditional-style class on Japanese *kenjutsu*, drawn from multiple sources, including modern and traditional arts. The class will be arranged to emphasize techniques that are known to have been used pre-1600. Emphasis will be on physical repetition more than scholarly discussion. The latter will be available after class, informally, as requested.
About the instructor: I have over 15 years of experience in Japanese sword arts, including *Nakamura Ryu Battodo (IBF 4-dan), ZNKR Kendo (1-kyu), Mugai Ryu Iaihyodo*, and *Shindo Muso Ryu Jodo*.

name: Anglo-Saxon Herbs and Gardens
description_book: What herbs did the Anglo-Saxons have for healing, for cooking, for magic; how did they grow or collect them?
description_web: What herbs did the Anglo-Saxons have available? How did they grow or collect them? How did they use them? What did they call them? How much is known about what was in the Anglo-Saxon garden, and how we can try to replicate it?

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children at Runestone Hill.
description_web: 7pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend, must have adult escort.

name: Glass Day
description_book: Working with glass to make handmade beads. Torches will be set up for demonstration and use; a display will showcase the various styles created.

name: Cheesemakers / Dairy Arts Day
description_book: Blessed are the Cheesemakers who make tasty bits. Come play with us and experience some tasty, tantalizing treats. See what you can make.
description_web: Blessed are the Cheesemakers who make tasty bits. Come play with us and experience some tasty, tantalizing treats. See what you can make and learn how cheese is made.

name: Lucet: Beyond Square Cord
description_book: You can make good square cord; what's next? Flat and multi-color cords. Bring your lucet. (We can slip a cord off and put it back on after class.)
description_web: You’re comfortable making square cord; what's next? We'll work on flat and multi-color cords. Please bring your lucet. We'll also demonstrate how to slip a cord off, and put it back on after class.
fee_itemization: (3) colors of floss on cards, and handout

name: What IPA Can Do For the SCA
description_book: A crash course on the International Phonetic Alphabet and how it can be useful to heralds, wordsmiths, performers, and all in between.
description_web:
An alphabet only has two rules to make it an alphabet.

1) Each letter has to represent a sound.
2) A single sound can not be represented by more than one letter.

The problem is that as a language develops, the rules of the alphabet are broken. This is why IPA (the International Phonetic Alphabet) is such a completely amazing tool that has been used by linguists over the past 100 years.

IPA, being an *international* alphabet, is able to transcribe the sounds made by any language at any time period. This is so important to us in our hobby because with one alphabet of symbols we can recreate the sounds of any name from any culture, and as we all learn the symbols together, we can all pronounce the names in a standardized way. There will be no more questioning, as long as the name is written in these symbols.

This class is a crash course in IPA for anyone interested in pronunciations and language, focused on how helpful it would be in the SCA for heralds, wordsmiths, and performers.

name: Fingerloop Braiding for Beginners
description_book: A hands-on class learning a 5-loop braiding technique. Useful as decoration or cording. Can be made into lanyard for site tokens!

name: Plagues of Europe: Really, There Was More Than One
description_book: Focuses on the types of plagues, their origins, biological mechanisms, means of transmission and long term impact on the affected populations.
description_web: Measles, small pox, bubonic plague and leprosy each had a devastating impact on the affected population physically, psychologically, spiritually, and economically. This class focuses on the origins, biological mechanisms, means of transmission and long term impact on the affected populations. When early man lived in relatively isolated groups, contact between individuals was infrequent and short-lived diseases (for either the disease or the host) were not able to spread by direct contact or through intermediaries such as rats, mosquitoes, etc. As people began to live closer together in towns, later in cities, and when sanitation became more of a threat to health, transmission of diseases became easier and more common. Resistant individuals lived and the less-resistant died, thus selectively increasing resistance in the population as a whole. The gradually declining death toll seen in recurrences of a particular plague was due to an increase in resistance within the population due to several factors. Modern medical investigations indicate that the same genetic makeup that allowed some people to survive or avoid bubonic plague are the same genetic makeup that allows some people be HIV positive and not develop AIDS.

name: Pouch for Kids
description_book: Hands-on class for making a leather pouch.This class is family-friendly and youth/children are encouraged to participate. Responsible adult required.
description_web: A hands-on class for making a leather pouch.This class is family-friendly and youth/children are encouraged to participate. Responsible adult required.

name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: Three-day class for a total of 9 hours. Learn the basic movements and make three basic projects. Start a period pattern.
description_web: This is a three-day class for a total of 9 hours of bobbin lace! First Day: Students will learn the basic movements of bobbin lace and begin a project. Second Day: Students will finish the project and learn some simple grounds. Third Day: Students will begin a period pattern from the *Nüw Modelbuch*.
fee_itemization: $30 – One-time fee for all three days. Includes pillow with cover, bobbin holder, 10 pair of bobbins, pins, handout, patterns

name: Researching on The Internet
description_book: How to use the Internet to find reliable, accurate information. If there is time we will try to solve individual research issues for the students.
description_web: How to use the Internet to find reliable, accurate information. If there is time, we will try to solve individual research issues for the students. Includes a handout of recommended URLs and techniques for locating more.

name: Wood: Working with the Undead
description_book: This is a class about wood and the conditions in which it continues to move long after the tree is dead.
description_web: We will talk about the structure of the tree, processing it into lumber, and why the material continues to move afterwards. Then we will also discuss strategies for using that movement to your advantage or trying to limit the movement.

name: Event Decorating on a Shoestring
description_book: Learn how to cut heraldic forms out of paper for centerpieces or wall decorations to decorate feast halls or event sites. Class materials supplied.
description_web: Learn how to cut heraldic forms out of paper for centerpieces or wall decorations to decorate feast halls or event sites. Applications for metalwork, leather work, stained glass or clothing decorations. Ages 12 & up. Class materials supplied. Pattern book available for $20.

name: Anglo-Saxon Magick
description_book: Covers the spells, chants, amulets, runes, and other techniques used by Anglo-Saxons as they changed over the six centuries of AS England.
description_web: The Anglo-Saxons used spells, chants, amulets, runes, and other sorts of magickal techniques well after they were nominally converted to Christianity. This workshop gives an overview of the material that has survived, as what was acceptable changed from year to year and place to place in the first millennium as well as in the second.

name: ASHI Instructor Development Course, Day 1
description_book: Course is designed to train ASHI instructors for Health and Safety Classes. Students will also need to teach one class for certification.
description_web: ASHI Instructor Development Course is an option that allows candidates who are interested in becoming ASHI Health and Safety Instructors to learn the skills and knowledge necessary to become an Instructor. Students will also need to teach one class for certification.
fee_itemization: Separate fee for certification card or course materials.

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.
description_web: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.

name: Intro to Woodworking: The Handplane
description_book: Introductory class in the care and use of handplanes. Modern iron-bodied planes will also be covered.
description_web: An Introduction to the setup and use of handplanes. Focus is primarily on wood-bodied planes but modern iron-bodied planes will be included. Sharpening will be briefly touched upon. Master Avery's sharpening class is recommended. Will also cover spokeshaves and drawknives

name: Range Setup
description_book: Setup of thrown weapons range. Setup will be divided between two days.
description_web: Setup of thrown weapons range. Setup will be divided between two days.

instructor: Lady Nina Amaya of Bright Hills
name: Belly Dance Basics
description_book: Let's shimmy and undulate, do snake arms and a figure eight... all ages, genders, styles and species welcome.
description_web: Let's shimmy and undulate, do snake arms and a figure eight... all ages, genders, styles and species welcome. www.NinaAmaya.com

name: Pimp Your Wagon
description_book: Learn how to design and create a cover to disguise your radio flyer wagon or garden cart to make it look more acceptable at events.
description_web: Learn how to design and create a cover to disguise your radio flyer wagon or garden cart to make it look more acceptable at events. A pattern CD-ROM will be available for $25 which includes patterns, designs and video tutorials.

name: 11th-16th-C. Spindle Sticks and Whorls, Hands-On
description_book: Learn use of Viking, Anglo Norse and Netherlandish recreated spindle sticks and whorls, including 'tuning' spindle and whorl. Hands-on spinning.
description_web: Hands-on spinning includes selection of re-created Anglo Norse spindle sticks from Coppergate, Viking spindles from Norse settlements of 11th-14th C, and Netherlandish spindles/Raeren whorls from the 15th-16th C. Instructor will teach 'tuning' whorls to spindle sticks and is particularly interested in the spinability of surviving spindle sticks with the 'belly bump' on the shaft. Tapered whorl holes that match tapered spindle sticks will be explored. Students will spin wool (provided) on these re-creations in class. All levels welcome, though this is not a beginners' class. Note that this class has 'loaner' spindle sticks available for those who don't want to purchase them. Or bring your own.
fee_itemization: Dependent on whether student uses loaner spindle or purchases spindles in price range from $15.00-$35.00

name: Harp Techniques
description_book: Historical information and techniques to improve strength, speed, tone and musicality. Useful for all harpers, beginner to advanced.
description_web: Techniques to improve strength, speed, tone and musicality. Historical information about harps, the men and women who played them, and their music. Useful for all harpers, complete beginner to advanced. Learn how to get more out of your instrument and practice time, as well as practical approaches to performing. This is one of a 3-part course. We will build on information from each class, but students are not required to attend all three. Feel free to contact teacher in advance if you cannot attend first class.
fee_itemization: Exercises for use in class, during Pennsic, and afterward.  Reading music, counting, fingering, etc.

name: Making The SCA Work On Your Resumé
description_book: Translate your SCA volunteer experience into mundane resumé content.
description_web: We will go over SCA terms and translate them into mundane job titles, and learn how to use SCA experience to address gaps in employment. The instructor is a senior recruiter, resumé consultant, and regular contributor to the Seattle Times NWJobs.

name: Abbess Hildegard: A Female Voice in a Male World
description_book: Hildegard of Bingen, a 12th-century German abbess, was an outspoken and multi-faceted woman in a very masculine world.
description_web: Hildegard of Bingen, a 12th-century German abbess, was a mystic and theologian, a musician and physician, a playwright and poet, and a – sometimes unbidden – advisor to kings and popes. This class delves into the life and works of this forthright and fascinating woman.

name: Intermediate Kumihimo
description_book: Part 2: Learn more braids on foam disk. There will be three to four new braids taught in this class as time allows.
description_web: Part 2: Students will continue to learn more braids on foam disk. There will be three to four new braids taught in this class. Students will also learn how to finish braids in many different styles.
fee_itemization:
10.00 for materials & handout
3.00 for handout only

name: *Temari* Ball Bases: Japanese Embroidery Balls
description_book: *Temari* balls are wrapped, stitched, and woven into beautiful, colorful patterns.  We'll cover the history and how to make a ball base.
description_web: *Temari* dates to about 800 CE. They are based on simple geometry (almost no math needed) and wrapped, stitched, or woven to form patterns over the whole ball. This is a great art for the impatient, as each stitch visibly develops the pattern, and you can easily pick it up or put it down at any time. Best of all, they are impressive out of all proportion with how easy they are! The class will cover basic construction of the ball base. Bring your ball to the second class to learn to stitch it.
fee_itemization: materials to create two ball bases for later stitching

name: *Tafl* Games
description_book: The *Tafl* family of games were played through the Norse lands. The rules are simple and easy to learn, and the game play can be quick or complex.
description_web: The *Tafl* family of games were played through the Norse lands. The rules are simple and easy to learn, and the game play can be quick or complex.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: Armor Extrication
description_book: Learn how to remove adult and youth armor without injuring yourself, the fighter, or the armor; when to use splinting/support.
description_web: Learn how to remove armor without injuring yourself, the fighter, or the armor and when to use it (splinting/support). This class will cover the assorted types of armor used in all adult and youth SCA martial activities. While the class is directed towards first aid providers, it is useful knowledge for anyone who may be assisting armored individuals. The logic presented here can also be applied to complex garb. This class will be part classroom and part walking tour of the combat areas. Volunteers will provide you the opportunity get hands-on practice during the class.

name: Christmas (Music) in July
description_book: Music-reading session on period music for 12th Night or Wassail. Singers and instrumentalists welcome. Public domain music, handout, no charge.
description_web: Bring your singing voice or instrument to a music-reading session featuring SCA-period Christmas/Yule music for 12th Night or Wassail. Public domain music, handout provided, no charge. This class is a repeat from Pennsic 42.

name: Set up:  Performing Arts Tent
description_book: Set up in Performing Arts Tent: stage decks and tops, stage back drop, curtains, backstage area, signs, lights, and other PA properties.
description_web: On Tuesday and Wednesday of Land Grab Week, we build the stage, hang curtains, rig the house and backstage lights, and set up the chairs. This starts at about 10 am each day and continues until we are done. Come help us make the tent into a theater worthy of the name!  Bring your cordless drills and other hand tools. On Tuesday we also set up the Amphitheater and the Performing Arts Rehearsal Tent.

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: For all levels and teachers. Drills focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Études* for drill; elements from drill used to work in groups.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class.We have three wonderful, new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Intro to Woodworking: Saws, the Care and Use of
description_book: Selecting a set of saws, using saws, maintaining saws; a little about making saws.
description_web: Saw basics, what to look for in a saw, how to select a saw, using the saw, overview of sharpening a saw. Also covers cutting stock to size and making joints.

name: A History of Silver Stain and Stained Glass
description_book: A discussion of the history and use of silver stain, period formulas for it, and a display comparing stains. A few samples may be available.

name: Tips, Tricks and Toddlers
description_book: A parents' guide on how to survive and enjoy the SCA with children. Part of class will be a roundtable discussion on positive ideas for problems.
description_web: A parents' guide on how to survive and enjoy the SCA with young children. The last part of class will be a roundtable discussion on positive ideas for problems. The class can also focus on tweenagers, if there is a need. While children are welcome, this class will focus on helping parents.

name: Grooming: Medieval-Style
description_book: Want to enhance your SCA experience? Try some period grooming recipes. This class gives you an opportunity to try period beauty/hygiene products.
fee_itemization: Donations to cover costs of herbs are appreciated but not required.

name: Glass Beads, Not Just a Pretty Shiny....
description_book: I, Rois, 16th-century Irish woman, want to share with you my experiences with glass beads, their place in history as well as shipping and trading!
description_web: I am Rois and excited to share an in-depth look at glass beads, beyond the pretty shiny..... Glass beads had an amazing place in history, where they came from, where they went to and how they got there! Join me as I share tales of my journeys and the prizes I have gathered along the way!

name: The Shady Valley of Bizarre Love
description_book: We'll be doing two dances, *Ombrosa Valle* from Caroso, and *Bizzarria d'Amore* from Negri, according to the teacher's current reconstructions.
description_web: We'll be doing two dances, *Ombrosa Valle* from Caroso, and *Bizzarria d'Amore* from Negri, according to the teacher's current reconstructions.

name: Intro to 6-on-2 Chainmail
description_book: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail. All materials provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
description_web: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail prevalent throughout period across multiple cultures. All materials necessary to complete class project provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
fee_itemization: Sufficient hand-turned & cut enameled copper rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter; to complete class project

name: Choral Conducting
description_book: Hands-on training in conducting patterns, cueing, finding and fixing errors, and choral leadership. You will sing and direct with teacher mentoring.
description_web: Taught by a past Pennsic Choir director, this class covers conducting patterns, cueing, finding and fixing errors, and choral leadership. Participants will sing and direct the other students in a choral piece, with assistance and advice from the instructor.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web:
Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater Wednesday 8/6 6-7 pm.
You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Hand-Sewing 101
description_book: A discussion and hands-on of hand-sewing of garb, etc. This is not embroidery, but useful stitches. Please bring needle, thread and light cloth.

name: Slavery in Viking Culture
description_book: Discussion of slavery and how it was treated in Viking culture.
description_web: A class discussing slavery in Viking cultures. How it was started in myth as well as the laws and devices used in the slave trade. Recreation of items from the time may be available for use as examples.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Runes: The Elder & Anglo-Saxon/Frisian *Futharks*
description_book: Origins and usage of *futharks*, including mercantile, cyphers and codes, magic, "this is mine!", rune names, and more.
description_web: From the earliest identifiable runic inscriptions to their decline, the Elder and the Anglo-Saxon/Frisian were the commonly used characters in epigraphic inscriptions. We will look at rune origins and meanings, use in trade and identifying goods, codes and cyphers, magic, and regional variations, and the bracteate tradition, as well as other venues.

name: Making Friends with Your Sewing Machine
description_book: Easy sewing machine basics for the newbie and novice sewers. All children under the age of 10 must be accompanied by an adult.
description_web: Easy sewing machine basics for the newbie and novice sewers. Simple patterns available so you won't go to the events naked or embarrassed! Advanced sewers invited to share your knowledge as well! Easy and fun class! All children under the age of 10 must be accompanied by an adult.
fee_itemization:
5-page handout on sewing basics and info.
6-10 page easy patterns and measurements

name: Three Pies from Christorforo's Kitchen
description_book: German-style apple pie, peach pie, and a veal pie from the 1549 cookbook the *Banchetti* by Christoforo Messisbugo.

name: Scottish Choral & Vocal Music Under the Stewarts
description_book: 12th-16th century, sacred and secular, choral and vocal, pre- and post-Reformation. Sources and singing through the KW Choir music.
fee_itemization: Duplication costs of handout materials and music.

name: Anatomy of a Demo
description_book: What makes a successful demo? What are the types of demos? How can you advertise them for low or no cost?
description_web: What makes a successful demo? What are the types of demos? How can you advertise them for low or no cost, what activities can you include? How can the populace leverage the chatelaine and other resources to run one?

name: Crusader Kits: Recreating the Maciejowski Bible
description_book: The Maciejowski Bible is recognized as the leading pictorial source of 13th-Century Western Europe. We will recreate elements of it in this class.
description_web: This class is for affordably recreating the world depicted in the Maciejowski Bible. Methods for recreating clothes, camps, weapons and armor will be discussed in detail, along with areas for further research. Anyone with a late 11th- to early 14th-Century persona is encouraged to attend.

name: Alman All The Time
description_book: Explore the Inns of Court and (nearly) all the almans on the set lists! *Black, Lorayne, Madam Sosilia's, New*, and *Queen's Almans.*
description_web: Explore the Inns of Court and (nearly) all the almans on the set lists! *Black, Lorayne, Madam Sosilia's, New*, and *Queen's Almans.*

name: Intro to Woodworking: Making Joints
description_book: Introduction to setting out and cutting common joints.
description_web: An introduction to setting out and cutting common woodworking joints. Brings together axe, drawknife, saws, squares, straight edges, marking gauges, knives, chisels and nearly everything else to cut your most common woodworking joints.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Medieval Pottery Kiln Building
description_book: Build a medieval English-style kiln from scratch using local clay & straw, with discussion of principles and precedents. Partial attendance OK. Muddy!
description_web:
We will build a medieval English-style kiln from scratch using local clay and straw, with discussion of principles and precedents. Partial attendance OK. Potters, ask to use my wheel (Okewode Hall, #160 Battle Rd) or hand-build pots to fire when dry.
Kiln site: Long Way, between North Gate & Shadowclans Cathedral.

name: Kumihimo Basics
description_book: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Youth Rapier Fencing Practice
description_book: Youth rapier practice, ages 6 to 17. Come out and fence.
description_web: Youth rapier fencing practice, ages 6 to 17. Come out and fence.

name: *Saz* Workshop
description_book: Workshop for beginner and experienced *saz* players.
description_web: Basic techniques and melodies for beginners. Traditional long-neck and short-neck playing techniques. Experienced *saz* players are encouraged to share insights, techniques, and more complex melodies.

name: Scribal Playtime
description_book: Open space for scribes/artists to work on projects, ask questions or discuss their art. Some community-shared materials may be available for use.
description_web: The AEthelmearc Scribal College pavilion will be open for scribes to work on projects, ask questions of experienced scribes or discuss their art. One-on-one instruction may be available if space and resources allow. Some community-shared materials such as Paint-a-Blanks may be available.

name: Juggling 101 (Beginner)
description_book: Learn to juggle three balls in the most simple pattern. Equipment available for use or purchase.
description_web: The most basic 3-ball cascade juggling. Juggling balls will be made available for use by the class and may be bought afterward from the instructor. Juggling sets range from $5-$10.

name: Throw Away Your Wristwatch: Basic and Advanced
description_book: Period methods of timekeeping. First 10 minutes teaches several ways to tell time. Last 40 minutes teaches you how to tell time anywhere, anytime.
description_web: Learn period methods of timekeeping to tell time day and night at Pennsic. Basic course (first 10 minutes) teaches several ways to tell time. Advanced course delves into the science and teaches more ways to tell time so you can tell time anywhere, anytime.

name: Japanese Ink Painting
description_book: Basic overview and hands-on introduction of how to make Japanese ink paintings with materials you might already have in your scribal bag...and beyond.
description_web: Basic overview and hands-on introduction of how to make Japanese ink paintings with materials you might already have in your scribal bag...and beyond.

name: Open Knit
description_book: Stuck on a project, need help understanding a pattern or just want to knit and chat with others? Come and join a knitter's circle.

name: Beginnings of Polyphony
description_book: A timeline review of the beginnings and evolution of polyphony in Western music from its first appearance to *Ars Antiqua*.
description_web: A timeline review of the beginnings and evolution of polyphony in Western music from its first appearance to *Ars Antiqua*.

name: Henna 101
description_book: A hands-on beginner look at henna history, application, and design. Participants will receive an instructional handout and henna cone.
description_web: A hands-on beginner look at henna history, application, and design. Participants will receive an instructional handout and henna cone.

name: Demystifying the SCA Kitchen
description_book: Decoding period recipes. Understanding basic concepts of period cooking. How to organize from planning and shopping to follow through.

name: Scented Waters: Early Perfumes You Can Make
description_book: Explores the various scented waters found in Renaissance cosmetics handbooks.  Here you can learn to make perfumes for a variety of uses.
fee_itemization: Donations to cover costs of herbs and handout.

name: *Heiho Okugisho* by Yamamoto Kansuke
description_book: A look at the *Heiho Okugisho*, the book of strategy by Yamamoto Kunsuke, a famous 16th-century *samurai* strategist.
description_web: A look at the *Heiho Okugisho*, the book of strategy by Yamamoto Kunsuke, a famous 16th-century *samurai* strategist.

name: *Furioso all'Italiano*
description_book: Come learn *Furioso all'Italiano*, a 16th-C Italian dance for sets of three couples. Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.

name: Building a Better Fighter
description_book: Better understand the mechanics of the basic blows in SCA combat so you can adapt them to your style. In armor, with weapons preferred.
description_web: Better understand the mechanics of the basic blows in SCA combat so you can adapt them to your style. Gain power and precision, while reducing fatigue and avoiding injury. This class will primarily focus on sword and shield techniques, but lessons can be applied to most weapon forms.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: The Social - A Recurring Non-Activity
description_book: How can a small, weekly canton social activity turn into something pulling 40-50+ members from 4 states on a regular basis, and what's next?
description_web: Modeled after something seen in the Canton of Whyt Whey some years ago, the Canton of Black Icorndall started a weekly "Canton Social" which has proven to be very successful in terms of general socializing, encouraging niche or not-quite-SCA (even non-SCA) activities as well as serving as a staging ground to relaunch a regional fighter practice, rekindle dance practice and more. It also serves as a good venue for newcomers, with so much going on. Join us for a discussion of the model, our successes, some things to watch out for and more!

name: Intermediate Heraldic Research Roundtable
description_book: Take your heraldic research to the next level. Or come to share your favorite sources and tricks. Intended for heralds of all levels.
description_web: Where do you go when the usual sources just don't have what you need? Have skills you'd like to pass on to newer heralds? Come share your favorite sources and research tips in a roundtable format. Intended for heralds of all experience levels. Handout provided.

name: Silversmithing on a Budget
description_book: A survey of minimum tools required to get started working with nonferrous metals for jewelry and small metal work.

name: Beginning Bottom-Whorl Drop Spindle
description_book: Create unique yarns on the bottom-whorl drop spindle. Spinning, plying, and helpful process tips will be discussed.
description_web: Create unique yarns on the bottom-whorl drop spindle. Spinning, plying, and helpful process tips will be discussed. Use 'student spindles' during class, or bring your own spindle. Adults or older children (age 12 and up with parent).

name: Basic Fiber Preparation for Spinning
description_book: Hands-on demonstration and discussion about how to prepare different types of fiber for spinning on a spindle or a wheel.
description_web: Hands-on demonstration and discussion about how to prepare different types of fiber for spinning on a spindle or a wheel. Discussion will include animal and plant fibers ranging from wool and silk to cotton and bast fibers (flax, hemp). The entire process of preparation will be discussed from washing to preparing to spin including methods and tools.

name: 15th-Century Two-Tailed Cap, or "Flemish Kerchief"
description_book: Learn to make a 15th-century woman’s cap, based on the images from the late 15th-century. Class will discuss images and will start hand-sewing a cap.
description_web: Come and learn to make a 15th-century woman’s cap, based on the images from the late 15th-century. Class will discuss images and will start hand-sewing a cap. Fee includes needle, linen and thread for cap as well as handout.

name: Simply Plaited: 14th-Century Women's Hair
description_book: Theorized period methods of achieving 4 simple 14th-C hairstyles popular in England and France with archaeological & artistic examples. Instructional.
description_web: Theorized period methods of achieving four **simple** 14th-century hairstyles popular in England and France. Period archaeological and artistic examples will be shown/demonstrated. Discussion of the use of modern materials also included.

name: History and Symbolism of the Unicorn Tapestries
description_book: An examination of "The Hunt for the Unicorn", 15th-century Flemish tapestries widely regarded as the best example of tapestries of the age.
description_web: Join us for an examination of "The Hunt for the Unicorn", 15th-century Flemish tapestries widely regarded as the best example of tapestries of the age. Why does the unicorn lack ears in one tapestry? What happened to the pieces of the fifth tapestry? Where are they now? All these and more will be answered.
fee_itemization: Full color, line drawing and plant key copies of all the tapestries with corresponding plants highlighted.

name: Beginner Dance: Absolute Beginner A
description_book: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics, and soon you'll be on your way to the Ball!

name: The Minimalist Bard Book
description_book: Discussion of the top 20 songs/song types for any bard's book.
description_web: Discussion of the top 20 songs/song types for any bard's book. Whether you are around a campfire, performing for royalty, joining in a competition, or singing in the shower, these few pieces will have you ready for anything, bardically speaking.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a trim strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a trim strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: Beyond Brewing: Vinegar
description_book: Learn some history about vinegar, how to use it and, most importantly, how to make it at home.
description_web: Learn some history about vinegar, how to use it and, most importantly, how to make it at home. Limited handouts; the information will be available online after Pennsic. Bring a spoon to class to get a taste of homemade vinegar while samples last.

name: Easy Heraldic Standards
description_book: How to design and make quick and easy heraldic standards with inexpensive materials.
description_web: The design of period-style SCA heraldic standards, and directions for how to make them with inexpensive materials. These are appropriate for display from a pole or from the tops of tents.

name: The Humoral Doctrine
description_book: The origins and structure of the prevailing doctrine of health in the medieval and Renaissance period.

name: Use of Basic Silversmithing Tools
description_book: Survey and demonstration of the use of tools from the "Silversmithing on a Budget" class. Soldering and fusing demonstrations will be included.

name: Talking to Mundanes: How to Interpret History
description_book: Interpretation techniques for making history (and reenacting) fun and accessible to mundane audiences.
description_web: We discuss how to make our hobby, historical topics, and of course our neat reenacting toys, accessible to audiences at recruitment events and other public venues. Topics covered will be how to organize your presentation material, keeping the presentation fun/engaging, and relating to non-historians. Instructor has 10 years of museum education experience.

name: Medieval Buddhist and Hindu Icons and Symbolism
description_book: Learn the many meanings, myths, and messages behind the multi-armed, many-headed gods and goddesses of the Buddhist and Hindu traditions.
description_web: Learn the many meanings, myths, and messages behind the multi-armed, many-headed gods and goddesses of the Buddhist and Hindu traditions. Meet gilded gods and holy hermits in the collection of the Art Institue of Chicago. How did Ganesha get his elephant head? How do you tell a Buddha from a Bodhisattva? What's an avatar, anyway? And find out the difference between yantra, mantra, and tantra, oh my!

name: The Courtly Art of Compliments
description_book: Brief overview of the history of courtly love, and explanation of how to use courtly love principles to create period-style compliments for SCA use.
description_web: A brief overview of the origin and history of courtly love, and an explanation of how to use courtly love principles to create period-style compliments for use in the SCA and to deal with being complimented. We will look at period ideas about the role of the suitor and the role of the courtly love object and discuss how these ideas can be applied to complimenting and being complimented in the modern SCA. Also included will be a brief discussion of "when handkissers attack" that covers modes of dealing politely with unwelcome attentions.  A handout will be provided.

name: Thorsberg Trousers: Pants That Last!
description_book: Tired of repairing pants that rip in unmentionable places? Then you’ll love these pants based on trousers from an Iron Age burial!
description_web: Tired of repairing pants that rip in unmentionable places? Then you’ll love these pants based on trousers from an Iron Age burial! Learn what you’ll need to make them yourself: fabrics, seams, pattern, and construction.

name: Beginner Dance: 15th-Century Italian A
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach fun, simple dances from 15th-century Italy.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach fun, simple dances from 15th-century Italy.

name: Period Black Powder Firearms: Safety and Handling
description_book: Firearm safety, handling, and shooting procedures for small arms and artillery, 1320-1600. Powder and match supplied by teacher. Ages 18+.
description_web: Firearm safety, handling, and shooting procedures for small arms and artillery, 1320-1600. Owners of period arms are requested/encouraged to bring them and help with coaching newer shooters. Powder and match are supplied by instructor. Ages 18+.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: Bardic Coaching
description_book: Participants perform a piece of their choosing, 3 to 5 minutes long. They receive personal feedback and attention to enhance performance skills.

name: ISIS Wings & Bellydance Veil
description_book: Ancient Bellydance Myth meets contemporary pizazz with ISIS wings! Wear your wings and learn Egyptian style bellydance routines. Everyone welcome!
description_web: Ancient Bellydance myth meets contemporary *pizazz* with ISIS wings. Wear your wings & bring your veils. You will learn Egyptian Style bellydance routines and also improvise with ISIS wings and veils.

name: The German Renaissance Wardrobe: What Was Worn
description_book: Learn about the types of clothing worn by men and women in 16th-century Germany. Samples, patterns, and handouts!
description_web: Learn about the types of clothing and accessories worn by men and women in 16th-century Germany (approx. 1515-1560). Samples to touch and dolls to dress. Handout packet with patterns also available to take home for $1. Those with German Ren dress are encouraged to come and show off their garb so we can all learn from one another.

name: Russian *Sarafans* and Short Jackets
description_book: Womens' regional dresses and short jackets; overview of styles and pattern layouts for cutout and construction.

name: Beginning Mead Brewing
description_book: Brewing mead for those who have not done so before or have very little experience. We will be covering the basic process and equipment. Over 21 only.
description_web: Brewing mead for those who have not done so before or have very little experience. We will be covering the basic process and equipment for your first few batches. Over 21 only.

name: Middle Eastern Music and Dance
description_book: A time for people of all skill levels to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. All instruments are welcome, and loaner drums are available!
description_web: A time for people interested in Middle Eastern music and dance to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. We will be providing instruction appropriate to the interest of the attendees, from beginning Middle Eastern drum and belly dance to teaching songs in which everyone can participate. All skill levels and instruments are welcome, and drums are available for borrowing!

name: Basic Italian Dances for the Balls of Pennsic
description_book: Come learn some of the common dances to be done at several of the balls at Pennsic. Included are *Petit Rose, Petite Vriens, Amoroso* and *Anello*.
description_web: Come learn some of the common dances to be done at several of the balls at Pennsic. Included are *Petit Rose, Petite Vriens, Amoroso* and *Anello*.

name: Fingerloop Gathering
description_book: Come out for an evening of socializing, information exchange, practice, tips and tricks of this art. Anyone is welcome--beginners on up.
description_web: Come out for an evening of socializing, information exchange, practice, tips and tricks of this art. Anyone is welcome--beginners on up. Various sources will be available to browse. We might even try multiple-person structures if we are brave enough. Sponsored by the Fingerlooping Group on FB.

name: *Kumihimo*: Complex Japanese Braids in Period
description_book: Lecture with an overview of period *kumihimo*, including a discussion of the different techniques and how the braids were used.
description_web: This is a lecture class giving an overview of period *kumihimo*, including a discussion of the different construction techniques and how the braids were used.

name: *Kenjutsu*: The Art of Japanese Swordsmanship
description_book: Dojo-style class, covering basics of Japanese sword. Japanese practice sword or equivalent (wood or metal) required. Limited loaners available.
description_web:
A traditional-style class on Japanese *kenjutsu*, drawn from multiple sources, including modern and traditional arts. The class will be arranged to emphasize techniques that are known to have been used pre-1600. Emphasis will be on physical repetition more than scholarly discussion. The latter will be available after class, informally, as requested.
About the instructor: I have over 15 years of experience in Japanese sword arts, including *Nakamura Ryu Battodo (IBF 4-dan), ZNKR Kendo (1-kyu), Mugai Ryu Iaihyodo*, and *Shindo Muso Ryu Jodo*.

name: First Aid or CPR Challenges
description_book: Individuals can challenge to recertify by taking the written and physical tests. These will be ASHI challenges, unless other instructors can be found.
description_web: Individuals can challenge to recertify by taking the written and physical tests. If the challenge is unsuccessful, the recommendation is for the full class. These will be ASHI challenges, unless other instructors can be found. Individual challenges take approximately 1 hour.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children at Runestone Hill.
description_web: 7pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend, must have adult escort.

name: Introduction to Runes
description_book: Introduction to the *Futharc* and *Futhorc* runes for use in divination and magic (and *RúnValdr* q.v.) with resources for further study.
description_web: Runes are a system of writing that is now best known as a tool for divination, but has been more, from basic communication to magickal practice. This workshop will give an overview of what the runes have been and can be, and give you direction on how to proceed in your studies.

name: A Quick Overview of Bookbinding
description_book: A quick overview of bookbinding from the 4th to 16th centuries. Slide presentation and book petting session. Handout also available.
description_web: This is a quick overview of the styles of bookbinding from the 4th to the 16th centuries using a slide presentation. A handout will be available for a donation. Several styles will be on hand for a book petting session at the end of the presentation.

name: Glass Cutting - Any Level
description_book: Want to learn how to cut glass? Know how to cut glass and wish to take your skills to the next level? Take this class! And wear closed-toed shoes.
description_web: Want to learn how to cut glass? Know how to cut glass and wish to take your skills to the next level? Make time for this class! And wear closed-toed shoes, please. This is a rolling-style class, meaning it **will not** take every person 1.5 hours, but as there are only 2 of us, and we have limited cutters and tools, each person will get about 10 minutes of one-on-one time to learn how to cut glass.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Youth Combat morning sessions, 8-10:30 AM.  Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.
description_web: Youth Combat morning sessions, 8-10:30 AM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.

name: Making a Leather Helm Crest
description_book: Learn through demonstration how to make an attachable parade helmet crest out of leather with heraldic painted designs using period pigments.
description_web: Learn through demonstration how to make an attachable parade helmet crest out of leather with heraldic painted designs using period pigments and techniques.

name: Leatherwork Day
description_book: A chance for leather workers of all skill levels to meet, share knowledge and work on projects as well as for novices to learn and ask questions.
description_web: Leatherwork Day is a place for leather workers of all skill levels to meet and share knowledge and work on projects, as well as a great learning opportunity for novices. Stop by any time to look around, ask questions, or just hang out and work on your own projects. We plan on being there from 9 to 5.

name: Music Day
description_book: Come and make music. Instrumental and vocal performers welcome. Novices, interested folk as well as experienced, all are welcome.

name: Game of Thrones: The Bayeux Tapestry
description_book: Discussion of the history and construction of the Bayeux Tapestry, followed by hands-on practice in the Bayeux techniques.
description_web: A discussion of the history and creation of the Bayeux Tapestry as well as a hands-on session where students will learn and practice the various stitches found in the Bayeux Tapestry. Hands-on session will be limited to 15 participants; however, the remainder of the class is open to any wishing to attend.
fee_itemization: Handout, embroidery hoop, needles, needle threader, wool embroidery floss.

name: Heraldic Conflict Checking
description_book: The basics for the rules the heralds use to determine if two pieces of armory are too close or not, and methods for finding conflicts.
description_web: The basics for the rules the heralds use to determine if two pieces of armory are too close or not, and methods for finding conflicts. This is *not* the one using the complex conflict checking form although there will be some discussion related to it.

name: Beginner Knitting
description_book: Learn how to cast on, knit, purl, and cast off. Feel free to bring your own needles and yarn.

name: Twisties and Complex Decoration
description_book: Making twisted decorations and stringer to apply to glass beads. You've made your beads; now decorate them.
description_web: You've made your beads; now decorate them. Learn about different techniques to make twisted stringers and then apply them to different shapes of beads.

name: Roses Then and Now
description_book: A survey of roses that were available and/or cultivated during our period and how they compare to roses commonly grown today.
fee_itemization: Handouts are in color so fee to cover that expense

name: Baby Carrier Survival Guide
description_book: Babywearing 101 to advanced. Help with any carrier, history, safety, feeding. Lots of hands-on and trouble-shooting. Bring baby. Latecomers welcome.
description_web: Babywearing 101 to advanced. Do you want to use a carrier at Pennsic but just can't "get" it? We have learned over time that holding your baby is good for them - and you. We have also experienced a baby that wants to be in arms most of the time. A quality carrier or a simple piece of cloth can give you that extra pair of hands you always think about. We will talk about historical carriers, extreme temperature baby-wearing, and how women managed in the hot fields world-wide and wore their baby. Expect lots of hands-on. You will learn new baby-wearing skills. Bring your carrier. I will be able to trouble shoot with you and show you how to be more comfortable with it. If your baby is fussy in a carrier, we can work together and see if there is a way he/she DOES like to be worn. While I will discuss historical carriers and babywearing in hot temperatures, trouble-shooting and getting everyone comfortable with a carrier is the focus of this class. This class was slotted for 2 hours; you can come any time even if the class is going on. Bring a flash drive to download my information.

name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: Three-day class for a total of 9 hours. Learn the basic movements and make three basic projects. Start a period pattern.
description_web: This is a three-day class for a total of 9 hours of bobbin lace! First Day: Students will learn the basic movements of bobbin lace and begin a project. Second Day: Students will finish the project and learn some simple grounds. Third Day: Students will begin a period pattern from the *Nüw Modelbuch*.
fee_itemization: $30 – One-time fee for all three days. Includes pillow with cover, bobbin holder, 10 pair of bobbins, pins, handout, patterns

name: Concerning Mohammed and the Well-Guided Caliphs
description_book: A history of the early years of Islam, taught in persona from the standpoint of a later Muslim.
description_web:
Concerning Our Lord the Prophet Mohammed (Blessings upon Him, his Kindred and his Companion Train) and the Well-Guided Caliphs.
A history of the early years of Islam, taught in persona from the standpoint of a later Muslim.

name: Fishing Forsoothly
