description_book: What did recreational fishing look like in the 15th and 16th century?  A look at the equipment, bait, and the character of the fisher.
description_web: Recreational fishing today is a reflection of what people have done for centuries.  Books were written in the 15th and 16th centuries that describe in detail the equipment, fishing techniques, baits, comportment and even clothing of the proper fisher.

name: High Magick in the Middle Ages
description_book: An historical overview of the magick practiced by the noble and educated from the Dark Ages until the Renaissance.
description_web: What kind of magick was actually practiced during the Dark and Middle Ages? Most people have a general idea of medieval witches and wizards from fairy tales, and stories of the “burning times” (which was actually after the Renaissance). What types of magick were really used from the fall of Rome through the Renaissance? Sources from the pre-Christian era to the new “natural science”.

name: Viking Design for Embroidery and Illumination
description_book: Covers Viking art styles, design manipulation, transfer methods, and includes a list of helpful supplies in a handout.
description_web: Covers Viking art styles and characteristics; how to manipulate designs to fit your project; transfer methods for cloth, wood, leather, and paper (some will be demonstrated); and a list of helpful supplies. A handout will be available for the cost of copying to the first 30 students.

name: ASHI Instructor Development Course, Day 2
description_book: Course is designed to train ASHI instructors for Heath and Safety Classes. Students will also need to teach one class for certification.
description_web: ASHI Instructor Development Course is an option that allows candidates who are interested in becoming ASHI Health and Safety Instructors to learn the skills and knowledge necessary to become an Instructor. Students will also need to teach one class for certification. Both sessions are required for certification.
fee_itemization: Separate fee for certification card or course materials.

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.
description_web: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.

name: Tree Trek
description_book: Take a stroll, learn to identify members of common tree families! You may wish to bring paper and a crayon to do bark and/or leaf rubbings.
description_web: Take a stroll with Lady Béibhinn to learn to identify members of common tree families! After learning to key out general characteristics, we'll take a walk and discuss how various trees impacted medieval cultures, and how various trees were frequently used. You may wish to bring paper and a crayon to do bark and/or leaf rubbings. Wear comfortable shoes for walking.

instructor: Lady Nina Amaya of Bright Hills
name: Enchant with Your Dance: Performance Track
description_book: How to be an enchanting and memorable performer. Emotion, breath, movement, stillness, vision, face... Use your moves for best effect! All levels.
description_web: How to be an enchanting and memorable performer. Mesmerize your audience as you take them on a journey. Exercises in breath, movement, stillness, emotion, weight, tension... Use the moves you know to best effect. Write a visual poem in dance!

name: Making "Rising Sun" Viking *Murrini*
description_book: Learn  to make the "rising sun"-style *murrini* found on many Norse beads. Ages 12+. Intermediate level class. No open-toed shoes.
description_web: Learn  to make the "rising sun"-style *murrini* found on many Norse beads, with hands-on glass work. Make a cane of *murrini* you will take with you to use on your own bead creations. This is an intermediate level class, so some lampworking experience is necessary. Sleeves must be tight or tied up, no open-toed shoes, and hair must be short or tied back; natural fiber clothing recommended.

name: Advanced Kumihimo
description_book: Part 3: New foam loom/plate is taught with new braid structures. Square plate is used.
description_web: Part 3: New foam loom/plate is taught with new braid structures. Square plate used.

name: Stitching *Temari*: *Kiku* Pattern
description_book: Learn to mark and stitch the classic *Kiku*, or chrysanthemum pattern. Please being your ball from the *Temari* Bases class, or bring your own.
description_web: This class builds on the base creation class and teaches how to mark and stitch the *kiku*, or chrysanthemum stitch and pattern. Bring your completed ball from the first class or bring your own.
fee_itemization: materials to stitch one ball, plus enough to begin several more

name: Building a Clay Oven
description_book: Hands-on class for constructing a clay oven. Class is in two parts: 1st day building with wet materials, 2nd day finish burn-out.
description_web: Learn how to construct a clay (cob) oven using clay, stray, mud, sand, and recycled materials. This is a hands-on class, please dress appropriately for working with mud. First class day will be laying out the frame and working with wet materials.  Second class day will be finishing the oven with a burn out.

name: Children's Dance
description_book: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn dances fun for all ages. Note: Any youth under 12 requires a responsible adult present.
description_web: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn dances fun for all ages. Note: Any youth under 12 requires a responsible adult present.

name: Morris Games
description_book: We will teach Nine Man's Morris and other games of that family (which include the modern tic tac toe).
description_web: We will teach Nine Man's Morris and other games of that family (which include the modern tic tac toe).

location: Good Friends Camp (usually N-01 on St. Lawrence Way)
name: 16th-Century Limp Book Binding (Chain Stitch)
description_book: All-day class making a 16th-century limp vellum-covered book with decorative chain stitching on exposed spine. Some embroidery skills required.
description_web: An all-day class on how to make a 16th-century limp vellum-covered book with decorative chain-stitched exposed spine. Some embroidery skills are required to do this decorative spine, but no prior bookbinding knowledge is required. All tools are loaned by the instructor, but students can bring at least 3 matching beads (no larger than 10mm) for the ties.
fee_itemization: Fee covers vellum for the cover, a handout, paper for the blank book, leather for the spine, beads for the ties, and linen thread.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: KW Choir: Known World Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: Join the Known World Choir and prepare a concert of *a capella* choral music! Enthusiastic amateurs-expert singers are all welcome!
description_web: Join the Pennsic Known World Choir! Enthusiastic amateurs-expert singers are all welcome! Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on the final Thursday of War week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is extremely helpful, but not required if you are willing to put in the effort to learn the music in advance. Sheet music and part-learning tracks are available online now at the KWChoir Yahoo group: https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/KWChoir/info.
fee_itemization: Limited packets of sheet music available for $3.00. Otherwise, download pre-Pennsic or you may print at Mystic Mail

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. No fee. String provided.

name: Early Bird Tournament
description_book: Pick fights, take names and get acquainted.
description_web: Pick fights, take names and get acquainted. The purpose of this tourney isn't to win the most bouts, but to find the most interesting facts about your opponents. **"More talk! Less fighting!"** Who will the MICs give the bird to this year?

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: For all levels and teachers. Drills focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Études* for drill; elements from drill used to work in groups.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Beginners' *Atlatl* Throwing (Morning)
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.
description_web: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.

name: Beginning Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn how to throw, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn how to throw, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class.We have three wonderful, new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Drum Solo Choreography
description_book: “Slave to the Rhythm”: A Nubianesk drum solo choreography by Aziza.
description_web: “Slave to the Rhythm”:  A Nubianesk drum solo choreography by Aziza.

name: Cartridge Pleating: How and Where
description_book: German Ren and English Tudor skirts; also later period styles. See and touch examples of each stage of the process. Handout w/examples. Beginners ok.

name: Street Smarts
description_book: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography. How the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.
description_web: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography. How the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.

name: Enameling for Byzantine
description_book: A persona-focused introduction to the technical and artistic aspects of the Byzantine style of enameling. Will have finished item. Max 6 participants.
description_web: A persona-focused introduction to the technical and artistic aspects of the Byzantine style of enameling. Will have finished item. Max of 6 participants.
fee_itemization:
$3 for handout with history.
$5 to recover cost of enameling

name: Law in the Lands of Peace
description_book: A class on *Fiqh*, Muslim law, taught in persona from the point of view of the Maliki school.
description_web: A class on *Fiqh*, Muslim law, taught in persona from the point of view of the Maliki school.

name: Basics of Hennin Construction
description_book: Anyone can make a hennin, truncated or horned. No sewing experience necessary!
description_web: Everyone should have a hat! Learn the basics of making a hennin, truncated or horned. Learn how to make a pattern, hand sew, work with buckram, add beads or pearls and/or trim. Novices welcome!
fee_itemization: Samples of fabrics and trim will be given.

name: English Country Dances: Miscellaneous
description_book: All dances reconstructed by the teacher from Playford and/or Sloane; may include *Parsons Farewell, Nonesuch, Whirligig, Lady Cullen*.
description_web: All dances reconstructed by the teacher from Playford and/or Sloane; may include *Parsons Farewell, Nonesuch, Whirligig, Lady Cullen*.

name: Intro to 6-on-2 Chainmail
description_book: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail. All materials provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
description_web: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail prevalent throughout period across multiple cultures. All materials necessary to complete class project provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
fee_itemization: Sufficient hand-turned & cut enameled copper rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter; to complete class project

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web:
Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater Wednesday 8/6 6-7 pm.
You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Interrogating Your Museum
description_book: It's time to get more out of your museum. Find out what to ask, who to ask, and what to do with the answers once you have them.

name: Heraldic Armory: Function and Design
description_book: We'll talk about what our ancestors generally did, what the SCA does and allows and how to find something that will tell the world you are present.
description_web: The SCA never requires you to register any armory. Ever. You can use whatever you want painted, embroidered or chiseled on anything you wish. However, if you want something reasonably accurate to history and something that will pass Laurel's scrutiny, there are standards to be met, reasons for the rules. We'll talk about what our ancestors generally did, what the SCA does and allows and how to find something that will tell the world you are present.

name: Combat Archery Tactics from *The Senryaku*
description_book: A survey of stratagems and training methods for combat archers drawn from a classic of period strategy, with discussion of equipment and doctrine.

name: Imperial Roman Hair Styling
description_book: A hands-on class showing how to recreate several Roman hairstyles using period technique. (Kits available)
fee_itemization:
A multi-page instructional handout. 
A kit with everything you will need to recreate a period Roman hairstyle.

name: Viking Ornamentation: Viking Treasure Necklace
description_book: Participants review historical evidence, then create their own Viking-era treasure necklace.
description_web: Participants review historical evidence, then create their own Viking-era treasure necklace. You may wish to bring one focal bead, medallion, or Thor's hammer. Small site tokens also work well. **Or** just come string beads with Brigitta! Adults or older children (age 12 and up with parent).

name: *De Lapidibus*
description_book: A class on gemstones, taught in persona, based on period sources.
description_web: A class on gemstones, taught in persona, based on period sources.
fee_itemization: no materials, probably a one page handout.

name: Sex in SCA Period
description_book: Not marriage, not birth, just sex. It's your Western Civ class with the juicy bits left in.
description_web: Not marriage, not birth, just sex. It's your Western Civ class with the juicy bits left in. From the illicit frescos of Pompeii to Aretino's invention of modern pornography. This year I will be adding a section on sex crimes. Handouts are limited, but I will also have CDs of the material for $1.
fee_itemization: Printing fees for 30 pg handouts  including 7 color pages

name: Fingerloop Braiding for Beginners
description_book: A hands-on class learning a 5-loop braiding technique. Useful as decoration or cording. Can be made into lanyard for site tokens!

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater - Youth Rehearsal
description_book: KWP Youth Readers' Theatre providers a low stress opportunity and theatre experience creating a staged reading of "The Tale of Righteous Robin Hood."
description_web: Known World Players - Youth Readers' Theatre will give the youth (ages 10-17) of the SCA an opportunity to experience a low stress theatre experience and learn about a popular legend from the medieval time creating a staged reading of ʺThe Tale of Righteous Robin Hood.ʺ This script is written by a fellow SCAdian, John Inchingham the Fool.  A staged reading means that the actors will be performing the play with the script in hand.  To be performed Friday 8/1 in the Performing Arts Tent at 6:30pm.

name: Youth Rapier Fencing Practice
description_book: Youth rapier practice, ages 6 to 17. Come out and fence.
description_web: Youth rapier fencing practice, ages 6 to 17. Come out and fence.

name: Leather Crafting Round Table
description_book: A gathering with the intent to share knowledge of working leather in its many forms. All experience levels welcome.

name: Early Period Fire Starting
description_book: Introduction to basic fire starting using flint and steel and natural items found in the local area. This is a hands-on class.

name: From Text to Voice
description_book: Converting traditional tales from text to oral form and why there's a difference.
description_web: Traditional stories from around the world have been recorded in writing, but the forms used by writers differ from those we use orally. This class addresses reasons why writers' versions vary from both the oral forms and each other, and how to give them voice. Students will have opportunity to retell stories during class; books will be available for reference but you are welcome and encouraged to bring a story you'd like to play with.

name: *Saz* Workshop
description_book: Workshop for beginner and experienced *saz* players.
description_web: Basic techniques and melodies for beginners. Traditional long-neck and short-neck playing techniques. Experienced *saz* players are encouraged to share insights, techniques, and more complex melodies.

name: Scribal Playtime
description_book: Open space for scribes/artists to work on projects, ask questions or discuss their art. Some community-shared materials may be available for use.
description_web: The AEthelmearc Scribal College pavilion will be open for scribes to work on projects, ask questions of experienced scribes or discuss their art. One-on-one instruction may be available if space and resources allow. Some community-shared materials such as Paint-a-Blanks may be available.

name: Juggling 201 (Intermediate)
description_book: Intermediate  3-ball juggling. Going beyond the simple cascade. We will touch briefly on 4 and 5 balls as well.
description_web: Intermediate 3-ball juggling. Learn several basic tricks, such as crosses, snatches, and reverse cascade. We may work our way into basic 2-, 4-, and 5-ball juggling as they apply. Juggling balls will be available for use and purchase, ranging from $5-$10.

name: Mythbusting Period Piracy
description_book: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined.
description_web: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined. Common myths and mistakes about piracy in the SCA period will be highlighted.

name: Silent Heraldry: Why Are You Waving Your Hands?
description_book: An introduction to Silent Heraldry focusing on what we do, where we do it, and how to get started. (English/ASL provided if needed.)
description_web: The purpose of this class is to introduce individuals to Silent Heraldry including what we do and our role, where we provide services, and how to get started.  (This is not a sign language class.)

name: Beyond the Rod: Beads from Other Glass Sources
description_book: Learn to make beads using materials other than glass rod. Eye protection required; safety glasses are fine. Advanced class. Adults only.
description_web: Learn to make beads using materials other than glass rod: stained glass sheet strips, pieces, cullet (chunks), and *smalti* (tesserae or mosaic pieces). Learn to break up chunks for frit, and how to make a bead with it. This is an advanced class so lampworking knowledge is vital. Eye protection required; safety glasses are fine. Sleeves must be tight or tied up, no open-toed shoes, and hair must be short or tied back; natural fiber clothing recommended.

name: Children's Clothing That Fits and Lasts
description_book: Using the *Eura* dress as a template, we will learn how to make unisex garments for babies and toddlers that will fit for several seasons.
description_web: Babies and toddlers have unusual proportions and grow like weeds. The *Eura* dress solves the "giant head, tiny shoulders" problem without the use of buttons or ties, while also allowing for a year or two of growth.

name: Christoforo's Wonderful Pastries
description_book: A German pastry stuffed with a French custard and a cloak-shaped pastry from the 1549 Italian cookbook *Banchetti* by Cristoforo di Messisbugo.

name: Period Mustards
description_book: There will be a tasting of various medieval mustards, and a hands-on demonstration on how to make a simple mustard.
description_web: A brief class on the theory and practice of making and using medieval mustards. There will be a tasting of various medieval mustards, and a hands-on demonstration on how to make a simple mustard.

name: Cheese Recipes from 16th-Century Italy
description_book: Instructions for making and cooking with cheese from 16th-century Italian sources including Scappi.
description_web: Instructions for making cheese are rare in the SCA period, yet 16th-century Italian sources have them. I will be sharing instructions for making cheese and other dairy items taken from period sources. In addition, 16th-century Italian cheese varieties and their use in recipes and menus will be covered. Please note, I am not a cheesemaker, I am a cook. So if you want to volunteer to make cheese based on these instructions to share with the class, please contact me.

name: *Samurai* Style: *Moyoyama* (1568-1600)
description_book: A look at clothing and accessories in the *Moyoyama* era (focusing on men), including wearing of swords and other weapons.
description_web: A look at men's clothing and accessories in the *Moyoyama* era (focusing on men),  including wearing of swords and other weapons.

name: *Contentezza D'Amore*
description_book: Come learn *Contentezza D'Amore*, a beautiful 16th-C *ballo* from *Nobiltà*! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.
description_web: Come learn *Contentezza D'Amore*, one of the most beautiful of the 16th-century *balli*! I will be teaching the version from *Nobiltà di Dame*, Master Caroso's second book, wherein he corrects all the errors of his first; if you think you already know it, be warned! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.

name: *Alquerque*
description_book: A short intro to one of the most prevalent board games in period.
description_web: A short intro to one of the most prevalent board games in period, *alquerque* was played at least as long ago as 1400 BC and as late as 1600. It was played from Egypt to England

name: Building a Better Fighter
description_book: Better understand the mechanics of the basic blows in SCA combat so you can adapt them to your style. In armor, with weapons preferred.
description_web: Better understand the mechanics of the basic blows in SCA combat so you can adapt them to your style. Gain power and precision, while reducing fatigue and avoiding injury. This class will primarily focus on sword and shield techniques, but lessons can be applied to most weapon forms.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Open Reading: Sir Gawain and the Green Knight
description_book: We will read Sir Gawain and the Green Knight from the beginning straight through to the end. All are welcome to participate in the reading.
description_web: Come read Sir Gawain and the Green Knight with us; we've broken the poem into numerous parts and we will assign them to people that show up for the reading. Feel free to bring your own copy of any translation; all are accepted. We will start promptly and run straight through to the end.

name: Cutting a Quill Pen
description_book: Learn how to take a plain feather and turn it into an instrument of writing. Sharp knives will be used; ages 10-14 need parental supervision.
fee_itemization: For a quill to take home.  No fee for those who bring their own quill to cut.

name: Embroidery: A Beginning
description_book: Learn a few simple stitches to start a project. Create a sampler to take home.
description_web: Learn a few simple stitches to start a project. Create a sampler to take home.
fee_itemization: Hand out, sampler materials - linen, needle, thread, hoop.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Runes: the Younger *Futhark*
description_book: The YF and its many variants were primarily used in Scandinavia. Includes mercantile, pagan and Christian magic, codes, memorial stones, and more.
description_web: From the late Vendel period through medieval times (and actually in some regions of northern Norway and Sweden into the 20th century), younger *futhark* runes were pretty much cut-down versions derived from the Elder *Futhark*. We will look at the many variations not only in individual *futharks*, but regional variants in individual characters, rune names and meanings, pagan and Christian rune magic, mercantile usage, quickie notes scratched on slips of wood (Viking period Post-Its), memorial stones, codes and cyphers, "handwriting" variants, and lots more.

name: Children's Hood Making
description_book: Come and make a fleece hood to keep you warm on cold nights. This is a child friendly class. Bring an adult to help you sew the two necessary seams.
description_web: Geared for children ages 10 and under, come and make your very own fleece hood to help keep you warm on those cold nights. All you need is to bring an adult with you to help you when needed to sew the two necessary seams. Instruction is given as are all needed supplies. This class is family-friendly and youth/children are encouraged to participate.

name: European Sausage in SCA Periods
description_book: Survey of the types of sausages available, condiments served with them, as well as how to replicate sausages in your kitchen.
description_web: Survey of the types of sausages made in SCA periods in Europe, condiments/sauces that were served with them, and discussion and tips for replicating these types of sausages at home in your kitchen. Free hand-out with extensive bibliography.

name: Some Simple Period Sauces
description_book: There will be a tasting of various sauces, and a hands-on demonstration on how to make a simple sauce.
description_web: A brief class on the theory and practice of making and using medieval sauces, with particular emphasis on the vinegar- and breadcrumb-based sauces. There will be a tasting of various sauces, and a hands-on demonstration on how to make a simple sauce.

name: Warping a Warp-Weighted Loom
description_book: Warp-weighted looms can be imposingly large and strange. Let's learn how to warp one on a smaller and more human scale.
description_web: A full-size warp-weighted loom, as built in period, can be imposingly large and strange. We're going to learn how to warp one on a smaller and more human scale. We'll be working in pairs, with space for up to 12 people working hands-on. We'll have a follow-up class with hands-on practice weaving on the warp we've created.

name: Beginner Dance: Measures A
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn simple middle class dances from Elizabethan England.

name: Stuff It
description_book: Different cultural and/or historical versions of filled pasta from dough to fillings.
fee_itemization: cost to cover grocery supplies, flour, eggs,cheese, herbs. students will be able to take some finished product with them.

name: Gilding for Wood Simplified
description_book: Oil gilding on wood can be used for furniture and panels. The class will cover period and modern techniques used to do metal gilding.
description_web: Oil gilding on wood can be used for furniture and panels. The class will cover period and modern techniques used to do metal gilding, including gold, composite gold (brass), silver, and copper. The class will be held at Guild Mirandola in Merchant Row.

name: Introduction to Combat Archery
description_book: Learn the basics of combat archery. The class will cover the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules and basic tactics.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to be a part of the action on the battlefield, but didn't want to swing a sword? Have you ever wanted to shoot back at that pesky archer who keeps killing you? Give combat archery a try. The class will cover the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater - Adult Rehearsal
description_book: KWP Readers' Theatre providers a low stress opportunity and theatre experience creating a staged reading of "Strategos Arestes (Soldier of Honor)"
description_web: Known World Players Readers' Theatre providers a low stress opportunity and theatre experience creating a staged reading of a new play, "Strategos Arestes (Soldier of Honor)" by fellow SCAdian Tarmach ben Yehuda al-Khazari. This is a play based on Homer's The Iliad. This will be a staged reading of the play. A staged reading means that the actors will be performing the play with the script in hand. To be performed Friday 8/1 in the Performing Arts Tent at 7:00pm. An opportunity to meet the author and cast of the play to follow the performance.

name: Needle-Woven Pouch
description_book: A simple needle-weaving method and loom for creating a woven pouch or bag.
description_web: A simple needle-weaving method and loom for creating a woven pouch or bag. Loom and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Feasts Are More Than Cooking
description_book: A discussion of the many things needed for a successful feast that are not in the kitchen.

name: Choosing An SCA-Registerable Name
description_book: What will work and what likely won't when choosing an SCA name the College will register.
description_web: Names are important. They are often the first thing other people have to form an opinion of us. We can invest a lot of time and emotion in coming up with a name. However, if it doesn't follow reasonable historical practice or general SCA standards, it won't be registered. In this class we'll discuss what the SCA requires in a name, what was generally historically done, and how to avoid heartache over your desired name.

name: Enameling for Saxons
description_book: A persona-focused introduction to the technical and artistic aspects of the Anglo-Saxon style enameling. Will have finished item. Max 6 participants.
description_web: A persona-focused introduction to the technical and artistic aspects of the Anglo-Saxon style of enameling. Will have finished item. Max of 6 participants.
fee_itemization:
$3 for handout with history.
$5 to recover costs of enameling

name: Archaeology of the Vikings
description_book: Viking material culture in the context of both burials and habitation sites. Will include evidence for diet, metalwork, pottery, glass and textiles.
description_web: Viking material culture in the context of both burials and habitation sites in Sweden and Norway. Will include evidence for diet, metalwork, pottery, glass and textiles. Taught by two professional archaeologists. See: http://users.stlcc.edu/mfuller/Viking.html

name: Beginner Dance: Bransles A
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn fun bransles from 16th-century France.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then introduce you to fun bransles from 16th-century France. Planned dances include *Washerwoman's Bransle, Peas Bransle* and probably *Horses' Bransle*!

name: Board Games
description_book: This class will review board games previously taught and provide opportunities to practice with a knowledgeable instructor's assistance.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.

name: Sources for Islamic Persona: A Discussion
description_book: Anyone who has suggestions for sources for developing such a persona is welcome to join in.
description_web: Anyone with such a persona, interested in developing one, or with suggestions of how to develop one, is welcome to join in.

name: Beginners' *Atlatl* Throwing (Afternoon)
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.
description_web: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Youth Combat afternoon sessions, 3-5 PM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.
description_web: Youth Combat afternoon sessions, 3-5 PM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.

name: Basic *Ka-Kha-Ga-Gha*
description_book: Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *devanagari* script used by Hindi, Sanskrit and other Indic languages.
description_web:
Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *devanagari* script used by Hindi and other North Indic languages (including Sanskrit, post-period). While the focus of this class is on Hindi usage, the characters and pronunciation are nearly identical for the others. There will be examples in Hindi. Please bring a writing utensil which makes a dark, easily-visible line. This is not a calligraphy class.
1st hour: Basic characters and pronunciation.
2nd hour:  Vowels and half-letters; more if time and student interest allow.

name: Building Scrolls Without a Book of Hours
description_book: What? No Book of Hours? Yes! Learn how to use period artwork to build scrolls and break into a new area of creativity.

name: How to Design a Sweet Bag
description_book: We'll review period Elizabethan sweet bags, look at their design, construction, stitches and materials used. Design booklet included with notes.
description_web: This class will review period examples of Elizabethan sweet bags, look at their design, construction, stitches and materials used. The class includes a bibliography of references, sources for materials and a design booklet to get you started.

name: Ancient Art of Drink or How to be an Ass in Athens
description_book: Raise your *rhyton* to the art and culture of beer and wine and process of brewing and vintning from the sands of Egypt to the shores of Greece. BYOB!
description_web: Raise your *rhyton* to the ancient art and culture of beer and wine from the sands of Ancient Egypt to the salty shores of Classical Greece. See how the ancient culture of drink left its mark on medieval and modern times. We’ll delve into the ancient processes of brewing and vintning, and explore exquisite works of ancient art celebrating the drinking culture from King Tut’s tomb, Agamemnon’s Mycenae, Plato’s Athens, and more. BYOB! Note: over 21 only.

name: Planning a Feast
description_book: How to design a menu, figure out how much to cook, plan logistics, and everything else you need to consider to ensure a successful feast.

name: Middle Eastern Music and Dance
description_book: A time for people of all skill levels to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. All instruments are welcome, and loaner drums are available!
description_web: A time for people interested in Middle Eastern music and dance to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. We will be providing instruction appropriate to the interest of the attendees, from beginning Middle Eastern drum and belly dance to teaching songs in which everyone can participate. All skill levels and instruments are welcome, and drums are available for borrowing!

name: Storytime with Arbeau
description_book: Trouble learning **all the bransles**!? Use mnemonics to learn *Aridan, Cassandra, Charlotte, Clog, Montarde, Pease, Pinigay*, and *Washerwoman's*!
description_web: Having trouble learning **all the bransles**!? Storytime with Arbeau uses mnemonics - tricks and stories to help keep straight many of the bransles. Dances may include *Aridan, Cassandra, Charlotte, Clog, Hermits, Horses, Montard, Pease, Pinigay*, and *Washerwoman's* as time permits.

name: Gold Leafing: Period to Modern
description_book: Learn application methods for a perfect finish both period and modern. Period fish glue, garlic, glair and modern permacol for paper or parchment.
description_web: Understand gold leaf and its use in illuminations. Class focuses on period fish glue, garlic, glair, plus modern permacol and *miniatum* for paper and parchment. Learn methods for application of glue, and tips for a perfect finish in both period and modern methods. Bring your gilding questions and problems! Students will create a small gilded sample on parchment and paper. All materials included.

name: Vocal Techniques for Singers, Bards, Storytellers
description_book: Learn proper breathing, vocal exercises, projection techniques, and how to care for your voice.
description_web: Learn proper breathing, vocal exercises, projection techniques, and how to care for your voice. Singing and public speaking involve your whole body. Learn to do it the right way so you can do it for a lifetime!

name: Target Archery Marshals' Meeting
description_book: All target archery marshals should meet in the marshals' tent on the archery range. Repeat session, Aug. 3, 5 pm for those who missed Thurs. meeting.
description_web: There will a target archery marshals meeting in the marshals' tent on the archery range. There will also be an archery marshals' meeting on Sunday, August 3, at 5 pm, for all those marshals who did not or could not make the meeting on Thursday.

name: Commenting on Letter of Intent
description_book: Heraldic letters of intent (in and out of kingdoms) can always benefit from trained, or less experienced, commenters. How can you help?
description_web:
Commenting on letters of intent: How I learned to stop worrying and love heraldry.
Heraldic letters of intent (in and out of kingdoms) can always benefit from trained, or less experienced, commenters. We will discuss how to provide helpful commentary. For heralds or aspiring heralds.

name: Making Your Own Soapstone Glass Molds
description_book: Join us to learn to make and use soapstone molds for your glass working. Advanced glass working methods required.
description_web: In period, people could not order cool glass molds or tools from the local Internet website. Instead, they made their own. Come and learn how to make and use your own soapstone glass molds! This class is recommended for those already comfortable with basic beadmaking.

name: Russian Men's *Rubashki* and *Porti*
description_book: Overview of men's shirts and trousers: regional overviews, construction tips and garment layout guidelines.

name: *Kenjutsu*: The Art of Japanese Swordsmanship
description_book: Dojo-style class, covering basics of Japanese sword. Japanese practice sword or equivalent (wood or metal) required. Limited loaners available.
description_web:
A traditional-style class on Japanese *kenjutsu*, drawn from multiple sources, including modern and traditional arts. The class will be arranged to emphasize techniques that are known to have been used pre-1600. Emphasis will be on physical repetition more than scholarly discussion. The latter will be available after class, informally, as requested.
About the instructor: I have over 15 years of experience in Japanese sword arts, including *Nakamura Ryu Battodo (IBF 4-dan), ZNKR Kendo (1-kyu), Mugai Ryu Iaihyodo*, and *Shindo Muso Ryu Jodo*.

name: *La Figlia Guglielmina*
description_book: This 15th-century Italian dance is fun, complex and elegant. Come learn it, discuss it and enjoy it! Knowledge of Italian dance steps advised.
description_web: This is a complex and exquisite dance of late 15th-century Italy. It is based on a popular song of the day. The dance tells a story--but do you read the same story as I do? The dance will be taught but, if there is time and inclination, the reconstruction used and alternative reconstructions may be discussed.

name: Glass Fusing for Total Beginners
description_book: An introduction to glass fusing, including some vocabulary associated with the art. Students will assemble a small piece to be fused on site.
description_web: This class, which covers introductory glass fusing, is very, very basic. It is geared toward total beginners with no glass experience. Students will learn basic terminology as well as assemble a small piece to be fused on site.
fee_itemization: covers the cost of the glass used

name: Brewing and Experimental Archaeology
description_book: Lessons learned from experimental archaeology with wine and beer will be discussed and tasted. Brave adults (over 21) only.
description_web: Lessons learned from experimental archaeology with wine and beer will be discussed and tasted. The discovery and excavation of a monastic winery at the archaeological site of Tell Tuneinir will be discussed including artifacts and inscriptions. Brewing examples with include a variety of herbed beers as well as wines (quince, herbed red wine, and "poignant" mead).  Brave adults (over 21) only.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children at Runestone Hill.
description_web: 7pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend, must have adult escort.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magick.
description_web: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.

name: Medieval Oil Lamps
description_book: Oils were used to light lamps by all cultures throughout the Middle Ages. Learn how easy, inexpensive and, best of all, *safe* oil lamps are!
description_web: Oils were used to light lamps by all cultures throughout the Middle Ages. Learn how easy, inexpensive, compact and, best of all, *safe* oil lamps still are! Learn how to camp with just one bottle of cooking oil. New this year, a brief mention of 'fat' lamps will be included.
fee_itemization: copying cost for handout and wick kit materials.

name: 2nd Annual Unofficial Pennsic Half-Marathon
description_book: Thora and Signy Heri will lead a run of roughly 13.1 miles around the Pennsic campground. All are welcome to join for all or part of the course.
description_web: The estimated 13-mile course (it is medievally inexact!) will consist of three loops around the entire Pennsic campground. Runners will meet in front of Chirurgeons' Point at 8 a.m. Water is available from the chirurgeons, but runners are encouraged to supply their own water/sports drink/snack needs. We will pass the Chirurgeons' Point three times, at roughly 4.5-mile intervals. Note: this is a group run, not a race. No times will be kept, though there will be some participant awards. The goal is fitness as part of the SCAdian lifestyle. All are welcome.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Youth Combat morning sessions, 8-10:30 AM.  Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.
description_web: Youth Combat morning sessions, 8-10:30 AM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.

name: Scientific Instruments Day
description_book: A day devoted to the scientific instruments of medieval science: teaching and demonstrations of astrolabes, quadrants, sundials and more.
description_web: For those of us who like to put the science into Arts and Sciences, Artisans' Row at  Pennsic this year will have a day devoted to the scientific instruments and tools of medieval science. There will be teaching and demonstrations of astrolabes, quadrants, sundials and many other devices.

name: Painting Studio Day
description_book: All-day demonstrations & display of different mediums, supports and tools; hands-on pigment making; *camera lucida & obscura* & more. Come grind rocks
description_web: All-day demonstrations and display of different mediums, supports and tools; hands-on pigment making; *camera lucida* and *camera obscura* as well as Q & A and troubleshooting of any problems with canvas, paper, parchment, metal or wood. Hands-on egg tempera starts at noon with tests on different types of eggs and trying out different types of hair brushes. Rocks available for grinding and will be happy to teach how to make any pigment to any grind, including : oil, gouache, sandarac, encostic and frit. Come to work, come to play or bring something to work on and come to chat.

name: Hammer of the Witches: Witch Hunts and Trials
description_book: Examines the various texts, tactics, and histories of witch-hunters, along with information on the enemies they believed they fought.

name: Introduction to Elizabethan Polychrome Embroidery
description_book: Learn to use silk and metal threads to create a Tudor Rose with tent, reverse chain and 4-legged spider stitches. Hoop and scissors not included.
description_web: This practical session will teach the student the basics of working with silk and metal threads. The kit will produce a Tudor rose learning the following stitches: tent stitch in silk, reverse chain using metal thread, and the 4-legged spider using metal thread. The class comes with a printed handout and kit to practice stitches. Please bring your own embroidery hoop and scissors if you have them. Loaners are available if not. Auditors with their own equipment are welcome.
fee_itemization: $1 for handout only, $5 for handout and kit. Kits limited to 12.

instructor: Lord Henry of Stone Hill Keep
name: 65 Silk Road Beads
description_book: We will discuss reproducing 65 Silk Road beads from photographs of the originals found in Xinjang, China. Concludes with hands-on beadwork.
description_web: This project is based on information published in the paper: “Silk Road Glass in Xinjang, China: Chemical Compositional Analysis and Interpretation Using a High-Resolution Portable XRF Spectrometer.” The original 65 beads date from 474 BCE to 907 CE. We will discuss ideas on reproducing these beads, and will conclude with hands-on beadwork at the torches.
fee_itemization:
$10 for Photographic Prints 
$10 for Glass and Gas

name: Waste-Free Garment Cutting
description_book: Twice the clothes from half the fabric...or at least, better clothes from less fabric. Come prepared to take notes.
description_web: Hand-spun, hand-woven, hand-finished...they never wasted a single thread. You don't have to! An overview of the thriftiest cutting and sewing tricks used in the SCA's target centuries. We cover only pre-17th century Western European clothing.

name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: Three-day class for a total of 9 hours. Learn the basic movements and make three basic projects. Start a period pattern.
description_web: This is a three-day class for a total of 9 hours of bobbin lace! First Day: Students will learn the basic movements of bobbin lace and begin a project. Second Day: Students will finish the project and learn some simple grounds. Third Day: Students will begin a period pattern from the *Nüw Modelbuch*.
fee_itemization: $30 – One-time fee for all three days. Includes pillow with cover, bobbin holder, 10 pair of bobbins, pins, handout, patterns

name: Beginning Tatting, Part 1
description_book: Tatting is a form of lacemaking. Supplies can be found at craft stores. Learn a craft that fits in a Ziplock bag, can be done in the car, or at court!
fee_itemization: I provide prewound shuttles and a handout with directions and projects.

name: Copper-Etched Needle Cases
description_book: Hands-on project to make etched copper needle cases using ferric chloride. Students will make and take one needle case.
description_web: Using ferric chloride to etch copper tubing to make needle cases. Students will learn the technique to prepare, etch and finish metals for etching and the process of using chemicals to etch copper and brass. Other methods for etching will also be discussed.
fee_itemization: Copper tubing, chemicals and protective items.

name: Low Magick in the Middle Ages
description_book: Low magick and witchcraft in the Middle Ages: What form did magick take among the popular classes from the Dark Ages until the Renaissance?
description_web: What kind of magick was actually practiced during the Dark and Middle Ages? This is the other half of the High Magick workshop (q.v.); in this I cover the magick of the common people, the attitudes toward witchcraft and witches, and the magick people used that wasn’t considered "witchy", but was usually anti-witch, or fairy magick.

name: Embroidery - How Do I Do That!?!
description_book: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Come out and learn a few easy stitches and finish by decorating a small, wool, needle book!
description_web: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Do you want to decorate your garb or projects but aren't sure where to start? Come out and learn a few easy stitches. See some examples of basic embroidery projects. We'll finish class by decorating a small, wool, needle book!

name: ASHI CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer
description_book: Designed for individuals in the healthcare or professional rescuer field who are required to have a professional-level basic life support training.
description_web: CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer program is designed for individuals in the healthcare or professional rescuer field who are required to have a professional-level basic life support training. Students learn how to recognize a life-threatening emergency, how to provide basic life support and what to do in case of an airway obstruction or choking. ASHI's CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer has been approved for training for Emergency Medical Services personnel and is accepted by the National Registry of Emergency Medical Technicians (NREMT). Class length: 7 hours
fee_itemization: Separate fee for certification card or course materials.

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.
description_web: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.

name: Basic Coining
description_book: Striking basic coins from punched dies. Die preparation, creating punches, using those punches to make dies, and striking coins. Slightly messy.
description_web: Striking basic coins from punched dies. Die preparation, creating punches, using those punches to make dies, and striking coins. Somewhat messy.
fee_itemization: Handout, dies, punches, sandpaper, and coin blanks.

instructor: Lady Nina Amaya of Bright Hills
name: Favorite Combinations
description_book:
Combinations and bits of choreographies you can use in your own dances! 
www.NinaAmaya.com
description_web:
Combinations and bits of choreographies you can use in your own dances! 
www.NinaAmaya.com

name: Wire-Wrapped Jewelry
description_book: Learn the basics of wire-wrapped jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. Bring tools and materials if you have them.
description_web: Learn the basics of wire-wrapped jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. Please bring tools, wire and beads if you have them. There will be some tools available to borrow and some to purchase at cost.

name: Harp Techniques
description_book: Historical information and techniques to improve strength, speed, tone and musicality. Useful for all harpers, beginner to advanced.
description_web: Techniques to improve strength, speed, tone and musicality. Historical information about harps, the men and women who played them, and their music. Useful for all harpers, complete beginner to advanced. Learn how to get more out of your instrument and practice time, as well as practical approaches to performing. This is one of a 3-part course. We will build on information from each class, but students are not required to attend all three. Feel free to contact teacher in advance if you cannot attend first class.
fee_itemization: Exercises for use in class, during Pennsic, and afterward.  Reading music, counting, fingering, etc.

name: Viking: The Next Step...
description_book: Taking your basic Viking/Norse to the next level. This class includes accessories and covers head to toe. Male and female.
description_web: Taking your basic Viking/Norse to the next level. How to make small changes to polish your overall Norse look. This class includes accessories and covers head to toe. Male and female attire will be covered. This is not a sewing or persona-specific class.

name: *Marudai* for Beginners (Also *Kumihimo*)
description_book: Part 4: *Kumihimo* on a *marudai* stand for beginners. Learn to braid beginning patterns on the traditional Japanese stand.
description_web: Part 4: *Kumihimo* on a *marudai* stand for beginners. Learn to braid beginning patterns on the traditional Japanese stand.Traditional Japanese fiber is used.
fee_itemization:
10.00 for class and handout
1.00 for handout only

name: Children's Dance: Fun Circle and Line Dances!
description_book: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn dances fun for all ages. (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)
description_web: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn dances fun for all ages. (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.) This class will teach French bransles and English almans.

name: Introduction to *Go*
description_book: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.
description_web: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.

name: Coptic Bookbinding
description_book: You'll learn to make a book using Coptic bookbinding techniques. Great for notebooks, journals, sketchbooks. Limit of 10 participants per class
description_web: You'll learn to make a book using Coptic bookbinding techniques. Great for notebooks, journals, sketchbooks. A limit of 10 participants per class, sorry.
fee_itemization: panels, acid free paper, needle, linen twine, awl

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: KW Choir: Known World Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: Join the Known World Choir and prepare a concert of *a capella* choral music! Enthusiastic amateurs-expert singers are all welcome!
description_web: Join the Pennsic Known World Choir! Enthusiastic amateurs-expert singers are all welcome! Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on the final Thursday of War week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is extremely helpful, but not required if you are willing to put in the effort to learn the music in advance. Sheet music and part-learning tracks are available online now at the KWChoir Yahoo group: https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/KWChoir/info.
fee_itemization: Limited packets of sheet music available for $3.00. Otherwise, download pre-Pennsic or you may print at Mystic Mail

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater - Adult Rehearsal
description_book: KWP Readers' Theatre providers a low stress opportunity and theatre experience creating a staged reading of "Strategos Arestes (Soldier of Honor)"
description_web: Known World Players Readers' Theatre providers a low stress opportunity and theatre experience creating a staged reading of a new play, "Strategos Arestes (Soldier of Honor)" by fellow SCAdian Tarmach ben Yehuda al-Khazari. This is a play based on Homer's The Iliad. This will be a staged reading of the play. A staged reading means that the actors will be performing the play with the script in hand. To be performed Friday 8/1 in the Performing Arts Tent at 7:00pm. An opportunity to meet the author and cast of the play to follow the performance.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: For all levels and teachers. Drills focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Études* for drill; elements from drill used to work in groups.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class.We have three wonderful, new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: Drum Solo Choreography
description_book: “Slave to the Rhythm”: A Nubianesk drum solo choreography by Aziza.
description_web: “Slave to the Rhythm”:  A Nubianesk drum solo choreography by Aziza.

name: Neck/Cuff/Hem: 14th-C Greenland Dresses
description_book: Learn special sewing techniques for the necklines, sleeve cuffs, and hems of the 14th-C dresses from a find in Greenland. Beginner-friendly.

name: Fingerloop Braiding for Beginners
description_book: A hands-on class learning a 5-loop braiding technique. Useful as decoration or cording. Can be made into lanyard for site tokens!

name: Beginning *Pysanky*
description_book: Students will learn the history of the *pysanka*, and have the opportunity to create one of their own.
description_web: Students will learn the history of the *pysanka*, as well as the techniques involved, and have the opportunity to create one of their own. The class is listed as three hours to allow plenty of time for writing the shells; it doesn't usually take that long.
fee_itemization: $5 overall, $2 if you just want the handout (but it IS a hands-on class ...)

name: Introduction to Enameling
description_book: This class will introduce you to the magical world of melting powdered glass onto metal with a kiln.
description_web: This class will introduce you to the magical world of melting powdered glass onto metal. We will discuss techniques and examples. I'll show you how you can get started relatively quickly and for less than you expect.

name: Historical Uses of Poisons
description_book: A rundown of the weaponization of poisons in history garnered from various resources.
description_web: A review of the weaponization of poisonous plants (and two rocks) as recorded in history. A summary garnered from various resources, the compilation paints a unique picture of warfare and weaponization techniques from several cultures.

name: Sewing 101
description_book: Learn a basic running stitch and a rolled hem. Create a coif or a cup cover while practicing stitches.
description_web: Hand-sewing is a great way to start making your own items. Learn about seaming two pieces and hemming the edges. You can create a basic coif or the simpler cup cover and practice the running stitch and rolled hem.
fee_itemization: fabric, needle and thread.  Beads for the cup cover.

name: Dance Atrocities 2014
description_book: Sion rescues 2 dance tunes from AS barely double digits, gives them new choreographies, and presents a new country dance. Trust me. They will be fun.
description_web: This year Uncle Sion rescues two dance-tunes-we-used-to-use in AS barely double digits and gives them bright new choreographies. He also steals from--er, is inspired by--Jamie's Magnum Opus and presents his own country dance (which needs 6 couples to do). Trust in Sion. They will be fun.

name: Intro to 6-on-2 Chainmail
description_book: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail. All materials provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
description_web: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail prevalent throughout period across multiple cultures. All materials necessary to complete class project provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
fee_itemization: Sufficient hand-turned & cut enameled copper rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter; to complete class project

name: Beginners' *Atlatl* Throwing (Morning)
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.
description_web: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.

instructor: Lord Henry of Stone Hill Keep
name: Your Persona and the Public
description_book: The dos and don'ts of using your persona to interact with the public. We will discuss using our SCA personas to teach history.
description_web: The dos and don'ts of using your persona to interact with the public. We will discuss using our SCA personas to teach history. There are traditions in the SCA that are not reflective of the histories we portray. We will discuss how to avoid misrepresenting the Middle Ages when we do demos or otherwise interact with the public. We will discuss developing an interpretive plan for your persona.

name: Beginning Wire Weaving
description_book: Students will learn to make intricate chains in the manner of the Vikings and other cultures, without need for heat or complicated tools.
description_web: This class will teach beginning students to make intricate chains in the manner of the Vikings and other ancient cultures, without the need for heat or complicated tools. With the techniques presented, you will learn to create items like the ones found in Viking burials and treasure hoards across the Nordic countries dating from the 9th century to the late 12th century. Wire chains made in this fashion have also been discovered in the British Isles (875 AD) and in the Roman, Greek and Byzantine civilizations from the 4th century BC to the 1st century AD. Timeless items can be created that are still beautiful and wearable today. If you have needle-nose pliers and wire cutters, please bring them. If you need glasses for close or small work, please bring them. The fee for the class includes the materials needed to complete the leather cord necklace. To view this unique jewelry, please visit www.AncientWire.com/book.htm

name: The Way of Saint James: Pilgrims to Santiago
description_book: An examination of the legends and lore of the Santiago de Compostela pilgrimage in period to the present day, taught by former pilgrims.

name: Medieval Modes
description_book: Medieval music isn't just major and minor. Find out the other "scales" used then. Good for performing and writing your own music. Bring a pencil.
description_web: Wondering how to make a tune sound more medieval? Go beyond major and minor keys, and learn about modes. We'll start at Do-Re-Mi, then go on. Previous music theory not necessary. We'll learn how to figure out the mode of almost any pre-written song. Handout includes a period song in every mode. Bring a pencil.

name: How to Drape the Great Kilt
description_book: Discussion and demo: How to create and wear the Scottish Great Kilt -- *Breacan an Fhéilidh* (belted plaid) or *Feileadh Mòr* (great plaid).

name: *Gracca Amorosa* for Beginners
description_book: Come learn *Gracca Amorosa*, one of the most popular 16th-C. *cascarde*. Dancers of all ages welcome. Prior dance experience helpful but not required.

name: Start a Fire Without the Sunday New York Times
description_book: How to make simple fire starters from items you have around your house.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Sing We And Chant It: Madrigal and *A Capella* Jam
description_book: Meet and greet, optional practice session, for audience participation, "Sing We and Chant It Madrigal and *A Capella* Jam."
description_web:
Meet and greet, optional practice session, for audience participation "Sing We and Chant It Madrigal, Part-Song, and *A Capella* Jam", Monday 8/4, at 6:30 pm in the Performing Arts Tent. All are welcome to come and make joyful music! Music will be available to share, or bring your own! (Material fee optional for a folder of this year's jam music).
Song list available online:  https://docs.google.com/document/d/14Erajd1a5RMcDm7YUDN5pweB1qQownE6vQYY-NEG4jA/edit?usp=sharing
fee_itemization: photocopy fee of public domain music selections

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater - Youth Rehearsal
description_book: KWP Youth Readers' Theatre providers a low stress opportunity and theatre experience creating a staged reading of "The Tale of Righteous Robin Hood."
description_web: Known World Players - Youth Readers' Theatre will give the youth (ages 10-17) of the SCA an opportunity to experience a low stress theatre experience and learn about a popular legend from the medieval time creating a staged reading of ʺThe Tale of Righteous Robin Hood.ʺ This script is written by a fellow SCAdian, John Inchingham the Fool.  A staged reading means that the actors will be performing the play with the script in hand.  To be performed Friday 8/1 in the Performing Arts Tent at 6:30pm.

name: Kumihimo Basics
description_book: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Youth Rapier Fencing Practice
description_book: Youth rapier practice, ages 6 to 17. Come out and fence.
description_web: Youth rapier fencing practice, ages 6 to 17. Come out and fence.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web:
Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater Wednesday 8/6 6-7 pm.
You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Intro to Egyptian-Style Group Improvisation
description_book: Learn Tribal Odyssey: Egyptian-based improvisational tribal-style with *beledi*-style combinations.
description_web: Rajni is a Certified Level 1 Tribal Odyssey dance leader, a group improvisational style developed by Kawakib of Fredericksburg, VA. In the words of Kawakib: “Tribal Odyssey uses natural posture and both sides of the body in combinations based primarily on Egyptian *beledi*-style movement. It's versatile enough to adapt to any size group.” Class will repeat to allow for several days of practice with a group, and will incorporate recorded Middle Eastern drumming as well as live music/ drumming as available. Learn moves that you and your dance friends can use at Pennsic haflas this year!

name: *Saz* Workshop
description_book: Workshop for beginner and experienced *saz* players.
description_web: Basic techniques and melodies for beginners. Traditional long-neck and short-neck playing techniques. Experienced *saz* players are encouraged to share insights, techniques, and more complex melodies.

name: Taking the Brush: Japanese calligraphy
description_book: A hands-on introduction to Japanese calligraphy for official documents. Please bring large bamboo writing brushes if you have them.
description_web: A hands-on introduction to designing and executing Japanese official documents. This class will introduce the role of the scribe in imperial and military government. Participants will also learn about the evolution of character styles and how documents were attested. Please bring large bamboo writing brushes if you have them.

name: Scribal Playtime
description_book: Open space for scribes/artists to work on projects, ask questions or discuss their art. Some community-shared materials may be available for use.
description_web: The AEthelmearc Scribal College pavilion will be open for scribes to work on projects, ask questions of experienced scribes or discuss their art. One-on-one instruction may be available if space and resources allow. Some community-shared materials such as Paint-a-Blanks may be available.

name: Bookbinders' Day
description_book: Display of Meisterin Katarina Helene’s completed books from the 4th to 16th century with the opportunity to learn some different text-block stitches.
description_web: A display of Meisterin Katarina Helene’s completed books ranging from the 4th century to the 16th century, with a chance to learn how to do some of the different types of text-block stitches.

name: Period Stained Glass Basics
description_book: Discussion of materials, techniques, and primary sources used in period stained glass work. This will not be hands-on, but many visual aids!
description_web: Discussion of materials, techniques, and primary sources used in period stained glass work, including vitreous paints, silver stain, design considerations, lead came technique, etc. Discussion will also include an overview of primary sources and other resources for research. Practical hands-on will not be available, but many examples will be available for viewing. This class intended for someone doing modern copper foil work who wants to try more period techniques.

name: Heraldic Customer Service
description_book: How to be a better local officer/consultation herald with a few, relatively painless, changes.
description_web: So you went to the bathroom during the bizmeet and now you're the herald. Or maybe you've been your group's herald since Cariadoc was a bootblack and there's no one to take over the office. Come learn some ways to be a better officer and serve your group without letting the heraldry go by the wayside.

name: Writing without Writing
description_book: Ever wonder how people composed long written works with limited resources for actual writing? We will discuss techniques of composing without writing.
description_web: Ever wonder how medieval authors composed long written works with limited resources for actual writing? So do I. Come to the class, and we will discuss how medieval people composed long, complicated works with limited resources for physical writing. This class is a discussion more than a lecture; please bring your knowledge and experience of composing without writing.

name: Introduction to Wet Felting
description_book: Hands-on class to make a a flat sheet of felt and a piece around a form. Discuss cultures that used felt fabric for clothing and homes.
description_web: Hands-on class to make a a flat sheet of felt and a piece around a form. Discuss cultures that used felt fabric for clothing and homes. Wear clothes that you don't mind getting wet and soapy.
fee_itemization: Wool top for felting, $5.00 per person

name: Brewing With Egil: Reconstructed Viking Brewing
description_book: Ever wondered how the Vikings brewed? Come learn about an evidence-based reconstruction of a plausible Viking-era brewing system!
description_web: The sagas tell us that Vikings had ale, but no written records detailing its production survive. How was it made? What was it like? Using literary, linguistic, archaeological, and scientific sources from several cultures (along with experimental creation), I will present my hypothesis detailing the production of two distinct classes of cereal beverage in the Viking age. Come listen, learn, and discuss!

name: *Assai Contrapassare*
description_book: There are at least 6 known choreographies for the tune *Contrapasso*, all of which almost fit the same music. We'll cover all 6!
description_web: There are at least 6 known choreographies for the tune *Contrapasso*, all of which almost fit the same music. We'll begin by learning (or reviewing) *Contrapasso en due*, and then we'll learn all of the ones done in a circle, including the one illustrated in the famous "rose hey" woodcut in Caroso's second manual.

name: Introduction to Crocheting
description_book: A beginner's class to introduce basic crocheting skills.
fee_itemization: Ten dollar material fee covers your choice of crochet needle, 2 balls of yarn, refreshments and informational handout

name: Morris Games
description_book: We will teach Nine Man's Morris and other games of that family (which include the modern tic tac toe).
description_web: We will teach Nine Man's Morris and other games of that family (which include the modern tic tac toe).

name: Bouquet List
description_book: Fencing list, double elimination,
description_web:
Entrants must be fighting for a consort (either present or not....preferred to be on the field). On entry you are given a single flower, after your second defeat you surrender it to the victor. At the end, the winner has a bouquet to present to his or her consort. Also, a pouch will be presented to the most chivalric as voted by the consorts     
NOW is your chance to extoll the virtues of your consort loudly!

name: Beginning Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn how to throw, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn how to throw, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Iron *Commedia*: Creating a New 16th-Century Play
description_book: Join actors from your favorite improvisational *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes to craft, cast, perform, & premier a brand-new play in just one afternoon!
description_web: If you've ever laughed at the zany antics of improvisational *Commedia dell'Arte*, join members from your favorite troupes to craft, cast, and perform a brand new *commedia* play in just one afternoon with its world premier at at Pennsic that same day! Two sessions, two performances, one each week. Find a mask, put it on, and see what happens!

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Running an In-Persona and/or Authentic Encampment
description_book: An open discussion of how to run and participate in an "in-persona" and/or authentic encampment, for those who have done it or might like to try.
description_web: An open discussion of how to run and participate in an "in-persona" and/or authentic encampment, for those who have done it or might like to try.

name: Simply Plaited: 14th-Century Women's Hair
description_book: Theorized period methods of achieving 4 simple 14th-C hairstyles popular in England and France with archaeological & artistic examples. Instructional.
description_web: Theorized period methods of achieving four **simple** 14th-century hairstyles popular in England and France. Period archaeological and artistic examples will be shown/demonstrated. Discussion of the use of modern materials also included.

name: Introduction to Beginning Period Cookery
description_book: Want to cook in period but don’t know where to start? No problem! For beginners who want a quick intro to some basics of modern period cookery.
description_web: Want to cook in period, but don’t know where to start? Your apartment doesn't have a handy open fireplace? No idea what an *eyroun* is or where to buy one?  No problem! This class is designed for those beginners who have never cooked a period recipe before but want a quick introduction into some of the basics of modern period cookery.

name: Open Reading: Period Sonnets
