description_book: Come read period sonnets out loud for fun and enjoyment. Many different samples will be available; bring your own book or written sonnet as well.
description_web: We will take turns reading sonnets or short poems from the entire medieval period, starting with Giacomo da Lentini's *lo m'aggio posto in core a Dio servire* (I have set my heart on serving God) and proceeding through Shakespeare, and sonnets from around the medieval period. Attendees are welcome to bring their own sonnets or short poems written in a medieval style or topic. We will provide a large number of sample sonnets to draw from, but people are welcome to bring whatever they can find.

name: Beginner Dance: Absolute Beginner B
description_book: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the Ball!

name: Bling on a Budget
description_book: Use glass jewels, beads, and metal to add dignity and ostentation to clothes without going broke. Dark Ages through Renaissance.
description_web: How to use glass jewels, beads, and metal to add dignity and ostentation to clothes without going broke. From minor flourishes to full-bore excess, planning and execution, covered by instructor with 25+ years experience working with these forms of embellishment. No purchase necessary. Supplies available for purchase; prices vary depending on patterns chosen.
fee_itemization: Fee depends on choices made. No purchase necessary.

name: Tunisian with a Twist!
description_book: Learn some Tunisian-style movements and footwork as well as some heavy hip twist variations and drills. It's Oola's class, so be prepared to sweat!
description_web: Learn a variety of Tunisian combinations focusing on some footwork and hipwork. This class will also spend focused time working on hip twists, drilling stationary, moving around the floor, and layering variations and combos.

name: PA Afternoon Series: European Music Exhibition
description_book: The history of composers plus a variety of instruments and vocal music from the 11th-17th centuries. Bring your voices, instruments, and play along!
description_web: Come and enjoy an afternoon of European music. Experience the history of composers and a variety of instruments and vocal music from the 11th-17th centuries. Bring your voices, instruments, and play along!

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Beginners' *Atlatl* Throwing (Afternoon)
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.
description_web: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.

name: Court Prep and Polish
description_book: Making Court efficient and memorable in a seemingly effortless way takes planning, coordination and practice.
description_web: Master Rowen Cloteworthy, former Brigantia Herald of the East, and Gisela, Triton Herald of Atlantia, will lead discussion on good court prep. Making Court efficient and memorable in a seemingly effortless way takes planning, coordination and practice. The class will be talk about practices in the East and Atlantia but will be useful for heralds from any kingdom.

name: Medieval and Renaissance Medical Terminology
description_book: Don't know a *ventose* from a *spatulum mondani*? Want to know the difference between quinsy and hydrocele? This is an introduction to medical terms.

name: Children's Pouchmaking Class
description_book: Kids of any age can come and make a very simple cloth pouch to hold small baubles. You can easily attach it to your wrist or belt.
description_web: Kids of any age can come and make a very simple cloth pouch to hold small baubles. You can easily attach it to your wrist or belt. This class is family-friendly and youth/children are encouraged to participate. Responsible adult required.

name: Smoked Salts
description_book: A quick introduction to smoked salts, their history, tastes, uses, and an easy how-to for those who wish to broaden their taste horizons.
description_web: A quick introduction to smoked salts, their history, tastes, uses, and an easy how-to for those who wish to broaden their taste horizons.
fee_itemization: A 6-7 page handout, bottle of water, crackers/tasting palate cleanser and small container of sea salt

name: Anatomy of a Demo
description_book: What makes a successful demo? What are the types of demos? How can you advertise them for low or no cost?
description_web: What makes a successful demo? What are the types of demos? How can you advertise them for low or no cost, what activities can you include? How can the populace leverage the chatelaine and other resources to run one?

name: The *Montante* (Iberian Greatsword) of Godinho
description_book: This class will cover the basics of the *montante*, a two-handed greatsword, of Godinho. Bring your greatsword (5~6' two-handed sword) or simulator.
description_web: This class will cover the basics of the *montante*, a two-handed greatsword, of Godinho. Bring your greatsword (5~6' two-handed sword) or simulator.  The *montante* is described as the "Queen of Swords". This class will teach the *montante* in rules as laid down by Domingo Luis Godinho in 1599. Trainers are limited.

name: Beginner Dance: English Country B
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn simple English Country dances.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! Come learn some easy dances that will be done at several of the balls at Pennsic. Included are *Black Nag, Rufty Tufty, Heart's Ease* and *New Bo Peep.*

name: Happy Japanese Games
description_book: Three leisure games of Japan will be discussed. Reproductions of each game will be available to play for the duration of class.
description_web: Three leisure games of Japan will be discussed. Reproductions of each game will be available to play for duration of class. May not be appropriate for small children; some game pieces can be a choking hazard.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Youth Combat afternoon sessions, 3-5 PM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.
description_web: Youth Combat afternoon sessions, 3-5 PM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.

name: Weaving on a Warp-Weighted Loom
description_book: Warp-weighted looms can be large and strange. Let's learn how to weave on one on a smaller scale. [Follow-up to "Warping" class. Others welcome!]
description_web: A ful- size warp-weighted loom, as built in period, can be imposingly large and strange. We're going to learn how to weave on one on a smaller and more human scale. Using the warp we created in the previous class, we'll be working in pairs, learning how to weave a tabby weave, with discussions on working with more complex weaves. We'll have space for up to 12 people working hands-on. This is a follow-up class for the "Warping a Warp-Weighted Loom" class.

name: GUDFR LQYLFWXV! Codes and Secret Communications
description_book: Want to know how to send battle plans securely to others? Want to express your love to someone without prying eyes? How to crack enemy codes too!
description_web: Want to know how to send battle plans securely to other commanders? Want to express your love to someone without prying eyes? Come talk about how messages were hidden in period, and see some of the methods used. Learn how some of the codes were broken as well. Handout includes practice codes to break and quick methods/formulas you can use at War.

name: Middle Eastern Music and Dance
description_book: A time for people of all skill levels to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. All instruments are welcome, and loaner drums are available!
description_web: A time for people interested in Middle Eastern music and dance to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. We will be providing instruction appropriate to the interest of the attendees, from beginning Middle Eastern drum and belly dance to teaching songs in which everyone can participate. All skill levels and instruments are welcome, and drums are available for borrowing!

name: Whose Partner Am I Anyway?
description_book: Why settle for one when you can have both? Three fun, flirty, and fickle Playford dances: *Rufty Tufty, Heart's Ease*, and *Cuckolds All in a Row.*
description_web: Why settle for dancing with one partner when you can dance with both! Learn three fun, flirty, and fickle four-person Playford dances including *Rufty Tufty*, *Heart's Ease,* and *Cuckolds All in A Row.* Basic ECD steps will be reviewed. Beginner+.

name: SCA Dance History Ball Musicians' Rehearsal
description_book: Dance History Ball musicians’ rehearsal includes old favorites and new ones alike! Open to all musicians and skill levels. Music provided.
description_web: Celebrate a part of the history of our Society as we hold a musicians’ rehearsal for the Friday Night Ball! The SCA Dance History Ball will include old favorites and new ones alike. Most of the music is in the Pennsic Pile, or provided. Players of all instruments and skill levels welcome.

name: Smoked Salts
description_book: A quick introduction to smoked salts, their history, tastes, uses, and an easy how-to for those who wish to broaden their taste horizons.
description_web: A quick introduction to smoked salts, their history, tastes, uses, and an easy how-to for those who wish to broaden their taste horizons.
fee_itemization: A 6-7 page handout, bottle of water, crackers/tasting palate cleanser and small container of sea salt

name: *Kenjutsu*: The Art of Japanese Swordsmanship
description_book: Dojo-style class, covering basics of Japanese sword. Japanese practice sword or equivalent (wood or metal) required. Limited loaners available.
description_web:
A traditional-style class on Japanese *kenjutsu*, drawn from multiple sources, including modern and traditional arts. The class will be arranged to emphasize techniques that are known to have been used pre-1600. Emphasis will be on physical repetition more than scholarly discussion. The latter will be available after class, informally, as requested.
About the instructor: I have over 15 years of experience in Japanese sword arts, including *Nakamura Ryu Battodo (IBF 4-dan), ZNKR Kendo (1-kyu), Mugai Ryu Iaihyodo*, and *Shindo Muso Ryu Jodo*.

name: Heavenly Dancing
description_book: Learn two 16th-century Italian dances, with titles about celestial objects: *Ardente Sole* and *Fulgente Stella*. All levels dancers welcome.
description_web: Come learn two dances by Caroso, with titles about celestial objects: *Ardente Sole* (Burning Sun) and *Fulgente Stella* (Shining Star). Dancers of all levels welcome.

name: Siege Inspections
description_book: Inspection time for siege weapons to be used during battles.

name: Aethelmearc Brewers Guild Meet and Greet
description_book: A gathering of the Aethelmearc brewers guild, open to all.
description_web: A gathering of the Aethelmearc brewers guild, open to all. Bring samples to share, projects to discuss or just show up to socialize.

name: First Aid or CPR Challenges
description_book: Individuals can challenge to recertify by taking the written and physical tests. These will be ASHI challenges, unless other instructors can be found.
description_web: Individuals can challenge to recertify by taking the written and physical tests. If the challenge is unsuccessful, the recommendation is for the full class. These will be ASHI challenges, unless other instructors can be found. Individual challenges take approximately 1 hour.

name: A Conspiracy of Choreographers
description_book: What do our dances say about us? Sion proposes a project to collect choreographies and document our dance history over the SCA’s 50 years.
description_web: Dance is a reflection of the society that creates it. But what do our dances say about us? Uncle Sion would love to meet with people interested in collecting choreographies and documenting the history of dances created by SCAdians for SCAdians over our 50-year history.

name: Iron *Commedia*: World Premiere
description_book: Actors from your favorite improvisational *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes craft, cast, perform, & premiere a brand-new play in just one afternoon!
description_web: Earlier this same day, a group of foolish players came together to craft, cast, and create a brand new sixteenth-century *Commedia dell'Arte* play to premiere before your very eyes! Sorry, we can't give you a plot synopsis but we only just built the plot a few hours before the performance! Come see the zany foolishness in extremely live theatre! Note: Possibly some material inappropriate for younger children but it's unknown until the play is created at the workshop earlier that day.

name: Pennsic Readers' Theater Youth Performance
description_book: A staged reading of ʺThe Tale of Righteous Robin Hoodʺ by fellow Scadian, Master John Inchingham the Fool.
description_web: A staged reading of ʺThe Tale of Righteous Robin Hoodʺ by the youth of Readers' Theater. This script is written by a fellow Scadian, Master John Inchingham the Fool. A staged reading means that the actors will be performing the play with the script in hand.

name: Wagon Homes
description_book: Period carts and wagons, what adaptations work to make it a Pennsic camping/storage wagon. Includes some of my available resources.
description_web: A discussion of period carts and wagons, what adaptations work to make it a Pennsic camping/storage wagon. Includes some of my available resources. Also, why these are *not* necessarily 'Gypsy' wagons. There are many different uses, from kitchens or showers to sleeping to 'gracious living'. Also, various building materials that work or don't work, etc. A look at my wagons and some of my neighbors after the class, and a map of others who are willing to let you look.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children at Runestone Hill.
description_web: 7pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend, must have adult escort.

name: Introduction to Runes
description_book: Introduction to the *Futharc* and *Futhorc* runes for use in divination and magic (and *RúnValdr* q.v.) with resources for further study.
description_web: Runes are a system of writing that is now best known as a tool for divination, but has been more, from basic communication to magickal practice. This workshop will give an overview of what the runes have been and can be, and give you direction on how to proceed in your studies.

name: Pennsic Readers' Theater
description_book: Pennsic Readers' Theater presents *Strategos Arestes* ("Soldier of Honor").
description_web: Staged reading of a new play, *Strategos Arestes* ("Soldier of Honor") by Tarmach ben Yehuda al-Khazari.

name: Pennsic Readers' Theater: Meet the Author and Cast
description_book: Meet the author and cast of the Pennsic Readers' Theater play, *Strategos Arestes* ("Soldier of Honor"), by Tarmach ben Yehuda al-Khazari.
description_web: Meet the author and cast of the Pennsic Readers' Theater play, *Strategos Arestes* ("Soldier of Honor"), by Tarmach ben Yehuda al-Khazari.

name: Period Jewelry: A Slide Show
description_book: Slides of jewels from museums, ranging from migration period through Renaissance.
description_web: Slides of jewels from museums, ranging from migration period through Renaissance.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Youth Combat morning sessions, 8-10:30 AM.  Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.
description_web: Youth Combat morning sessions, 8-10:30 AM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: St. Sebastian's Archery Shoot IV
description_book: This is the St. Sebastian's Archery Shoot IV hosted by Atlantia.
description_web: A full day of Atlantian-style archery with 13 novelty stations to test your prowess with the bow. Come on out and have some fun and take a chance to win some fabulous prizes.

name: Confectionery Day
description_book: Working with period sugar paste and other confections. Demonstration, hands-on materials for sugar play for adults and children. Age 6 and up welcome.
description_web: A day of confectionery delights, working with period sugar paste and other confections.Taught by Baroness Alesone Gray of Cranleigh. Demonstration, hands-on materials for sugar play. For adults and children age 6 and up.

name: Metalsmith Day
description_book: Small metals, jewelry, wire work, hard soldering, gemstone setting and more. Bring your tools, some metal and have some fun in the company of others.
description_web: This is the place for small metals and jewelry work, wire work, fabrication with nonferrous metals, hard soldering, gemstone setting and more. Bring your tools, some metal and have some fun in the company of others working with similar materials.

name: Where to Find the Fun, Once It Has Been Lost
description_book: Have you lost "the fun"? Changing how you identify yourself is difficult. Come join in a discussion on ways to find the fun again.
description_web: There are a great many ways in which you can lose "the fun". You may or may not have had any control over its leaving. Times change, people change. With those changes so can "fun" change. Come join me in a discussion on ways to find the fun again.

name: Roman Chain (Loop-in-Loop)
description_book: Learn to transform fine silver wire into a beautiful, history-rich chain.
description_web: Participants will learn how to fuse fine silver wire, shape it, and link it to form a chain found throughout antiquity. Class is limited to 10 hands-on participants. Time may allow for others to try it but there are no promises. Auditors welcome.

name: Running or Winning Siege Cooking Contests
description_book: How to run or enter and win "siege cooking" contests. We cover from picking the foods to hand out, to adding theater to your entry.
description_web: "Siege cooking" contests pit contestants, provided with identical raw ingredients, against each other or a pre-announced standard. A popular feature of weekend events, such contests can spice up a household dinner or provide the entire feast. The instructor has run the Maison Rive siege cooking contest at Pennsic for more than ten years now; learn what worked and what didn't from both sides of the judging table.
fee_itemization: Multipage handout available, plus some sample ingredients to try

name: The Varangian Guard
description_book: A short history of the of the men from the North who found their way into Byzantine service.
description_web: Men from the North who found their way into Byzantine service, the Varangian Guard, were known for their loyalty to the throne of the Eastern Roman Empire, as well as their prowess on the field of battle, and their wonderful reputation of being "The Emperor's Wine Bags." Come enjoy a short history of these men, and take in the exciting tales of Bolli Bollason and Harald Hardrada from the Sagas.

name: Intermediate Bobbin Lace
description_book: Learn patterns from *Le Pompe* with new techniques. Bring 8 pairs of bobbins wound with Gutermann silk or an equivalent thread.
description_web: Learn patterns from *Le Pompe* with new techniques (picots, sewings, windmill crossings). Bring 8 pairs of bobbins wound with Gutermann silk or an equivalent thread.

name: Intro to Free Embroidery
description_book: Hands on kit class - learn to sew outlines, filling techniques and decorative stitches. No experience whatsoever required!
description_web: This is an introduction to decorative embroidery done in the "free embroidery style" (which means not counted work). Each student will get a piece of fabric with a design printed on it, floss, a needle and a hoop. If you have scissors or your own hoop (4-6"), please bring them. If you need reading glasses, please also bring those. Stitches covered include: back stitch, chain stitch, reverse chain, split stitch, satin stitch, fly stitch, lazy daisy and if we are feeling adventurous - french knots.  No experience whatsoever required!
fee_itemization: Kit includes: fabric, floss, needle, and wooden hoop.

name: Making The SCA Work On Your Resumé
description_book: Translate your SCA volunteer experience into mundane resumé content.
description_web: We will go over SCA terms and translate them into mundane job titles, and learn how to use SCA experience to address gaps in employment. The instructor is a senior recruiter, resumé consultant, and regular contributor to the Seattle Times NWJobs.

name: ASHI Basic First Aid
description_book: Created to help students develop basic first aid knowledge, skills, and the confidence to respond.
description_web: Basic First Aid was created to help students develop basic first aid knowledge, skills, and the confidence to respond. The program is an excellent choice for both the community and workplace setting, and is consistent with recommendations of the 2010 National First Aid Science Advisory Board and OSHA’s best practices for first aid training programs in the workplace. Class length: 5 hours
fee_itemization: Separate fee for card or course materials.

name: Fundamentals of Giganti
description_book: Nicoletto Giganti lays out an efficient system for success in the personal duel. Learn about it and how to apply it. Bring sword, gorget, and mask.
description_web: Nicoletto Giganti, in his two books, lays out a highly efficient system for success in the personal duel. We'll discuss and practice his application of measure, tempo, and line to improve your fight. Bring your sword, gorget, and mask.

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.
description_web: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.

name: Anglo-Saxon Pottery
description_book: What sort of pottery would your Anglo-Saxon persona have used depending on from where and when you came, and how it was used.
description_web: From hand-built, unglazed funeral urns in the migration period, to wheel-thrown and earliest glazed pieces, we'll cover what sort of pottery Anglo-Saxons have used in what centuries and which regions of England, plus how it was used from table to storage.

name: Battle of La Rochelle
description_book: The defenders of La Rochelle **will** die! The only question is, **when**? Join us at the Fort to find out. Heavy rapier and rubber band gun melée.
description_web: The defenders of La Rochelle **will** die! The only question is, **when**? Join us at the Fort to find out. Heavy rapier and rubber band gun melée. Attackers will have unlimited resurrections, defenders will have limited resurrections. RBG cannon are welcome. No archery please. Pennsic standard rules for rapier apply. Don't have a heavy rapier? Bring a dagger or two. Bring a friend or 20. The more the merrier. Don't like to fight melée? Come and get close to the action and help marshal the battle. Please muster **at the Fort**  half an hour before the start time, especially if you want to fight along with a particular group. Time permitting, we will let the holders of all the assembled kingdoms' and principalities' highest award for rapier, and kingdom and principality rapier champions see how long they can hold out against the Known World! Always a fan favorite.

name: Scribal Wordsmithing 101
description_book: Learn the basic wording structure for scrolls across several Kingdoms. No experience necessary.
description_web: You may not be a Bard but that shouldn't stop you from taking part in one of the most rewarding things the SCA.... Being a scribe! We always need words for our scrolls. We'll introduce you to the basic formula for wording and discuss ways to flourish it and make it your own.

name: Pennsic Food Lab
description_book: Primitive and medieval cooking space will be made available while open discussion, demonstrations and classes will be taught on applied archaeology.
description_web: Primitive and medieval cooking space will be made available while open discussion, demonstrations and classes will be taught on applied archaeology relating to food and its production. Medieval cooking techniques, technology and methodology will be showcased in this open forum. Up-to-date times and topics will be posted outside of AEthelmearc Royal.
fee_itemization: Handout fees may vary. A requested donation tin will be available to help defray the cost of equipment and materials.

name: Eight Essential Knots for the SCA Camper
description_book: Hands-on class on how to tie eight basic and important knots that can make your camping life easier and safer.
description_web: Hands-on class on how to tie eight basic and important knots that can make your camping life easier and safer.

name: Medieval Pinwheels
description_book: Based on illuminations, pinwheels were a common toy of the 15th and 16th centuries. We will examine the various styles of pinwheels and make one.
description_web: Based on illuminations, pinwheels were a common toy of the 15th and 16th centuries. We will examine the various styles of pinwheels and make one to take home. Fun for adults and children. Children should be accompanied based on their tool-using skills.

name: Beginning Tatting, Part 2
description_book: Tatting is a type of lacemaking. Supplies can be found at craft stores. Learn a craft that fits in a Ziplock bag. Do it the car or at court!
fee_itemization: I provide a prewound shuttle, a handout with directions & projects.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magick.
description_web: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.

name: Natural Hair Dye: Henna and Beyond
description_book: Learn how to use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever.
description_web: Learn how to use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever. We'll focus on henna but explore other herbs to color and protect hair naturally without dangerous chemicals. Some supplies will be available at the class.

name: All Ages Revel
description_book: For those who like to dance, but can't stay up late enough to attend the evening revels! Featuring dances from the Youth Track, which will be taught.
description_web: For those who like to dance, but can't stay up late enough to attend the evening revels! Featuring dances from the Youth Track, which will be taught. We'll have period snacks and live music!

name: Game of the Goose
description_book: Period game in the style of Chutes and Ladders. We will review the rules and then play through a game, dice willing.
description_web: Period game in the style of Chutes and Ladders. The game is purely deterministic dice-based so it is suitable for children but for adults is often played with stakes to make repeated play more interesting. We will review the rules and then play through a game, dice willing.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: Armor Extrication
description_book: Learn how to remove adult and youth armor without injuring yourself, the fighter, or the armor; when to use splinting/support.
description_web: Learn how to remove armor without injuring yourself, the fighter, or the armor and when to use it (splinting/support). This class will cover the assorted types of armor used in all adult and youth SCA martial activities. While the class is directed towards first aid providers, it is useful knowledge for anyone who may be assisting armored individuals. The logic presented here can also be applied to complex garb. This class will be part classroom and part walking tour of the combat areas. Volunteers will provide you the opportunity get hands-on practice during the class.

name: KW Choir: Known World Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: Join the Known World Choir and prepare a concert of *a capella* choral music! Enthusiastic amateurs-expert singers are all welcome!
description_web: Join the Pennsic Known World Choir! Enthusiastic amateurs-expert singers are all welcome! Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on the final Thursday of War week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is extremely helpful, but not required if you are willing to put in the effort to learn the music in advance. Sheet music and part-learning tracks are available online now at the KWChoir Yahoo group: https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/KWChoir/info.
fee_itemization: Limited packets of sheet music available for $3.00. Otherwise, download pre-Pennsic or you may print at Mystic Mail

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a trim strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a trim strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class.We have three wonderful, new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Be Sinister: Left-handed Tourney Turns 5!
description_book: Once again, the field is open for left-handed fighting. The tourney will be a round-robin, left-handed sword and shield only.
description_web: Once again, the field is open for left-handed fighting. All are welcome, but the tourney will be left-handed sword and shield only. The format will be a round-robin style, providing plenty of fighting.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: The basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. BYO drum.
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. BYO Drum.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*
Day 4- *Kashlimah* and other strange stuff

name: History of Gunpowder and Gunpowder Weapons
description_book: The instructor will document the origins and history of gunpowder and gunpowder weapons from their earliest use to ca. 1600 CE.

name: Intermediate Elizabethan Polychrome Embroidery
description_book: Learn detached buttonhole, heavy chain, Ceylon and 8-legged spider stitches to create a Tudor Rose. Basic embroidery experience required.
description_web: This session assumes knowledge of the basic embroidery stitches and handling of silk and metal threads learned in the Introduction class. We will create another Tudor rose using the following intermediate stitches: detached buttonhole in silk, heavy chain using metal, Ceylon in silk and gilt silk twist, and the 8-legged spider using metal thread. The class comes with a printed handout and kit to practice stitches. Please bring your own embroidery hoop and scissors if you have them. Loaners are available if not.
fee_itemization: $1 for handout only or $6 for handout and kit limited to 12 kits.

name: Why Poets Should Use the English Style
description_book: Learn why the poetry of English elegies and epics is superior for composition in our common tongue, and learn its elements and techniques.
description_web: Learn why the poetry of English elegies and epics is superior for composition in our common tongue, and works better for poetry in the common tongue than the techniques of the Irish, Norse, Romans, and Greeks. We will learn the elements and techniques of the English elegies and epics, and possibly speak of the saints' lives and riddles as well. [Old English / Anglo-Saxon]

name: Blockprinting on Fabric and Paper
description_book: European-style blockprinting on fabric and paper. This hands-on class will include period and modern methods for block carving and printing.
description_web: European-style blockprinting on fabric and paper using wood blocks. Printed fabric was used for clothing, wall hangings, tablecloths, etc. This hands-on class will focus on historical techniques and include block carving and printing.

name: Gathering of the Louds
description_book: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Loud Renaissance instruments with a different focus each day: *intradas*, *chansons*, polychoral work
description_web: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Players of loud Renaissance instruments gather just for fun to play different styles of music at each session such as *intradas* and other instrumental processionals, *chansons*, and polychoral music. Not sure what these instruments are? Come listen or try one. Instruments will be available to share. Bring a chair, music stand and clothespins.

name: Kamikaze Battle
description_book: Three-hour unlimited resurrection battle. No war points, no prizes, just fighting.

name: Beginners' *Atlatl* Throwing (Morning)
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.
description_web: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.

name: Accessories through the Ages
description_book: Want to look more medieval? Overview class to help match your shoes, belts, headwear, and more to your Norse, Norman, and 14th/15th-century persona.
description_web: Want to look more medieval? This class will be an overview of the accessories used by our Norse, Norman, and 14th/15th-century counterparts and will help you identify the types of accessories that most closely match the clothing styles you are wearing, based on extant pieces and manuscript images, as well as provide examples of modern recreations of these pieces available from modern vendors.

name: Intermediate Heraldic Research Roundtable
description_book: Take your heraldic research to the next level. Or come to share your favorite sources and tricks. Intended for heralds of all levels.
description_web: Where do you go when the usual sources just don't have what you need? Have skills you'd like to pass on to newer heralds? Come share your favorite sources and research tips in a roundtable format. Intended for heralds of all experience levels. Handout provided.

name: Counted German White Work Embroidery
description_book: A hands-on class utilizing counted white work fill stitches to create a small take-home project.

name: *Eura* Mitten Needle-Binding Stitch
description_book: The *Eura* mitten is Viking age, from a Finnish burial.Come and learn a new stitch. All levels are welcome! Free handout.
description_web: The *Eura* mitten is Viking age, from a Finnish burial.Come and learn a new stitch. All levels are welcome! Yarn and needles will be available, if you want to keep the needles afterwards, it is $5. Free handout.
fee_itemization: If you want to keep the needle, it is $5

name: Everyday Elizabethan for the Middling Sort
description_book: What did working and middle class people wear in Elizabethan England? Learn the  building blocks of a comfortable, everyday outfit for men or women.
description_web: What did working and middle class people wear in Elizabethan England? What layers, what fibers, what fabrics? Learn what goes into a comfortable, everyday outfit. Look at different possibilities and get ideas for designing your own mid- to late-16th-century wardrobe. For men and women. The focus is on English ensembles, but other western European sources will be used also.

name: Bidding the Bedes: Introduction to Paternosters
description_book: The history and development of western European Christian prayer beads as well as information on making your own replica.
description_web: In the 13th-16th centuries in western Europe, prayer beads were a ubiquitous accessory. This class discusses the history and development of the paternoster, as well as information on making your own replica. Kits will be available to make a glass or bone paternoster.
fee_itemization: Beads, silk thread, needle, terminal pendant, bead tip

name: Boreal Master Symposium
description_book: Presentation of papers and discussions of the totally unknown Norse poet called the Boreal Master.
description_web: Presentation of papers and discussions of the totally unknown Norse poet called the Boreal Master.

name: Hand and Foot Massage for Lovers and Others
description_book: Be the most popular gentle in camp! Learn simple techniques to relax friends and loved ones. Wear comfortable clothes and bring a mat to lie on.
description_web: Be the most popular gentle in camp! Learn simple techniques to relax friends and loved ones. Pennsic is hard on the body, particularly the feet. This is the perfect opportunity to hone your innate massage skills. Bring a partner, but If you don't have one, you will be paired up with a fellow classmate. Wear comfortable clothing and easy-to-remove footwear. Also, bring a towel or mat to lie on the floor.

name: Everyone’s a Chatelain!
description_book: We want to help you learn how to be an ambassador for our organization and will discuss ways members of the populace can make a good first impression.
description_web: The Office of the Chatelain needs you! Everyone in the Society has the opportunity to make a good first impression on potential members. It really does go beyond being friendly and we want to help you learn how to be an ambassador for our organization. In this class we will talk about ways members of the populace can make that good first impression. How to approach people and make them feel welcome. What to say, what not to say, and when to get an officer to help you out.

name: Oh Yeah? My Dad Can Beat Up Your Dad! Tourney
description_book: A tournament for dads inspired by their child. There is no restriction on the age of the child and no restrictions in terms of rank or weapons form.
description_web:
This is a tournament for dads inspired by their child(ren) to earn renown upon the field. This will be a Round Robin Tournament, but if many gentles show up then it will be a double elimination format.
Requirements: All dads (combatants) must be signed in at the list table by their child to participate. A change for Pennsic XLIII is that there is no restriction on the age of the child to sign in their dad. Children do not need to remain for the tournament but it is encouraged. This tournament is open to all dads who wish to participate. There are no restrictions in terms of rank (Kings and Princes may fight), weapons form or appearance.
At least two prizes will be given: overall winner and best presentation. This can mean more than just armour; it can include how your entourage presents themselves, etc. It is how you impress the crowd.
The Tourney is being organized by Baron Richard Larmer. If you have any questions, please seek him out in the De Taahe encampment in W02.  Before Land grab weekend His Excellency can be reached at alowry2002@yahoo.com.

name: Longways for as Many... Whut?
description_book: First, we'll reconstruct Playford's actual Trenchmore, then we'll dance the *sciolta* of *Chiaranzana* - twins separated at birth? You be the judge.
description_web: First, we'll reconstruct Playford's actual *Trenchmore*, then we'll dance the *sciolta* of *Chiaranzana* -- twins separated at birth? You be the judge.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Folk Tunes of the Elizabethan Era
description_book: Learn to sing some broadside ballads and tunes collected by Thomas Ravenscroft. Then join us to sing around the lake, 9 pm, Sunday, August 3rd!
description_web: Learn to sing some Elizabethan music, including various broadside ballads and tunes collected by Thomas Ravenscroft, the first collector of folk music. After class, join us to sing our way around the lake at 9 pm on Sunday, August 3rd!

name: Youth Rapier Fencing Practice
description_book: Youth rapier practice, ages 6 to 17. Come out and fence.
description_web: Youth rapier fencing practice, ages 6 to 17. Come out and fence.

name: Greybeard Heavy Weapons Tourney
description_book: A tourney for heavy weapons fighters of either gender who are 50 years or more old.
description_web: A tourney for heavy weapons fighters of either gender who are 50 years or more old. The tourney shall either be a double elimination or a round robin depending on how many fighters take the field for this tourney that day. Beards grey or otherwise are optional (wink)!

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web:
Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater Wednesday 8/6 6-7 pm.
You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Afternoon Art: All Things Scribal
description_book: An afternoon of scribal arts sponsored by the Carolingian Calligraphers Guild. Calligraphy, illumination, wordsmithing, & more. For any ability level.
description_web: An afternoon of scribal arts sponsored by the Carolingian Calligraphers Guild. Calligraphy, illumination, wordsmithing, and more. This program is for any level of ability, with hands-on participation and welcoming. Come join us.

name: Intro to Egyptian-Style Group Improvisation
description_book: Learn Tribal Odyssey: Egyptian-based improvisational tribal-style with *beledi*-style combinations.
description_web: Rajni is a Certified Level 1 Tribal Odyssey dance leader, a group improvisational style developed by Kawakib of Fredericksburg, VA. In the words of Kawakib: “Tribal Odyssey uses natural posture and both sides of the body in combinations based primarily on Egyptian *beledi*-style movement. It's versatile enough to adapt to any size group.” Class will repeat to allow for several days of practice with a group, and will incorporate recorded Middle Eastern drumming as well as live music/ drumming as available. Learn moves that you and your dance friends can use at Pennsic haflas this year!

name: *Saz* Workshop
description_book: Workshop for beginner and experienced *saz* players.
description_web: Basic techniques and melodies for beginners. Traditional long-neck and short-neck playing techniques. Experienced *saz* players are encouraged to share insights, techniques, and more complex melodies.

name: How to Draw Manuscript Flora
description_book: If you passed kindergarten art class, you can draw a 14th-century French scroll.
description_web: If you passed kindergarten art class, you can draw a 14th-century French scroll. This class will break down the elements and have you leaving confident and ready to illuminate.

name: A Tudor Boy's Wardrobe
description_book: In 1584 Thomas Hariot sailed to the New World. He took a year's worth of clothing. Have you ever wondered what that looked like or was packed in?
description_web: In 1584 Thomas Hariot (also Harriott, Heriot) sailed to the New World to map the east coast of Virginia. He took a year's worth of supplies and clothing. Have you ever wanted to know how much clothing was needed or what to pack your wardrobe in? Then this is the class for you. Time permitting, we will discuss a wonderful new invention called pockets.
fee_itemization: several page handout with a bibliography

name: Powering Medical Devices at Pennsic
description_book: How to power your CPAP machine or other medical device in the middle of camp at Pennsic without an extension cord.

name: Mammen Needlebinding Stitch
description_book: Another Viking Age needle-binding stitch to add to the collection. Needle-binders of any level welcome. Free handout.
description_web: Another Viking Age needle-binding stitch to add to the collection. Needle-binders of any level welcome. Free handout. Yarn and needles will be available for class, but please feel free to bring your own. Needles are also available for purchase.
fee_itemization: If you want to keep the needle, it is $5.

name: Tactical Feast Planning
description_book: How to organize, plan and manage a feast in the SCA.
description_web: No one organizes a feast intending to disappoint those attending, but we have all been to some unfortunate examples of what can happen. My intent with this course to discuss some of the organizational principles and ideas that can be applied to any food service, in any setting, to minimize the chaos and problems which occur. I will not be addressing authenticity, period recipes or precise cooking methods; except as they relate to managing your kitchen.

name: Viking Clothing Embelishment
description_book: Creative and inexpensive ways to embellish your Viking clothing using wool, linen and silk without costing a fortune. Covers male/female clothing.
description_web: Creative and inexpensive ways to embellish your Viking clothing using wool, linen and silk without costing a fortune. Class is focused on adding embellishment to clothing both male and female, but will not cover accessories such as arm rings, brooches, beads, shoes, etc.

name: All About Branles
description_book: For those who have some orientation to Arbeau's branles, we'll be going over as much information about as many branles as we can get to in one class.
description_web: For those who have some orientation to Arbeau's branles, we'll be going over as much information about as many branles as we can get to in one class.

name: *Tafl* Games
description_book: The *Tafl* family of games were played through the Norse lands. The rules are simple and easy to learn, and the game play can be quick or complex.
description_web: The *Tafl* family of games were played through the Norse lands. The rules are simple and easy to learn, and the game play can be quick or complex.

name: KW Choir: Children's Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: The KW Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert.
description_web: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert on Thursday of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon 8/7 in the PAT, details TBA during regular rehearsals.)

name: A Matter of Honor Rapier Tournament
description_book: Show your skills as a duelist. Defeat your opponent in an honorable fight without killing them. Note: This is **not** a wounds-retained tournament.
description_web:
Show your skills as a duelist. Defeat your opponent in an honorable fight without killing them. This tournament will randomly pair fencers. Each pairing will fight until one of the contestants loses use of their primary weapon hand/arm. Each of the fencer's wounds are reported at the end of the bout. When fencers have accumulated 10 wounds, they must retire from the tournament. If you kill your opponent, any wounds you inflicted on the 'deceased' during that bout are not counted, but the 'victor' is marked with 3 wounds.  
Notes:  
   This is NOT a wounds-retained tournament.
   Two-handed weapons are not for dueling.

name: Juggling 201 (Intermediate)
description_book: Intermediate  3-ball juggling. Going beyond the simple cascade. We will touch briefly on 4 and 5 balls as well.
description_web: Intermediate 3-ball juggling. Learn several basic tricks, such as crosses, snatches, and reverse cascade. We may work our way into basic 2-, 4-, and 5-ball juggling as they apply. Juggling balls will be available for use and purchase, ranging from $5-$10.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Writing Between the Lines: Ames Lettering Guide
description_book: Hands-on class for beginning and intermediate calligraphers on using the Ames Lettering Guide to improve your scribal technique and scroll layout.
description_web: Are your miniscules misconstrued? Do your descenders dangle? Do you struggle with getting the words to line up straight across the paper? Are you ready to go beyond light table calligraphy? This is a hands-on class for beginning and intermediate calligraphers on using the Ames Lettering Guide to improve your scribal technique and scroll layout.
fee_itemization: Ames Lettering Guide, hard lead pencil, practice paper

name: When in Rome: The Odd and the Risqué
description_book: The weird little quirks of Rome and some very bizarre facts. There will be some risqué topics (and maybe some pictures too).

name: *Kumihimo*: Braids and Finishing
description_book: This is a beginning *kumihimo* class. Covers making a round braid on a foam disk and several finishing techniques for the ends of the braids.
description_web: This is a beginning *kumihimo* class; we will cover making a round braid on a foam disk and couple of finishing techniques. I will also have a *marudai* in the class for people to try out to get a feel for the difference between braiding on a disk and on a *marudai*.
fee_itemization: Foam disk, weights, and enough floss to make a short braid.

name: Seasons and Cycles of Medieval Life
description_book: Examines the cycles which drove medieval life: the seasons, the agricultural year, the church year, to show the broad outline of medieval life.
description_web: Seasons and Cycles of Medieval Life or "The Rhythm Method", examines the cycles which drove medieval life: the seasons, the agricultural year, the church year, light and dark, to show the broad outline of life in the medieval world.

name: History of Drinking: Common Medieval Drinks
description_book: History of drinks, how they affected society and culture. Includes samples and recipes of common drinks found in the Middle Age and SCA. Over 21 only.
description_web: A look at the history of drinks, especially those in the between 3rd-16th centuries and how they affected society and culture. Class will include samples (and recipes) of the most common drinks found in the Middle Ages (and in the SCA). No instruction on brewing provided. Over 21 only.

name: Livery Collars
description_book: An exploration of this elite accessory, with a focus on earlier examples and historical significance, plus a discussion of how to adapt to SCA use.

name: Beginner Dance: Pavan and Galliard
description_book: All beginning dancers welcome! Learn how to walk (and jump!) with style and rhythm. Then use these skills for improvised dances of the 16th century.
description_web: All beginner dancers welcome! You will learn how to walk (and jump!) with style and rhythm. Then use these skills for improvised dances of the 16th century.

name: Sword for Belly Dancers
description_book: Previous belly dance experience (1-2 yrs) required. We'll go over basics, some cool tricks, exits & intros. 18+ only, please. Some loaner swords.
description_web: Want to be able to scythe down your enemies effortlessly? Me, too. However, today I will be teaching you not only the basics of dancing with your sword, but graceful intros and exits. Learn how to integrate your sword while not forgetting to dance, plus doing things that look awesomely difficult that hurt neither your brain nor your body. 18+ only, please. If you are age 14+ **with** several years' belly dance experience and a parent or legal guardian signs your waiver and remains for the duration of class, you will be permitted to attend.

name: KW Choir: Youth Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: The KW Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 18 to learn period vocal music and performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert.
description_web: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 18 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella*. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert on Thursday of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon 8/7 in the PAT, details TBA during regular rehearsals.)

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

name: Peerless Bardic Circle - Runestone Park
description_book: No peers allowed! This is a circle for bardic newbies, apprentices, and anyone to just come to hang out and let your hair down. Bardic Safe Zone!
description_web: No peers allowed! This is a circle for bardic newbies, apprentices, and anyone who doesn't have a Laurel medallion around their neck. Bring your silliest, most cringe-worthy, "I'd never perform this in front of my Peer" pieces, or just come to hang out and let your hair down. This is a bardic safe zone! Hosted by Robert the Perilous and Lucia Elena Braganza.

name: Beginning Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn how to throw, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn how to throw, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Dumbek Diagnosis
description_book: This class is designed to hone your technique whether you are a beginner or advanced. We will diagnose and offer suggestions on how to improve.
description_web: This class is designed to hone your technique. Or, simply learn technique if you are not familiar with the dumbek. Whether you are just beginning or have been playing for years we will diagnose and offer suggestions on how to improve your technique. Each and every student will receive individual attention.

name: A Walkabout of the Poisons at Pennsic
description_book: Wandering throughout Pennsic identifying poisonous plants.

name: How To Perform *Commedia* Characters
description_book: Intro-level class covering basic history of *commedia*, stock characters, opportunities to play short scenes, and how to start up *commedia* at home.
description_web: An introductory-level class covering basic history of *Commedia dell' Arte*, the Italian improvisational comic theater, and its stock characters with opportunities to play short scenes to try them out. We will play some theater improv games, so all students will participate! We'll also cover how to make *commedia* happen in the modern SCA. Instructors are from the Atlantian troupe *i Firenzi*.

name: How to Build a Germanic Lyre
description_book: A description of how to build an early period musical instrument.

name: How to Be a Good Court Herald
description_book: Ideal for the new or want-to-be Court Herald as well as helpful tips for the old veterans, we look at how to train and do the job.
description_web: We look at the definition and role of a Court Herald, some suggested training to refine your abilities, then how to run a successful court as the herald.

name: How to Successfully Pull Off a Feast
description_book: From first concept to follow up. A complete walk through of the do's and don'ts of feeding a large group a successful period feast.

name: From Fiber to Garb
description_book: We will discuss fiber, prep, yarn and cloth-making choices in different periods and locations. Emphasis will be on techniques and fiber sources.
description_web: We will discuss fiber, prep, yarn and cloth-making choices in different periods and locations. Emphasis will be on available techniques and fiber sources. Examples will be provided, but please bring your own to share.

name: Nigel's Fire-Starting Class
description_book: You too can start a fire with flint and steel. We will explore the history of fire and how to start a fire with flint and steel. You will make fire.
description_web:
Formerly titled “How to Start a Fire Like a Moderately Intelligent Saxon”.
Yes, you too can start a fire with flint and steel like a Saxon, Roman, Viking, or any other civilized culture in the Middle Ages. Includes history of fire and the flint-and-steel mechanics of starting a fire. Hands-on class: you will start a fire. You must be at least 14 years old and have your parents' or wife’s permission.

name: Beginner's Intro to Weaving (Weaving for Dummies)
description_book: Learn vocabulary and basic techniques of weaving, as well as how to start weaving on a budget. Focused on absolute beginners; don't be shy!
description_web: Weaving vocabulary and three types of weave (tabby, twill, and card/tabletweaving) will be taught. Some common weaving tools will be available for students to play with. Ideas on how to start weaving at home using inexpensive and upcycled materials will be given.
fee_itemization: Cardboard loom, weaving needles, yarn, tablets and shuttles.

name: Fighting with Flails
description_book: Learn about and try out Paulus Hector Mair's system of personal combat with the peasant flail. Bring C&T gear and knee pads to participate.
description_web:
Paulus Hector Mair's omnibus of German combat includes instructions on the use of the tools of a farmer in combat. Working from our own translation and interpretation, we'll discuss the system he documents for using the grain flail (a six-foot staff with a heavy wooden head attached to it), why such a system even existed, and how you can study it safely.  

Handouts will include the translation and interpretation.  

If you wish to participate in drills, be warned that these are not light-weight weapons. It's a bit like being punched. Bring Society-legal C&T gear, plus knee pads, if you wish to participate in drills.

name: Leaves of Laughter: Comic Theatre Workshop
description_book: A participatory workshop introducing late-medieval improvisational Japanese comic theatre. Script short plays for performance later in the week.
description_web: A participatory workshop introducing late-medieval improvisational Japanese comic theatre. Participants will be introduced to stock characters, theatrical devices, and comic theory. We will read several play synopses and script a short play for performance later in the week.

name: Beginner Dance: 15th-Century Italian B
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn fun, simple dances from 15th-century Italy.

name: Board Games
description_book: This class will review board games previously taught and provide opportunities to practice with a knowledgeable instructor's assistance.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.

name: *Bodhran* 101
description_book: Introduction to playing the Irish frame drum. No experience necessary. Please bring your drum.

name: Advanced Thrown Weapons
description_book: Teaches alternate throwing methods with different weapons. Experienced throwers or prior beginner's class preferred. Thrower limit is 25.
description_web: Teaches alternate throwing methods with different weapons. Experienced throwers or prior beginner's class preferred. Thrower limit is 25.

name: Tarl's Little Pole-Arm Tourney
description_book: Ninth annual heavy, pole-arm only, bear-pit tourney.
description_web: Welcome to the 9th annual Tarl's Little Pole-Arm Tourney. This is a heavy tourney, and will follow the Pennsic rules for pole-arm construction. The format will be our traditional two bear-pit sessions, with a half-time show. Winner gets first choice at the prize table, but everybody wins a prize. Whether you are newly authorized or a grizzled veteran, come out and play with all the other fighters that share your passion for this, The One True Weapons Form.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Youth Combat afternoon sessions, 3-5 PM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.
description_web: Youth Combat afternoon sessions, 3-5 PM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.

name: Making Period Glass Beads as a Beginner
description_book: Creating historically accurate glass beads is not as hard as you might think. You can make period beads at any skill level! (Lecture/Discussion)
description_web:
Creating historically accurate glass beads is not as hard as you might think. You can make period beads at any skill level! Resources and strategies will be shared with attendees in this lecture/discussion class to help get you on the path to making beads that you can enter in A&S displays and competitions. We will discuss good starting points and first projects. The instructor will use her knowledge of Anglo-Saxon glass beads as an example, and share research and projects that others are invited to use and make their own. 
This class is appropriate for beginning bead makers and intermediate bead makers who have not done much research into period beads or entered their beads into A&S competitions before. Experienced bead makers are invited to attend to discuss their own first projects and to share additional resources and strategies.

name: Healthy Projection and Professional Presentation
description_book: Discuss breathing, resonance, and acoustics for the active voice herald, story teller, or singer from an operatic perspective. Masterclass style.
description_web: Discussion of breathing, resonance and acoustics for the active voice herald, story teller, or signer from an opera singer's perspective, with a lecture followed by a masterclass-style session with any willing participants.

name: Distiling History: Cordial Making
description_book: 1st hour: History of distillation; 2nd hour: Beginning cordial-making technique and a tasting. **Must** be 21 or over to attend
fee_itemization:
Distillation handout 8 pages;
Cordial-making handout 10 pages.

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang
name: Basic Bookbinding
description_book: Basic binding of books, history, hands-on, practical application. Learn different stitches and page attachment; leave with a small bound book.
description_web: Basic binding of books, a bit of history, hands-on, and practical application. Participants will learn different types of stitching and page attachment, plus covers, and will leave with a small bound book and/or a girdlebook cover.

name: ASHI Bloodborne Pathogens
description_book: Information that will help students understand what blood-borne pathogens are; how risks of exposure can be reduced for themselves and others.
description_web: Bloodborne Pathogens awareness program includes information that will help students understand what bloodborne pathogens are and how risks of exposure can be reduced for themselves and others. The program assists in satisfying the training requirements of the U.S. Department of Labor, OSHA Bloodborne Pathogens Standard (29 CFR 1920.1030). Students will be given the option of taking the test for certification. No fee for class but fee for certification.
fee_itemization: Separate fee for certification card or course materials.

name: Fighting with Sickles
description_book: Learn about and try out Paulus Hector Mair's system of combat with grain sickles. Bring Society-legal C&T gear, plus knee pads, to participate.
description_web:
Paulus Hector Mair's omnibus of German combat includes instructions on the use of the tools of a farmer in combat. Working from our own translation and interpretation, we'll discuss the system he documents for using the sickle, why such a system even existed, and how you can study it safely.  

Handouts will include the translation and interpretation.  

Bring Society-legal C&T gear, plus knee pads.

name: Middle Eastern Music and Dance
description_book: A time for people of all skill levels to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. All instruments are welcome, and loaner drums are available!
description_web: A time for people interested in Middle Eastern music and dance to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. We will be providing instruction appropriate to the interest of the attendees, from beginning Middle Eastern drum and belly dance to teaching songs in which everyone can participate. All skill levels and instruments are welcome, and drums are available for borrowing!

name: Beginning *Bassadanza*
description_book: Learn the basics of this graceful style of dance from 15th-century. Italy. Focus is more on how to dance than on learning a particular dance.

name: Known World Novice Championship
description_book: Fighters from all over the Known World, with 2 years or less experience since their primary authorization, test their skills against each other.

name: Siege Inspections
description_book: Inspection time for siege weapons to be used during battles.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): i Verdi Confusi
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: Fiore/Lichtenauer Longsword Tourney
description_book: Longsword-only heavy tourney devoted to the masters of the two traditions.  Prizes awarded for best technique, best 14th-15th-C. kit, and Victory!

name: Pennsic Archery Champions Practice/Tryouts
description_book: All archers wishing to make the Pennsic Archery Champions Teams should attend these practices.
description_web: All archers wishing to be on the Pennsic Archery Champions Teams should attend these practices. See either the East Kingdom Captain General or the Midrealm Archer General for more details.

name: Telling Stories as Your Persona
description_book: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.
description_web: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.

name: Book Lovers' Tea
description_book: Please bring your favorite book(s) to discuss. Books with medieval themes and topics are encouraged but not required. Be ready to take notes!
description_web: Please bring your favorite book(s) to discuss. Books with medieval themes and topics are encouraged but not required. Bring paper and pencil to jot down new authors to check out. Iced tea, water and treats will be provided.

name: *Kenjutsu*: The Art of Japanese Swordsmanship
description_book: Dojo-style class, covering basics of Japanese sword. Japanese practice sword or equivalent (wood or metal) required. Limited loaners available.
description_web:
A traditional-style class on Japanese *kenjutsu*, drawn from multiple sources, including modern and traditional arts. The class will be arranged to emphasize techniques that are known to have been used pre-1600. Emphasis will be on physical repetition more than scholarly discussion. The latter will be available after class, informally, as requested.
About the instructor: I have over 15 years of experience in Japanese sword arts, including *Nakamura Ryu Battodo (IBF 4-dan), ZNKR Kendo (1-kyu), Mugai Ryu Iaihyodo*, and *Shindo Muso Ryu Jodo*.

name: Thrown Weapons Marshals' Opening Meeting
description_book: Open to all TW marshals and MiTs. We'll discuss rules and procedures for this year.
description_web: Open to all TW marshals and MiTs. We'll discuss rules and procedures for this year.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP Read-Through Cast and Crew
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: "Paisley Is Not Period": Ottoman Textile Motifs
description_book: A survey of Ottoman textile motifs: botanical and cultural significance of designs and how to make wiser fabric choices for recreating Ottoman garb.
description_web: A survey of Ottoman textile motifs: botanical and cultural significance of designs and how to make wiser fabric choices for recreating Ottoman garb. Twenty-page handout will be available while they last; information will also be made available online.

name: Anglo-Saxon Magick
description_book: Covers the spells, chants, amulets, runes, and other techniques used by Anglo-Saxons as they changed over the six centuries of AS England.
description_web: The Anglo-Saxons used spells, chants, amulets, runes, and other sorts of magickal techniques well after they were nominally converted to Christianity. This workshop gives an overview of the material that has survived, as what was acceptable changed from year to year and place to place in the first millennium as well as in the second.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children at Runestone Hill.
description_web: 7pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend, must have adult escort.

name: Open Stage Shakespeare Night
description_book: In honor of the Bard's 450th birthday, Pennsic Performing Arts is holding open audience presentations from Shakespeare's works!
description_web: Pennsic Performing Arts bids a most Happy Birthday to the Bard himself with Open Stage Shakespeare night! Bring a favorite Shakespeare sonnet or two, monologue under 5 minutes, or short scene (under 10 min.) to perform. Sign in at the light table in the back of the PA Tent the night of the show. Come bid a happy 450th birthday to The Bard!

name: Night Tournament
description_book: Cut glow sticks with axes. Age 18 and over only.
description_web: Cut glow sticks with axes. Age 18 and over only.

name: i Verdi Confusi
description_book: i Verdi Confusi: Players' Patchwork Theatre Company returns with hilarious antics of *Commedia all'Improvviso*! Of Course! It All Makes Sense Now!
description_web: Players' Patchwork Theatre Company returns with hilarious antics of *Commedia all'Improvviso*! Of Course! It All Makes Sense Now! Note: *Show Contains Adult-Themed Content*.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Youth Combat morning sessions, 8-10:30 AM.  Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.
description_web: Youth Combat morning sessions, 8-10:30 AM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: Populace Archery War Point Practice
description_book: Come to the archery range; practice the War Point shoots from 9-11 am during War Week except for Wednesday, August 6.
description_web: All archers can come to the archery range and practice the War Point shoots from 9 am to 11 am during War Week except Wednesday, August 6th, when the range is closed except for Archery Champions.

name: Leatherwork Day
description_book: A chance for leather workers of all skill levels to meet, share knowledge and work on projects as well as for novices to learn and ask questions.
description_web: Leatherwork Day is a place for leather workers of all skill levels to meet and share knowledge and work on projects, as well as a great learning opportunity for novices. Stop by any time to look around, ask questions, or just hang out and work on your own projects. We plan on being there from 9 to 5.

name: Fiber Arts
description_book: Play with the softness of fiber and the beauty of color! See how thread is spun and cloth is woven! Display, demonstration and hands-on experiences.
description_web: Come play with the softness of fiber and the beauty of color! See how thread is spun and cloth is woven! We will have items on display to look at, and people available demonstrate and discuss topics such as fiber preparation, spinning, weaving, natural dyeing, and planning projects. Fiber Arts Day is a time and place for fiber artisans of all skill levels to meet, share knowledge, and work on projects, as well as a great learning opportunity for novices. Stop by anytime to look around, ask questions, or even just hang out and work on your projects. Get a feel for weaving by some hands-on experience with a simple weaving project. See the fabulous colors possible from natural dyes by looking at the dye bottles we have on display. We'll have plenty to show you, and even more ways for you to join in!

name: Lacemaker's Day
description_book: Come share your lace projects, from bobbin lace, *teneriffe, reticello*, etc. Learn about different grounds and try out this interesting craft.

name: Wool Spinning on a Distaff, Hands-On
description_book: Learn the use of the iconic distaff. Distaffs are not just for flax! Learn how to prepare wool to spin and mount it on various styles of distaffs.
description_web: Learn the use of the iconic distaff. Distaffs are not just for flax! To a spinster, a distaff functions as a third hand, holding a large quantity of fiber in orderly condition as she pulls down fiber to fill her spindle. Come and learn about several types of distaff designs and how to mount wool prepared in various ways on them. Great for hot, sticky or windy weather. And if you walk around a lot..... Improve your Pennsic spinning experience. Loaner spindles and distaffs available for students who don't wish to purchase them.

name: Beginning Pewter Casting in Soapstone
description_book: Where do those great pewter site tokens come from? Learn how to do them and much more! A discussion, with examples, of basic soapstone casting.
description_web: Where do those great pewter site tokens come from? Learn how to do them and much more! A discussion, with examples, of basic soapstone casting. I will have some soapstone and pewter available for sale.

name: Beginning Bead-Making
description_book: Interested in learning the art of glass bead-making? Must wear closed-toed shoes, long sleeves and pants/dress.
description_web: Interested in learning the art of glass bead making? Come join us! Instruction will be given the first hour of class with guided practice; the second hour is for you to practice the skills that you have learned. Students will be able to take home any beads they make during class. Must wear closed-toed shoes, long sleeves and pants or dress. Students not wearing the proper attire will be turned away. Sorry, we are dealing with hot glass, people, and it is hot!
fee_itemization: Glass rods, propane, mandrels, hot head torches, bead release.

name: Being Your Persona
description_book: How to maintain the illusion, at an event, that you are a period person interacting with other period people.
description_web: How to maintain the illusion, at an event, that you are a period person interacting with other period people.

name: Russian Men's *Rubashki* and *Porti*
description_book: Overview of men's shirts and trousers: regional overviews, construction tips and garment layout guidelines.

name: The Melon Basket
description_book: The melon basket is pictured in many Psalters and Books of Hours. It's a ribbed basket with God's Eyes.
description_web: Tthe melon basket is pictured in many Psalters and Books of Hours. It's a ribbed basket with God's Eyes.

name: High Magick in the Middle Ages
description_book: An historical overview of the magick practiced by the noble and educated from the Dark Ages until the Renaissance.
description_web: What kind of magick was actually practiced during the Dark and Middle Ages? Most people have a general idea of medieval witches and wizards from fairy tales, and stories of the “burning times” (which was actually after the Renaissance). What types of magick were really used from the fall of Rome through the Renaissance? Sources from the pre-Christian era to the new “natural science”.

name: ASHI Wilderness First Aid, Day 1
description_book: Comprehensive course for those involved in serious wilderness activities. This course is the choice of many wilderness trip leaders and guides.
