description_web: A comprehensive 16-hour course for those who are involved in serious wilderness activities. This course is the choice of many wilderness trip leaders and guides. The program meets the Boy Scouts of America Wilderness First Aid curriculum and guidelines. Class length: 2 days, 9 hours each, Both sessions are required for certification.
fee_itemization: Separate fee for certification card or course materials.

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.
description_web: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.

name: Opening Ceremonies
description_book: The introduction of the host kingdoms and the announcement of their allies.
description_web: The introduction of the host kingdoms and the announcement of their allies.

name: Family Stick Weaving
description_book: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
description_web: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian. Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Fee covers sticks and string; take your work home with you.

name: Reconstructing Archaeological Textiles
description_book: In this 2-part, hands-on class, students weave several reconstructions of textiles from archaeological context. Fee includes use of loom and yarn.
description_web: In this 2-part, hands-on class, students will weave several reconstructions of textiles from archaeological context, illustrating structure, fibers and tools used, and time involved in creating textiles prior to industrialization. Use of loom and all supplies for completing samples included in class fee.
fee_itemization: handouts, supplies for completing woven samples

name: Thrown Weapons Marshal Class
description_book: Proof of paid membership and be at least 18 years of age to begin training. All 3 classes must be attended unless other arrangements are made.
description_web: This class is for anyone who wishes to become a Thrown Weapons Marshal. Class is held in three parts, with a practical session. Participants **must** attend all three parts and have at least 3 hours of range time to complete the course (unless you make other arrangements with the Marshal in Charge). Minimum requirements for participants are membership in the SCA and a minimum age of 18. There are suggested classes also offered later in the week. At the time of the printing of the Pennsic book, the East and Middle are holding classes. There may be other kingdoms holding classes; check at the range for a complete list.

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia*, before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.

name: Vellum
description_book: Learn the secrets of vellum: How to correct errors and how to use vellum. A hands-on class. Limited to 10 hands-on students.
description_web: A hands-on class using vellum. You will come away from the class knowing how to use vellum, how to correct mistakes and where to purchase the vellum for your project. Limited to 10 hands-on students.

name: Ships in the SCA Period: A Chronological Overview
description_book: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.
description_web: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.

name: Advanced Pewter Casting: Making Hollows
description_book: How to create hollows in your soapstone mold: hollow plate buckles, eyelets, barrel hinges, bells.
description_web: How to create hollows in your soapstone mold: hollow plate buckles, eyelets, barrel hinges, bells.

name: Telling Stories as Your Persona
description_book: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.
description_web: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.

name: Persona-Based Arts and Science
description_book: How to easily incorporate your persona and research into your daily SCA activities. Includes beginner persona information and intermediate resources.
description_web: Don't just let your persona stop with your name. Learn how you can easily incorporate aspects of your persona into your A&S projects, garb, and activities at events. Includes beginner persona information and more intermediate resources for the next step.
fee_itemization: Handouts and links for further information

name: *Temari* Ball Bases: Japanese Embroidery Balls
description_book: *Temari* balls are wrapped, stitched, and woven into beautiful, colorful patterns.  We'll cover the history and how to make a ball base.
description_web: *Temari* dates to about 800 CE. They are based on simple geometry (almost no math needed) and wrapped, stitched, or woven to form patterns over the whole ball. This is a great art for the impatient, as each stitch visibly develops the pattern, and you can easily pick it up or put it down at any time. Best of all, they are impressive out of all proportion with how easy they are! The class will cover basic construction of the ball base. Bring your ball to the second class to learn to stitch it.
fee_itemization: materials to create two ball bases for later stitching

name: Children's Dance: More Fun Dances!
description_book: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn dances fun for all ages. (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)
description_web: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn dances fun for all ages (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.) This class will teach some early and some late dances in our period, from 15th-century Italy, to 17th-century English country dances.

name: Chess, Chess, Chess
description_book: A description of three forms of chess that co-existed in Germany.
description_web: *Das Schach- oder König-Spiel* describes three forms of chess that co-existed in Germany. We'll discuss the rules of all three versions, followed by an opportunity to play any of them.

name: Champ. Battles: Allies/Unbelt/Belted/Heroic/Rapier
description_book: The order is Allied Battle, Unbelts, Belts followed by a break for Court(s). Then Heroics, Rapier Champions.
description_web:
Champions Battles: Allies/Unbelted/Belted/Heroic
1000-1130 Allied Battle
1030-1100 Unbelts
1100-1130 Belts
1130-1230 Break for Court business and to allow a rest between Allied & Heroics
1230 - 1400 Heroics
1430 - 1700 Rapier Champs

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: KW Choir: Known World Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: Join the Known World Choir and prepare a concert of *a capella* choral music! Enthusiastic amateurs-expert singers are all welcome!
description_web: Join the Pennsic Known World Choir! Enthusiastic amateurs-expert singers are all welcome! Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on the final Thursday of War week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is extremely helpful, but not required if you are willing to put in the effort to learn the music in advance. Sheet music and part-learning tracks are available online now at the KWChoir Yahoo group: https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/KWChoir/info.
fee_itemization: Limited packets of sheet music available for $3.00. Otherwise, download pre-Pennsic or you may print at Mystic Mail

name: Clay for Blacksmiths
description_book: A discussion for advanced to beginner on using clay to demonstrate hammer blows and what happens between the hammer and anvil
description_web: Discussion for advanced to beginners on using polymer clay to demonstrate hammer blows and what happens between the hammer and anvil. Demonstrations on using this technique for demonstrators and teachers will be provided.

name: Beginners' *Atlatl* Throwing (Morning)
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.
description_web: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class.We have three wonderful, new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: Bellatrix System: Great Weapons
description_book: Bellatrix techniques for great weapons, for use against all weapons and at all ranges, as well as techniques for different physical capabilities.
description_web: Learn the Bellatrix system for the use of great sword and glaive, focusing on the close-in techniques against other great-weapons, and against sword and shield. Modify these techniques for different physical capabilities. It will also cover fighting at medium and long range. The class can be taught armored, unarmored, or with helms and gauntlets. Participation in the exercises will vary, depending. At a minimum, students must have gloves and a great sword, long bastard sword, or pole weapon. Some students should bring swords and shields for use in training.

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: The basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. BYO drum.
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. BYO Drum.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*
Day 4- *Kashlimah* and other strange stuff

name: *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*: A Masterful Model
description_book: An overview of this virtuoso model book of calligraphy, written in 1561-62 by one Renaissance master and illuminated 30 years later by another.
description_web: Calligraphers gush when describing this virtuoso model book of calligraphy, written in 1561-62 by one Renaissance master and illuminated 30 years later by another. Find out why it’s so amazing and what it offers SCA scribes. This year’s Advanced Calligraphy track will offer an in-depth study of several of the scripts in this manuscript.

name: Archery Populace War Point
description_book: Archery Populace War Point
description_web: All archers young and old are encouraged to come and lend their support to their kingdom's efforts, and to display their skill at archery. There will be 3 challenging populace shoots to test skills. Each Kingdom will be competing to earn the 3 War Points for each shoot.

name: Pewter Casting: Tips and Tricks for Your Soapmolds
description_book: Covers tips and tricks for troubleshooting why a soapstone mold won't pour, as well as how to achieve depth and layering in your carving.
description_web: Having trouble getting that pesky mold to pour? This class covers tips and tricks for troubleshooting why a mold won't pour, as well as how to achieve depth and layering in your carving.

name: Glass Twisties and Stringers
description_book: Learn how to make those really cool looking complicated glass stringers in less than 10 minutes!

name: Historic Herbalism: Source Petting Zoo
description_book: Be introduced to and browse a wide selection of historic resources on herbalism and medicine pre-1650.

name: Throw Away Your Wristwatch: Basic and Advanced
description_book: Period methods of timekeeping. First 10 minutes teaches several ways to tell time. Last 40 minutes teaches you how to tell time anywhere, anytime.
description_web: Learn period methods of timekeeping to tell time day and night at Pennsic. Basic course (first 10 minutes) teaches several ways to tell time. Advanced course delves into the science and teaches more ways to tell time so you can tell time anywhere, anytime.

name: Intro to Magic as a Performing Art
description_book: Magic in theory and practice. Three period tricks taught by professional magician. Real methods. Class sworn to secrecy.
description_web: Theory and practice of magic as a performance art, taught by a professional magician. We will cover three period tricks from Scot’s *Discoverie of Witchcraft*, 1584, for close-up, parlor, and stage. The class will be sworn to secrecy and real working methods will be taught.

name: *Piccolo Passi*: Baby Steps into Italian Dance
description_book: Apply familiar ECD steps and terms to take the first baby steps towards mastering the elegant (and fun!) dances of 15th-C. Italy. Beginners welcome!
description_web: Learn how to apply familiar ECD steps and terms to take the first baby steps towards mastering the elegant (and fun!) dances of 15th-century Italy. We will cover period dances *Amoroso*, *Petit Vriens*, *Rostiboli Gioioso*, and *Petit Rose*. Beginners are welcome.

name: Introduction to Spinning *Poi*
description_book: Learn some of the basic *poi* movements and terminology necessary to get you started.
description_web: In this one-hour workshop, you will learn some of the basic *poi* movements and terminology necessary to get you started. *Poi* spinning is a great low-impact workout that will help you to improve your coordination and give your fitness routine some "flare"! After paying for their first class, students are welcome to return to subsequent classes free of charge!
fee_itemization: $20.00 Material Fee covers handout, poi, and refreshments

name: A&S Display
description_book: Sunday, August 3rd - 1:00 - 6:00 pm
description_web:
Sunday, August 3rd
Set up: 11:00am - 1:00pm
A&S Display: 1:00 - 6:00pm
(Take down after 6:00pm)

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. No fee. String provided.

name: Start Thrown Weapons in Your Local Group
description_book: New marshal? Old marshal? Bored marshal? You'll want your local group to support your efforts so you can develop a program. Here's how.
description_web: New marshal? Old marshal? Bored marshal? You'll want your local group to support your efforts so you can develop a program. Here's how.

name: Pennsic Ladies' Championship Tournament
description_book: The Pennsic Ladies' Championship Tournament will be a round-robin to qualify for the Known World Ladies' Championship.
description_web: The Pennsic Ladies' Championship Tournament is the qualifying tournament for the Known World Ladies' Championship to be held later in the week. The winner will be the Pennsic Ladies Champion, but the top 8 will be allowed to compete in the Known World Ladies' Championship held later in the week. The format is round-robin with the top 8 dueling it out in a single elimination format. Prizes will be awarded to first, second and third.

name: Poker Card Tournament
description_book: Bear pit format, loser stays. Fencers leaving the field receive a playing card up to 7. Winner is the fencer with the best 5-card hand.
description_web: This is a bear pit-style format where the loser of the bout stays to fight the next fencer. Fencers stay until they win or have 3 deaths. Double kills count towards the number of deaths. Fencers leaving the field shall receive a playing card and shall keep up to 7 cards. The winner of the Tournament shall be determined by the best poker hand of 5 cards. This format will be run twice to determine 2 winners.

name: 14th-Century Clothing and Accessories
description_book: A look at how clothing styles and accessories changed, 1300-1400, using extant pieces, manuscript images, and sumptuary laws/contemporary commentary
description_web: An overview of changes in clothing shape, fitting, and accessories from 1300 to 1400 in Western Europe using extant pieces, manuscript images, contemporary commentaries as well as sumptuary laws available. Class will also cover the 14th-century accessories including shoes, belts, headwear, purses, and jewelry that any good 14th-century noble would wear.

name: Book Heraldry 100
description_book: An introductory class for book heralds, covering topics such as the organization of the SCA heralds, becoming a herald, and the submission process.
description_web: An introductory class for book heralds, covering administrative matters and general principles, including the organization of the SCA heralds, becoming a herald, the submission process, and related topics.

name: White Work Embroidery
description_book: A brief history, a few stitches, a work in progress. Create a sampler of a few beginning stitches.
description_web: A brief history, a few stitches, a work in progress. Create a sampler of a few beginning stitches.

name: Warrior Ethics in Japanese War Tales
description_book: An introduction to the characteristics and behaviors of admirable (and contemptible) warriors in war tales from the 10th to 14th centuries.

name: Beginning Inkle Weaving
description_book: Learn the basics of Inkle weaving. How to warp an Inkle loom and how to achieve some of the basic patterns. Bring your own loom and 2 colors thread
description_web: Learn the basics of Inkle weaving. How to warp an Inkle loom and some basic patterns such as the chain and the flower patterns. Students should bring their own loom and at least 2 colors of thread, preferably cotton.

name: Long-Armed Cross Stitch: Attractive and Authentic
description_book: More than just a background stitch in Assisi work, it goes faster, and is prettier, than common cross stitch. Versatile and widely used late period!
description_web: More than just a background stitch (as in Assisi work), it goes faster, and is prettier, than common cross stitch. In late period, it was used on a broad variety of household objects, often to beautiful effect. We will do the stitch, then look at photos of widely varied extant examples.

name: Harp Techniques
description_book: Historical information and techniques to improve strength, speed, tone and musicality. Useful for all harpers, beginner to advanced.
description_web: Techniques to improve strength, speed, tone and musicality. Historical information about harps, the men and women who played them, and their music. Useful for all harpers, complete beginner to advanced. Learn how to get more out of your instrument and practice time, as well as practical approaches to performing. This is one of a 3-part course. We will build on information from each class, but students are not required to attend all three. Feel free to contact teacher in advance if you cannot attend first class.
fee_itemization: Exercises for use in class, during Pennsic, and afterward.  Reading music, counting, fingering, etc.

name: Nigel's Fire-Starting Class
description_book: You too can start a fire with flint and steel. We will explore the history of fire and how to start a fire with flint and steel. You will make fire.
description_web:
Formerly titled “How to Start a Fire Like a Moderately Intelligent Saxon”.
Yes, you too can start a fire with flint and steel like a Saxon, Roman, Viking, or any other civilized culture in the Middle Ages. Includes history of fire and the flint-and-steel mechanics of starting a fire. Hands-on class: you will start a fire. You must be at least 14 years old and have your parents' or wife’s permission.

name: Event Finances: Before, During and After
description_book: From budget to gate to the event report: a practical discussion of event finances, based on Chapter 9 of the *Local Exchequer Handbook*.

name: English Country Dance for Six
description_book: Come learn *Black Nag, Upon a Summer's Day*, and *Picking of Sticks.*
description_web: Come learn *Black Nag, Upon a Summer's Day*, and *Picking of Sticks.*

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Folk Tunes of the Elizabethan Era
description_book: Learn to sing some broadside ballads and tunes collected by Thomas Ravenscroft. Then join us to sing around the lake, 9 pm, Sunday, August 3rd!
description_web: Learn to sing some Elizabethan music, including various broadside ballads and tunes collected by Thomas Ravenscroft, the first collector of folk music. After class, join us to sing our way around the lake at 9 pm on Sunday, August 3rd!

name: Rehearsal (Closed): i Sebastiani
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: Youth Rapier Fencing Practice
description_book: Youth rapier practice, ages 6 to 17. Come out and fence.
description_web: Youth rapier fencing practice, ages 6 to 17. Come out and fence.

name: Creating a Thrown Weapons Competition
description_book: Whether you have new throwers or seasoned throwers with an intense hatred of wood targets, learn to cater to your audience.
description_web: Whether you have new throwers or seasoned throwers with an intense hatred of wood targets, learn to cater to your audience.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web:
Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater Wednesday 8/6 6-7 pm.
You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Intro to Egyptian-Style Group Improvisation
description_book: Learn Tribal Odyssey: Egyptian-based improvisational tribal-style with *beledi*-style combinations.
description_web: Rajni is a Certified Level 1 Tribal Odyssey dance leader, a group improvisational style developed by Kawakib of Fredericksburg, VA. In the words of Kawakib: “Tribal Odyssey uses natural posture and both sides of the body in combinations based primarily on Egyptian *beledi*-style movement. It's versatile enough to adapt to any size group.” Class will repeat to allow for several days of practice with a group, and will incorporate recorded Middle Eastern drumming as well as live music/ drumming as available. Learn moves that you and your dance friends can use at Pennsic haflas this year!

name: Intermediate Middle Eastern Drumming: 6/8 and 12
description_book: Add to your rhythm repertoire with rhythms played in 6 and 12. Morrocan & Persian 6/8 and Chaka 12 are covered, with variations. Beginners welcome.

name: The Oxburgh Hangings
description_book: An overview of embroidered wall hangings associated with Mary, Queen of Scots, including the glimpse they offer into Elizabethan history and culture.
description_web: A fascinating and unique set of Elizabethan-era embroidered wall hangings, the Oxburgh Hangings offer a fascinating glimpse into the culture of the time, and into the lives of the two famous women who embroidered them: Mary, Queen of Scots and Bess Hardwick. This class offers an overview of these pieces.

name: London Plague of 1603
description_book: The 1603 plague outbreak in London killed over 35,000 people. Come learn about the history, medicine, and plague doctors of the time.
description_web: The 1603 plague outbreak in London killed over 35,000 people. Recreated medicine of the time will be shown and explained. New documentation on the suit worn by plague doctors will be presented.

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to Gypsy Persona
description_book: Don't know how/where to start with this persona? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a Gypsy persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.

name: *Kosode* Construction
description_book: An essential garment in every *nihonjin* wardrobe! We’ll discuss construction of this Japanese garment, based on a Tokyo National Museum example.
description_web: An essential garment in every *nihonjin* wardrobe! We’ll discuss construction of this Japanese garment, based on a Tokyo National Museum example. The predecessor to the *kimono*, the *kosode* was worn by both men and women throughout most of Japanese history. A visual, step-by-step example of its construction will be presented. Extra time is allotted for consultations. Please bring along your own materials if you would like assistance starting your pattern. If you have questions prior to the class, please contact me at yamamura.kitsune@gmail.com.
fee_itemization: Handout of class outline with garment instructions.

name: *Bushido*: the Japanese Path of Honor
description_book: Discussion of the virtues of *Bushido* and how the warrior's way guided the development of Japanese culture.
description_web: Discussion of the virtues of *Bushido* and how the warrior's way guided the development of Japanese culture.

name: *Gishiki*: Court and Polity in Medieval Japan
description_book: A discussion of court procedure, rank, title, and office. An introduction to Japanese etiquette. Includes a beginner's guide to Japanese governance.
description_web: A discussion of court procedure, rank, title, and office. An introduction to Japanese etiquette. Includes a beginner's guide to Japanese governance.

name: A Playford Scramble: Three Dances to Move You
description_book: Be prepared to ask "Who's my partner, and where are we going?" in this exploration of direction-changing, partner-changing, and progression dances.
description_web: Be prepared to ask "Who's my partner, and where are we going?" in this exploration of direction-changing, partner-changing, and progression dances. Some familiarity with basic English Country dance is helpful but not necessary. *Halfe Hannikin, Maiden Lane*, and *Cuckolds All A Row* will be taught.

name: *Xiang-qi* for Beginners (Chinese Chess)
description_book: A 90-minute class in how to play *Xiang-qi* (Chinese Chess). History, rules, strategy and tactics; enough time left for students to play afterwards.
description_web: A 90-minute class in how to play *Xiang-qi* (Chinese Chess). History, rules, strategy and tactics; enough time left for students to play afterwards.

name: Cooking on Campaign: Using a Clay Oven
description_book: Learn how to use a period clay oven. Students will experiment baking mini pies and taste various other dishes prepare in a clay oven.
description_web: Learn how to use a period clay oven. Students will experiment baking mini pies and taste various other dishes prepared in the clay oven. Students are also welcomed to bring bread dough to bake their own loaf of bread to take.
fee_itemization:
beef $10-$15
veggies $8-$10
dough supplies $10
fruits $8-10
odd and end spices

name: KW Choir: Children's Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: The KW Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert.
description_web: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert on Thursday of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon 8/7 in the PAT, details TBA during regular rehearsals.)

name: Engineering for a Mobile Theater Troupe
description_book: Methods for putting up a mobile stage, including a temporary backdrop curtain, footlights, signboards, and scenario boards.
description_web: So you have a troupe that goes to events and want to present plays but you need to be able to have a stage setup that is transportable and relatively quick to set up and take down. This class is a presentation of how the *commedia* troupe *I Firenzi* handles those things, including an adjustable backdrop curtain, footlights (for playing in the dark), announcement signboards, etc.

name: Family Spool Knitting
description_book: Family-oriented spool knitting. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
description_web: Family-oriented spool knitting. Cord braiding on a spool. Make a basic round cord. Youth welcome with parent or guardian. Fee covers spool and string; take your work home with you.

name: Youth Armored Combat Sword Making
description_book: Make an SCA YC single-handed sword with a PEX core. Parents, please accompany children. Kits available to those 6-17 years old. Limited to 20 kits.
description_web: Make an SCA youth combat single-handed sword with a PEX core. Parents, please accompany children. Kits available to those 6-17 years old. Limited to 20 kits.
fee_itemization:
$10 for Div. 2 &3, $6 for Div. 1
Pipe foam
Core (PEX or Siloflex)
Cap or plug x 2
Strapping tape
Hockey tape
Duct tape
lanyard rope/cord

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: The Bayeux Tapestry
description_book: Construction and history of this embroidered wall hanging from 1066, including hints and tips for making your own tapestry.

name: Heraldic Flag Design
description_book: Learn about the various types of heraldic flags that existed in period, their design and application. Then design your own!
description_web: What does one do with those fantastic animals, interesting designs and brilliant colors needed for a good heraldic design? And where does one apply said design? Before heraldry ever appeared on shield and surcoat, those heraldic designs fluttered over the heads of kings and peasants, like majestic birds, in the form of banners, pennons, standards and gonfalons. Learn about the various types of heraldic flags that existed in period, their design and application. Then design your own!

name: Elizabethan Embroidered Slips
description_book: Popular from the mid-16th to the mid-17th century, slips were embroidered motifs on canvas which were cut out and applied to various backing fabrics.
description_web: Popular from the mid-16th to the mid-17th century, slips were embroidered motifs on canvas which were cut out and applied to various backing fabrics. Many of the surviving examples found today are of floral and plant motifs with many of the images having been copied or inspired by herbals, hence the use of the term 'slips.'
fee_itemization: Kits will include an embroidery hoop, needles, floss, 18-count even-weave fabric with a pre-drawn image, and full-colour handout.

name: Children's Garb Roundtable
description_book: Join a discussion on how to make inexpensive garb for your child as they grow. Share your tips, ideas and questions.
description_web: Join a discussion on how to make inexpensive garb for your child as they grow, that will grow with them. Share your tips, ideas and questions. Bring samples of your favorite go-to garb for your child. The handout will include ideas, websites, pictures that have been gleaned over the years.

name: A Storybook Petting Zoo: Captain Cox's Books
description_book: A bibliography of late-period stories and collections which will be of use to SCA storytellers, described and highlighted by...an SCA storyteller.
description_web: In 1575. Elizabeth visited Kenilworth castle, and the "Magnificent pageants presented before her" were recorded by one Robert Langham / Laneham. In his letter, he describes one player's extensive list of stories, books, songs and other works. The resulting bibliography contains many sources which SCA storytellers can utilize. Stories range from short (jestbook jokes) to epic (tales which frame a series of tales à la "1001 Nights" or "Decameron"), and cover a wide range of styles. Some books will be available for perusal.

name: Marzipan Fruit
description_book: Marzipan was used for centuries to make many pretty and tasty items. This class teaches how to make 2-3 different kinds of fruit from marzipan.
description_web: Marzipan was used for centuries to make many pretty and tasty items. This class teaches how to make 2-3 different kinds of fruit from marzipan. Marzipan, food colors and sample fruit will be provided for a $5 fee. Ages 12 and up.
fee_itemization: Fee covers marzipan, food colors and a container to take home marzipan fruit.

name: Once Upon a Time
description_book: A 40-year member of the SCA tells stories, asks (and answers) questions, and suggests ways to "keep it fresh" or keep the magic in the SCA experience.

name: Bellatrix System: Wraps
description_book: A bio-mechanically safe "wrap", and complementary techniques. Unarmored class appropriate for all levels of proficiency.
description_web: The class teaches the Bellatrix version of the "wrap", which provides powerful wraps from various angles, while maintaining bio-mechanical safety. The class will touch on several techniques that appear to be a wrap until late in the swing. The class is appropriate for authorized fighters at all levels of proficiency. The class is taught unarmored. Students must bring a sword and a shield.

name: Beginner Dance: Absolute Beginner C
description_book: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the Ball!
description_web: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the Ball!

name: Start a Fire Without the Sunday New York Times
description_book: How to make simple fire starters from items you have around your house.

name: Henna Party
description_book: Come and explore the world of henna body art! All materials and instruction are provided. Children welcome with responsible adult.
description_web: Come and explore the world of henna body art! All materials and instruction are provided. Children are welcome when accompanied by a responsible adult.
fee_itemization: Henna powder (approximately 1 kilo), mylar cone applicators, Scotch tape, packing tape, plastic baggies, lemon juice, tea tree essential oil, geranium essential oil, watercolor pencils, paper towels, cotton balls, witch hazel, bamboo skewers

name: KW Choir: Youth Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: The KW Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 18 to learn period vocal music and performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert.
description_web: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 18 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella*. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert on Thursday of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon 8/7 in the PAT, details TBA during regular rehearsals.)

name: PA Afternoon Series: *Commedia* Experience
description_book: Come experience *Commedia dell'Arte*! Meet the characters and the actors behind them and learn to act in comic masked style.
description_web: Come experience *Commedia dell'Arte*! Meet the characters and the actors behind them and learn to act in comic masked style (movement, vocalization, express funny ideas). Experienced actors/directors from several well-known *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes will guide you if you're new, or give you free advice that's definitely worth the price to veteran performers!

name: Beginning Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn how to throw, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn how to throw, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

instructor: Lord archer bear horseman of rockbr
name: Make Your Own Flemish String for Any Bow
description_book: Make a string for your recurve, long bow, horse bow or crossbow using modern B-50 Dacron.
fee_itemization: String material, Serving material, nock material

name: Cartridge Pleating: How and Where
description_book: German Ren and English Tudor skirts; also later period styles. See and touch examples of each stage of the process. Handout w/examples. Beginners ok.

name: *Kumihimo*: Complex Japanese Braids in Period
description_book: Lecture with an overview of period *kumihimo*, including a discussion of the different techniques and how the braids were used.
description_web: This is a lecture class giving an overview of period *kumihimo*, including a discussion of the different construction techniques and how the braids were used.

name: Photographers' Roundtable
description_book: Want to take better SCA photos? Want to talk shop with other photographers? Come hang out for a chat. No topic too big, no camera too small.

name: Beginning Wire Weaving
description_book: Students will learn to make intricate chains in the manner of the Vikings and other cultures, without need for heat or complicated tools.
description_web: This class will teach beginning students to make intricate chains in the manner of the Vikings and other ancient cultures, without the need for heat or complicated tools. With the techniques presented, you will learn to create items like the ones found in Viking burials and treasure hoards across the Nordic countries dating from the 9th century to the late 12th century. Wire chains made in this fashion have also been discovered in the British Isles (875 AD) and in the Roman, Greek and Byzantine civilizations from the 4th century BC to the 1st century AD. Timeless items can be created that are still beautiful and wearable today. If you have needle-nose pliers and wire cutters, please bring them. If you need glasses for close or small work, please bring them. The fee for the class includes the materials needed to complete the leather cord necklace. To view this unique jewelry, please visit www.AncientWire.com/book.htm

name: The Viborg Shirt
description_book: This class will review the cut and construction seams used to recreate the linen shirt found near Viborg Søndersø, Denmark.
description_web: The Viborg shirt is a linen shirt dated to between 1019 and 1050 found near Viborg Søndersø, Denmark. This class will review the cut of the shirt and the seams used in its construction. There will be hand sewing.

name: Bardic Collegium #1: The Secret Handshake
description_book: It can sometimes be difficult finding fellow bards, events and performance opportunities.This is our annual Meet and Greet. Come one, Come all!
description_web: So you're thinking of becoming a bard, or maybe you already are but you just can't seem to get in touch with others of your ilk. It can be difficult finding other bards, mentors, events and performance opportunities around you. This is our annual Meet and Greet. Come one, Come all!

name: Funny Little Cordial
description_book: Properties of humors in brewing. Covers the classification of medieval beverages and how to create a cordial based on a desired humor. Over 21 only.
description_web: A look into the properties of humors in brewing. Medieval food and drinks were chosen and arranged based on their “humors”, a classification system of hot to cold, and moist to dry that was thought to influence one's temperament and health. Class covers the classification of typical medieval beverages such as ales, beers, wines and mead as well as how to create a personalized cordial based on a desired humor. Over 21 only.

name: New to the SCA? A Class on the Basics
description_book: Learn about what essentials you should have for an event, basic customs and protocol, how to get involved, persona and heraldry, as well as much more.
description_web: Are you new to the Society, or have you only gone to a few events? Still confused about what there is to do and what we are about? Come meet the Chatelain for the Kingdom of Atlantia (the officer in charge of welcoming you to the Society) and get a grasp on the basics. Learn about what essentials you should have for an event, basic customs and protocol, how to get involved, persona and heraldry, as well as much more. Come with questions or sit and listen. We promise you will learn a lot!

name: Beginner Dance: Measures B
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn simple middle class dances from Elizabethan England
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach simple middle class dances from Elizabethan England. They are from the Inns of Court in London and are done in a line, some not much more than walking.

name: Introduction to Crocheting
description_book: A beginner's class to introduce basic crocheting skills.
fee_itemization: Ten dollar material fee covers your choice of crochet needle, 2 balls of yarn, refreshments and informational handout

name: Two Unusual Chess Variants
description_book: Knight's chess: a 14th-century game that bestowed unusual power on the knight. Papal chess: a Reformation-era game banned by the Catholic church.
description_web: Knight's chess is a 14th-century version that bestowed unusual power on the knight. Papal chess is a Reformation-era chess that was banned by the Catholic church for centuries. Both derive from the Low Countries and adjoining areas of Germany. Learn to play the games as well as their history.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: Sing We And Chant It - Madrigal and *A Capella Jam
description_book: Meet & greet optional practice session for audience participation, "Sing We and Chant It" Madrigal and *A Capella* Jam, Mon. 8/4 6:00pm in the PAT
description_web:
Meet & greet optional practice session for audience participation "Sing We and Chant It" Madrigal, Part Song, and *A Capella* Jam, Monday 8/4, at 6:30pm in the Performing Arts Tent. All are welcome to come and make joyful music! Music will be available to share, or bring your own! (Material fee optional for a folder of this year's jam music)
Song list available online: https://docs.google.com/document/d/14Erajd1a5RMcDm7YUDN5pweB1qQownE6vQYY-NEG4jA/edit?usp=sharing
fee_itemization: photocopy fee for public domain music handouts

name: Beyond Lucet Basics
description_book: Variations, loops, and monkey wrenches.
description_web: Starts with a basic refresher class for everyone. We then proceed to variations, loops, and monkey wrenches. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. String provided.

name: Beginners' *Atlatl* Throwing (Afternoon)
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.
description_web: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Youth Combat afternoon sessions, 3-5 PM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.
description_web: Youth Combat afternoon sessions, 3-5 PM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.

name: Timbuktu and Beyond!
description_book: Exploring daily life during the Golden Age of medieval West Africa

name: Reading Foreign Language Scroll Texts
description_book: A brief introduction to foreign language diction. We will cover Latin, Italian, German, French, and Middle English in this class.
description_web: A brief introduction to foreign language diction. We will cover Latin, Italian, German, French, and Middle English pronunciations in this class.
fee_itemization: A large hand-out with multiple examples and practice pieces.

name: How to Wrap a Sari
description_book: Discussion of several methods of wearing that new sari.

name: Sex in SCA Period
description_book: Not marriage, not birth, just sex. It's your Western Civ class with the juicy bits left in.
description_web: Not marriage, not birth, just sex. It's your Western Civ class with the juicy bits left in. From the illicit frescos of Pompeii to Aretino's invention of modern pornography. This year I will be adding a section on sex crimes. Handouts are limited, but I will also have CDs of the material for $1.
fee_itemization: Printing fees for 30 pg handouts  including 7 color pages

name: Middle Eastern Music and Dance
description_book: A time for people of all skill levels to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. All instruments are welcome, and loaner drums are available!
description_web: A time for people interested in Middle Eastern music and dance to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. We will be providing instruction appropriate to the interest of the attendees, from beginning Middle Eastern drum and belly dance to teaching songs in which everyone can participate. All skill levels and instruments are welcome, and drums are available for borrowing!

name: Meet-the-Dance-Faculty Social
description_book: All are invited to meet the faculty and staff who make the School of European Dance happen! There will be light refreshments and a group picture.
description_web: Everyone is invited to meet the people who make the Pennsic School of European Dance happen! This event is open for all students and dancers to meet this year's faculty and staff, and is another social event for our faculty and experienced dancers. We encourage all to attend. Light refreshments will be provided and a group picture of staff and teachers will be taken.

name: Gold Leafing: Period to Modern
description_book: Learn application methods for a perfect finish both period and modern. Period fish glue, garlic, glair and modern permacol for paper or parchment.
description_web: Understand gold leaf and its use in illuminations. Class focuses on period fish glue, garlic, glair, plus modern permacol and *miniatum* for paper and parchment. Learn methods for application of glue, and tips for a perfect finish in both period and modern methods. Bring your gilding questions and problems! Students will create a small gilded sample on parchment and paper. All materials included.

name: Advanced Thrown Weapons
description_book: Teaches alternate throwing methods with different weapons. Experienced throwers or prior beginner's class preferred. Thrower limit is 25.
description_web: Teaches alternate throwing methods with different weapons. Experienced throwers or prior beginner's class preferred. Thrower limit is 25.

name: Embellishing 16th-Century Music
description_book: A class on adding ornaments, or extra notes, especially good for dance music.  Bring an instrument.
description_web: Getting bored playing for dancing? Then come learn how to jazz your playing up in a period style! This class is on adding ornaments, or extra notes, and is especially good for dance music, but applies to all 16th century. Helpful handout based on period treatises. Bring an instrument or your voice.

name: Pennsic Archery Champions Practice/Tryouts
description_book: All archers wishing to make the Pennsic Archery Champions Teams should attend these practices.
description_web: All archers wishing to be on the Pennsic Archery Champions Teams should attend these practices. See either the East Kingdom Captain General or the Midrealm Archer General for more details.

name: Target Archery Marshals' Meeting
description_book: All target archery marshals should meet in the marshals' tent on the archery range. Repeat session, Aug. 3, 5 pm for those who missed Thurs. meeting.
description_web: There will a target archery marshals meeting in the marshals' tent on the archery range. There will also be an archery marshals' meeting on Sunday, August 3, at 5 pm, for all those marshals who did not or could not make the meeting on Thursday.

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang
name: Basic Jewelry-Making, or How to Float a Pearl
description_book: Basics on design/recreation of jewelry including closures, spacing, double/triple strands, scalloping, extra adornments, fixing broken items.
description_web: Basics on design or recreation of jewelry including closures, spacing, double/triple strands, achieving scalloping, adding extra adornments, fixing a broken item, making a floating bead necklace, dropping a knot where you want it.
fee_itemization: kit with wire, string, beads, trinkets, closures

name: A Sixth-Century Hopped Mead
description_book: An evidence-based reconstruction of a hopped mead from a 6th-century CE German grave find. Come learn about an early hopped mead!

name: Multiplying Like Rabbits
description_book: Focuses on the many examples of math applied to business practices in Fibonacci's *Liber Abaci*, including the famous rabbit problem.
description_web: In 1202, Leonardo of Pisa, known today as Fibonacci, wrote *Liber Abaci* in an attempt to introduce our modern number system to the merchants of Pisa. He included many examples of ways to apply this new math to business practices of the day, such as commodities trading, evaluating company shares, accounting, minting money, and breeding rabbits. We will look at the kinds of problems he wrote about in order to convince merchants to adopt the new number system.

name: Let’s Write Poetry!
description_book: This class covers some basic period poetry forms and how to choose them. Class will write poems if there is enough time.
description_web: If you want to write period poetry, this class will help you get started. First, we will discuss basic terminology used in describing poetry forms. Then we will cover some basic period forms of poetry such as rhymed couplets, the basic ballad form and sonnets. Next we will discuss the interaction between the subject of the poem and the form chosen. Please bring something to write on and with. There will be time for questions. There will also be a brief handout.

name: *Kenjutsu*: The Art of Japanese Swordsmanship
description_book: Dojo-style class, covering basics of Japanese sword. Japanese practice sword or equivalent (wood or metal) required. Limited loaners available.
description_web:
A traditional-style class on Japanese *kenjutsu*, drawn from multiple sources, including modern and traditional arts. The class will be arranged to emphasize techniques that are known to have been used pre-1600. Emphasis will be on physical repetition more than scholarly discussion. The latter will be available after class, informally, as requested.
About the instructor: I have over 15 years of experience in Japanese sword arts, including *Nakamura Ryu Battodo (IBF 4-dan), ZNKR Kendo (1-kyu), Mugai Ryu Iaihyodo*, and *Shindo Muso Ryu Jodo*.

name: Ball Prep: Beginners' Ball
description_book: Want to dance at Ball on Sunday night, but haven't danced before? This is for you! We'll cover everything: dancing, etiquette, and survival tips.
description_web: Want to dance at the Beginners' Ball on Sunday night, but have no or little idea how? This is the class for you! All dances and steps will be taught, along with etiquette and survival tips.

name: Siege Inspections
description_book: Inspection time for siege weapons to be used during battles.

name: Kumihimo Basics
description_book: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Empire of the Sun Battle
description_book: Japanese tournament and battle.
description_web: Japanese tournament and battle.

name: Inter-Kingdom Brewers Guild Competition
description_book: Brewers and vintners: Have your beverages evaluated by experts from across the Known World. Up to two entries per category. Over 21 only.
description_web: An opportunity for brewers and vintners to have their beverages evaluated by experts from across the Known World. Up to two entries per category (wine/mead, beer, cordials/others) per participant. IKBG masters are asked to help judge. Entrants are responsible for the temperature/condition of their beverage(s) as it may be some time before a particular beverage is judged. Documentation is encouraged. Over 21 only.

name: Interkingdom Brewers Guild Roundtable
description_book: This roundtable is designed to serve as both a place to discuss period beverages as well as hang out for the IKBG. Over 21, please.
description_web: This roundtable is designed to serve as both a place to discuss period beverages as well as hang out till your beverage is called to be judged with the IKBG. It is being held in conjunction with the IKBG. All entrants are asked to wait in this area. Someone will come call you when your entry is ready to be judged. Please bring something to do/drink/discuss until your entry is called. Over 21, please.

name: Latin Smack Talk
description_book: Learn how to insult friends and foes in Latin! Good fun on and off the field! We shall be rowdy!
description_web: Learn how to insult friends and foes in Latin! Good fun on and off the field! We shall be rowdy!

name: Combat of the Thirty
description_book: This is a 30-versus-30 deed of arms inspired by the original Combat of the Thirty between French and English forces that occurred in 1351.
description_web:
This is a 30-versus-30 deed of arms inspired by the original Combat of the Thirty between French and English forces that occurred in 1351. Combat standards are a modified counted-blows scenario that employs rules for capturing opponents and ransoming of captured parties. Participants must be acceptable to the captains of the French and English forces. Armour must be a reasonable attempt at a complete 14th-C harness, and weapons are restricted to ones that closely resemble their medieval counterparts. Final say on weapons and appropriate harness will be at the sole discretion of the captains.

    Requirements: All participants must wear a 14th c kit. Greaves are required and all are encouraged to wear chausses and braies. All weapons must closely resemble their medieval counterpart and are restricted to bastard swords, polearms of period design (axes, hammers, etc.), spears under 7', daggers and single handed swords. All participants should be prepared to pay a ransom that they feel is appropriate to their station in the event that they are "captured" during this deed of arms. Rules of combat will be explained to all combatants before the CotT begins.

name: Drake Oranwood, Singing Minstrel
description_book: Drake Oranwood, wandering minstrel, will beguile you with tales boldly sung in his first solo concert.
description_web: Drake Oranwood, wandering minstrel, will beguile you with tales boldly sung in his first solo concert. Note: Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.

name: Viking Age Tablet Weaving: Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of the major finds of tablet weaving from Norse sites like Birka, Oseberg, Mammen, Elisenhof, Evebo, Snartemo, and Eura; 40-page handout.
description_web: A brief survey of the major finds of tablet weaving from Norse and neighboring sites, including Birka, Oseberg, Mammen, Elisenhof, Evebo, Snartemo, Eura and others; 40-page handout is available.

name: Youth Combat Marshals' Meet and Greet
description_book: Meet and Greet for Knowne World youth combat marshals hosted by the Society Deputy for Youth Combat.
description_web: Meet and Greet for any youth combat marshals and any adults interested in the youth combat program. Hosted by the Society Deputy for Youth Combat, this is a chance to ask questions, air concerns, and get to know other marshals.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children at Runestone Hill.
description_web: 7pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend, must have adult escort.

name: Brothel Games
description_book: Learn some of the games known to have been played in the brothels and gambling dens in period. Bring proof of age, over 18.
description_web: Learn some of the games known to have been played in the brothels and gambling dens. Sources of most games are from the Channel ports of England, later in the SCA's time frame, but a few games can be documented from other times and places. Attempts will be made to keep the discussion and play PG, but be aware that in prior teaching sessions it has occasionally gone beyond that limit.

name: Duke Moonwulf and Michael Longcor - Together!
description_book: Enjoy Pennsic 43 with a Pennsic War tradition. Songs, stories and shenanigans with Duke Master Moonwulf, Michael Longcor, and special guests.
description_web: Enjoy Pennsic 43 with a Pennsic War tradition. Songs, stories and shenanigans with Duke Master Moonwulf, Michael Longcor, and special guests.

name: A Quick Overview of Bookbinding
description_book: A quick overview of bookbinding from the 4th to 16th centuries. Slide presentation and book petting session. Handout also available.
description_web: This is a quick overview of the styles of bookbinding from the 4th to the 16th centuries using a slide presentation. A handout will be available for a donation. Several styles will be on hand for a book petting session at the end of the presentation.

name: Known World Siege Marshal Social
description_book: A social meeting for informal discussions about siege combat and marshaling.
description_web: To promote convivial dialogue amongst the various groups of siege marshals in the Known World, Lord Diccon de Reinport, former D.E.M. of Siege for the Middle Kingdom, is please to announce the 5th Annual Kown World Siege Marshal Social to be hosted at the Holt Heroetus encampment at Pennsic War 43. Please join us for informal discussions about siege combat and marshaling and any other topics of interest.

name: *Guedra*: North African Trance Dance
description_book: Brief instruction in dance followed by participation in *Guedra* ritual. All levels. Bring water. Bring a veil if you want to dance.
description_web: Dance and chant will be taught, as well as some background info. (If you've heard the talk before, you can skip the first 30 minutes or so and come for the participation in the dance. Men must leave at that point.) Until our voices give out, we'll chant the *Guedra* for 1 to 4 dancers at a time. Bring a veil if you think you might want to dance. Everyone must participate in chant, no singing talent required, no dancing experience necessary. Bring water. Avoid wearing large jewelry.

name: Efenwealt Wystle
description_book: These versatile minstrels will amuse, entertain and educate you with the depth and breadth of their musical moxi - goofy filk to touching SCA ballads.
description_web: Efenwealt will do something entertaining and probably include other people, as he often does. If you are reading this text in the actual Pennsic Book, then something has gone horribly wrong and you should probably run for your life while there is still time. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.

name: i Sebastiani!
description_book: i Sebastiani! The greatest *Commedia dell'Arte* troupe in the entire world!
description_web: *Buon giorno!*  O, you lucky people! Truly you are blessed among the living, for into your lives has come i Sebastiani, the Greatest *Commedia dell'Arte* Troupe in the Entire World! Join us as we improvise from the thinnest of outlines a wondrous entertainment in three acts. You will be glad that you did!

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Youth Combat morning sessions, 8-10:30 AM.  Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.
description_web: Youth Combat morning sessions, 8-10:30 AM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: Populace Archery War Point Practice
description_book: Come to the archery range; practice the War Point shoots from 9-11 am during War Week except for Wednesday, August 6.
description_web: All archers can come to the archery range and practice the War Point shoots from 9 am to 11 am during War Week except Wednesday, August 6th, when the range is closed except for Archery Champions.

name: Circa 1200 Day
description_book: Circa 1200 Day will feature a daily life exhibit. Activities planned include a glass artisan, brewer and smith portraying life in this time period.
description_web: Circa 1200 Day will feature a daily life exhibit sponsored by Mistress Katherine von Schlosserwald and House Yew-Bend. Activities planned include a glass artisan, brewer and smith portraying life in this time period.

name: Fingerloop Braiding for Beginners
description_book: A hands-on class learning a 5-loop braiding technique. Useful as decoration or cording. Can be made into lanyard for site tokens!

name: Anglo-Saxon Ring Pouch
description_book: Create the only pouch an Anglo-Saxon woman would ever want or need, using period supplies and sewing techniques.
fee_itemization: All of the supplies and materials needed to make a ring pouch.

name: Street Smarts
description_book: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography. How the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.
description_web: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography. How the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.

name: 14th-Century Card-Woven Edges
description_book: Learn a simple needle-and-card-weaving technique to finish raw edges of 14th-century garments and accessories. Materials provided to make sample.
description_web: Learn a simple needle-and-card-weaving technique to finish raw edges of 14th-century garments and accessories as found on archaeological finds from London. Materials provided.
fee_itemization:
color handout
card weaving cards
fabric
embroidery floss
needle

name: Running an Event: Basics to Best Practices
description_book: Discover best practices from around the Society for making new or annual events run more smoothly. Appropriate for newcomers and the not-so-new.
description_web: What are the basic things you need to remember if you're running an event? What are some of the "best practices" (or recommended) ways to organize a new or returning event? How can you make an annual event run even smoother? This class uses focused discussion to discover some of the best practices we've seen around the Society, and how to apply them to your own local events. This class will not cover how to run a feast (please see the class schedule for a different complete class on that topic), and will focus primarily on local or baronial level events. The instructor has mundane experience running events for two other non-profit organizations in addition to SCA events.

name: Russian *Sarafans* and Short Jackets
description_book: Womens' regional dresses and short jackets; overview of styles and pattern layouts for cutout and construction.

name: The SCA's Greatest Hits
description_book: An overview of some of the most popular songs and singers in the SCA available on CD or as downloads. There will be recorded music and information.
description_web: An overview of some of the most popular songs and singers in the SCA available on CD or as downloads. Artists will incude Heather Dale, John Inchingham, Hector of the Black Height, Ken Theriot, Lisa Theriot, Lorelei Skye, Efenwealt Whystle, Baldwin of Erebor, Aneleda Falconbridge and a host of Calontiri. There will be others, too. (Two hours, but you'll get a lot if you can just stay one hour.)

name: Small, Simple Period Notebook
description_book: No experience needed! Make a small notebook for your pouch or purse, appropriate for most mid- to late-period personas. All supplies included.
description_web: No experience needed! Make a small stab-stitch notebook for your pouch or purse, appropriate for most mid- to late-period personas. All supplies included. If you have any of the following tools, please bring them: ruler, pencil, awl, sharp scissors, embroidery needle with large eye.

name: What Kind of Viking Are You?
description_book: Survey of women's clothing and accessories during the Viking Age.
description_web: Survey of women's clothing and accessories during the Viking Age. We will discuss basic theories of dress construction and skim through the types of accessories that are appropriate. This is **not** a sewing class, just a survey for women who want to understand the basics.

name: Anglo-Saxon Herbs and Gardens
description_book: What herbs did the Anglo-Saxons have for healing, for cooking, for magic; how did they grow or collect them?
description_web: What herbs did the Anglo-Saxons have available? How did they grow or collect them? How did they use them? What did they call them? How much is known about what was in the Anglo-Saxon garden, and how we can try to replicate it?

name: ASHI Wilderness First Aid, Day 2
description_book: Comprehensive course for those involved in serious wilderness activities. This course is the choice of many wilderness trip leaders and guides.
description_web: Wilderness First Aid is a comprehensive 16-hour course for those who are involved in serious wilderness activities. This course is the choice of many wilderness trip leaders and guides. The program meets the Boy Scouts of America Wilderness First Aid curriculum and guidelines. Class length: 2 days, 9 hours each, Both sessions are required for certification.
fee_itemization: Separate fee for certification card or course materials.

name: Poetry Day and Known World Poetry Competition
description_book: We will again have Poetry Day for poets to share their knowledge. We will also hold the Known World Poetry Competition.
description_web: We will again have Poetry Day for poets to share their knowledge and their poetry. Come and ask questions; come and share. We will also hold the Known World Poetry Competition. Drop off your entries between 10:00 and 12:00. Return at 2:00 pm to perform your work for final judging.

name: Gathering of the Louds
description_book: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Loud Renaissance instruments with a different focus each day: *intradas*, *chansons*, polychoral work
description_web: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Players of loud Renaissance instruments gather just for fun to play different styles of music at each session such as *intradas* and other instrumental processionals, *chansons*, and polychoral music. Not sure what these instruments are? Come listen or try one. Instruments will be available to share. Bring a chair, music stand and clothespins.

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.
description_web: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.

name: Laurel Roadshow
description_book: Come watch and participate as the Sovereigns of Arms decide a letter. This is highly entertaining and very educational. All are welcome.
description_web: Come watch and participate as the Sovereigns of Arms explain by examples how decisions are made for names and device. This is highly entertaining and very educational for heralds of all levels. All are welcome.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

name: "By the Book" Tournament
description_book: Historical fencing tourney. Memorize Marozzo, review Ridolfo, study Saviolo, for the third annual tournament where book worms can be winners!
description_web: A historical fencing tourney; memorize your Marozzo, review your Ridolfo and study your Saviolo, for the third annual tournament where book worms can be winners! Period fencing forms and period dress as seen in the manuals will bring you success. As always, lavish prizes will be bestowed upon the competitor with the most wins, the best dressed, and the one who best adheres to the style of a given master.

name: SCA Rapier Combat for Historic Martial Artists
description_book: Field time for HMA-interested fencers to meet, teach, learn, and spar.
description_web:
This is a place and time for SCA fencers who are interested in, or are actively pursuing, the study of historic martial arts in the context of SCA rapier rules. During this time, you can meet others with similar interests, offer to teach, look to learn, or just come out to spar with the like-minded.

A daily sign-up sheet will allow those in attendance to connect with others with matched goals for the day (e.g. someone willing to teach Fabris can find students wanting to learn, or vice versa, or someone looking for a fight can get one), and each day will end with special HMA-related sparring challenges.

name: Forge Safety 101
description_book: Beginners to blacksmithing will learn the basics of working safely around a forge.
description_web: Beginners to blacksmithing will learn how to be safe while working around a forge, including proper clothing, awareness of surroundings, and having more than one person in the forge area at a time.

name: Thrown Weapons Marshal Class
description_book: Proof of paid membership and be at least 18 years of age to begin training. All 3 classes must be attended unless other arrangements are made.
description_web: This class is for anyone who wishes to become a Thrown Weapons Marshal. Class is held in three parts, with a practical session. Participants **must** attend all three parts and have at least 3 hours of range time to complete the course (unless you make other arrangements with the Marshal in Charge). Minimum requirements for participants are membership in the SCA and a minimum age of 18. There are suggested classes also offered later in the week. At the time of the printing of the Pennsic book, the East and Middle are holding classes. There may be other kingdoms holding classes; check at the range for a complete list.

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia*, before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.

instructor: Lady Nina Amaya of Bright Hills
name: Belly Dance Basics
description_book: Let's shimmy and undulate, do snake arms and a figure eight... all ages, genders, styles and species welcome.
description_web: Let's shimmy and undulate, do snake arms and a figure eight... all ages, genders, styles and species welcome. www.NinaAmaya.com

name: Beginning Celtic Knotwork
description_book: Using 5-dot technique, students will be able to create knotwork. We'll look at examples and see patterns used. You get handout, pencils, graph paper.

name: Adv. Calligraphy: *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*
description_book: Learn Rotunda lowercase, Rotunda caps, Italic, and cadels. Take your calligraphy to the next level. Four two-hour sessions. Not for beginners.
description_web: The *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta* is a late-period Renaissance master’s showcase. In this four-day, in-depth study, students will learn scripts used in this manuscript: Rotunda lowercase, Rotunda caps, Italic, and cadels. Take your calligraphy to the next level with our tips on analyzing scripts. Plan to attend all four two-hour sessions. Not suitable for beginners.
fee_itemization: calligraphy marker, watercolor paper, specialty nib, supplies, color handouts.  $10 fee, payable 8/4, covers all 4 classes.

name: Pennsic Food Lab
description_book: Primitive and medieval cooking space will be made available while open discussion, demonstrations and classes will be taught on applied archaeology.
description_web: Primitive and medieval cooking space will be made available while open discussion, demonstrations and classes will be taught on applied archaeology relating to food and its production. Medieval cooking techniques, technology and methodology will be showcased in this open forum. Up-to-date times and topics will be posted outside of AEthelmearc Royal.
fee_itemization: Handout fees may vary. A requested donation tin will be available to help defray the cost of equipment and materials.

name: Perfume in History
description_book: Perfume and its relationship with science and culture from ancient times on, including spiritual, medicinal and cosmetic applications.
description_web: Perfume and its relationship with science and culture from ancient times on, including spiritual, medicinal and cosmetic applications.
fee_itemization: Donations to cover costs appreciated, and contributions will be made to the royal travel fund.

name: Medieval Business Practices
description_book: Explore how modern accounting practices evolved following the changes in business during the Middle Ages and Renaissance.
description_web: We're told that modern accounting practices, such as double-entry bookkeeping, started in the 13th century. This class explores how the growth and changing needs of period businesses created methods still in use today.

name: Plagues of Europe: Really, There Was More Than One
description_book: Focuses on the types of plagues, their origins, biological mechanisms, means of transmission and long term impact on the affected populations.
description_web: Measles, small pox, bubonic plague and leprosy each had a devastating impact on the affected population physically, psychologically, spiritually, and economically. This class focuses on the origins, biological mechanisms, means of transmission and long term impact on the affected populations. When early man lived in relatively isolated groups, contact between individuals was infrequent and short-lived diseases (for either the disease or the host) were not able to spread by direct contact or through intermediaries such as rats, mosquitoes, etc. As people began to live closer together in towns, later in cities, and when sanitation became more of a threat to health, transmission of diseases became easier and more common. Resistant individuals lived and the less-resistant died, thus selectively increasing resistance in the population as a whole. The gradually declining death toll seen in recurrences of a particular plague was due to an increase in resistance within the population due to several factors. Modern medical investigations indicate that the same genetic makeup that allowed some people to survive or avoid bubonic plague are the same genetic makeup that allows some people be HIV positive and not develop AIDS.

name: Breastfeeding Support  Group
description_book: Are you pregnant or nursing and would like support? Please come. Kids welcome, IBCLC, La Leche Leaders, LCs, Counselors. Late is ok.
description_web: Breast-feeders, unite. Come join us If you are pregnant or nursing (any age child) or if you are a support person or educator. You are welcome to come, hang out and learn about breastfeeding and overcoming issues. Sometimes we all need help when we are working through issues like heat, growth spurts, teething, first foods and weaning. This is a casual group. If you have learned something about breastfeeding, and you think it would benefit others, please feel free to share it. If you are an IBCLC, LC, Support Counselor, Educator, La Leche League leader or associate, please come and provide your support.

name: Taking Your Research From Reenactment to Academia
description_book: Have you ever considered taking your SCA research and bringing it to the 'mundane' academic community? The path is not for the faint of heart.
description_web: Have you ever considered taking your SCA research and bringing it to the 'mundane' academic community? The path is not for the faint of heart, but this class will at least give you a map. Critical thinking skills to apply to your research will also be discussed.

name: Spinning Fine
description_book: We will discuss what contributes to making a fine yarn or thread. Topics will include fiber type, fiber prep, spinning technique, etc.
description_web: We will discuss what contributes to making a fine yarn or thread. Topics will include fiber type, fiber prep, spinning technique, etc. Bring your spindle and/or wheel. We may also play the technique guessing game.

name: Beaded Kumihimo
description_book: Part 5: Students will learn how to make modern jewelry from an ancient technique. Students will make a beaded bracelet to take home.
description_web: Part 5: Students will learn how to make modern jewelry from an ancient technique. Students will make a beaded bracelet to take home. It is recommended to bring your own magnification if needed. Teacher will have magnifying lights for use.

name: Stitching *Temari*: Wrapped and Woven Patterns
description_book: *Temari* balls are wrapped, stitched, and woven into beautiful, colorful patterns that are impressive out of all proportion with how easy they are.
description_web: Bring your completed ball from the "Ball Bases" class and learn to wrap and weave a pattern onto it.
fee_itemization: materials to complete one ball, plus enough to begin several more

name: Advanced Beginning Reed Basket Making
description_book: Students will learn to weave a reed basket. Students will be able to complete and take their baskets in this class.
description_web: Students will learn weaving a reed basket from beginning to end and take their basket with them. They will learn techniques for using round reeds to construct baskets and will learn the history of reed basket making.

name: Renaissance Party Dances: *Chirintana* and Friends
