description_book: Some dances are more about fun than footwork. We will start by learning *Piva* and *Saltarello*, and then finish with *Chirintana*. Beginners welcome.
description_web: Some dances are more about fun than footwork. We will start by learning *Piva* and *Saltarello*, and then finish with *Chirintana*. Beginners are very welcome.

name: Loading Loadum
description_book: A late Renaissance trick-avoiding card game.
description_web: A late Renaissance trick-avoiding card game.

name: Coptic/Greek Bookbinding
description_book: Make a wood-covered book with exposed stitching in 6th- to 12th-century style.  Five-hour class, with handout and your own book to take home.
description_web: This Coptic/Greek bookbinding was popular from the 6th to the 12th centuries in the Middle East and Europe. Students will make their own book in this 5.5 hour-long class. No prior knowledge necessary, but will make it easier to do. All materials and tools provided by the instructor.
fee_itemization: Fee includes wood covers, paper for blank book, needles & thread to sew with, and a detailed handout.

name: Armored Field Battles
description_book: Field Battles consist of five battles, one point each. No switching sides.
description_web: Field Battles consist of five battles, one point each. No switching sides.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: KW Choir: Known World Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: Join the Known World Choir and prepare a concert of *a capella* choral music! Enthusiastic amateurs-expert singers are all welcome!
description_web: Join the Pennsic Known World Choir! Enthusiastic amateurs-expert singers are all welcome! Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on the final Thursday of War week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is extremely helpful, but not required if you are willing to put in the effort to learn the music in advance. Sheet music and part-learning tracks are available online now at the KWChoir Yahoo group: https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/KWChoir/info.
fee_itemization: Limited packets of sheet music available for $3.00. Otherwise, download pre-Pennsic or you may print at Mystic Mail

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: For all levels and teachers. Drills focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Études* for drill; elements from drill used to work in groups.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class.We have three wonderful, new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: The basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. BYO drum.
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. BYO Drum.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*
Day 4- *Kashlimah* and other strange stuff

name: Archery Populace War Point
description_book: Archery Populace War Point
description_web: All archers young and old are encouraged to come and lend their support to their kingdom's efforts, and to display their skill at archery. There will be 3 challenging populace shoots to test skills. Each Kingdom will be competing to earn the 3 War Points for each shoot.

name: Mythbusting Period Piracy
description_book: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined.
description_web: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined. Common myths and mistakes about piracy in the SCA period will be highlighted.

name: Medieval Sewing
description_book: Come learn the techniques used to sew all varieties of clothing. No previous experience needed! Please bring scissors if you have them.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to know how medieval clothing was actually constructed? Learn the techniques used to sew all varieties of clothing. This class focuses on the 14th-15th centuries, but the methods are applicable to other periods as well. This class is hands-on, no previous sewing experience needed! The 1st hour we will learn the stitches, the 2nd hour we will make a pouch using medieval threads. Please bring scissors if you have them.

name: Beginning *Pysanky*
description_book: Students will learn the history of the *pysanka*, and have the opportunity to create one of their own.
description_web: Students will learn the history of the *pysanka*, as well as the techniques involved, and have the opportunity to create one of their own. The class is listed as three hours to allow plenty of time for writing the shells; it doesn't usually take that long.
fee_itemization: $5 overall, $2 if you just want the handout (but it IS a hands-on class ...)

name: Survey of Soapmaking
description_book: Covers known soapmaking examples from the 10th-century Middle East through 16th-century Europe, plus period usage. Reproduction examples available.
description_web: This class surveys the documented history of soapmaking from al-Razi in 10th-century Persia to "Alexis of Piedmont" in 16th-century Italy. We will focus on soap as a product for cleaning the skin, hair and clothing. Discussion covers basic processes, raw materials, and usages in period. Examples of reproduction soaps will be available to handle, view, smell and wash with.
fee_itemization: Small sample packs of the soaps discussed will be available for participants to take home and try for a $1.00 fee.

name: The Cathars
description_book: We examine such questions as "Who were the Cathars and what did they believe?  What impact did they have on history?"
description_web: The subject of numerous popular fiction novels and conspiracy theories, the Cathars were a religious sect from the medieval period. Declared heretics, they were the subject of intense persecution by the Roman Catholic Church. This class will examine such questions as "Who were the Cathars and what did they believe?  What impact did they have on history?"

name: Filking: Fun With Words
description_book: A little history, a little fun, and a little filking all in the same class.
description_web: A little history, a little fun, and a little filking all in the same class.

name: Intro to Divination by Sorcery
description_book: Sorcery aka divination with coins, dice, runes, cards, books, sticks, all that randomizes - umm, I mean - reveals your fate or the will of the gods.
description_web: A survey class on Sorcery, aka *Sortilege*, aka Divination by Lot, as it was done in period. We will look at methods from all over the world, using coins, dice, stones, cards, books, sticks. From Julius Caesar’s battlefield system, to studying the flights of arrows, to Italian salon games, to the Catholic Church rolling dice to obtain answers directly from God. Most important of all, we will cover the mindset necessary to appreciate how sorcery was seen and understood in period.

name: Putting the Right Foot Forward
description_book: The first step to learning about buying or making footwear for the SCA. Handout with tutorials for making shoes and a buying guide of different styles
description_web: Want SCA appropriate footwear, but don’t know where to start? Come learn the basic styles for different cultures throughout the SCA time frame so you can easily identify what footwear is right for you. Class notes will also include links and references for tutorials on how you make your own SCA footwear.

name: Double-Reed Musical Instruments: Loud and Soft
description_book: Learn a little about the crumhorn, cornamuse, kortholt, shawm and *Rauschpiefe*.
description_web: Have you ever wondered about period woodwinds other than then recorders? Double-reed instruments come in several flavors: loud or soft, windcapped or open reeds. What is better: a natural or synthetic reed? Learn a little about the care and feeding of the crumhorn, cornamuse, kortholt, shawm and *Rauschpiefe*.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magick.
description_web: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.

name: Italian Dance for ECD Feet: *La Castellana*
description_book: Don't be intimidated by Italian dance! Join us for Caroso's *La Castellana* using English Country Dance terminology.
description_web: Italian dances can seem intimidating for dancers just getting steady on their English Country feet. Caroso's *La Castellana* is a simple Italian dance for couples that translates easily into ECD terminology. For as many couples as will.

name: Byzantine Iconography: Theology in Line and Color
description_book: In-depth overview of origins, history, symbolism, and technique of the ancient art of Byzantine icons.
description_web: In-depth overview of origins, history, symbolism, and technique of the ancient art of Byzantine Icons. Also a good introduction to two-part "Egg Tempera" class.

name: Intro to 6-on-2 Chainmail
description_book: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail. All materials provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
description_web: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail prevalent throughout period across multiple cultures. All materials necessary to complete class project provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
fee_itemization: Sufficient hand-turned & cut enameled copper rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter; to complete class project

name: Kumihimo Basics
description_book: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Thugs for Jugs: A Rapier Charity Tourney
description_book: A breast cancer rapier charity tourney, hosted by the Free Scholars of the *Academie de Espée*, Atlantia. Triple elimination with progressive weapons.
description_web:
To all those skilled in the art of rapier, the Free Scholars of the *Academie de Espée* of the great Kingdom of Atlantia are pleased to once again host an annual tournament to raise funds and awareness for breast cancer research. The format of this 9th annual tourney will be triple elimination, with progressive weapons forms following Atlantian rapier conventions. Combatants start first with Single Sword. Upon taking a loss, the combatant may take up a defensive secondary. Upon taking a second loss, the combatant may take up an offensive secondary. Upon taking a third and final loss, the combatant will take heed on the need to learn to parry, and watch their fellow combatants strive to bring glory and awareness towards a most noble and important cause. A donation of at least $5 will be required to compete, though all are welcome to support this important cause.

The winner and finalist will be awarded a period drinking vessel worthy of their great feat of strength. All funds raised will be donated to a breast cancer charity of the winner's choice.

name: Beginners' *Atlatl* Throwing (Morning)
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.
description_web: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.

name: Beginning Spear Throwing
description_book: Learn to accurately throw spears without destroying your arm. History and development of spears will be covered. By Lord Dominic Seamor.
description_web: Learn to accurately throw spears without destroying your arm. History and development of spears will be covered. By Lord Dominic Seamor

name: How to Teach Beginners to Throw
description_book: For TW marshals and MiTs, this course explains exactly how to teach a beginner to throw. By Lord Leonhard Schuwert.
description_web: For thrown weapons marshals and MITs, this course will show how to teach thrown weapons to someone who wants to learn how to throw. It will cover both an informal class and a formal class technique. This is a recommended class for MITs, but not required. By Lord Leonhard Schuwert.

name: Healthy Projection and Professional Presentation
description_book: Discuss breathing, resonance, and acoustics for the active voice herald, story teller, or singer from an operatic perspective. Masterclass style.
description_web: Discussion of breathing, resonance and acoustics for the active voice herald, story teller, or signer from an opera singer's perspective, with a lecture followed by a masterclass-style session with any willing participants.

name: Viking Design for Embroidery and Illumination
description_book: Covers Viking art styles, design manipulation, transfer methods, and includes a list of helpful supplies in a handout.
description_web: Covers Viking art styles and characteristics; how to manipulate designs to fit your project; transfer methods for cloth, wood, leather, and paper (some will be demonstrated); and a list of helpful supplies. A handout will be available for the cost of copying to the first 30 students.

name: Basic Weaving: Emphasis on Tablet Weaving
description_book: Hands-on weaving using cards to produce a decorative woven band. Adults or older children (age 12 and up with parent).
description_web: Learn a few tablet weaving basics and begin weaving on pre-strung cards. Students leave with ability to reproduce simple bands on their own. Handout included in material fee. Adults or older children (age 12 and up with parent).

name: Equestrian Research Sources
description_book: Class will focus on the sources available to the researcher concerning equestrian arts and equipment used in the Middle Ages.
description_web: This class will focus on the sources available to the researcher concerning equestrian arts and equipment used in the Middle Ages. The emphasis is on locating sources for documentation of projects and as a guide to creating your own equestrian related pieces. The last part of the class will feature a roundtable discussion of favorite sources of participants.

name: Introduction to Medieval Music Notation
description_book: We'll discuss differences with modern notation, then read several examples. Bring melody instruments you play fluently, e.g., recorder, fiddle, voice.
description_web: Reading medieval music in modern notation imposes modern notions of measure, phrasing, and tonality. Reading it in the original notation allows us to get closer to the composer's intentions and the head-space of a medieval performer, and can help achieve those elusive, magical “medieval moments”. We'll start with an overview of differences between modern and medieval notation, and then spend most of the class reading examples. Bring melody instruments you play fluently, such as recorder, gamba, fiddle, voice (if you have good pitch memory), etc. If you have multiple sizes of your instrument, please bring them (e.g., SATB recorders).

name: *Cuirboulli*: Water-Hardened Leather Armor
description_book: How to make armor from vegetable-tanned leather, using hot water.
description_web: How to make armor from vegetable-tanned leather, using hot water.

name: A New Way to Wire Weave: Anglo-Saxon Interweave
description_book: Discussion and hands-on of a wire weaving technique unique to Anglo-Saxon areas. Knowledge of "Viking" wire weaving is assumed but not required.
description_web:
This will be a discussion of a historical wire weaving pattern and its differences from the Baltic area examples often called "Viking" wire weaving. We will be discussing the archaeological evidence for its construction and use. Ten kits will be available for $5 on a first-come basis for interested participants to practice the method and take home the materials to finish a chain. Observers are welcome.
The Baltic method, commonly known in the SCA as "Viking" wire weaving, will be discussed but not directly taught.
fee_itemization: Kits include wire spool and tool for hands on practice

name: Eastern Divination
description_book: Demonstration of the divinatory arts of Asia. Some arts we will examine are *Omikuji, I Ching*, the 100 poems of *Kuan Yin*, and Chinese astrology.

name: Planning a Feast
description_book: How to design a menu, figure out how much to cook, plan logistics, and everything else you need to consider to ensure a successful feast.

name: Cooking in a Clay Oven
description_book: Cooking in an on-site clay oven focusing on breads and baked goods.
description_web: Cooking in an on-site clay oven. The focus will be on breads and baked goods; yeast breads, flat breats, pizza, cobblers, cake. Discusson of slow cooking using a pre-heated oven.

name: *Déjà Vu: La Castellana* Part 2
description_book: Practice this *cascarde* with Italian terminology and a focus on style and embellishment. Completion of earlier *Castellana* class recommended.
description_web: Delve a little more deeply into this 16th-century *cascarde* by transitioning to the use of Italian terminology and focusing on style and embellishment. Completion of *"La Castellana*: Italian Dance for ECD Feet" or some familiarity with 16th-century Italian steps is recommended but not required.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Basics of Vocal Production
description_book: How to produce healthy, efficient vocal tone when speaking or singing. Come prepared to make noise!

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Movement by *Mysore*
description_book: Space in use

name: Youth Rapier Fencing Practice
description_book: Youth rapier practice, ages 6 to 17. Come out and fence.
description_web: Youth rapier fencing practice, ages 6 to 17. Come out and fence.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web:
Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater Wednesday 8/6 6-7 pm.
You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Intro to Egyptian-Style Group Improvisation
description_book: Learn Tribal Odyssey: Egyptian-based improvisational tribal-style with *beledi*-style combinations.
description_web: Rajni is a Certified Level 1 Tribal Odyssey dance leader, a group improvisational style developed by Kawakib of Fredericksburg, VA. In the words of Kawakib: “Tribal Odyssey uses natural posture and both sides of the body in combinations based primarily on Egyptian *beledi*-style movement. It's versatile enough to adapt to any size group.” Class will repeat to allow for several days of practice with a group, and will incorporate recorded Middle Eastern drumming as well as live music/ drumming as available. Learn moves that you and your dance friends can use at Pennsic haflas this year!

name: Intermediate Middle Eastern Drumming: 6/8 and 12
description_book: Add to your rhythm repertoire with rhythms played in 6 and 12. Morrocan & Persian 6/8 and Chaka 12 are covered, with variations. Beginners welcome.

name: Mooselodge Open Tourney
description_book: Remember when we used to have regular SCA-style tourneys at Pennsic? This year we will again!
description_web: Remember when we used to have regular SCA style tourneys at Pennsic? This year we will again! This tournament will be open to all armoured fighters and fought Atlantian Speed Style, double elimination, under the Atlantian Conventions of Combat.

name: Affordable Illumination Kit
description_book: Don't make the same mistakes I did! We will discuss how to build a solid illumination kit without breaking the bank.
description_web: Have you done a "paint-a-scroll" and decided that this is pretty nifty? Are you working with borrowed supplies? Building an illumination kit can be an expensive proposition but it doesn't have to break the bank. Don't make the same mistakes I did! We will discuss paint options, medium choices, brush selection, other essential tools, and some online resources to draw inspiration from.

name: Mead Begins with Bees
description_book: Class covers site selection, reference material sources, basic equipment, wooden wares needed to set up an apiary, all before you get your bees.
description_web: Class covers site selection, reference material sources, basic equipment, demonstrations on wooden ware construction.  These are the things you will need **before you even order your bees**.

name: 14th-Century Quilting in Household Textiles
description_book: This class focuses on the 14th-century *Guicciardini* quilt at the V&A and Bargello museums. Materials provided to make a sample.
fee_itemization: Color handout, fabric, batting, cord, thread, needle, boutis tool

name: Make a St. Birgitta Coif
description_book: Come make a simple linen coif appropriate for all classes of women from the 13-15th centuries. Recommended: knowledge of basic hand-sewing.

name: Medieval Pigments I: Red Ocher
description_book: How to make and use red ocher pigment. Basics of paint-making and pigment safety. Tools and materials provided.
description_web: How to make and using red ocher pigment. Fundamentals of paint-making and pigment safety. Tools and materials provided.
fee_itemization: Free paper, brushes, use of tools.

name: Demystifying the SCA Kitchen
description_book: Decoding period recipes. Understanding basic concepts of period cooking. How to organize from planning and shopping to follow through.

name: *Hakama* Construction
description_book: A brief overview of Japanese trousers/divided skirt will be discussed, along with a step-by-step visual demonstration of their construction.
description_web: A brief overview of Japanese trousers/divided skirt will be discussed, along with a step-by-step visual demonstration of their construction. Extra time is allotted for consultations. Please bring along your own materials if you'd like assistance starting your pattern. If you have questions prior to the class, please contact me at yamamura.kitsune@gmail.com.
fee_itemization: Handout of class outline and garment instructions.

name: Fun with Body Parts I: Relics
description_book: Miscellaneous body parts more precious than jewels? An irreverent look at the cult of the saints.
description_web: Miscellaneous body parts more precious than jewels? An irreverent look at the cult of the saints, a phenomenon which led to an international business in bones, daring thefts and major con jobs.

name: *Sado Nyumon*: Introduction to the Tea Ceremony
description_book: An overview and participatory introduction to the Japanese tea ceremony focusing on the role of the guest. This class is not a tea ceremony.
description_web: An overview and participatory introduction to the Japanese tea ceremony. Includes a basic introduction to the history and theory of the tea ceremony along with a participatory introduction to the basics of performing the role of a guest in a tea ceremony.

name: Gresley Dances
description_book: Dated to 1500, these are the earliest period English dances we have. They are easy and no experience is necessary.
description_web: These dances, dated to c.1500, were found on the back of ledger sheets in 1995 and are the earliest English dances we have. Different than any dances you may be familiar with, they are easy, fun and sometimes silly. No experience is necessary. Dances: New Year, *Rawty de duobus*, *Roye de tribus*, *Oringe de tribus*, *Ly bens distonys de duobus*.

name: Bling on a Budget
description_book: Use glass jewels, beads, and metal to add dignity and ostentation to clothes without going broke. Dark Ages through Renaissance.
description_web: How to use glass jewels, beads, and metal to add dignity and ostentation to clothes without going broke. From minor flourishes to full-bore excess, planning and execution, covered by instructor with 25+ years experience working with these forms of embellishment. No purchase necessary. Supplies available for purchase; prices vary depending on patterns chosen.
fee_itemization: Fee depends on choices made. No purchase necessary.

name: KW Choir: Children's Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: The KW Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert.
description_web: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert on Thursday of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon 8/7 in the PAT, details TBA during regular rehearsals.)

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Thrown Weapons for the Handicapped
description_book: Most physical limitations are not a barrier to this martial art. Please join us and expand your Pennsic experience. By Lord Alexander Makristyne.
description_web: Most physical limitations are not a barrier to this martial art. Please join us and expand your Pennsic experience. By Lord Alexander Makristyne.

name: Juggling 101 (Beginner)
description_book: Learn to juggle three balls in the most simple pattern. Equipment available for use or purchase.
description_web: The most basic 3-ball cascade juggling. Juggling balls will be made available for use by the class and may be bought afterward from the instructor. Juggling sets range from $5-$10.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Slavery in Viking Culture
description_book: Discussion of slavery and how it was treated in Viking culture.
description_web: A class discussing slavery in Viking cultures. How it was started in myth as well as the laws and devices used in the slave trade. Recreation of items from the time may be available for use as examples.

name: Designing Armory from Period Examples
description_book: Want to have a device that might have existed in the Middle Ages? This class will help you design period-style arms by looking at period examples.
description_web: Thinking about a device but don't really know what you want? Want to have something that might have existed in the Middle Ages? This class will tell you how to design core-style arms by looking at period examples (many of which are online) and borrowing ideas, all within the standards of the Society.

name: Pagan Beliefs in Ancient Russia
description_book: This is a brief reconstruction of ancient Russian mythology, based on archaeological and folkloric evidence.
description_web: Slavic mythology is a difficult subject. The historical evidence is fragmented, with many conflicting sources and multiple later literary inventions. This is a brief reconstruction of Russian mythology, based on archaeological and folkloric evidence.

name: *Cloisonné* Enameling
description_book: Introduction to the technique, tools, and materials of *cloisonné* enamel. Kits are available for students to create a small piece.
description_web: Students will be introduced to the technique, tools, and materials of *cloisonné* enamel. Kits are available for students to create a small piece of their own. You may - and are encouraged - to bring wire working tools such as pliers and cutters.
fee_itemization: Kit Includes handout, blank disk to apply enamels, cloisonne' wire and use of instructor's enamel colors and kiln to fire.

name: Beginning Bead-Making
description_book: Interested in learning the art of glass bead-making? Must wear closed-toed shoes, long sleeves and pants/dress.
description_web: Interested in learning the art of glass bead making? Come join us! Instruction will be given the first hour of class with guided practice; the second hour is for you to practice the skills that you have learned. Students will be able to take home any beads they make during class. Must wear closed-toed shoes, long sleeves and pants or dress. Students not wearing the proper attire will be turned away. Sorry, we are dealing with hot glass, people, and it is hot!
fee_itemization: Glass rods, propane, mandrels, hot head torches, bead release.

name: Basic Silversmithing
description_book: Make period-style pendant using cabochon semi-precious stone, sterling sheet and wire. Includes forming, soldering and finishing.
description_web: Students will make a pendant using cabochon semi-precious stones which would have been available in period, and sterling silver sheet and wire. The processes will include forming, silver soldering and finishing.
fee_itemization:
Silver sheet and wire  $25
Semiprecious stone  $10
Expendable materials  $5

name: How to Run "It Takes My Child to Raze a Village"
description_book: The basics of running a parent-child focused event to help further the future generation's involvement in the SCA.
description_web: The basics of running a parent-child focused event to help further the future generation's involvement in the SCA. <----- Sorry that sounds boring, but I had to keep it short for the book description! I will explain and answer and try to answer any questions!

name: SCA 101: Very Basics for Newcomers and Chatelaines
description_book: Starting with what SCA stands for, how it started and what we do, this is the class to take if you are new to the SCA or teach newcomers.
description_web: Starting with what SCA stands for, how it started and what we do, this is the class to take if you are new to the SCA or teach newcomers. We'll also talk about navigating your first Pennsic.

name: Butter Make-and-Take
description_book: Churn your own butter and take it back to your camp to enjoy! Appropriate for all ages.
description_web: Come learn how to churn butter from simple cream. Participants will use a mini-churn to create their own batch of butter to take back to their camp, plus also get the opportunity to help churn a larger batch in a wooden churn that everyone can sample. Prepare to get a wee bit messy. Material fee of $3 covers mini-churn and cream to make the butter.

name: Meet the Mayor (Pennsic 44)
description_book: Questions/comments on Pennsic 44; meet with the Mayor for a friendly discussion.

name: Bellatrix Techniques
description_book: Fundamental and advanced Bellatrix techniques of armored sword and shield fighting. Unarmored class appropriate for all levels of proficiency.
description_web:
This class teaches fundamental and advanced techniques of the Bellatrix system of armored sword and shield fighting. It is appropriate for all levels of proficiency. Technique is one of the main pillars of successful fighting. No matter what your level of proficiency, efficient and effective technique will help you to improve your game, and avoid injury through faulty bio-mechanics.
The class is taught unarmored. Students will need a sword and preferably a shield, or something similar. Neither need to be SCA legal, but must be safe.

name: Period Portable Furniture You Can Make
description_book: Three chairs, two tables, and a bed, all based on period designs.
description_web: Three chairs, two tables, and a bed, all based on period designs. At least one chair, one table, and the bed are simple enough so that someone with only basic tools and no expertise should be able to make them.

name: Beginner Dance: Bransles B
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Class starts with basic steps and patterns, and then introduces you to fun bransles from 16th-century France.

name: Rapier Field Battle
description_book: Consists of 3 battles with 15 minutes between; one Friendship Battle 20 minutes after War Point battles.
description_web: Consists of 3 battles with 15 minutes between; one Friendship Battle 20 minutes after War Point battles.

name: Restorative Dance
description_book: For people who have undergone physical trauma, surgery, or other disabling event, this class will introduce gentle movement back into your life.
description_web:
This is for anyone who is on a healing journey—any person who is recovering from cancer; has had a serious surgery or multiple reconstructive surgeries; women who have just given birth and/or have had rough childbirths/cesarean surgery; anyone who is suffering from an emotional and/or physical disconnect from her body as the result of debilitating illness.
Using the framework of Middle Eastern dance, we will gently introduce movement back into the lives of those who have suffered physical traumas that may prevent them from feeling both physically and emotionally comfortable in a traditional dance class. The class will consist of a gentle dance warm-up, gentle stretch, learning no more than two to three dance moves, slow and gentle cool-down stretch.

name: KW Choir: Youth Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: The KW Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 18 to learn period vocal music and performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert.
description_web: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 18 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella*. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert on Thursday of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon 8/7 in the PAT, details TBA during regular rehearsals.)

name: PA Afternoon Series: Bardic Arts Exhibition
description_book: Come and enjoy an amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of bardic arts and artists from around the Known World!
description_web: Come and enjoy an amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of bardic arts and artists from around the Known World!

name: Beginners' *Atlatl* Throwing (Afternoon)
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.
description_web: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.

name: Axes and Javelins and Hurlbats, Oh My!
description_book: Petting zoo of thrown weapons, 1300-1600. Learn about the huge variety of weapons used in the late period, with buyer’s guide, and reproduction tips!
description_web: Petting zoo of late-period throwing weapons, 1300-1600. Learn about the huge variety of throwing weapons used in the late period, along with a buyer’s guide for reproductions and tips for constructing or modifying your own.

name: Dumbek Rhythm Changes
description_book: This class will focus on changing from one common rhythm to another. Handouts will be supplied.
description_web: This class will focus on changing from one common rhythm to another. Handouts will be supplied.

name: Improv Theater Games for Improving Your Character
description_book: Theater games for learning improvisation. Good for *commedia*, theater, and living in persona.
description_web: Come learn and play theater games focused on the art of improvisation. Skills learned here can be used to improve any kind of performance including the portrayal of your persona in the SCA.

name: Æthelmearc Scribes Get-Together
description_book: An afternoon to meet your fellow scribes and enjoy some light refreshment. Bring your portfolio and share your work.
description_web: An afternoon to meet your fellow scribes and enjoy some light refreshment. Bring your portfolio and share your work.

instructor: Lord archer bear horseman of rockbr
name: Make Your Own Flemish String for Any Bow
description_book: Make a string for your recurve, long bow, horse bow or crossbow using modern B-50 Dacron.
fee_itemization: String material, Serving material, nock material

name: Neck/Cuff/Hem: 14th-C Greenland Dresses
description_book: Learn special sewing techniques for the necklines, sleeve cuffs, and hems of the 14th-C dresses from a find in Greenland. Beginner-friendly.

name: Building Scrolls Without a Book of Hours
description_book: What? No Book of Hours? Yes! Learn how to use period artwork to build scrolls and break into a new area of creativity.

name: Viking Age Clothing: The Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of the major finds of Viking Age clothing, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make accurate reproductions; 45-page handout.
description_web: A brief survey of the major finds of Viking Age clothing, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make reasonably accurate reproductions. We will cover Thorsbjerg, Mammen, Viborg, Damendorf, Birka, Eura, and other finds; 45-page handout is available.

name: Children's Pouchmaking Class
description_book: Kids of any age can come and make a very simple cloth pouch to hold small baubles. You can easily attach it to your wrist or belt.
description_web: Kids of any age can come and make a very simple cloth pouch to hold small baubles. You can easily attach it to your wrist or belt. This class is family-friendly and youth/children are encouraged to participate. Responsible adult required.

name: Shiny Hats and Medallions: A Guide to SCA Regalia
description_book: Covers Society award structure, what all the medallions and coronets mean, using titles appropriately and court etiquette.
description_web: Keeping everyone’s names straight can be confusing, but then when you add titles to the mix it takes on a whole new level. This class will cover Society award structure (so you know why people are clapping in court) as well what all the medallions and coronets mean. We will also discuss some of the differences in awards across the different Kingdoms. In addition there will be a section on using titles appropriately and court etiquette. That way, when you are called up for the first time, you know what to do!

name: Retaining the Unretainable
description_book: How to get started or improve your knowledge base for wrangling those royal types. A must-have if you are new to retaining.
description_web: Getting started in retaining? Have some seasoning under your belt? This is the class to get started or improve your skills, share stories and learn from each other. Help create the magic of the game by being a good retainer.

name: Grooming: Medieval-Style
description_book: Want to enhance your SCA experience? Try some period grooming recipes. This class gives you an opportunity to try period beauty/hygiene products.
fee_itemization: Donations to cover costs of herbs are appreciated but not required.

name: Roman Ladies' Afternoon
description_book: An afternoon of information, fun, and learning. Learn about the role of women in Rome, partake in Roman pampering, and enjoy light refreshments.
description_web: An afternoon of information, fun, and learning. Learn about the role of women in Rome, partake in Roman pampering, and enjoy light refreshments. A chance to build on your existing Roman persona/ garb or start learning.
fee_itemization: A multi-page resource for those interested

name: This Pile of Sticks Is a Loom?
description_book: Vertical, warp-weighted, tapestry, floor, inkle, backstrap, Oseberg...so many types of looms! Come learn the differences!

name: Beginner Dance: English Country C
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn simple English Country dances.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn simple English Country dances.

name: Board Games
description_book: This class will review board games previously taught and provide opportunities to practice with a knowledgeable instructor's assistance.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.

name: Pre-16th-C. Musical Modal Improvisation
description_book: This is a practical application class for musicians to learn improvisational skills that were practiced in the Middle Ages for ages.
description_web: Musician class for acoustic instruments to learn medieval modal improvisation that will teach the student to create melodies on the spot for both free form and structured rhythmic forms. Students are required to be very familiar with their instruments. Reading is not require but really helps (especially your major and natural minor scales).

name: The Polearm Techniques of Paulus Hector Mair
description_book: A look at several techniques from the 16th-century manual of arms of Paulus Hector Mair.
description_web: A look at several techniques from the 16th-century manual of arms of Paulus Hector Mair.

name: Kinetic Throwers' Tourney
description_book: Competitors will throw at the targets while walking toward them. For advanced throwers; limit of six participants. By Lord Magnus de Londres
description_web: Competitors will throw at the targets while walking toward them. For advanced throwers; limit of six participants. By Lord Magnus de Londres

name: Construction of Spear for Thrown Weapon Activities
description_book: Includes finding low cost quality materials, tools and techniques to put spear together; safety and actual production of two spears in Class 1.
description_web: Includes finding low cost quality materials, tools and techniques to put spear together; safety and actual production of two spears in Class 1.

name: East/Midrealm Round-Robin Tournament
description_book: Their Majesties invite Youth Combatants to vie for Honor and Victory in a round-robin list for Divisions 1 -3.
description_web: Their Majesties invite Youth Combatants to vie for Honor and Victory in a round-robin list for Divisions 1 -3.

name: *Kalaripayattu*
description_book: A first taste of a traditional Indian martial art. Class is hands-on, highly athletic, unarmored, and great for martial artists and dancers alike.
description_web: Get a first taste of an art often called the mother of all martial arts. Originating from Kerala, India, this highly athletic form of unarmoured combat is a rare and rigorous style preserved from pre-British Raj India. A great adventure for martial artists, it's also a great way to add strength, balance and flexibility to your dance. Bring extra water and extremely flexible, nonrestrictive clothing.

name: Whose Line Doth It Be? - Auditions (Amphitheater)
description_book: Think you are a great improviser? Here's your chance to audition for "Whose Line Doth It Be?" Performance slots are limited.
description_web: Think you are a great improviser? Now here's your chance to audition for the improvisational show, "Whose Line Doth It Be?", taking place at 7:00 pm in the Amphitheater. Performance slots are limited, so sharpen your wit!

name: Glass Art Design Considerations
description_book: A brief overview of motifs and design considerations across Europe and throughout the SCA period.
description_web: A brief overview of motifs and materials for glass art through the SCA period. This class will focus on stained glass. Discussion and picture examples of changes in themes and designs in several countries/regions and time periods.

name: Cutting a Quill Pen
description_book: Learn how to take a plain feather and turn it into an instrument of writing. Sharp knives will be used; ages 10-14 need parental supervision.
fee_itemization: For a quill to take home.  No fee for those who bring their own quill to cut.

name: Becoming a Peer: One Laurel's Journey
description_book: Wondering about being a Peer? Maybe having some struggles with your path? You're not alone! Hear a Laurel's story to help enjoy your own adventure.
description_web: Wondering about being a Peer? Maybe having some struggles with your path? You're not alone! It happens to many of us. Hear one Laurel's story that can hopefully help you figure out how to enjoy your own adventure. We'll be covering what have come to be known as "Zsof's Rules". We'll discuss each one and how it came about. Maybe you'll walk away with some of your own rules too.

name: How to Card-Weave Letters and Designs
description_book: Weave letters, numbers, designs! To participate, bring a loom warped with 42 cards, A&B in one color, C&D in a contrasting color. Observers welcome.
description_web: Learn to weave letters, numbers, or your own designs using the double-faced weaving technique! To fully participate, bring a loom warped with 42 cards, A&B in one color, C&D in a contrasting color, all S or Z threaded, and shuttle in either color. Basic technique can be learned with fewer cards (12 or up) for smaller looms, but you will be limited for patterns to try in class. Observers welcome, or bring one loom and share with a friend.

name: Developing Your Japanese Persona
description_book: Designed to take an individual through the process of building and fully developing any Japanese persona.
description_web: Designed to take an individual through the process of building and fully developing any Japanese persona. Focuses on thinking through back story to add realism to one's SCA identity. Good for newcomers and old hands alike.

name: Middle Eastern Music and Dance
description_book: A time for people of all skill levels to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. All instruments are welcome, and loaner drums are available!
description_web: A time for people interested in Middle Eastern music and dance to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. We will be providing instruction appropriate to the interest of the attendees, from beginning Middle Eastern drum and belly dance to teaching songs in which everyone can participate. All skill levels and instruments are welcome, and drums are available for borrowing!

name: Beginning English Country Dance
description_book: Come to this beginners' class on English Country dance to learn the basic steps and a few simple dances such as *Black Nag* and *Gathering Peascods.*
description_web: Do you know what doubles, siding, arming, sets and turns, and heys are? Well come to this beginners' class on English Country dance and you will! Simple dances such as *Black Nag, Gathering Peascods*, and *Rufty Tufty* will be taught.

name: Egg Tempera Panel Painting: Part 1
description_book: Hands-on; explore period medium of egg tempera panel painting from Egyptian to medieval, in-depth, prep to finish. Materials included.
description_web: Egg tempera is an ancient medium dating to the Egyptians and used throughout history. Virtually all panel paintings executed before mid 1400s used solely the yolk of the egg. This 2-part workshop will give hands-on time to explore this essential period medium in depth, from prep to finish. All materials included, beginner to advanced.
fee_itemization: fee is for 2 classes- traditional gesso panel, pigments, tools etc.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a trim strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a trim strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: Everything Looks Rosier at the Bottom of a Glass
description_book: Double-elimination tourney with random pairings. No two-handed. Entry is bottle of your favorite libation. Over 21 to play. Bring chairs, cups, food.
description_web:
To enter this tourney bring a bottle of your favorite libation as an entrance fee.  The winner of this tournament will get to choose their favorite libation from all the entries. However, any visiting or participating Royalty may wish to sample from the entries, as Their Royal Whim suits them. This is a simple double-elimination random pairing tourney. No two-handed swords are allowed. Double kills count as a loss for both parties. MICs: Don Caine Ramsey and Warder Colin Macnish.
To enter you must meet the following criteria:
      1) Be 21, with a valid picture ID available for review. NO exceptions to this rule
      2) Have at least 1 bottle of your favorite libation (alcoholic or non-alcoholic) as your entrance fee. 
We encourage all participants to stick around for the post-tourney revel. Bring food, brings chairs…AND bring your cups.

name: 10-Man Unbelted Melée Tourney
description_book: Sargeants of Saint Aiden 10-Man Unbelted Melée Tourney
description_web: For the third year The Sargents of Saint Aiden sponsor the Ten Man Melée Tourney. The fight will be for the Sargents' chest. Each year the coat of arms of the winning team are added to the chest. At this time Atlantia and Æthelmearc are the two kingdoms on the Chest. Will one of these two Kingdoms be the first to form a Dynasty in this tourney, or will a new kingdom emerge as champions this year?

name: My Mom Can Beat Up Your Mom Tourney
description_book: The Victorious Mother will take home the Gilded Macaroni Shield with painted case for the year!  All Moms authorized in heavy combat are welcome.

name: Dance Musician Logistics and Performance
description_book: Lecture and "jam" for musicians performing music to support historical dance events.
description_web: This will be a lecture as well as actual run-through of dance tunes in order to teach musicians the logistical and philosophical applications of instruments when supporting historical dance events.

name: Pennsic Archery Champions Practice/Tryouts
description_book: All archers wishing to make the Pennsic Archery Champions Teams should attend these practices.
description_web: All archers wishing to be on the Pennsic Archery Champions Teams should attend these practices. See either the East Kingdom Captain General or the Midrealm Archer General for more details.

name: A Sleeping Pen Awakened
description_book: Women's literacy between 1400-1600 was a much contested (and complicated) concept. This class examines how women interacted with texts.
description_web: Literacy does not mean the same thing today that it meant 500 years ago, and this change is more complicated when gender enters the picture. This class will examine women's literacy between 1400-1600. Class will examine women who wrote, men and women who wrote about women writing, and the distinction between women reading and women writing.

name: Viking Age Furniture: The Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of the major finds of Viking Age furniture, with help to interpret the finds to make accurate reproductions; 45-page handout.
description_web: A brief survey of the major finds of Viking Age furniture, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make reasonably accurate reproductions. We will cover digs at Norse sites such as Oseberg, Gokstad, Birka, Dublin, Hedeby, etc. There will be a 45-page handout available.

name: Period Drinking Songs
description_book: Learn to sing a variety of period songs about drinking from across Europe, including easy unison and rounds, as well as harmony with up to four parts
description_web: Learn to sing a variety of period songs about consuming alcoholic beverages from across Europe. The songs vary in difficulty from easy unison and rounds to harmony with up to four parts, so anyone can participate. Music will be available to take with you. If you have heard of the Pennsic Drinking and Singing Walk or the *Hymni Bacchi*, this is the music we sing.

name: *Kenjutsu*: The Art of Japanese Swordsmanship
description_book: Dojo-style class, covering basics of Japanese sword. Japanese practice sword or equivalent (wood or metal) required. Limited loaners available.
description_web:
A traditional-style class on Japanese *kenjutsu*, drawn from multiple sources, including modern and traditional arts. The class will be arranged to emphasize techniques that are known to have been used pre-1600. Emphasis will be on physical repetition more than scholarly discussion. The latter will be available after class, informally, as requested.
About the instructor: I have over 15 years of experience in Japanese sword arts, including *Nakamura Ryu Battodo (IBF 4-dan), ZNKR Kendo (1-kyu), Mugai Ryu Iaihyodo*, and *Shindo Muso Ryu Jodo*.

name: Ball Prep: Grand Ball
description_book: Want to dance at the ball, but have no or little idea how? This is for you! All steps will be taught, along with etiquette and survival tips.
description_web: Want to dance at the Grand ball on Monday night, but have no or little idea how? This is the class for you! All steps will be taught, along with etiquette and survival tips.

name: Introduction to Combat Archery
description_book: Learn the basics of combat archery. The class will cover the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules and basic tactics.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to be a part of the action on the battlefield, but didn't want to swing a sword? Have you ever wanted to shoot back at that pesky archer who keeps killing you? Give combat archery a try. The class will cover the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.

name: In-Persona Storytelling and Poetry
description_book: Poetry and period stories presented as told by a period person to a period audience by Duke Cariadoc of the Bow.
description_web: Poetry and period stories presented as told by a period person to a period audience by Duke Cariadoc of the Bow.

name: Efenwealt Wystle at the Amphitheater
description_book: If you haven’t had enough Efenwealt yet this year, come on out for a little comedy warm-up before the evening’s improv comedy intensive.
description_web: What’s the difference between a baboon and a Viking? The Viking has a sword and will hit people who make bad jokes! Thank you! Thank you! I’m here all week. If you haven’t had enough Efenwealt yet this year, come on out for a little comedy warm-up before the evening’s improv comedy intensive.

name: Interrogating Your Museum
description_book: It's time to get more out of your museum. Find out what to ask, who to ask, and what to do with the answers once you have them.

name: Fingerloop Braids Project
description_book: We've decoded only a small fraction of braids from the primary sources! Come to this meeting and help us organize a project to finish them all!
description_web: We know the instructions for a bunch of fingerloop braids, but only a small fraction of braids explained in the primary sources have been decoded. Would you like to help? Come to this meeting and help us organize a project to finish them all!

name: *Opus Teutonicum*: German white work embroidery
description_book: An overview of German white work embroideries from the 12th to 15th centuries.  Looking at who, what, when and where.

name: Sing We And Chant It IV: Madrigal/*A Capella* Jam
description_book: Come all who enjoy part-singing to sing along for an evening of madrigal, part-song, and *a capella* favorites performed by you, The Audience!
description_web:
Come one and all who enjoy madrigal and polyphony / part-singing to sing along for an evening of madrigal, part-song, and *a capella* favorites performed by you, The Audience!  Lady Lorelei Skye returns as your host, along with Mistress Gianetta Andreini da Vicenza, Professor Pieter van Doorn, and other guest conductors, for an evening of musical variety. Come and make joyful music, or sit and enjoy the harmony of multiple *a capella* voices!  (Some music will be available to share, or bring your own!) 
Informal practices to be held during Peace Week on Friday, 8/1, 12-2 pm and Sunday, 3-4:30 pm; look in the class listings for more information. You do not need to attend a practice to participate in the Jam.
Song list available online:  https://docs.google.com/document/d/14Erajd1a5RMcDm7YUDN5pweB1qQownE6vQYY-NEG4jA/edit?usp=sharing

name: Whose Line Doth It Be? Performance in Amphitheater
description_book: Improv comedy competition. Audience members should bring seating. Over 110 minutes of improvisation guaranteed!
description_web: Welcome to Whose Line Doth It Be?, the improv comedy competition where anything can happen. Audience members should bring seating. Over 110 minutes of improvisation guaranteed! Would-be contestants must attend the Audition at 4PM. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.

name: Low Magick in the Middle Ages
description_book: Low magick and witchcraft in the Middle Ages: What form did magick take among the popular classes from the Dark Ages until the Renaissance?
description_web: What kind of magick was actually practiced during the Dark and Middle Ages? This is the other half of the High Magick workshop (q.v.); in this I cover the magick of the common people, the attitudes toward witchcraft and witches, and the magick people used that wasn’t considered "witchy", but was usually anti-witch, or fairy magick.

name: Mustards and Sauces Roundtable 100
description_book: Mustard? Medieval sauces? Informal meeting for those interested in making mustards and sauces. Sample and share recipes and information.
description_web: Mustard? Medieval sauces? Informal meeting for those interested in making mustards and sauces. Sample and share recipes and information. We highly encourage folks, if they so desire, to bring samples of mustards and sauces they have made. Not required at all but the more things to sample the better! We will be making up booklets to hand out at class. If any mustardiers or sauciers have recipes to share, please contact me at bookshop@charter.net to have these included in the booklet.

name: Museums and Archaeological Sites of Europe
description_book: This presentation travels through Europe and Scandinavia looking at artifacts from museums and investigating archaeological sites.
description_web: This presentation looks at artifacts from museums and archives from around Europe and Scandinavia and investigates archaeological sites that have been excavated and visited by Dread Viscountess Seelie (mka Barb Klessig, M.A., Archaeology).

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children at Runestone Hill.
description_web: 7pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend, must have adult escort.

name: Youth Combat Pole Arm Tourney
description_book: The First Youth Combat Pole Arm Tourney! Rules will be available at the Marshals' Tent.
description_web: Come enter the First Youth Combat Pole Arm Tourney! Details and Rules will be available at the Youth Combat Marshals' Tent. For those not entering the tourney the usual open-field practice time will be available.

name: The Debatable Choir
description_book: The award-winning Debatable Choir sings medieval and Renaissance music and includes a guest appearance by our friends from the Sylvan Singers
description_web: The award-winning Debatable Choir sings medieval and renaissance music by such famed composers as Michael East, Orlando di Lasso, Orazio Vecchi, John Dowland, Juan del Encina, and Adam de la Halle. Includes a guest appearance by our friends from the Sylvan Singers of the Shire of Sylvan Glen!

name: Paternosters: A Visual History of Period Prayer
description_book: Slideshow will feature images of prayer bead sets and fragments from the 12th to 16th centuries.
description_web: After a brief discussion of the history and development of prayer beads in western Europe, this slideshow will feature images of prayer bead sets and fragments from the 12th to 16th centuries.

name: Aneleda Falconbridge
description_book: Baroness Aneleda Falconbridge - songwriter, poetess, and performer of songs for modern warriors, shield maidens, and people with magic in their hearts
description_web: Baroness Aneleda Falconbridge is a songwriter, poetess, and performer of songs for modern warriors, shield maidens, and people with magic in their hearts (and probably a sword or two on their walls.) ʺI Am of the Northʺ, her first full-length album of original music, will be released in early summer 2014. She lives in the wilds of the Barony of Endewearde in the East (Maine) where the snow is deep in the winter, the forest is deep in the summer, and the people are deep all the time.

name: *i Genesii*
description_book: *i Genesii*: Love! Money! Greed! Sex! Murderation! Overwhelming beauty! Underwhelming intelligence! Terrible poetry!
description_web: Love! Money! Greed! Sex! Murderation! Overwhelming beauty! Underwhelming intelligence! Terrible poetry! All in one magnificent *Commedia dell'Arte* show, as only *i Genesii* can do! Join us for an evening of wondrous wackiness, fabulous funniness, and tenuous tastefulness!  *Show Contains Adult-Themed Content*.

name: Glass Cutting - Any Level
description_book: Want to learn how to cut glass? Know how to cut glass and wish to take your skills to the next level? Take this class! And wear closed-toed shoes.
description_web: Want to learn how to cut glass? Know how to cut glass and wish to take your skills to the next level? Make time for this class! And wear closed-toed shoes, please. This is a rolling-style class, meaning it **will not** take every person 1.5 hours, but as there are only 2 of us, and we have limited cutters and tools, each person will get about 10 minutes of one-on-one time to learn how to cut glass.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Youth Combat morning sessions, 8-10:30 AM.  Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.
description_web: Youth Combat morning sessions, 8-10:30 AM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: Food Lab Study Hall
description_book: Playtime for cooks! We got fire--You bring food! Bring your own food and recipes. Historically accurate cooking equipment, fuel and fire provided.
description_web:
Ever wanted to try hearth cooking but only had access to an electric range?  Thought about braizing in pottery but all you own is All-Clad? This is the place for you! In association with the Food Lab Classes, we have set up a Food Lab Study Hall. Bring your redacted recipes and see how they work out in our historically accurate equipment over real fire. Experts in open fire cooking will be available to help if needed. Come let your Feast Flag fly!

All participants entering the Food Lab Study Hall will be required to read the fire safety handout that will be available on site at all times.
fee_itemization: The $1 suggested donation is to cover the cost of reproducing the fire safety handout and pottery cooking handout for the Food Lab.  the $5 suggested donation is to help defray the cost of the materials for the Food Lab (fuel, cleaning supplies, etc.).

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia*, before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.

name: Populace Archery War Point Practice
description_book: Come to the archery range; practice the War Point shoots from 9-11 am during War Week except for Wednesday, August 6.
description_web: All archers can come to the archery range and practice the War Point shoots from 9 am to 11 am during War Week except Wednesday, August 6th, when the range is closed except for Archery Champions.

name: Embroidery Day
description_book: All things designed and wrought with a needle: embroidery, whitework, blackwork, tapestry, stump work and more. Displays, demonstrations and teaching.
description_web: All things designed and wrought with a needle: embroidery, whitework, blackwork, tapestry, stump work and more. Displays, demonstrations and teaching. Day organized by Lady Jaqueline de Molières with Baroness Rainillt.

name: Narrow Wares Day
description_book: All things with string including  *kumihimo*, inkle loom weaving, tablet weaving, card weaving, sprang, fingerloop braiding and lucet cording.

name: Paternoster Day
description_book: Explore this interesting art. Paternosters and prayer beads exist in most cultures and yet take very different forms. See the variety and make one.

name: A Guide to Equestrian Activities in the SCA
description_book: The types of equestrian activities practiced in the SCA. It is beneficial to the spectator and the participant.
description_web: This class will discuss types of equestrian activities practiced in the SCA. As such it is an aid to those watching the activities, enhancing their appreciation of equestrian events through an understanding of the purpose of the "games," historical background, and "scoring" for competition purposes. This class is also of benefit to those persons seeking to get involved in this exciting area of the SCA experience.

name: Heraldic Conflict Checking
description_book: The basics for the rules the heralds use to determine if two pieces of armory are too close or not, and methods for finding conflicts.
description_web: The basics for the rules the heralds use to determine if two pieces of armory are too close or not, and methods for finding conflicts. This is *not* the one using the complex conflict checking form although there will be some discussion related to it.

name: Half-Linings Considered Harmful
description_book: This class will examine fashion fabric, lining, and construction choices for the Gothic (late-14th-century) fitted dress.
description_web: This class will examine fashion fabric, lining, and construction choices for the Gothic fitted dress. Particular attention is paid to preferred choices as recorded in primary sources, and alternative options that acknowledge the widely variant needs of a lady of the Society from those of her ancestress.

name: Twisties and Complex Decoration
description_book: Making twisted decorations and stringer to apply to glass beads. You've made your beads; now decorate them.
description_web: You've made your beads; now decorate them. Learn about different techniques to make twisted stringers and then apply them to different shapes of beads.

name: Soap: Reading and Using Period Recipes
description_book: Details of two period soap recipes: units of measurement, terms, differences from modern practice, resources to help in redactions.
description_web: This class takes a closer look at two period soap recipes: a 13th-century Yemeni soap made from sesame oil, and a 16th-century Italian soap made from olive oil. Units of measurement and terminology used in the sources will be examined and explained, with resources for deciphering the units and terms provided. We will also discuss how period recipes and techniques differ from modern soapmaking practice, the possible reasons for those differences, and how it affects the final product.
fee_itemization: There will be a limited number of samples of the two soaps available to take home and try. No fee, but donations are welcome.

name: Babies at Pennsic: A Discussion
description_book: How to deal with babies and small children at Pennsic: a discussion by and for those who have done it, are doing it, or will do it.

name: Using a Turkish Drop Spindle
description_book: An introduction to hand-spinning with a focus on the special characteristics of a Turkish style spindle. Practice drafting, winding on, and plying.
description_web: An introduction to hand-spinning with a focus on the special characteristics of a Turkish style spindle. Practice drafting, winding on, and plying. Use spindle during class for free; take it home for $20.

name: Viking Ornamentation: Viking Treasure Necklace
description_book: Participants review historical evidence, then create their own Viking-era treasure necklace.
description_web: Participants review historical evidence, then create their own Viking-era treasure necklace. You may wish to bring one focal bead, medallion, or Thor's hammer. Small site tokens also work well. **Or** just come string beads with Brigitta! Adults or older children (age 12 and up with parent).

name: Stone Spinning Whorls Made with Simple Supplies
description_book: This class will show how to make a common stone spinning whorl with tools and stone available at hardware stores. It's easy, inexpensive and period!
description_web: The most common 11th - 14th-century Anglo-Norse spindle whorls were made of various types of soft stone with a tapered, centered hole. While stone appears intimidating to work with, choosing the correct stone makes it fairly simple to do. This class will reveal the secrets to making stone whorls with standard hardware store stone and tools! As a spindle spinner, making your own whorls allows you to produce various weights and sizes.

name: Researching on The Internet
description_book: How to use the Internet to find reliable, accurate information. If there is time we will try to solve individual research issues for the students.
description_web: How to use the Internet to find reliable, accurate information. If there is time, we will try to solve individual research issues for the students. Includes a handout of recommended URLs and techniques for locating more.

name: Fun with Interkingdom Anthropology
description_book: How do you do things in your kingdom? Tell us, and we'll tell you how we do it in ours. Trust us, we will all learn a lot.
description_web:
How do you do things in your kingdom? Tell us, and we'll tell you how we do it in ours. Trust us, we will all learn a lot. 

If you have ever traveled in the SCA, you know things can be very different from kingdom to kingdom. Even though we have a lot in common, we have differences, too. Let's talk about them.

name: ASHI CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer
description_book: Designed for individuals in the healthcare or professional rescuer field who are required to have a professional-level basic life support training.
description_web: CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer program is designed for individuals in the healthcare or professional rescuer field who are required to have a professional-level basic life support training. Students learn how to recognize a life-threatening emergency, how to provide basic life support and what to do in case of an airway obstruction or choking. ASHI's CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer has been approved for training for Emergency Medical Services personnel and is accepted by the National Registry of Emergency Medical Technicians (NREMT). Class length: 7 hours
fee_itemization: Separate fee for certification card or course materials.

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.
description_web: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.

name: Intro to Woodworking: Axe, Adze, Froe, Drawknife
description_book: Introduction to the use of axes for woodworking. Selection, sharpening and safety emphasized, then moving on to drawknives.
description_web: Intro to use of hatchets, axes and adzes for woodworking and wood carving. Since these tools are potentially the most dangerous of any of the tools in our woodworking arsenal, I feel it is imperative that correct safe methods be introduced to our population. Selection, sharpening, handling and safety will be covered. The class will segue into the class on rendering log sections into furniture parts with the use of the froe, drawknife, shavehorse, and spokeshave

name: Reforging Hammers
description_book: This class will show the basics of how to rework common hammers into hard-to-find tools.

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Ansteorran Rapier Tournament
description_book: Her Majesty Ansteorra does invite duelists across the Knowne World to join Her on the fields of Pennsic for a grand tourney. Come show your prowess.
description_web: Her Majesty Ansteorra does invite duelists across the Knowne World to join Her on the fields of Pennsic for a grand tourney. Come show your prowess, your valor, and your heart. There will be fighting enough for all. Her Majesty reserves the right to alter the tourney format to give the most fun for all those who enter, which will be fought under Ansteorran Conventions. There will be a sumptuous repast for all those entering. Join your comrades, your brothers and sisters in arms....for glory and fame!

name: SCA Rapier Combat for Historic Martial Artists
description_book: Field time for HMA-interested fencers to meet, teach, learn, and spar.
description_web:
This is a place and time for SCA fencers who are interested in, or are actively pursuing, the study of historic martial arts in the context of SCA rapier rules. During this time, you can meet others with similar interests, offer to teach, look to learn, or just come out to spar with the like-minded.

A daily sign-up sheet will allow those in attendance to connect with others with matched goals for the day (e.g. someone willing to teach Fabris can find students wanting to learn, or vice versa, or someone looking for a fight can get one), and each day will end with special HMA-related sparring challenges.

name: Reconstructing Archaeological Textiles
description_book: In this 2-part, hands-on class, students weave several reconstructions of textiles from archaeological context. Fee includes use of loom and yarn.
description_web: In this 2-part, hands-on class, students will weave several reconstructions of textiles from archaeological context, illustrating structure, fibers and tools used, and time involved in creating textiles prior to industrialization. Use of loom and all supplies for completing samples included in class fee.
fee_itemization: handouts, supplies for completing woven samples

name: Build a Bellows for Your Camp Fire
description_book: Each student will build a functional camp fire bellows from the provided materials.
description_web: Students will build a working set of bellows that can be used for their camp fire. Each student will be provided materials, patterns, and the use of tools to make their bellows. When complete, the bellows will be usable to help start your fire without having to huff and puff. There will be an hour break in the class for lunch. Lunch will be on your own.

instructor: Lady Nina Amaya of Bright Hills
name: Dancing with a Veil: Performance Track
description_book: A modesty garment or... your dance partner? Learn to swoop and glide, wrap and floof a silk veil to best effect. Bring or borrow a 3-yard rectangle.
description_web: A silk veil is a beautiful and sensuous dance partner; learn to move in harmony with it! Dazzle your audience with an ethereal vision of you and your silk. Learn swoops, swirls, turns, and tricks. This workshop will cover traditional use of the veil in Middle Eastern dance: entrances, illusions and interactions. Bring or borrow a 3-yard rectangle.

name: Getting Youth into the Scribal Arts
description_book: Geared to kids who are interested in the scribal arts, specifically Illumination. Step-by-step instructions on how to get started with a Youth Scribe
description_web: The Scribal Arts know no age limit. In this class, youth will be instructed on how to find images appropriate for their age, that tracing is OK, and the basics of painting.

name: Adv. Calligraphy: *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*
description_book: Learn Rotunda lowercase, Rotunda caps, Italic, and cadels. Take your calligraphy to the next level. Four two-hour sessions. Not for beginners.
description_web: The *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta* is a late-period Renaissance master’s showcase. In this four-day, in-depth study, students will learn scripts used in this manuscript: Rotunda lowercase, Rotunda caps, Italic, and cadels. Take your calligraphy to the next level with our tips on analyzing scripts. Plan to attend all four two-hour sessions. Not suitable for beginners.
fee_itemization: calligraphy marker, watercolor paper, specialty nib, supplies, color handouts.  $10 fee, payable 8/4, covers all 4 classes.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: Intro to the ADA
