description_book: How the Americans with Disabilities Act works with the hobby we love. Ideas on what to do and how to do it, as well as what not to do and why.
description_web: How the Americans with Disabilities Act works with the hobby we love. If you are autocrating an event, or just wondering what your options are under the ADA, here are ideas on what to do and how to do it, as well as what not to do and why.

name: Lucet: Beyond Square Cord
description_book: You can make good square cord; what's next? Flat and multi-color cords. Bring your lucet. (We can slip a cord off and put it back on after class.)
description_web: You’re comfortable making square cord; what's next? We'll work on flat and multi-color cords. Please bring your lucet. We'll also demonstrate how to slip a cord off, and put it back on after class.
fee_itemization: (3) colors of floss on cards, and handout

name: Pennsic Without a Cooler
description_book: How to feed yourself period food at long camping events without the use of a cooler.

name: Shakespeare Wrote Shakespeare
description_book: An examination of the evidence that Shakespeare wrote the works attributed to him. Skeptics welcome.
description_web: Some doubt that Shakespeare of Stratford wrote the works attributed to him. An examination of the evidence reveals not only that Shakespeare did indeed write Shakespeare but also many fascinating things about Elizabethan life, in court, in the theater, and in their everyday world. Skeptics welcome.

name: Cheese Recipes from 16th-Century Italy
description_book: Instructions for making and cooking with cheese from 16th-century Italian sources including Scappi.
description_web: Instructions for making cheese are rare in the SCA period, yet 16th-century Italian sources have them. I will be sharing instructions for making cheese and other dairy items taken from period sources. In addition, 16th-century Italian cheese varieties and their use in recipes and menus will be covered. Please note, I am not a cheesemaker, I am a cook. So if you want to volunteer to make cheese based on these instructions to share with the class, please contact me.

name: Origami for Beginners
description_book: Learn the ancient art and traditional forms of Japanese paper folding as well as the history.
description_web: Learn the ancient art of Japanese paper folding. Come learn traditional Japanese forms used and learn the history. Students will get paper to take and work on project at home.

name: An Organized Tent Is a Happy Tent
description_book: Tips to help your encampment be a happier place. Class is run as a roundtable discussion. Please bring something to sit on.

name: Henna History and Application
description_book: Learn how and why henna was used in period, and how you can use it yourself. We will mix some henna in class; everyone gets some to try.
description_web: Learn how and why henna was used in period, including traditions, materials, and techniques, and how you can use it yourself today. We will mix some henna in class, which for me (becoming a professional artist) was the hardest part to learn; everyone gets some to use and take.
fee_itemization: One cone of fresh henna paste. You may also take the class without this, or bring your own.

name: *Basse Danse* Two Ways
description_book: Come explore two "low dances" -  *Danse de Cleves* and *Jouyssance Vous Donneray*. Both dances are featured in Tuesday evening's Ball.
description_web: Come explore two "low dances" -  *Danse de Cleves* and *Jouyssance Vous Donneray*. This version of *Danse de Cleves* is the Cleftlands' reconstruction by Sibylla of Amaysa. Both dances are featured in Tuesday evening's Ball.

name: Introduction to *Shogi*
description_book: We'll go over the basic rules of *Shogi* or "Japanese Chess", and describe a few historic variants.
description_web: We'll go over the basic rules of *Shogi* or "Japanese Chess", and describe a few historic variants.

name: Intro to Woodworking: Splitting, Riving, Shaving
description_book: Intro to splitting, riving and shaving. You got your log, now you need to make it into parts.
description_web: Moving on from axe safety, this class covers use of wedges, gluts, froes, riving brake, drawknife, spokeshave, and marking gauge to take split down lumps of wood and make them into usable parts.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: KW Choir: Known World Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: Join the Known World Choir and prepare a concert of *a capella* choral music! Enthusiastic amateurs-expert singers are all welcome!
description_web: Join the Pennsic Known World Choir! Enthusiastic amateurs-expert singers are all welcome! Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on the final Thursday of War week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is extremely helpful, but not required if you are willing to put in the effort to learn the music in advance. Sheet music and part-learning tracks are available online now at the KWChoir Yahoo group: https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/KWChoir/info.
fee_itemization: Limited packets of sheet music available for $3.00. Otherwise, download pre-Pennsic or you may print at Mystic Mail

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: For all levels and teachers. Drills focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Études* for drill; elements from drill used to work in groups.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Beginners' *Atlatl* Throwing (Morning)
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.
description_web: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.

name: Estrogen and Axes
description_book: Ladies of the Known World, this is a thrown weapons competition just for you, no men allowed. Axes only event. By THL Catriona inghean Ragnaill.
description_web: Ladies of the Known World, this is a thrown weapons competition just for you, no men allowed. Axes only event. By THL Catriona inghean Ragnaill.

name: Teaching Youth to Throw
description_book: How to teach thrown weapons to youth. This is a recommended class for MITs and marshals. By Lady Dominique and Master Arinwald Rotstein.
description_web: How to teach thrown weapons to youth. This is a recommended class for MITs and marshals. By Lady Dominique and Master Arinwald Rotstein.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class.We have three wonderful, new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Intermediate Medieval Music Notation
description_book: Ligatures and perfection, for those comfortable with long note values, no bar lines, and funky clefs. Bring melody instruments you play fluently.
description_web: For those already comfortable with long note values, unbarred music, *musica ficta*, and clefs other than treble and bass. We'll learn some more advanced stuff: ligatures for combinations of *breves* and *longas*, and the weird world of triple meter, where the same note-head can mean several different durations in the same piece depending on context. Bring melody instruments (recorder, harp, fiddle, lute, etc.) that you play fluently. Voice is OK if you have good pitch sense. If recorder, bring several sizes if possible.

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: The basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. BYO drum.
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. BYO Drum.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*
Day 4- *Kashlimah* and other strange stuff

name: Known World Celebration of Hats: A Hatter's Tea
description_book: Hat enthusiasts of the Known World are cordially invited to join us for a tea-and-cookies reception. Wear your best creation!
description_web: Hat enthusiasts of the Known World are cordially invited to join Duchess Ilish O'Donovan and Baroness Clarice Roan for a tea-and-cookies-reception. Wear the hat creation you are most proud of and bring pictures of the rest and share your ideas and creativity.

name: Archery Populace War Point
description_book: Archery Populace War Point
description_web: All archers young and old are encouraged to come and lend their support to their kingdom's efforts, and to display their skill at archery. There will be 3 challenging populace shoots to test skills. Each Kingdom will be competing to earn the 3 War Points for each shoot.

name: Melon Glass Beads: Their Beginnings and Beyond
description_book: A bead that truly survived the test of time...join us for discussion and also hands-on time!
description_web: The melon bead was one of the earliest types of beads made, and also made by many many cultures! Join us for discussion on the beads - their evolution through time and location - as well as making our own melon beads!

name: Poland: How Its Poetry Relates to Its History
description_book: Poland’s history, culture and language reflected in its poetry.
description_web: Poland’s history, culture and language are closely reflected in its poetry. We will look at a brief history of Poland and the poetry that was being written at that time. We will also discuss how Poland’s poetry differed from other medieval poetry.

name: Pouch for Kids
description_book: Hands-on class for making a leather pouch.This class is family-friendly and youth/children are encouraged to participate. Responsible adult required.
description_web: A hands-on class for making a leather pouch.This class is family-friendly and youth/children are encouraged to participate. Responsible adult required.

name: Everyday Elizabethan for the Middling Sort
description_book: What did working and middle class people wear in Elizabethan England? Learn the  building blocks of a comfortable, everyday outfit for men or women.
description_web: What did working and middle class people wear in Elizabethan England? What layers, what fibers, what fabrics? Learn what goes into a comfortable, everyday outfit. Look at different possibilities and get ideas for designing your own mid- to late-16th-century wardrobe. For men and women. The focus is on English ensembles, but other western European sources will be used also.

name: Beginner Beadwork
description_book: History of beadwork within the SCA period. Techniques for beading on fabric.
description_web: History of beadwork within the SCA period. Techniques for beading on fabric.

name: Children's Doll Meet
description_book: This class is open to children ages 3-18 years of age. Please bring your favorite doll to the class, as you will be making something for your doll.
description_web: This class is open to children ages 3-18 years of age. Please bring your favorite doll to the class, as we will be making something for them. All dolls are welcome; ball jointed, cloth, plastic, porcelain, anime.

name: Cartomancy: Divination with Playing Cards
description_book: The latest research on period history of cartomancy, or divination with cards including Tarot. We have a timeline and period how-to books in hand!
description_web: A special focus on the art of cartomancy, or divination by cards. We will cover the very latest research on history and methods of card divination in period, with both the standard French deck and the Tarot. We will put to rest the long-standing controversy of whether this art was performed in period by providing a timetable of period sources, making it clear that the art was commonplace. Most exciting of all, we will examine a facsimile edition of an Italian “how to” cartomancy book, originally published in 1540.

name: Medieval Genealogy Roundtable
description_book: A discussion of medieval genealogy, sources and techniques as well as period examples.
description_web: A discussion of medieval genealogy, sources and techniques as well as period examples. As a follow-up to past classes on medieval genealogy, this class will start with a review of techniques and sources and will culminate in a round-table discussion.

name: Four-Couple English Country Dance
description_book: Many of Playford's most interesting dances are done with four couples. Come and learn a few! Dancers of all levels welcome.
description_web: Many of Playford's most interesting dances are done with four couples. Come and learn a few! Dances taught will include *Lord of Carnavann's Jegg, Goddesses, If All the World Were Paper*, and *Newcastle*. Dancers of all levels welcome.

name: Glass Gilding: *Verre Églomisé*
description_book: Create a small *verre églomisé* (glass gilding) item using period glass water gilding technique.
description_web: Glass gilding, or *verre églomisé*, used in Roman antiquity, reached great popularity in the 14th and 15th centuries. It was often incorporated into reliquaries, furniture, and *object d'art*. Participants will create a small *verre églomisé* work using the *églomisé* water gilding technique.

name: Intro to 6-on-2 Chainmail
description_book: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail. All materials provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
description_web: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail prevalent throughout period across multiple cultures. All materials necessary to complete class project provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
fee_itemization: Sufficient hand-turned & cut enameled copper rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter; to complete class project

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a trim strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a trim strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: Making, Care and Feeding of Thrown Weapons
description_book: How to make and maintain your weapons. Not only how to pass inspection, but also to extend their life and improve performance with a minimum of tools.
description_web: How to make and maintain your weapons. Not only how to pass inspection, but also how to extend their life and improve performance with a minimum of tools.

name: Melodic Middle Eastern Drumming
description_book: Join us for Middle Eastern drumming with a twist! Includes melodic and harmonic playing with hand drumming fundamentals. All exp. levels welcome.

name: Armored Woods Battle
description_book: Armored Woods Battle consists of two battles, 1 hour each, with 30-minute switch time.
description_web: Armored Woods Battle consists of two battles, 1 hour each, with 30-minute switch time.

instructor: THL Don Po Silvertop the Rogue
name: Known World Rapier Cadet Tournament
description_book: Open to those who are sponsored by a person who has a kingdom’s highest award for rapier. Format: traditional double elim tourney.
description_web: Come join rapier combatants from across the Known World in the second annual Cadet Tournament. This tournament will be open to those who are sponsored by a person who has a kingdom’s highest award for rapier. This includes the Order of the White Scarf, Order of the Bronze Ring, Order of the Golden Rapier, The Dragon's Steel, The Order of Thorbjorn's Hammer, The Order of the Queen's Blade, and The Meridian Order of the Blade or equivalent award. A person may sponsor more than one entrant. Sponsors will be required to sign in their cadet, or send a letter of entrance. If you need a sponsor, we will find one for you. This will be a traditional double elimination tournament. Each bout shall be fought to a single kill. Double kills will be re-fought one time. On the second double kill, “Dead is dead!” The finals will be fought best two out of three. All bouts shall be fought with default Pennsic rules.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): i Sebastiani - Amphitheater
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: Bow and Arrow Tuning for the Begining Archer
description_book: An introduction on how and why to make adjustments to your equipment for proper shooting, followed by a test shooting at the range.
description_web:
An introduction on how and why to make adjustments to your equipment for proper shooting. This will include the how to choose the proper spine for your arrows, based on your bow, then fine tuning your bow for the best arrow flight. 
After the lecture/adjustment portion we will take our equipment to the range to see how the arrows fly.
*Note: Tuning is a process that can take many hours. While we can and will make some quick rough adjustments, archers will need to dedicate themselves to the proper maintenance of their equipment.

instructor: Master Dani of the Seven Wells
name: Medieval Wales
description_book: An introduction to pre-conquest Wales. A bit of Welsh history, a bit of Welsh law, a bit more on Welsh society.

name: *Mon*: Heraldic Devices in Medieval Japan
description_book: Learn about the history, usage, and design of *mon* (Japanese heraldic devices) and how authentic Japanese *mon* can be registered in the SCA.

name: Introduction to Falconry
description_book: Introduction to the basics of laws concerning birds and responsibilities of being a falconer.

name: Introduction to Enameling
description_book: An introduction the history of and process of enameling reproduction using modern tools. Will have finished item. Max of 6 participants.
description_web: An introduction the history of and process of enameling reproduction using modern tools. Will have finished item. Max of 6 participants.
fee_itemization:
$3 fee for information handout.
$5 recovering costs of enameling.

name: Persian Culinary Plants
description_book: Find out the range of edible plants available in Persia. This will cover cultivated and wild plants as well as availability and scientific names.
description_web: There's more to cooking Persian food than the plants you find at the grocery store. Find out the range of plants in Persia that were available and edible. This class will cover a comprehensive list of cultivated and wild plants. I will also discuss US availability, accurate scientific names, and more.

name: Palm and Face Reading
description_book: A “hands on” class on fortune telling via palmistry and the Asian art of face reading. Bring at least one hand and one face to class.
description_web: A “hands on” class on fortune telling via palmistry and the Asian art of face reading. To reduce the instructor’s out-of-pocket expenses, all students are requested to bring at least one hand and one face to class.

name: Dressing Like a 14th-Century Venetian
description_book: Discuss the differences in style and aesthetic between the Italian Peninsula and Western Europe in the 14th century.

name: The Cornett and the Serpent: Renaissance Brass?
description_book: Made of wood, played with a brass-type mouth piece and fingered like a recorder. A hands-on discussion about the cornett and serpent.
description_web: Once a favorite of composers and now obscure, the cornett is a musical instrument with a trumpet-type mouth piece that is made of wood and fingered like a recorder. The larger serpent, which filled the need for bass instrument, is a late-period ancestor of the modern tuba. Are they brass or woodwind? Join in for a hands-on discussion about these instruments, information on where to buy, and how to play.

name: In Pursuit of Playford
description_book: Lovely afternoon English Country dances. All levels, no partner needed. Musicians welcome to join the open band. Some light refreshments available.
description_web: Please join us for a ball that is open to all levels of dancers (partners and fancy garb not necessary). We will focus on English Country Dances from John Playford’s The English Dancing Master. We will enjoy dances at all levels. There will be dances appropriate for beginners as well as more challenging dances for advanced dancers. Music will be provided by an open band assembled at Pennsic. We welcome musicians to join us in our celebration. In addition, there will be light refreshments available.

name: Youth Rapier Fencing Melée Castle Battle
description_book: Fencing for ages 6-17. Note: Younger fencers will fight 1-on-1 at the portcullis.
description_web: Fencing for ages 6 to 17. Older fencers will fence in groups at the main gate. Younger fencers in a single line by the portcullis. Winning groups from each section will fight to determine the winning side. Scenario will be repeated several times.  Melée instruction and teaching will be provided. Any questions, please call or see Don Alfosno Pontelli (EKYRM).

name: Barter Town Meeting
description_book: Meeting of the Barter Town Citizens
description_web: Annual Meet and Greet

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: 10 Songs Everyone in the SCA Could Know
description_book: Ten cool, kingdom-neutral songs that have something to say about life in these current Middle Ages. We'll sing through them together.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): *Sans Nomen* Dress Rehearsal
description_book: Space in Use
description_web: Space in Use

name: Norse Poetry Overview
description_book: Talk like Egil Skalagrimson! We will go over rhythm and alliteration, how to write in Norse verse; we'll talk about the ways poetry was used.
description_web: Iambic pentameter got you down? Want to know what exactly a “ring giver” is? Do you want to write a line that ends with "silver?" Are you a fan of Egil Skalagrimson (who isn't?)? Come on over, and we’ll go over the basics of Viking poetry. I will go over how Norse poetry alliterates, talk about the types and ways Norse poetry was used, and go over poetic devices such as *kennings*. We'll then go over style and format, and the specific forms Norse poetry takes. Whether you want to try your hand at writing it, or just want a better appreciation of the form, stop by!

name: Seven Shimmies with Samira
description_book: Learn classic-era Egyptian shimmies, how to layer them, travel with them and more!
description_web: Learn classic-era Egyptian shimmies, how to layer them, travel with them and where they work best in your favorite music. Samira helps you find your body’s best shimmies and which shimmies are “friends” with each other. Includes Samira’s Crossover Coaching; how to use this musicality in different styles of the belly dance tree from Vintage Oriental to *Raqs Sharqi* to tribal fusion.

name: Intermediate Middle Eastern Drumming: 7/8 and 10/8
description_book: Add to your repertoire odd-numbered rhythms played in 7/8 and 10/8. *Samai*, *Curcuna, Laz*, and variations are covered. Beginners welcome.

instructor: Baroness Juliana Rosalia Dolce di Siena
name: Heraldry for Scribes
description_book: Beginner-level scribal class covers the basics of heraldry and resources to include badges and arms on your scrolls. Also open to new heralds.
description_web: This beginner-level scribal class will cover the basics of heraldry, blazoning and emblazoning, and resources for including badges and arms on your scrolls. There will be a hands-on portion where students will get to translate blazoning. This class is also open to new heralds.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web:
Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater Wednesday 8/6 6-7 pm.
You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Spin in Time
description_book: A roundtable discussion of spinners who have chosen to focus on (for their persona) period fibers and tools within the context of the SCA.
description_web: A roundtable discussion of spinners who have chosen to focus on (for their persona) period fibers and tools within the context of the SCA. Spinning on a modern wheel or spindle is one thing; looking to recreate spinning as your persona would have done it is another. This is an opportunity for spinners to come together and discuss what they have learned plus new theories and information they have come across.

name: Choosing An SCA-Registerable Name
description_book: What will work and what likely won't when choosing an SCA name the College will register.
description_web: Names are important. They are often the first thing other people have to form an opinion of us. We can invest a lot of time and emotion in coming up with a name. However, if it doesn't follow reasonable historical practice or general SCA standards, it won't be registered. In this class we'll discuss what the SCA requires in a name, what was generally historically done, and how to avoid heartache over your desired name.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Runes: The Elder & Anglo-Saxon/Frisian *Futharks*
description_book: Origins and usage of *futharks*, including mercantile, cyphers and codes, magic, "this is mine!", rune names, and more.
description_web: From the earliest identifiable runic inscriptions to their decline, the Elder and the Anglo-Saxon/Frisian were the commonly used characters in epigraphic inscriptions. We will look at rune origins and meanings, use in trade and identifying goods, codes and cyphers, magic, and regional variations, and the bracteate tradition, as well as other venues.

name: Persian Gardens
description_book: This class will cover the basic tenets of Persian garden design, cultivated plants, and ideas on how to translate this into a home garden.
description_web: This class will cover the basic tenets of Persian Garden design and plants known to have been cultivated. In addition, I will offer ideas on how to translate ancient gardens into a contemporary setting.

name: Medieval Pinwheels
description_book: Based on illuminations, pinwheels were a common toy of the 15th and 16th centuries. We will examine the various styles of pinwheels and make one.
description_web: Based on illuminations, pinwheels were a common toy of the 15th and 16th centuries. We will examine the various styles of pinwheels and make one to take home. Fun for adults and children. Children should be accompanied based on their tool-using skills.

name: The Sine Quadrant in Theory and Practice
description_book: The Sine Quadrant is a period calculating device. This class will discuss the history and theory of it and provide hands-on experience.
description_web: The Sine Quadrant or Rubu Markahb is a period calculating device. This class will discuss the history and theory of the Sine Quadrant and provide extensive, hands-on practical experience. Details at http://astrolabeproject.com
fee_itemization: Fee covers part of the cost of a large (25+ page) handout.

name: Law in the Lands of Peace
description_book: A class on *Fiqh*, Muslim law, taught in persona from the point of view of the Maliki school.
description_web: A class on *Fiqh*, Muslim law, taught in persona from the point of view of the Maliki school.

name: Leather Corners for Wooden Book Covers
description_book: Learn how to make the four most common corners using leather on wooden book covers; make samples.
description_web: Students will learn how to make the four most common corners using leather on wooden book covers. Each student will make four sample corners. All tools will be loaned by instructor. This is a hands-on class.
fee_itemization: Fee covers both a handout and the wood, leather, thread to make the samples.

name: *Grisaille* Painting: Overview and Technique
description_book: Monochrome illuminations are done using shades of a single color. Learn the historical background and practice your technique in this hands-on class.
description_web: Monochrome illuminations are done using shades of a single color. Learn the historical background of this period technique and practice your skills in this hands-on class. Bring paintbrushes, paint mixing trays, pencil, beige paper or pergamenata, black ink, and black and white paints, if you have them.

name: A History of Playing Cards
description_book: The cards themselves from Eastern origins and Asian influences, to their introduction and development in Europe and beyond.
description_web: A discussion of the game system, its origins, art and migration through Europe's introduction and romance with playing cards. Migration routes and production techniques, as well as myth debunking and cultural influences will be included.
fee_itemization: Donations to cover costs appreciated, and contributions will be made to the royal travel fund

name: European Sausage in SCA Periods
description_book: Survey of the types of sausages available, condiments served with them, as well as how to replicate sausages in your kitchen.
description_web: Survey of the types of sausages made in SCA periods in Europe, condiments/sauces that were served with them, and discussion and tips for replicating these types of sausages at home in your kitchen. Free hand-out with extensive bibliography.

name: Fun with Body Parts II: Pilgrimage
description_book: Need the personal intervention of a saint? Pay him or her a visit! An irreverent look at the hundreds of thousands who left home on pilgrimage.
description_web: Need the personal intervention of a saint? Pay him or her a visit! An irreverent look at the hundreds of thousands who left home on pilgrimage: who went, why, and where. Taught by someone who has been to the Big Three: Compostela, Rome, Jerusalem.

name: Basic Tablet Weaving
description_book: Learn to warp the loom and weave a basic pattern. Limited number of small looms and materials available for use and/or purchase.

name: *Itamae*: Samurai Chef
description_book: An introduction to the food, food culture, cookery, rituals of the meal, and the culinary calendar of pre-modern Japan.
description_web: What did *Pimiko, Shotoku-taishi*, the Shining *Genji*, *Dogen*, and *Hideyoshi* eat? An introduction to the food, food culture, cookery, rituals of the meal, and the culinary calendar of pre-modern Japan.

name: Introduction to Crocheting
description_book: A beginner's class to introduce basic crocheting skills.
fee_itemization: Ten dollar material fee covers your choice of crochet needle, 2 balls of yarn, refreshments and informational handout

name: Multiplayer Table Games
description_book: Four- and seven-player backgammon will be taught depending on attendance. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.
description_web: Four- and seven-player backgammon will be taught depending on attendance. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.

name: KW Choir: Children's Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: The KW Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert.
description_web: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert on Thursday of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon 8/7 in the PAT, details TBA during regular rehearsals.)

name: Interkingdom Thrown Weapons Tournament
description_book: Interkingdom tournament open to the Knowne World. By THL Elayne Thorne and Baron Gareth Thorne
description_web: Contestants are required to throw knife, ax and spear at a variety of targets. This  annual competition is open to everyone from every kingdom. Come on out and try for bragging rights to call yourself the Interkingdom Thrown Weapons Champion for the year. By THL Elayne Thorne and Baron Gareth Thorne

name: From Text to Voice
description_book: Converting traditional tales from text to oral form and why there's a difference.
description_web: Traditional stories from around the world have been recorded in writing, but the forms used by writers differ from those we use orally. This class addresses reasons why writers' versions vary from both the oral forms and each other, and how to give them voice. Students will have opportunity to retell stories during class; books will be available for reference but you are welcome and encouraged to bring a story you'd like to play with.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

instructor: Baroness Una de Saint Luc, OL, OP
name: Color Theory for Scribes
description_book: This class will help scribes to have a better understanding of color theory and what was used in period.
description_web: This class will help scribes to have a better understanding of color theory and terminology. We will also briefly talk about some of the colors that were used in history and how beginner scribes can take their work to the next level.

name: Juggling 201 (Intermediate)
description_book: Intermediate  3-ball juggling. Going beyond the simple cascade. We will touch briefly on 4 and 5 balls as well.
description_web: Intermediate 3-ball juggling. Learn several basic tricks, such as crosses, snatches, and reverse cascade. We may work our way into basic 2-, 4-, and 5-ball juggling as they apply. Juggling balls will be available for use and purchase, ranging from $5-$10.

name: Heraldic Customer Service
description_book: How to be a better local officer/consultation herald with a few, relatively painless, changes.
description_web: So you went to the bathroom during the bizmeet and now you're the herald. Or maybe you've been your group's herald since Cariadoc was a bootblack and there's no one to take over the office. Come learn some ways to be a better officer and serve your group without letting the heraldry go by the wayside.

name: Baba Yaga, the Arch-Villainess of Russian Folklore
description_book: Baba Yaga is a common character in Russian fairy tales. We will discuss the diverse roles she plays, and look into the origins of the character.
description_web: Baba Yaga is a common character in Russian and Eastern European fairy tales. We will discuss the diverse roles she plays, and look into the origins of the character. (Some familiarity with Russian folklore is helpful, but not really required.)

name: Service Dogs in the SCA
description_book: What is a service dog? How do service dogs fit into the hobby we love and how do we adapt?
description_web: What is a service dog? How do service dogs fit into the hobby we love and how do we adapt?

name: German Renaissance Roundtable
description_book: *Achtung*! German personas, Landsknechts, and curious parties, join our roundtable chat and share ideas on clothing, history, laws, and more.
description_web: *Achtung*! German personas, Landsknechts, and curious parties, join our roundtable chat and share ideas on clothing, history, laws, and more. Handouts, clothing examples, artifacts, armaments, and books will be on hand. Wear your German garb and bring your German projects and ideas!

name: *De Lapidibus*
description_book: A class on gemstones, taught in persona, based on period sources.
description_web: A class on gemstones, taught in persona, based on period sources.
fee_itemization: no materials, probably a one page handout.

name: Be Thou a Good Webminister
description_book: Clean web design, compliance issues and copyrights, oh my!
description_web: On being a good local web administrator. Focuses on clear design, being in compliance, and copyright issues. For the newish web administrator, but is a good review for old-timers, too.

name: *Samurai* Style: *Moyoyama* (1568-1600)
description_book: A look at clothing and accessories in the *Moyoyama* era (focusing on men), including wearing of swords and other weapons.
description_web: A look at men's clothing and accessories in the *Moyoyama* era (focusing on men),  including wearing of swords and other weapons.

name: *Seppuku*: Salvation Through the Door of Pain.
description_book: A discussion of the ritual and use of ceremonial suicide within period.
description_web: A discussion of the ritual and use of ceremonial suicide within period.

name: Beginner Dance: 15th-Century Italian C
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn fun, simple dances from 15th-century Italy.

name: Siege Competition
description_book: Siege Competition

name: Heart-Thumping Drum Solos
description_book: Learn how to capture the magic of the drums in your dancing. Structure, rhythms, shimmies, accents and more!
description_web: In classic Egyptian-era dancing, the drum solo was the highlight. Learn how to capture that magic through musical choice, dynamic changes, travels, accents, and shimmies galore. Includes "Rhythm Dissection", Samira’s tutorial on how to understand and find the meter and rhythm as well as "Samira’s Crossover Coaching"; how to use this musicality in all different styles of the belly dance tree.

name: KW Choir: Youth Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: The KW Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 18 to learn period vocal music and performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert.
description_web: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 18 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella*. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert on Thursday of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon 8/7 in the PAT, details TBA during regular rehearsals.)

name: PA Series: Knowne World Pennsic Harp Celebration
description_book: Open to all harpers of the Knowne World! Perform any SCA-appropriate piece, harp or harp and vocal, five minutes or less in length.
description_web: Open to all harpers of the Knowne World! Perform any SCA-appropriate piece, harp or harp and vocal, five minutes or less in length. Audience and non-performing harpers welcome.

instructor: Lord archer bear horseman of rockbr
name: Make Your Own Flemish String for Any Bow
description_book: Make a string for your recurve, long bow, horse bow or crossbow using modern B-50 Dacron.
fee_itemization: String material, Serving material, nock material

name: Norse Apron Dress
description_book: How to pattern and construct a Norse apron dress. If possible, bring 2 yards of fabric, scissors, and fabric pen, though not necessary for the class.
description_web: How to pattern and construct a Norse apron dress. If possible,bring 2 yards of fabric, scissors, and fabric pen, though not necessary for the class.

name: What IPA Can Do For the SCA
description_book: A crash course on the International Phonetic Alphabet and how it can be useful to heralds, wordsmiths, performers, and all in between.
description_web:
An alphabet only has two rules to make it an alphabet.

1) Each letter has to represent a sound.
2) A single sound can not be represented by more than one letter.

The problem is that as a language develops, the rules of the alphabet are broken. This is why IPA (the International Phonetic Alphabet) is such a completely amazing tool that has been used by linguists over the past 100 years.

IPA, being an *international* alphabet, is able to transcribe the sounds made by any language at any time period. This is so important to us in our hobby because with one alphabet of symbols we can recreate the sounds of any name from any culture, and as we all learn the symbols together, we can all pronounce the names in a standardized way. There will be no more questioning, as long as the name is written in these symbols.

This class is a crash course in IPA for anyone interested in pronunciations and language, focused on how helpful it would be in the SCA for heralds, wordsmiths, and performers.

name: "Paisley Is Not Period": Ottoman Textile Motifs
description_book: A survey of Ottoman textile motifs: botanical and cultural significance of designs and how to make wiser fabric choices for recreating Ottoman garb.
description_web: A survey of Ottoman textile motifs: botanical and cultural significance of designs and how to make wiser fabric choices for recreating Ottoman garb. Twenty-page handout will be available while they last; information will also be made available online.

name: Comparison of Tudor and Modern Ale Brewing
description_book: Review and compare Tudor era ale brewing (as shown on Tudor Monastery Farm) to modern home and commercial brewing. From planting barley to drinking!

name: Burn the Coloring Pages, Toss Out the Foam Crowns!
description_book: Fun, hands-on youth activity ideas.
description_web: Fun, hands-on activity ideas for running a youth point that shares knowledge about medieval life and/or life in our Society. There is an optional $6 fee if you want to actually make and take samples.
fee_itemization: Not required, but if you want to make and take samples, you can pay the fee.

name: Cooking from Period Sources
description_book: How to start with a recipe that was written in period and end up with a dish that is consistent with that recipe and tastes good.
description_web: How to start with a recipe that was written in period and end up with a dish that is consistent with that recipe and tastes good. Also a discussion of available sources for recipes.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Traditional Norse Medical Herbalism
description_book: Collecting, storing, and techniques of herbal preparations, some dating back to saga times.
description_web: Medicine in Norway was surprisingly sophisticated back into saga times, compared with the Continent. We will look at the herbs/roots/barks/berries/fungi, etc., used in traditional healing, including preparation and administration of salves, syrups, teas and washes, poultices, and lots more.

name: Bardic Collegium #2: Upping Your Game
description_book: Join us for open discussion or tips and tricks to reading or working a room, getting noticed in a circle, developing a portfolio and more!
description_web: Bards! We all know that there are tips and tricks to reading or working a room, getting noticed in a circle, developing a portfolio and growing as bards! Whether a Laurel or a beginner, we all want to "up our game" which can be especially challenging when our game is set in the Middle Ages. Knowing that there are ways to do this is great - sharing them is even better! Come join us for this open discussion!

name: Medieval-Style Mustards
description_book: Mustard was the main condiment of the Middle Ages. Using ingredients documented for period sauces, students will blend their own mustard sauces.

name: Making Yellow Ochre Pigment from Natural Clays
description_book: Extract and refine yellow ochre pigment from various natural clay bodies for use in  painting.
description_web: Extract and refine yellow ochre pigment from various natural clay bodies for use in  painting.

name: Brewing and Experimental Archaeology
description_book: Lessons learned from experimental archaeology with wine and beer will be discussed and tasted. Brave adults (over 21) only.
description_web: Lessons learned from experimental archaeology with wine and beer will be discussed and tasted. The discovery and excavation of a monastic winery at the archaeological site of Tell Tuneinir will be discussed including artifacts and inscriptions. Brewing examples with include a variety of herbed beers as well as wines (quince, herbed red wine, and "poignant" mead).  Brave adults (over 21) only.

name: *Xia*: The Chinese Knight-Errant
description_book: In China, the practice of chivalry was much different than in the West. But in many key ways it was much the same.
description_web: Join us for a discussion of how chivalry was practiced in China in the Middle Ages.  This class will cover how *Xia* is different from Western chivalry, how it is the same, and ways to incorporate these into your persona.

name: The Clothes Make the Man (or Woman)
description_book: A discussion regarding the choosing of garb and accessories to accurately reflect your persona. Focuses on styles and look.
description_web: A discussion regarding the choosing of garb and accessories to accurately reflect your persona. Focuses on styles and look.

name: Pennsic Fools' Parade
description_book: The long-standing Pennsic tradition continues! Bring noise makers and bright clothes! Great for families! Meet at Bath House next to Cooper's store.
description_web: The long-standing Pennsic tradition continues! Open to any and all Pennsic campers! Adults, teens, and kids, come romp around the marketplace with fools from around the Knowne World! Bring your toys, noise makers, juggling balls, puppets, kazoos, and wear your brightest clothing!  Kids under 16 must bring a responsible adult. (This is a great activity for families!) We will meet at the Bath House next to the Cooper's store. All fools must attend the safety briefing 15 minutes before parade start. Parade lasts about 45 minutes. Please contact the Fool In Charge (Sophia the Orange) if you would like to arrange for the parade to visit your encampment or event.

name: Beginner Dance: 16th-Century Italian *Balli*
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach simple late 16th-century Italian dances.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach simple late 16th-century Italian dances. Dances may include *Contrapasso* and *Fedelta*.

name: *Alquerques*
description_book: Period game from the Middle East in the family of checkers-style games. We will teach the rules and the play.
description_web: Period game from the Middle East in the family of checkers-style games. We will review what is known, the rules, and the play through some games to learn the basic strategies.

name: The Turkish Bath
description_book: Pennsic is our vacation; why not pamper ourselves? Learn about the history of the Turkish bath, try beauty treatments and desserts. Bring a towel.
description_web: Pennsic is our vacation, so why not pamper ourselves? Come learn about the history of the Turkish bath, try out some beauty treatments and sample Turkish desserts. Please bring a towel. For privacy, this is open to self-identified women and girls only.
fee_itemization: Henna, beauty supplies, desserts and tea.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: Pre-16th-C. Musical Modal Improvisation
description_book: This is a practical application class for musicians to learn improvisational skills that were practiced in the Middle Ages for ages.
description_web: Musician class for acoustic instruments to learn medieval modal improvisation that will teach the student to create melodies on the spot for both free form and structured rhythmic forms. Students are required to be very familiar with their instruments. Reading is not require but really helps (especially your major and natural minor scales).

name: Needle-Woven Pouch
description_book: A simple needle-weaving method and loom for creating a woven pouch or bag.
description_web: A simple needle-weaving method and loom for creating a woven pouch or bag. Loom and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: The Polearm Techniques of Paulus Hector Mair
description_book: A look at several techniques from the 16th-century manual of arms of Paulus Hector Mair.
description_web: A look at several techniques from the 16th-century manual of arms of Paulus Hector Mair.

name: Beginners' *Atlatl* Throwing (Afternoon)
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.
description_web: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.

name: Rapier Woods Battle
description_book: Rapier Woods Battle

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Youth Combat afternoon sessions, 3-5 PM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.
description_web: Youth Combat afternoon sessions, 3-5 PM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.

name: Introduction to *Bharata Natyam*
description_book: Introductory class in *Bharata Natyam*, taught in a traditional style. *Bharata Natyam* is a modern classical dance form from India, fairly athletic.
description_web: *Bharata Natyam* is one of the current classical styles of Indian dance, which originates from South India. Lakshmi will teach this all-levels-welcome introductory class in the style of a classical Indian arts class, and in persona. Class will include basic postures, drills, technique, and hand positions. Former students are eagerly encouraged to come for review.  Please wear clothing that allows rigorous movement, including full torso flexibility and the ability to fully flex the legs and squat.

name: Getting to Know Your Archetype (Workshop)
description_book: For students already familiar with *commedia*. Dive deep into your *commedia dell'arte* character through an active workshop.
description_web: Often in *commedia dell'arte* you have no more than the rehearsal time to develop your character. In this class we'll be work-shopping each of the archetypes. Everyone in the class will have a chance to address their personal portrayal of their favorite face, with feedback and constructive criticism from the class. Handouts with a basic overview of some of the common traits of each character will be provided for reference. Whether you've been clowning for years and want to fine-tune your approach, or you're looking forward to your first show, this is a time to flesh out your portrayal, work on your movements and crowns, and get inside the head of your character.  Students should have a basic knowledge of *commedia dell'arte*.
fee_itemization: It would be a suggested donation.I have to print at my local library for a fee, so the handout fee is to offset that cost.

name: Period Nautical Personas Roundtable
description_book: An open discussion on what constitutes a nautical persona in the SCA, and how to effectively portray one.
description_web: An open discussion on what constitutes a nautical persona in the SCA, how sailors were perceived and behaved in period, and tips on how to bring nautical personas to life in the SCA.

name: thing.pennsicuniversity.org: Hiss & Purr
description_book: Second year, new features!  Everyone, instructor or not, come say what you liked, disliked, and would like to see in this system for next year.

name: Beginning Wire Weaving
description_book: Students will learn to make intricate chains in the manner of the Vikings and other cultures, without need for heat or complicated tools.
description_web: This class will teach beginning students to make intricate chains in the manner of the Vikings and other ancient cultures, without the need for heat or complicated tools. With the techniques presented, you will learn to create items like the ones found in Viking burials and treasure hoards across the Nordic countries dating from the 9th century to the late 12th century. Wire chains made in this fashion have also been discovered in the British Isles (875 AD) and in the Roman, Greek and Byzantine civilizations from the 4th century BC to the 1st century AD. Timeless items can be created that are still beautiful and wearable today. If you have needle-nose pliers and wire cutters, please bring them. If you need glasses for close or small work, please bring them. The fee for the class includes the materials needed to complete the leather cord necklace. To view this unique jewelry, please visit www.AncientWire.com/book.htm

name: Period Islamic Cooking
description_book: A description of a wide range of recipes from period Islamic cookbooks, along with a discussion of the available sources.
description_web: A description of a wide range of recipes from period Islamic cookbooks, along with a discussion of the available sources.

name: Initiation into the World of Whiskies
description_book: Everything you need to know to enjoy whisky. Covers history of whisky, distilling, aging, nomenclature, and how to taste whisky. Must be 21 or older.
description_web: A beginner-level course covering the history of whisky, ingredients, distilling, aging, how to taste whisky, laws governing whisky, and nomenclature. A Q&A session is a provided at the end of class. Samples for the tasting portion of the class are provided free of charge (21 and over only). Visit http://thecraftycadger.blogspot.com for a class primer.

name: Demistifying *Safavid* Women's Headwear
description_book: Is that a napkin on her head? Take a closer look at just what it was *Safavid* women wore as head wear. Make and take your own aigrette (feather pin).
description_web: Is that a napkin on her head? Take a closer look at just what it was *Safavid* women wore as head wear. Make and take your own aigrette (feather pin).

name: Intro to Free Embroidery
description_book: Hands on kit class - learn to sew outlines, filling techniques and decorative stitches. No experience whatsoever required!
description_web: This is an introduction to decorative embroidery done in the "free embroidery style" (which means not counted work). Each student will get a piece of fabric with a design printed on it, floss, a needle and a hoop. If you have scissors or your own hoop (4-6"), please bring them. If you need reading glasses, please also bring those. Stitches covered include: back stitch, chain stitch, reverse chain, split stitch, satin stitch, fly stitch, lazy daisy and if we are feeling adventurous - french knots.  No experience whatsoever required!
fee_itemization: Kit includes: fabric, floss, needle, and wooden hoop.

name: Middle Eastern Music and Dance
description_book: A time for people of all skill levels to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. All instruments are welcome, and loaner drums are available!
description_web: A time for people interested in Middle Eastern music and dance to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. We will be providing instruction appropriate to the interest of the attendees, from beginning Middle Eastern drum and belly dance to teaching songs in which everyone can participate. All skill levels and instruments are welcome, and drums are available for borrowing!

name: Joy and Jealousy
description_book: We'll run through two Italian pieces, *Bizzaria D'Amore* and *Contrapasso En Due*.
description_web: We'll run through two Italian pieces, *Bizzaria D'Amore* and *Contrapasso En Due*.

name: Introduction to Combat Archery
description_book: Learn the basics of combat archery. The class will cover the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules and basic tactics.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to be a part of the action on the battlefield, but didn't want to swing a sword? Have you ever wanted to shoot back at that pesky archer who keeps killing you? Give combat archery a try. The class will cover the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.

name: Egg Tempera Panel Painting: Part 2
description_book: Continuation of Hands-on; explore period medium of egg tempera panel painting, Egyptian to medieval, in-depth, prep to finish. Materials included.
description_web: Egg tempera is an ancient medium dating to the Egyptians and used throughout history. Virtually all panel paintings executed before mid-1400s used solely the yolk of the egg. This 2-part workshop will give hands-on time to explore this essential period medium in depth, from prep to finish. In-depth, hands-on. Materials included, beginner to advanced.
fee_itemization: all materials for two sessions: traditional gessoed panel, pigments, brushes, tools

name: But Mom, I Don't Want to Sing in English
description_book: Period music for singers, in languages other than modern English. Resources and advice for singing, say, Latin drinking songs around your campfire.
description_web: Period music for singers, to encourage the singing of random Latin drinking songs, among others, around your campfire. Not just for bards! Let's all sing in Catalan! We will review the big sources for songs ( *Carmina Burana*, *Cantigas de Santa Maria*, *Llibre Vermell de Montserrat*, etc.), sing a few, and discuss helpful hints to your success.

name: Fingerloop Gathering
description_book: Come out for an evening of socializing, information exchange, practice, tips and tricks of this art. Anyone is welcome--beginners on up.
description_web: Come out for an evening of socializing, information exchange, practice, tips and tricks of this art. Anyone is welcome--beginners on up. Various sources will be available to browse. We might even try multiple-person structures if we are brave enough. Sponsored by the Fingerlooping Group on FB.

name: Survey of Middle Eastern Clothing
description_book: Compare Arabic tunics & wraps with Central Asian-based (Seljuk, Persian, Ottoman) coats & pants. General history, schematic patterns. For men & women.
description_web: A comparison of two basic historic dress systems for both men and women in the Near and Middle East: (1) Arabic-based tunics and wraps; and (2) Central Asian-based coats and pants, as worn by Persians, Seljuk Turks, and Ottoman Turks. Includes general history, schematic patterns for garments, some discussion of women's veils and head coverings and men's hats.

name: Heraldic Flag Design
description_book: Learn about the various types of heraldic flags that existed in period, their design and application. Then design your own!
description_web: What does one do with those fantastic animals, interesting designs and brilliant colors needed for a good heraldic design? And where does one apply said design? Before heraldry ever appeared on shield and surcoat, those heraldic designs fluttered over the heads of kings and peasants, like majestic birds, in the form of banners, pennons, standards and gonfalons. Learn about the various types of heraldic flags that existed in period, their design and application. Then design your own!

name: 12th-Century Women's Clothing
description_book: An overview of 12th-C women's clothing, including the elusive bliaut.
description_web: An overview of 12th-C women's clothing, including the elusive bliaut. This class examines period sources outside of the Chartres Portal Sculpture box to explore how women's clothing was made in the 12th century.

name: Herringbone Patterns on Glass Beads
description_book: Make twisties and apply them onto beads to achieve herringbone patterns.  Discussion of the herringbone pattern found on historical beads.
description_web: Students will make twisties and apply them onto beads to achieve the herringbone patterns. We will also discuss the herringbone pattern found on historical beads.
fee_itemization: gas and glass for the class

name: Science in the Middle Ages
description_book: What would an educated, well-read, and well-traveled scholar know about science and the nature of the cosmos in late period Middle Ages in Europe?
description_web: What would an educated, well-read, and well-traveled scholar know about science and the nature of the cosmos in late period Middle Ages in Europe? The class will include a survey of scientific thought from the Greeks up until the 16th century for background. The class will largely be taught in persona from the point of view of an alchemist addressing university students.

name: EKBG Panel and Meet-and-Greet
description_book: East Kingdom Brewers may panel for guild rank. Don't wish to panel? Come visit with other brewers from the East! Contact Sylvia to sign up for panels.
description_web: Members of the East Kingdom Brewers' Guild may sign up for panel slots with the Guildmistress. Other EK Brewers are welcome to visit and share their potables for our meet-and-greet.

name: Henna 101
description_book: A hands-on beginner look at henna history, application, and design. Participants will receive an instructional handout and henna cone.
description_web: A hands-on beginner look at henna history, application, and design. Participants will receive an instructional handout and henna cone.

name: *Kenjutsu*: The Art of Japanese Swordsmanship
description_book: Dojo-style class, covering basics of Japanese sword. Japanese practice sword or equivalent (wood or metal) required. Limited loaners available.
description_web:
A traditional-style class on Japanese *kenjutsu*, drawn from multiple sources, including modern and traditional arts. The class will be arranged to emphasize techniques that are known to have been used pre-1600. Emphasis will be on physical repetition more than scholarly discussion. The latter will be available after class, informally, as requested.
About the instructor: I have over 15 years of experience in Japanese sword arts, including *Nakamura Ryu Battodo (IBF 4-dan), ZNKR Kendo (1-kyu), Mugai Ryu Iaihyodo*, and *Shindo Muso Ryu Jodo*.

name: *Basse* Dances
description_book: Burgundian *basse* (or low) dance is a mystery to many but it is easy to learn and fun to do.
description_web: Burgundian *basse* (or low) dance is a mystery to many but it is actually a very simple and elegant form that is found in some of the earliest sources and continues in a similar style for many years. There are three patterns that will prepare you to do most of the dances in this genre. Once these three patterns are gained you will simply combine them in sets to perform this most elegant and graceful of dances.

name: A Cycle of Norse Myths
description_book: Mistress Dervila ni Leanon will be performing a cycle of Norse myths from the Creation of the World to Ragnarok, and more!
description_web: I will be performing a cycle of Norse myths from the Creation of the World to Ragnarok. Come hear why Thor dressed up as a bride, how the evil wolf Fenris was bound, how Mjolnir was created, how the beautiful Freya convinced Loki the trickster to become a mother, and more!  *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

name: *i Sebastiani!* (Amphitheater)
description_book: *i Sebastiani*, the Greatest *Commedia dell'Arte* Troupe in the Entire World! New and different three-act improvisation from Sunday!
description_web: Buon giorno!  O, you lucky people!  Truly you are blessed among the living, for into your lives has **again** come *i Sebastiani*, the Greatest *Commedia dell'Arte* Troupe in the Entire World! Join us as we improvise from the thinnest of outlines a wondrous entertainment in three acts **completely different** from the one we did on Sunday. You will be glad that you did!

name: Pimp Your Wagon
description_book: Learn how to design and create a cover to disguise your radio flyer wagon or garden cart to make it look more acceptable at events.
description_web: Learn how to design and create a cover to disguise your radio flyer wagon or garden cart to make it look more acceptable at events. A pattern CD-ROM will be available for $25 which includes patterns, designs and video tutorials.

name: Beginner Russian Calligraphy
description_book: The basics of medieval Russian calligraphy. Learn the basics of writing the Old Church Slavonic alphabet.
description_web: The basics of medieval Russian calligraphy. Learn the basics of writing the Old Church Slavonic alphabet. There will also be a handout for Russian-style English alphabet. The hands-on portion of the class is limited to 15 people.

name: Beginning Bottom-Whorl Drop Spindle
description_book: Create unique yarns on the bottom-whorl drop spindle. Spinning, plying, and helpful process tips will be discussed.
description_web: Create unique yarns on the bottom-whorl drop spindle. Spinning, plying, and helpful process tips will be discussed. Use 'student spindles' during class, or bring your own spindle. Adults or older children (age 12 and up with parent).

name: Archaeology of the Vikings
description_book: Viking material culture in the context of both burials and habitation sites. Will include evidence for diet, metalwork, pottery, glass and textiles.
description_web: Viking material culture in the context of both burials and habitation sites in Sweden and Norway. Will include evidence for diet, metalwork, pottery, glass and textiles. Taught by two professional archaeologists. See: http://users.stlcc.edu/mfuller/Viking.html

name: First Aid or CPR Challenges
description_book: Individuals can challenge to recertify by taking the written and physical tests. These will be ASHI challenges, unless other instructors can be found.
description_web: Individuals can challenge to recertify by taking the written and physical tests. If the challenge is unsuccessful, the recommendation is for the full class. These will be ASHI challenges, unless other instructors can be found. Individual challenges take approximately 1 hour.

name: AEthelmearc Court
description_book: AEthelmearc Court
description_web: AEthelmearc Court

name: The Ancient Celtic Field Sport of Hurling
description_book: Celtic game of hurling: history, rules, drills. One-hour, hands-on scrimmage depending on available loaner equip. A contact sport; 18 or older.
description_web: Hands-on class on the Celtic game of hurling: history, rules, drills. One-hour scrimmage depending on available loaner equipment. A contact sport; 18 years old or older only. BYO pads, cup, hockey helmet, etc., at own discretion. Bring your own water/sports drink. Hurley stick/ball available for purchase.

name: Glass Workers Meet 'n Greet
description_book: Calling **all** glass workers! Join us for the Meet 'n Greet. Food, friends and fun! What could be better?
description_web: Calling **all** glass workers! Join us for a few hours of fun at this year's Meet 'n Greet. Catch up with old friends and make new ones! We will have snacks and maybe even some fun games with some prizes to win! We would also encourage you to bring some small tokens, and maybe even some little cards with your contact information to share with others. We look forward to seeing you!

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children at Runestone Hill.
description_web: 7pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend, must have adult escort.

name: Introduction to Runes
description_book: Introduction to the *Futharc* and *Futhorc* runes for use in divination and magic (and *RúnValdr* q.v.) with resources for further study.
description_web: Runes are a system of writing that is now best known as a tool for divination, but has been more, from basic communication to magickal practice. This workshop will give an overview of what the runes have been and can be, and give you direction on how to proceed in your studies.

name: *Muhekian*: The Taste of Tea
description_book: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothing with white socks or tabi, and bring a fan if you have one.
description_web: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothing with white socks or tabi, and bring a fan if you have one. Please do not wear any jewelry or weapons in the tea room.
fee_itemization: cost of tea and sweets - 12 per sitting.

name: Third Annual Depressing Song Competition
description_book: Bring your most depressing, lugubrious, cry-in-your-beer song and see if you can bring the judges to tears. Prizes will be awarded.
description_web: Bring your most depressing, lugubrious, cry-in-your-beer song and see if you can bring the judges to tears. Prizes will be awarded before we dissolve into puddles of melancholy. Sign up at Moongate Designs. Note: Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.

name: Youth Armored Combat: "Try It"
description_book: Ages 6-17; try on YC loaner armor, learn the basics and spar against a YC veteran. Parents **must** be list side. Read rules for attire requirements.
description_web: Ages 6-17; try on YC loaner armor, learn the basics, borrow a sword (or use the sword you made in our sword-making class) and spar against a YC veteran. Parents **must** be list side. Youths wear closed-toe shoes and have their legs and torso covered. We have external "protection" for both genders. Many sizes of sweaty loaner gear will be available, but may not fit everyone. Please read the YC rules for more details and visit us earlier in the day if you have questions.

name: Ring Brooches: Roman to Medieval
description_book: Slide show and discussion of the most popular brooch type of the Middle Ages. Warning: opinionated instructor.
description_web: Slide show and discussion of the most popular brooch type of the Middle Ages. Photos from museum study collections and my collection. Warning: opinionated instructor.

name: *Cantore Borealis*
description_book: A "pick up" choir formed during Pennsic, that practices all week. Organized by Ban Ollamh Orlaith Ballach Ingen Fhlainn, OL, of Northshield.
description_web: A "pick up" choir formed during Pennsic, that practices all week. Ban Ollamh Orlaith Ballach Ingen Fhlainn, OL, of Northshield, organizes music, rehearsals and performers. Note: If you're interested in performing, find her in Northshield populace camping for an audition.

name: Clan Blue Feather Ball and Fashion Cotillion
description_book: Clan Blue Feather's annual Ball and Fashion Cotillion. Food, fun, dancing, music, free raffle and prizes. Wear what makes you look your best!
description_web: Join Clan Blue Feather once again for their annual Ball and Fashion Cotillion. Food, fun, dancing, music, costumes, revelry, a free raffle and special prizes for the most fabulous garb. Remember, you don't have to wear your best garb; just wear what makes *you* look your best!

name: Ken and Lisa Theriot
description_book: Ken Theriot (Sir Kenneth MacQuarrie of Tobermory) and Lisa Theriot (Mistress Adelaide de Beaumont) and friends in concert.
description_web: Ken Theriot (Sir Kenneth MacQuarrie of Tobermory) and Lisa Theriot (Mistress Adelaide de Beaumont) and friends in concert, featuring songs from the newly-released album "Outlaws and Bystanders", as well as favorites like "The Feast Song" and "Band of Brothers".

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Youth Combat morning sessions, 8-10:30 AM.  Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.
description_web: Youth Combat morning sessions, 8-10:30 AM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: Archery Champions War Point
description_book: Archery Champions War Point.
description_web: This archery competition will test the skill of the Known World archers in a 10-station roving range, a timed friend-or-foe shoot and an unknown distance walk-up shoot. All are welcome to come and view the finest archers in the Known World showcase their skills.

name: Glass Day
description_book: Working with glass to make handmade beads. Torches will be set up for demonstration and use; a display will showcase the various styles created.

name: Animals of the Medieval World
description_book: Explore the animals of the ancient world, as shown in art, illuminated manuscripts and other sources. Sponsored by Gozen.

name: Enameling Day
description_book: See a demonstration of vitreous enameling and try it out for yourself. To learn the steps you will complete your own enameled *champlevé* leaf.
description_web: Come and see a demonstration of vitreous enameling and try it out for yourself. Participants will complete a sample pre-etched piece (*champlevé* leaf) to learn the steps involved including choosing colors, packing the enamel, leveling the piece, and repacking until satisfied with the final enameled version. Kiln will be handled by an experienced operator. Class sponsored by Lady Bronwen Rose of Greling.

name: 11th-16th-C. Spindle Sticks and Whorls, Hands-On
description_book: Learn use of Viking, Anglo Norse and Netherlandish recreated spindle sticks and whorls, including 'tuning' spindle and whorl. Hands-on spinning.
description_web: Hands-on spinning includes selection of re-created Anglo Norse spindle sticks from Coppergate, Viking spindles from Norse settlements of 11th-14th C, and Netherlandish spindles/Raeren whorls from the 15th-16th C. Instructor will teach 'tuning' whorls to spindle sticks and is particularly interested in the spinability of surviving spindle sticks with the 'belly bump' on the shaft. Tapered whorl holes that match tapered spindle sticks will be explored. Students will spin wool (provided) on these re-creations in class. All levels welcome, though this is not a beginners' class. Note that this class has 'loaner' spindle sticks available for those who don't want to purchase them. Or bring your own.
fee_itemization: Dependent on whether student uses loaner spindle or purchases spindles in price range from $15.00-$35.00

name: Norse Apron Dress
description_book: How to pattern and construct a Norse apron dress. If possible, bring 2 yards of fabric, scissors, and fabric pen, though not necessary for the class.
description_web: How to pattern and construct a Norse apron dress. If possible,bring 2 yards of fabric, scissors, and fabric pen, though not necessary for the class.

name: Pleatwork Apron Make-and-Take
description_book: Make your own honeycomb pleated apron similar to those seen in German Ren woodcuts. Bring 1 yard of linen or buy for $6 (limit 10 available).
description_web: A hands-on, instructional class on smocking, or honeycomb pleatwork, the gathering method commonly seen in German Renaissance clothing (but also popular for hundreds of years throughout Europe). You will make your own apron to wear around camp in style! We'll also discuss pleating in general as we work, and students can read/obtain a copy of my recent, 30-page research paper on historical pleating techniques. Materials available for 10 people, or bring your own medium-weight linen (1 yard) in white, black, or red.

name: Breastfeeding Support  Group
description_book: Are you pregnant or nursing and would like support? Please come. Kids welcome, IBCLC, La Leche Leaders, LCs, Counselors. Late is ok.
description_web: Breast-feeders, unite. Come join us If you are pregnant or nursing (any age child) or if you are a support person or educator. You are welcome to come, hang out and learn about breastfeeding and overcoming issues. Sometimes we all need help when we are working through issues like heat, growth spurts, teething, first foods and weaning. This is a casual group. If you have learned something about breastfeeding, and you think it would benefit others, please feel free to share it. If you are an IBCLC, LC, Support Counselor, Educator, La Leche League leader or associate, please come and provide your support.

name: The Bayeux Tapestry
description_book: Construction and history of this embroidered wall hanging from 1066, including hints and tips for making your own tapestry.

name: Mastering Sewing: Scope
description_book: Creating, researching, patterning, cutting, sewing and finishing; making a realistic time-line.

name: Event Decorating on a Shoestring
description_book: Learn how to cut heraldic forms out of paper for centerpieces or wall decorations to decorate feast halls or event sites. Class materials supplied.
description_web: Learn how to cut heraldic forms out of paper for centerpieces or wall decorations to decorate feast halls or event sites. Applications for metalwork, leather work, stained glass or clothing decorations. Ages 12 & up. Class materials supplied. Pattern book available for $20.

name: SCAbominations
description_book: The things the SCA taught you about the Middle Ages that just aren't true. Parents' note: Includes brief, graphic discussion of prostitution.
description_web: The things the SCA taught you about the Dark Ages, Middle Ages, and Renaissance that just aren't true. Parents' note: Includes a brief, graphic discussion of prostitution.

name: From Fiber to Garb
description_book: We will discuss fiber, prep, yarn and cloth-making choices in different periods and locations. Emphasis will be on techniques and fiber sources.
description_web: We will discuss fiber, prep, yarn and cloth-making choices in different periods and locations. Emphasis will be on available techniques and fiber sources. Examples will be provided, but please bring your own to share.

name: ASHI Basic First Aid
description_book: Created to help students develop basic first aid knowledge, skills, and the confidence to respond.
description_web: Basic First Aid was created to help students develop basic first aid knowledge, skills, and the confidence to respond. The program is an excellent choice for both the community and workplace setting, and is consistent with recommendations of the 2010 National First Aid Science Advisory Board and OSHA’s best practices for first aid training programs in the workplace. Class length: 5 hours
