fee_itemization: Separate fee for card or course materials.

name: Gathering of the Louds
description_book: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Loud Renaissance instruments with a different focus each day: *intradas*, *chansons*, polychoral work
description_web: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Players of loud Renaissance instruments gather just for fun to play different styles of music at each session such as *intradas* and other instrumental processionals, *chansons*, and polychoral music. Not sure what these instruments are? Come listen or try one. Instruments will be available to share. Bring a chair, music stand and clothespins.

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.
description_web: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magick.
description_web: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.

name: Intro to Woodworking: The Handplane
description_book: Introductory class in the care and use of handplanes. Modern iron-bodied planes will also be covered.
description_web: An Introduction to the setup and use of handplanes. Focus is primarily on wood-bodied planes but modern iron-bodied planes will be included. Sharpening will be briefly touched upon. Master Avery's sharpening class is recommended. Will also cover spokeshaves and drawknives

name: Beginning Belly Dance
description_book: Covers very basic belly dance steps
description_web: We will work on basic hip, arm and walking movements.

name: Atlantian 5-Man Melée Tournament
description_book: An annual tradition. Bring your best 5-man fencing team and compete against the Known World. No more than two martial high orders per team.

name: SCA Rapier Combat for Historic Martial Artists
description_book: Field time for HMA-interested fencers to meet, teach, learn, and spar.
description_web:
This is a place and time for SCA fencers who are interested in, or are actively pursuing, the study of historic martial arts in the context of SCA rapier rules. During this time, you can meet others with similar interests, offer to teach, look to learn, or just come out to spar with the like-minded.

A daily sign-up sheet will allow those in attendance to connect with others with matched goals for the day (e.g. someone willing to teach Fabris can find students wanting to learn, or vice versa, or someone looking for a fight can get one), and each day will end with special HMA-related sparring challenges.

name: Tree Trek
description_book: Take a stroll, learn to identify members of common tree families! You may wish to bring paper and a crayon to do bark and/or leaf rubbings.
description_web: Take a stroll with Lady Béibhinn to learn to identify members of common tree families! After learning to key out general characteristics, we'll take a walk and discuss how various trees impacted medieval cultures, and how various trees were frequently used. You may wish to bring paper and a crayon to do bark and/or leaf rubbings. Wear comfortable shoes for walking.

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia*, before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.

name: Drawing with a Proportional Scale
description_book: A low tech option for plotting and enlarging the illuminations you see in books onto your scroll page and improving your drawing skills.
description_web: So you've learned to draw a straight line with a ruler, great! But are you still intimidated by free-hand drawing? Are you inspired by period illumination art, but not sure how to get it on your scroll? The proportional scale is the low tech answer to improving your drawing skills. Learn how this tool can help you enlarge/reduce and plot out illuminated elements such as framing and architecture, flowers, animals and people, directly from your favorite source books all without a scanner, Photoshop software or a light box. This class is hands-on! Tools will be available for use during class.

name: Adv. Calligraphy: *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*
description_book: Learn Rotunda lowercase, Rotunda caps, Italic, and cadels. Take your calligraphy to the next level. Four two-hour sessions. Not for beginners.
description_web: The *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta* is a late-period Renaissance master’s showcase. In this four-day, in-depth study, students will learn scripts used in this manuscript: Rotunda lowercase, Rotunda caps, Italic, and cadels. Take your calligraphy to the next level with our tips on analyzing scripts. Plan to attend all four two-hour sessions. Not suitable for beginners.
fee_itemization: calligraphy marker, watercolor paper, specialty nib, supplies, color handouts.  $10 fee, payable 8/4, covers all 4 classes.

name: Pennsic Food Lab
description_book: Primitive and medieval cooking space will be made available while open discussion, demonstrations and classes will be taught on applied archaeology.
description_web: Primitive and medieval cooking space will be made available while open discussion, demonstrations and classes will be taught on applied archaeology relating to food and its production. Medieval cooking techniques, technology and methodology will be showcased in this open forum. Up-to-date times and topics will be posted outside of AEthelmearc Royal.
fee_itemization: Handout fees may vary. A requested donation tin will be available to help defray the cost of equipment and materials.

name: How to Be a Good Court Herald
description_book: Ideal for the new or want-to-be Court Herald as well as helpful tips for the old veterans, we look at how to train and do the job.
description_web: We look at the definition and role of a Court Herald, some suggested training to refine your abilities, then how to run a successful court as the herald.

name: "Dem Bones"
description_book: A brief introduction to osteoarchaeology.
description_web: This class is a brief introduction to osteoarchaeology. Mord will discuss three areas of this discipline: animals, injury, disease.

name: When in Rome: Basics of Roman Dress
description_book: Toga party? Not quite! Come out and learn the difference between a *tunica, stola*, and, yes, even the famous toga.
description_web: Toga party? Not quite! Come out and learn the difference between a *tunica, stola*, and, yes, even the famous toga. This two-hour lecture will encompass as much about Roman dress as the teacher can cram in. Questions are encouraged. Handouts and downloadable materials available.

name: *Temari*
description_book: The ancient art of Japanese thread balls. Once used in games, now a decorative gift.
description_web: The ancient art of Japanese thread balls. Once used in games, now a decorative gift. Learn the history of this craft once done by the Japanese nobles.

name: 14th-15th-Century Women's Hairstyles and Veils.
description_book: An overview of different hairstyles and veils worn in the later Middle Ages by women of all classes. Focusing on England, France, and Italy.
description_web: An overview of different hairstyles and veils worn in the later Middle Ages by women of all classes, focusing on England, France, and Italy and the differences between these regions. Handout includes a pattern for a women's coif and instructions on how to wear a veil without the aid of a circlet no matter the length of your hair.

name: *Heiho Okugisho* by Yamamoto Kansuke
description_book: A look at the *Heiho Okugisho*, the book of strategy by Yamamoto Kunsuke, a famous 16th-century *samurai* strategist.
description_web: A look at the *Heiho Okugisho*, the book of strategy by Yamamoto Kunsuke, a famous 16th-century *samurai* strategist.

name: Help Advise a Dance Apprentice
description_book: Criticism is a great way to improve as a dance teacher. We'll pick experts from the attendees & critique me, teaching like a novice. Will I be fired?
description_web: Giving and taking constructive criticism is a great way to improve as a dance teacher. We'll pick an expert panel from the class attendees, and critique Gregory pretending to be a novice dancemaster. Will I be fired?

name: Crusader Versus Saracen Battle
description_book: God wills it! Scenarios to re-enact battles from the time of the Crusades.
description_web: God wills it! Scenarios to re-enact battles from the time of the Crusades. Participants are required to only use arms and armor documentable to the time period of 1096-1291. Allowed weapons: Any documentable to 1096-1291, subject to approval: swords, maces, axes, dagger, spear, thrown weapons, archery, siege, etc. Allowed shields: round, kites, and heaters (and any other documentable style from the period). Armor and helms from the period are required. Bring your banners for pageantry. Properly attired support people are most welcome!

name: Multiplayer Period Chess
description_book: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.
description_web: Chess games for four players.

location: Good Friends Camp (usually N-01 on St. Lawrence Way)
name: 16th-Century Limp Book Binding (Chain Stitch)
description_book: All-day class making a 16th-century limp vellum-covered book with decorative chain stitching on exposed spine. Some embroidery skills required.
description_web: An all-day class on how to make a 16th-century limp vellum-covered book with decorative chain-stitched exposed spine. Some embroidery skills are required to do this decorative spine, but no prior bookbinding knowledge is required. All tools are loaned by the instructor, but students can bring at least 3 matching beads (no larger than 10mm) for the ties.
fee_itemization: Fee covers vellum for the cover, a handout, paper for the blank book, leather for the spine, beads for the ties, and linen thread.

name: Gilding for Wood Simplified
description_book: Oil gilding on wood can be used for furniture and panels. The class will cover period and modern techniques used to do metal gilding.
description_web: Oil gilding on wood can be used for furniture and panels. The class will cover period and modern techniques used to do metal gilding, including gold, composite gold (brass), silver, and copper. The class will be held at Guild Mirandola in Merchant Row.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: KW Choir: Known World Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: Join the Known World Choir and prepare a concert of *a capella* choral music! Enthusiastic amateurs-expert singers are all welcome!
description_web: Join the Pennsic Known World Choir! Enthusiastic amateurs-expert singers are all welcome! Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on the final Thursday of War week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is extremely helpful, but not required if you are willing to put in the effort to learn the music in advance. Sheet music and part-learning tracks are available online now at the KWChoir Yahoo group: https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/KWChoir/info.
fee_itemization: Limited packets of sheet music available for $3.00. Otherwise, download pre-Pennsic or you may print at Mystic Mail

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: For all levels and teachers. Drills focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Études* for drill; elements from drill used to work in groups.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Known World Baronial Armoured Champions Tourney
description_book: Open to all current Armoured Baronial Champions.

name: Youth Thrown Weapons Tournament
description_book: Limited to youth ages 5-15; 30 total participants. Parent/guardian must be there. By Master Arinwald Rotstein and THL Dominique.
description_web: Limited to Youth ages 5-15; 30 total participants. Parent/guardian must be there. By Master Arinwald Rotstein and THL Dominique.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class.We have three wonderful, new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: Home Recording for Bards
description_book: How to get started recording and distributing your bardic work: equipment to buy, what to do, with hands-on demo.
description_web: Now that you've developed your bardic performance pieces and skills, how do you plan on getting it out to people? We'll discuss how to get started recording your bardic work, with notes on what equipment to buy and a discussion on how to produce and distribute it. The first hour will be a discussion of the steps involved. In the last 30 minutes, we'll actually do a demo recording on site.

name: Intro to Woodworking: Saws, the Care and Use of
description_book: Selecting a set of saws, using saws, maintaining saws; a little about making saws.
description_web: Saw basics, what to look for in a saw, how to select a saw, using the saw, overview of sharpening a saw. Also covers cutting stock to size and making joints.

name: Tribal Odyssey Slow and Fast Combos
description_book: More funky, flowing combos for duets or large group tribal improv (lead and follow) with Atesh of Orluk (Anthea/Kawakib). Finger cymbals optional.
description_web: Slow and fast tribal combinations with finger cymbals! Suitable for any level.

name: Evolution of Black Powder Arms from 1320-1600
description_book: History and development of black powder arms from 1320-1600. This is a NON-shooting lecture/discussion class covering period firearm technology.
description_web: History and development of black powder arms from 1320-1600. This is a NON-shooting lecture/discussion class covering period firearm technology.

name: Introduction to Russian Names
description_book: The basics of constructing, documenting, and registering a period Russian name with the SCA College of Arms.
description_web: The basics of constructing, documenting, and registering a period Russian name with the SCA College of Arms. Class will address common sources for documentation and the basics of Russian grammar as applied to names.

name: Let's Be Frank: Improving Your Carolingian Persona
description_book: Tips for making and acquiring the appropriate clothing and accessories for a Carolingian Frankish persona (both male and female).
description_web: Tips for making and acquiring the appropriate items for a Carolingian Frankish persona. Focuses on clothing (male and female), but also includes accessories, weapons, and armor. Even Charlemagne himself will be envious after you take this class.

name: Making a Pavilion (and Illuminated Camp Wall)
description_book: Saga of making a 22' high hub-and-spoke pavilion from scratch, painting it, and furnishing it. Also a camp wall painted like an illuminated border.
description_web: The saga of making a 22' high hub-and-spoke pavilion from scratch, painting it, and furnishing it (the Dum Vivimus Vivamus pavilion on the Serengeti). Also discussed: making a camp wall painted like an illuminated border.

name: German Reformation and Sumptuary Laws
description_book: A look at German sumptuary laws, the effects of the Reformation, and how the people broke the rules.
description_web: A look at German sumptuary laws, the effects of the Reformation, and how the people broke the rules. These are the laws that ran the everyday lives of the citizens of the German city states - not only how they dressed, but how they celebrated, practiced their faith, and planned a meal, and socialized.
fee_itemization: 10+ page handout with color plates for reference.

name: Food Preservation Methods and History
description_book: Learn a bit about the various methods documented to before 1650 for preserving foods. Samples may be available.

name: Adult Doll Meet
description_book: This class is geared towards adults that collect, or want to collect dolls. Please bring your favorite doll to the meet.
description_web: This class is geared towards adults that collect, or want to collect dolls. Please bring your favorite doll, as we will be making something special for them. Adults only because doll hobbies can be expensive.

name: Anatomy of a Street Show
description_book: See a professional street show under real conditions, then learn how the show works as we dissect it piece by piece.
description_web: After a brief classroom orientation, Kuji will perform his professional street magic show in the marketplace, using psychological and theatrical techniques as old and universal as streets themselves. Afterwards, we will return to the classroom, where Dr Best will interview the artist so we can learn why this show works the way it does.

name: SCA 102: Beyond the Basics
description_book: So you have some SCA knowledge. Let's talk about titles, local groups, kingdoms, awards and court.
description_web: So you have some SCA knowledge. Let's talk about titles, local groups, kingdoms, awards and court. We'll talk about what coronets and crowns mean, how to address people of certain ranks, how people get awards, what to do in court and we will touch on SCA geography

name: Katana for SCA Combat
description_book: This is a non-armored class to show how Japanese single sword can be used in SCA armored combat.
description_web: This is a non-armored class to show how Japanese single sword can be used in SCA armored combat. Topics such as defense, attack, movement and proper thought will be covered.

name: Dance Master Roundtable
description_book: Come join other dance masters to share problems and potential solutions that we, as Dance Masters, encounter but don't usually discuss.
description_web: Come join other dance masters to share problems and potential solutions that we, as Dance Masters, encounter but don't usually discuss. Some situations to discuss are (but are certainly not limited to) problem children, creepy people, cameras on the dance floor, hygiene, safety, etc.

name: Introduction to Spinning *Poi*
description_book: Learn some of the basic *poi* movements and terminology necessary to get you started.
description_web: In this one-hour workshop, you will learn some of the basic *poi* movements and terminology necessary to get you started. *Poi* spinning is a great low-impact workout that will help you to improve your coordination and give your fitness routine some "flare"! After paying for their first class, students are welcome to return to subsequent classes free of charge!
fee_itemization: $20.00 Material Fee covers handout, poi, and refreshments

name: Coptic Bookbinding
description_book: You'll learn to make a book using Coptic bookbinding techniques. Great for notebooks, journals, sketchbooks. Limit of 10 participants per class
description_web: You'll learn to make a book using Coptic bookbinding techniques. Great for notebooks, journals, sketchbooks. A limit of 10 participants per class, sorry.
fee_itemization: panels, acid free paper, needle, linen twine, awl

name: Intro to 6-on-2 Chainmail
description_book: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail. All materials provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
description_web: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail prevalent throughout period across multiple cultures. All materials necessary to complete class project provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
fee_itemization: Sufficient hand-turned & cut enameled copper rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter; to complete class project

name: Beginners' *Atlatl* Throwing (Morning)
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.
description_web: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.

name: Melodic Middle Eastern Drumming
description_book: Join us for Middle Eastern drumming with a twist! Includes melodic and harmonic playing with hand drumming fundamentals. All exp. levels welcome.

name: Anthropomorphic Bestiary
description_book: A look at the importance of animals and the connection between cultures as human civilizations evolved.
description_web: We will take a look at the connection between animals and humans as the cultures of the world developed. Have you ever wondered how cultures, who had no connection for hundreds of years, have very similar thoughts and beliefs about animals? The class will be mainly open discussion where we will compare thoughts and beliefs of cultures all over the world at many different time frames and look for connections beyond basic religion and myth. Also includes the importance of these animals to people in the SCA today, and what causes that centuries-long connection with animals many people have never even seen in real life.

name: Silent Heraldry: Why Are You Waving Your Hands?
description_book: An introduction to Silent Heraldry focusing on what we do, where we do it, and how to get started. (English/ASL provided if needed.)
description_web: The purpose of this class is to introduce individuals to Silent Heraldry including what we do and our role, where we provide services, and how to get started.  (This is not a sign language class.)

name: Spice Up Your Sleeves
description_book: We will discuss different sleeve styles used in the 14th/15th centuries for men and women. Includes patterns.
description_web: Want to spice up the sleeves of your basic Gothic clothing? We will discuss some different sleeve styles used in the 14th/15th centuries for both men and women. Includes patterns. Basic sewing skills are a plus, but not required.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Runes: the Younger *Futhark*
description_book: The YF and its many variants were primarily used in Scandinavia. Includes mercantile, pagan and Christian magic, codes, memorial stones, and more.
description_web: From the late Vendel period through medieval times (and actually in some regions of northern Norway and Sweden into the 20th century), younger *futhark* runes were pretty much cut-down versions derived from the Elder *Futhark*. We will look at the many variations not only in individual *futharks*, but regional variants in individual characters, rune names and meanings, pagan and Christian rune magic, mercantile usage, quickie notes scratched on slips of wood (Viking period Post-Its), memorial stones, codes and cyphers, "handwriting" variants, and lots more.

name: Leather Pouchmaking: Make-and-Take
description_book: Make a simple but functional drawstring leather pouch in a time-honored fashion. For ages 3-103. Materials available for 20 pouches.
description_web: Make a simple but functional drawstring leather pouch in a time-honored fashion. Students will learn how to properly lace the pouch so it can be opened and closed easily. Appropriate for ages 3-103. Materials available for 20 pouches (pre-sized and pre-punched leather with leather ties).

name: Introduction to 14th-Century German Brick Stitch
description_book: A basic introduction to a simple counted-thread technique used in 14th- to 15th-century Germany.
description_web: A basic introduction to a simple counted-thread technique used in 14th- to 15th-century Germany. The class covers the basic stitches, design features and history. Fee includes handout and materials.

name: Basic Feast Planning
description_book: Are you experienced at planning feasts? Need to brush up? Then come and review with an experienced feast steward.

name: Introduction to Medieval Music Notation
description_book: We'll discuss differences with modern notation, then read several examples. Bring melody instruments you play fluently, e.g., recorder, fiddle, voice.
description_web: Reading medieval music in modern notation imposes modern notions of measure, phrasing, and tonality. Reading it in the original notation allows us to get closer to the composer's intentions and the head-space of a medieval performer, and can help achieve those elusive, magical “medieval moments”. We'll start with an overview of differences between modern and medieval notation, and then spend most of the class reading examples. Bring melody instruments you play fluently, such as recorder, gamba, fiddle, voice (if you have good pitch memory), etc. If you have multiple sizes of your instrument, please bring them (e.g., SATB recorders).

name: Retaining the Unretainable
description_book: How to get started or improve your knowledge base for wrangling those royal types. A must-have if you are new to retaining.
description_web: Getting started in retaining? Have some seasoning under your belt? This is the class to get started or improve your skills, share stories and learn from each other. Help create the magic of the game by being a good retainer.

name: Thorsberg Trousers: Pants That Last!
description_book: Tired of repairing pants that rip in unmentionable places? Then you’ll love these pants based on trousers from an Iron Age burial!
description_web: Tired of repairing pants that rip in unmentionable places? Then you’ll love these pants based on trousers from an Iron Age burial! Learn what you’ll need to make them yourself: fabrics, seams, pattern, and construction.

name: Closed Form Sword and Shield: A Voice From AS IV
description_book: A description of an SCA fighting style taught in the Middle and East in the early years of the Society.
description_web: A description of an SCA fighting style taught in the Middle and East in the early years of the Society. The class is done as an early fighter training session, with commentary.

name: Dancing at the Villa: *Bella Gioiosa*
description_book: *Cascarde* for 3; 7 verses; stand-alone *Ritonello*; solo for each dancer. Recommend you know some 16th-century Italian footwork.
description_web: This is not one of Caroso’s typical *Cascarde*. *Bella* is for three dancers with seven different verses, a stand-alone *Ritornello*, and a solo for each dancer. Come experience the thrill of this threesome. Familiarity with 16th-Century Italian footwork strongly recommended.

name: 15th-Century Italian Dances
description_book: *Anello*, *Amoroso*, and *Rostiboli* will be in the Ball Thursday night and are relatively simple - no experience necessary.

name: Stuff It
description_book: Different cultural and/or historical versions of filled pasta from dough to fillings.
fee_itemization: cost to cover grocery supplies, flour, eggs,cheese, herbs. students will be able to take some finished product with them.

name: Knowne Worlde Ladies of the Rose Tournament
description_book: Each Rose will sponsor one unbelted heavy fighter and one non-White Scarf duellist. The tourney will be run in a Bedford points-style.
description_web:
All Roses, Diamonds, Edelweiss, etc., are welcome to be a part of the tourney as are all sitting Queens and Princesses, both Heirs and Territorials who are not yet members of the Orders.
Each Rose will sponsor one unbelted heavy fighter and one non-White Scarf (or White Scarf equivalent) duellist; i.e. they cannot be the recipient of your kingdom’s highest level rapier award.   
The tourney will be run in a Bedford points-style to maximize the number of bouts for the fighters.
The tourney will be run to Atlantian/Eastern Standard.

name: Children's Water Battle
description_book: Assault the Fort! The Children's Water Battle is open to everyone 6 - 12. Bring your own water weapons (no catapults). Dress for mess. Water provided.
description_web: Assault the Fort! The Children's Water Battle is open to everyone 6 - 12. Bring your own water weapons (squirt guns, water balloons, etc. No catapults, they hurt!). Dress for mess and mud. Water provided. Each participant must be in the charge of a responsible adult. Treasure provided to each participant. Extra marshals are always wanted; marshals do not necessarily get wet.

name: Intro to Woodworking: Making Joints
description_book: Introduction to setting out and cutting common joints.
description_web: An introduction to setting out and cutting common woodworking joints. Brings together axe, drawknife, saws, squares, straight edges, marking gauges, knives, chisels and nearly everything else to cut your most common woodworking joints.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Middle Eastern Dancing for All Shapes and Sizes
description_book: If you love to shake your shimmy or want to try dancing for the first time, come out and join us.

name: Choral Conducting
description_book: Hands-on training in conducting patterns, cueing, finding and fixing errors, and choral leadership. You will sing and direct with teacher mentoring.
description_web: Taught by a past Pennsic Choir director, this class covers conducting patterns, cueing, finding and fixing errors, and choral leadership. Participants will sing and direct the other students in a choral piece, with assistance and advice from the instructor.

name: Bardic Coaching
description_book: Performers present a three- to five-minute piece and receive personal feedback with the object of increasing effectiveness.

name: Youth Rapier Fencing Practice
description_book: Youth rapier practice, ages 6 to 17. Come out and fence.
description_web: Youth rapier fencing practice, ages 6 to 17. Come out and fence.

name: AEthelmearc Tag Team Youth/Adult Tourney
description_book: All Kingdoms! Bring your teams of youth and adult fighters to determine the best combatants of the day in their respective divisions of heavy combat.
description_web: Once again, youth and adult fighters meet on the field of battle for glory and honor. Each team will bring forward 1 youth and 1 adult fighter. Adult fights adult, youth fights youth, (3 divisions). Typically, there are 50 pairs or more so bring your friends and their best heavy fighter for the largest youth tournament in the Known World!

name: Beginning Spear Throwing
description_book: Learn to accurately throw spears without destroying your arm. History and development of spears will be covered. By Lord Dominic Seamor.
description_web: Learn to accurately throw spears without destroying your arm. History and development of spears will be covered. By Lord Dominic Seamor

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web:
Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater Wednesday 8/6 6-7 pm.
You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Known World Baronial Rapier Champions Tournament
description_book: Participants must be the current rapier champion of their Barony; a tourney for the entertainment of Their Excellencies and the gallery.
description_web: A tournament displaying the finest displays of chivalry, pageantry and knowledge between baronial champions, for the entertainment of Their Excellencies and the gallery. Participants must be the current rapier champion of their Barony.

instructor: THL Don Po Silvertop the Rogue
name: AE Rapier Novice Tourney
description_book: For novices: less than three years from first rapier authorization; have never received a Kingdom-level rapier award or won a published-event tourney.
description_web:
This tournament is open to any authorized rapier combatant with less than three years from their first rapier authorization, who has never received an award at the Kingdom level for rapier prowess and who has never won a rapier tourney at a published SCA event. The tourney will be run as a multiple-bearpit tourney. Prizes will be awarded.

Note: This tournament will take place on the main battlefield near the rapier field

name: Intermediate Middle Eastern Drumming: 7/8 and 10/8
description_book: Add to your repertoire odd-numbered rhythms played in 7/8 and 10/8. *Samai*, *Curcuna, Laz*, and variations are covered. Beginners welcome.

name: How to Draw Manuscript Flora
description_book: If you passed kindergarten art class, you can draw a 14th-century French scroll.
description_web: If you passed kindergarten art class, you can draw a 14th-century French scroll. This class will break down the elements and have you leaving confident and ready to illuminate.

name: Medicine, Physick, and Surgery
description_book: An overview of medicine as practiced by doctors, surgeons, and apothecaries.
description_web: An overview of the three "official" branches of healthcare (physicians, surgeons, apothecaries), with a look at other trades such as midwife, herbalist, etcetera.

name: Silent Heralds' Roundtable
description_book: A gathering of Silent Heralds and people interested in Silent Heraldry to discuss topics important to providing services to the populace.
description_web: This will be an opportunity for Silent Heralds across the Known World to gather, make new acquaintances, and renew friendships. During this gathering of Silent Heralds and people interested in Silent Heraldry we will discuss topics important to providing services to the populace. Topics may include, but are not limited to, how to get started in Silent Heraldry, what our purpose is, appropriate conduct and etiquette.

name: Hand-Sewing 101
description_book: A discussion and hands-on of hand-sewing of garb, etc. This is not embroidery, but useful stitches. Please bring needle, thread and light cloth.

name: Demystifying the East: Byzantine Dress
description_book: Byzantine clothing may come off as daunting and foreign, but this class is designed to give an in-depth look at their clothing.
description_web: Byzantine clothing may come off as daunting and foreign, but this class is designed to give an in-depth look at this type of clothing.  This is a 2-hour discussion spanning the time period from the 4th century through the 15th, focusing on what was worn, how they were made, the Byzantine silk trade, and the impact of outside influences. An outline will be provided; supplies for note taking are encouraged.

name: Medieval Pigments II: Acanthus Leaves
description_book: Paint acanthus leaves from *Göttingen Model Book*. Basic paint-making and pigment safety. Tools and materials provided.
description_web: Paint acanthus leaves from *Göttingen Model Book*. Basic-paint making and pigment safety. Tools and materials provided.

name: Christoforo's Wonderful Pastries
description_book: A German pastry stuffed with a French custard and a cloak-shaped pastry from the 1549 Italian cookbook *Banchetti* by Cristoforo di Messisbugo.

name: Bellatrix System: Teardrop Return
description_book: A very powerful sword technique, providing very rapid, powerful combinations. Unarmored class; appropriate for all levels of proficiency.
description_web: The class teaches the Teardrop Return, one of the essential and most powerful offensive techniques of the Bellatrix method of fighting with sword and shield. It provides the fighter with the ability to use very rapid combinations of full-force strikes. The class is appropriate for authorized fighters at all levels of proficiency. The class is taught unarmored. Students must bring a sword and a shield.

name: Dancing at the Villa: Negri Favorites
description_book: Two fun and showy 16th-century Italian dances from *Le Gratie d'Amore* by Cesare Negri: *Lo Spagnoletto* and *Bizzaria d'Amore*.
description_web: Two fun and showy 16th-century Italian dances from *Le Gratie d'Amore* by Cesare Negri: *Lo Spagnoletto* and *Bizzaria d'Amore*.

name: *Kamon*: Samurai Banners
description_book: An introduction to the history, function, aesthetics, and display of Japanese heraldry.
description_web: An illustrated introduction to the history, function, aesthetics, and display of Japanese heraldry.

name: Arbeau's Galliard Technique
description_book: This class is not so much about how to dance the galliard as how to practice to dance the galliard.
description_web: This class is not so much about how to dance the galliard as how to practice to dance the galliard.

name: Laugh and Lie Down
description_book: A simple trick-taking card game played with a Tarot deck, fun for children and adults.
description_web: A simple trick-taking card game played with a Tarot deck, fun for children and adults.

name: Known World Children's Fête in the Great Hall
description_book: Known World Children's Fête
description_web: Join us in a day of fun and friendship at a party for all children attending Pennsic. There will be fun activities and treats for the children. Please ensure that all children have a parent or guardian present with them at the fête.

name: KW Choir: Children's Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: The KW Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert.
description_web: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert on Thursday of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon 8/7 in the PAT, details TBA during regular rehearsals.)

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. No fee. String provided.

name: Iron *Commedia*: Creating a New 16th-Century Play
description_book: Join actors from your favorite improvisational *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes to craft, cast, perform, & premier a brand-new play in just one afternoon!
description_web: If you've ever laughed at the zany antics of improvisational *Commedia dell'Arte*, join members from your favorite troupes to craft, cast, and perform a brand new *commedia* play in just one afternoon with its world premier at at Pennsic that same day! Two sessions, two performances, one each week. Find a mask, put it on, and see what happens!

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Bellydance for Wee Ones
description_book: Bring your littlest bellydancer to this fun, inclusive, stress-free class to initiate the tiniest. Ages 4-12. One adult per child **must** attend.
description_web: For the little people. Bring the little ones who love trailing after Mom around the fire; fun, safe, stress-free, and educational. Young children learn the basics while having a blast. Shaheen has taught many children's workshops and ongoing classes.

instructor: Baroness Una de Saint Luc, OL, OP
name: Perspective and Shading Techniques
description_book: Scribes will learn how to make an item appear three-dimensional on a flat surface.
description_web: Scribes will learn how to make an item appear three-dimensional on a flat surface.  This will help scribes who are interested in making *trompe l'oeil-* style scrolls.

name: Beginning Pewter Casting in Soapstone
description_book: Where do those great pewter site tokens come from? Learn how to do them and much more! A discussion, with examples, of basic soapstone casting.
description_web: Where do those great pewter site tokens come from? Learn how to do them and much more! A discussion, with examples, of basic soapstone casting. I will have some soapstone and pewter available for sale.

name: *Opus Consutum*: Appliqué in the 14th Century
description_book: This medieval appliqué technique is a quick, simple way to embellish your domestic textiles or clothing. Hands-on class with materials provided.
description_web: The 1392 Tristan tapestry at the V&A in London and other examples of European appliqué textiles form the basis for this hands-on class on a medieval appliqué technique that's a quick, simple way to embellish your domestic textiles or clothing. Hands-on class with materials provided.
fee_itemization: Color handout, fabric, thread, cord, needle

name: Counted German White Work Embroidery
description_book: A hands-on class utilizing counted white work fill stitches to create a small take-home project.

name: 14th-Century Alliterative Poetry
description_book: Join the "Alliterative Revival"! Learn about the "Alliterative Long Line" - a high medieval poetic style with its roots in Anglo-Saxon poetry.
description_web: Chaucer wasn’t the only game in town for poetry in the 14th century. Join the "Alliterative Revival"! The “Alliterative Long Line” was a poetry style evocative of Anglo-Saxon verse, but with the distinctive imagery of the 14th century. We will discuss how to create the alliterative long line that appears in many poems from this period, as well as how to blend it with rhyming poetry such as in “Sir Gawain and the Green Knight”.

name: Beginning Coiled Basket-Making
description_book: Learn to make a small basket utilizing traditional coiling techniques. Student will be provided all materials. Beginner-level skill.
description_web: Learn to make a small basket utilizing traditional coiling techniques with period materials. Student will be provided all materials to make a small basket. Beginner-level skill.

name: The Fairy Tale and Legend Workshop
description_book: Will review period instances and sources of fairy tales and legends, and show how to re-construct tales which could have been told in period.
description_web: We will go briefly over the history and definitions of fairy tales and legends, instances of fairy tales in period, how to look for period sources of both, and how to identify and use motifs to construct/reconstruct tales which could have been told/recorded in period. The participants in the workshop will construct a fairy tale and a legend.

name: Japanese Tea Drama!
description_book: Politics, murder, and ritual suicide in Momoyama Japan - all related to tea and tea culture. Tea was heavily involved in military and politics.
description_web: During the Momoyama period of Japan, tea culture was tightly tied to and connected to politics and the military. This class will offer a review of Japanese military tea culture, traditions, and some customs. Topics include murder, ritual suicide, and other mature themes. A selection of books will be on hand.

name: Paternosters: The Evidence
description_book: Lecture class on evidence for prayer bead construction from Europe prior to 1600, and the benefits and challenges of each source.
description_web: We will discuss what evidence we have for the construction of prayer beads in Europe prior to 1600 and the benefits and challenges of using each kind of source. Lecture-style class.

name: Bellatrix System: Two Sword
description_book: The techniques and strategy of the Bellatrix system of fighting with the two-sword style. Unarmored class. Appropriate for all levels of proficiency.
description_web: The class teaches the techniques and strategy of the Bellatrix system of fighting with the two-sword style. The class is appropriate for authorized fighters at all levels of proficiency. The class is taught unarmored. Students must bring two swords, and preferably a shield.

name: Dancing at the Villa: Dances from Caroso
description_book: Join us at the beautiful Casa Bardicci to learn two fun 16th-century Italian dances: *Villanella* and *Castellana*.
description_web: Join us at the beautiful Casa Bardicci to learn two fun 16th-century Italian dances: *Villanella* and *Castellana*, both from Master Caroso's first book, *Il Ballarino*!

name: Beginner Dance: Absolute Beginner D
description_book: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the Ball!
description_web: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the Ball!

name: Barbarians vs Ancients
description_book: A battle to show off your ancient equipment! Weapons will be limited to appropriate for the personas. Please show off your pre-450 AD kit!
description_web: We want one and all to come out and fight. A chance to showcase your ancient rigs and get inspired for new ones.

name: KW Choir: Youth Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: The KW Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 18 to learn period vocal music and performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert.
description_web: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 18 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella*. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choir and Friends Concert on Thursday of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon 8/7 in the PAT, details TBA during regular rehearsals.)

name: PA Series: Middle Eastern Dance Exhibition
description_book: The Middle Eastern Dance Exhibition returns to delight and amaze audiences of all ages!
description_web: The Middle Eastern Dance Exhibition returns to delight and amaze audiences of all ages!

name: Cut-and-Thrust Tournament
description_book: Swash your buckler and swing your side sword, it's time for the Pennsic Cut-and-Thrust tournament. All secondary forms permitted.
description_web: Swash your buckler and swing your side sword, it's time for the Pennsic Cut-and-Thrust tournament. Competitors must be qualified in Cut-and-Thrust in their home kingdom. All secondary forms permitted.

name: Known World Courtesan Social
description_book: Join us for an afternoon of leisure, food and entertainment. This “meet ‘n greet” is open to anyone interested in courtesan history and/or persona.
description_web: Join our 3nd Annual Social for an afternoon of leisure, food and entertainment. This “meet and greet” is open to anyone who has an interest in courtesan history and/or courtesan persona. Topics of conversation will include introductions, courtesan persona Q&A, plus future meetings. More details can be found at http://courtesans.weebly.com.

name: Beginners' *Atlatl* Throwing (Afternoon)
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.
description_web: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.

instructor: Lord archer bear horseman of rockbr
name: Make Your Own Flemish String for Any Bow
description_book: Make a string for your recurve, long bow, horse bow or crossbow using modern B-50 Dacron.
fee_itemization: String material, Serving material, nock material

name: Frederick II, Louis IX, Edward I: Crusader Kings
description_book: Discuss and examine the lives, ideologies, practices, and policies of three 13th-century Crusader kings who changed the medieval world.
description_web: Come learn and discuss the world, lives, practices, ideals, and history of Emperor Frederick II of the Holy Roman Empire, King Louis IX of France, and Edward I of England, and see how they impacted the wars for control of the Holy Land. A discussion will be held as well to dissect the intricate nature of Crusading during the 13th century, and how these men may have led to the end of the Crusading period in the Levant. No previous knowledge of the period required.

name: Couching 1: Medievalest Embroidery Stitch of All
description_book: Part 1: Class attendees will learn the simple couching stitch and its many variations.  (Gold work in Part 2.)
description_web: Class attendees will learn the simple couching stitch and its variations, including basic couching, Bayeaux/ laidwork, couched appliqué, Kloster stitch, maybe even late-period strawberries, and how its use changed throughout the medieval time period. Bring embroidery supplies if you have them. I will have supplies available for those who don't have everything they need. Part 2 (another class) will cover work with gold (*or nué*), surface couching and underside couching.

name: Basic Silversmithing
description_book: Make period-style pendant using cabochon semi-precious stone, sterling sheet and wire. Includes forming, soldering and finishing.
description_web: Students will make a pendant using cabochon semi-precious stones which would have been available in period, and sterling silver sheet and wire. The processes will include forming, silver soldering and finishing.
fee_itemization:
Silver sheet and wire  $25
Semiprecious stone  $10
Expendable materials  $5

name: Conversational Russian
description_book: Covers the Russian alphabet and basic modern-day Russian conversational phrases, plus words and phrases more related to the SCA.
description_web: The class will cover the Russian alphabet and basic modern-day Russian conversational phrases, responses and questions. After that we will go over words and phrases more related to the SCA, which can be used to flavor one’s persona. There will be time reserved at the end of the class for questions.

name: Knitting in the 16th Century: An Overview
description_book: Not only is hand-knitting period, the 16th century has a wealth of items to choose from. We'll look at a wide range of caps, gloves, and hosen.
description_web: Not only is hand-knitting period, the 16th century has a wealth of items to choose from. We'll look at a wide range of caps, gloves, and hosen. Interested in Eleanora of Toledo's stockings? I wrote the pattern!
fee_itemization: I have a handout with color illustrations & extensive bibliography.

name: Bardic Collegium #3: Crowdsourcing the Muse
description_book: Having trouble finishing that poem? Finding a rhyme for orange? Your Elder Edda is turning into Star Trek? What is giving you pause? We can help!
description_web: Having trouble finishing that poem? Finding a rhyme for orange? Somehow your piece from the Elder Edda is turning into Star Trek? This Bardic Collegium is an open floor help session were you can tell us how far you've gone and what is giving you pause. Everyone who has an idea can pitch in and help - and isn't that what the Bardic Community is all about?

name: Abbess Hildegard: A Female Voice in a Male World
description_book: Hildegard of Bingen, a 12th-century German abbess, was an outspoken and multi-faceted woman in a very masculine world.
description_web: Hildegard of Bingen, a 12th-century German abbess, was a mystic and theologian, a musician and physician, a playwright and poet, and a – sometimes unbidden – advisor to kings and popes. This class delves into the life and works of this forthright and fascinating woman.

name: Viking Age Feast Gear: The Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of feast gear and cookware options from among the archaeological finds of the Old Norse World; 43-page handout is available.
description_web: A survey of feast gear and cookware options from among the archaeological finds of the Old Norse World. We will look at items from Birka, Gotland, Oseberg, York, and other sites; 43-page handout is available.

name: The *Montante* (Iberian Greatsword) of Godinho
description_book: This class will cover the basics of the *montante*, a two-handed greatsword, of Godinho. Bring your greatsword (5~6' two-handed sword) or simulator.
description_web: This class will cover the basics of the *montante*, a two-handed greatsword, of Godinho. Bring your greatsword (5~6' two-handed sword) or simulator.  The *montante* is described as the "Queen of Swords". This class will teach the *montante* in rules as laid down by Domingo Luis Godinho in 1599. Trainers are limited.

name: Bellatrix System: Single-Hip Return
description_book: Very powerful sword technique; allows combinations with full-force strikes on each count; unarmored class for all levels of proficiency.
description_web: The class teaches the Single-Hip Return, one of the essential and most powerful offensive techniques of the Bellatrix method of fighting with sword and shield. It allows the fighter to use combinations, with full-force strikes on each count, instead of every other count. The class is appropriate for authorized fighters at all levels of proficiency. The class is taught unarmored. Students must bring a sword and a shield.

name: Dancing at the Villa: A Caroso Ball
description_book: A Caroso Ball will be held in the ballroom of Casa Bardicci. Don't miss this opportunity to dance in the villa by the lake.

name: Beginner Dance: Bransles C
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn fun bransles from 16th-century France.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then introduce you to fun bransles from 16th-century France.

name: Introduction to Crocheting
description_book: A beginner's class to introduce basic crocheting skills.
fee_itemization: Ten dollar material fee covers your choice of crochet needle, 2 balls of yarn, refreshments and informational handout

name: Card Games
description_book: This class will review the card games previously taught and let you practice playing them with an instructor's assistance.
description_web: This class will review the card games previously taught and let you practice playing them with an instructor's assistance.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.

name: Expression with *Bharata Natyam*
description_book: Learn the gentle arts of self expression using classical Indian techniques. Class will include historical overview and a very short choreography.
description_web: The modern style of *Bharata Natyam* is a great inspiration and interpretation for the movements of classical Indian dance treatises. Learn some of movements from the expressive side of *Bharata Natyam* with a short choreography, work on expression techniques and a short historical overview.

name: Crumhorn Consort
description_book: Music session for players of the "soft" double-reeds: crumhorns, cornamusen, dolzaines, etc. (Recorders also welcome.) Sheet music provided.
description_web: Bring out your "buzzy" instruments and play through a set of 15th- and 16th-century songs. Attendees will take home a packet of sheet music good for crumhorns and similar instruments.

name: Kumihimo Basics
description_book: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: The Polearm Techniques of Paulus Hector Mair
description_book: A look at several techniques from the 16th-century manual of arms of Paulus Hector Mair.
description_web: A look at several techniques from the 16th-century manual of arms of Paulus Hector Mair.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Youth Combat afternoon sessions, 3-5 PM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.
description_web: Youth Combat afternoon sessions, 3-5 PM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.

name: Where to Find the Fun, Once It Has Been Lost
description_book: Have you lost "the fun"? Changing how you identify yourself is difficult. Come join in a discussion on ways to find the fun again.
description_web: There are a great many ways in which you can lose "the fun". You may or may not have had any control over its leaving. Times change, people change. With those changes so can "fun" change. Come join me in a discussion on ways to find the fun again.

name: *Cloisonné* Enameling
description_book: Introduction to the technique, tools, and materials of *cloisonné* enamel. Kits are available for students to create a small piece.
description_web: Students will be introduced to the technique, tools, and materials of *cloisonné* enamel. Kits are available for students to create a small piece of their own. You may - and are encouraged - to bring wire working tools such as pliers and cutters.
fee_itemization: Kit Includes handout, blank disk to apply enamels, cloisonne' wire and use of instructor's enamel colors and kiln to fire.

name: Known World Beekeepers Gathering
description_book: Join fellow beekeepers to swap tips and tales from the field. Please bring a sample of your own honey to share.

name: Basics of Hennin Construction
description_book: Anyone can make a hennin, truncated or horned. No sewing experience necessary!
description_web: Everyone should have a hat! Learn the basics of making a hennin, truncated or horned. Learn how to make a pattern, hand sew, work with buckram, add beads or pearls and/or trim. Novices welcome!
fee_itemization: Samples of fabrics and trim will be given.

name: Blockprinting on Fabric and Paper
description_book: European-style blockprinting on fabric and paper. This hands-on class will include period and modern methods for block carving and printing.
description_web: European-style blockprinting on fabric and paper using wood blocks. Printed fabric was used for clothing, wall hangings, tablecloths, etc. This hands-on class will focus on historical techniques and include block carving and printing.

name: Understanding Oak's Contribution to Wine Flavor
description_book: Taste the same wine flavored with different oaks & different lengths of extraction for each oak. (For Brewers & Wine Lovers) Note: over 21 only.
description_web:
The oak barrel became a gold standard for storing and aging wine in the middle ages. Science has improved the understanding of its contributions to wines but it remains remains mysterious to wine makers and wine enthusiasts. 
 
I will present the same wine treated with 6 different oaks with each of 3 different length of contact with the wine.

The 6 oaks are:
French Medium Toast, French Medium Plus Toast, French Heavy Toast
American Medium Toast, Hungarian Medium Plus Toast, American Heavy Toast
 
The 3 contact lengths are:
a 1-2 week short infusion
a 6-8 week medium length infusion
a 3-4 week medium infusion that used the oak from short infusion (simulates a barrel for a second or third year)

We will also discuss a strategy to control the oak level in wine by blending
 
Target audience: This class will be of extreme use to wine makers. It is also useful to non wine makers to understand the contribution of oak to all wines and so that they can use oak to improve or customize commercial wines that they buy.

Note: over 21 only.

name: Machines, Technology and Change
description_book: Technology survey: Classical Greece through medieval. Construction, ship building, power (horse, water, wind), clocks, education, etc.

name: ASHI Bloodborne Pathogens
description_book: Information that will help students understand what blood-borne pathogens are; how risks of exposure can be reduced for themselves and others.
description_web: Bloodborne Pathogens awareness program includes information that will help students understand what bloodborne pathogens are and how risks of exposure can be reduced for themselves and others. The program assists in satisfying the training requirements of the U.S. Department of Labor, OSHA Bloodborne Pathogens Standard (29 CFR 1920.1030). Students will be given the option of taking the test for certification. No fee for class but fee for certification.
fee_itemization: Separate fee for certification card or course materials.

name: Afternoon Yoga: Bring a Partner If You've Got One!
description_book: Partner yoga can be a way of advancing your practice, having a great workout with a friend, or meeting a new one if willing. Singles welcome.
description_web: Partner yoga can be a way of advancing your practice, having a great workout with a friend, or meeting a new one if willing. Singles welcome. Bring a yoga strap or belt, as well as a mat or towel for each participant. Yoga can help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: 8th Annual Warriors of History Tourney
description_book: An unbelted tournament for kits that are documented.
description_web:
Hosted by the Cataphracts and Chivalry of Duchy Von Drachenklaue and the East Kingdom’s Crimson Company. An unbelted tournament for kits that meet the standards of the Fedoratii of the VDK: Order of the Cataphract to encourage and inspire excellence of kit on the field. 

This year’s weapon choice: Iconic weapons of your persona. Please bring to the field that form which best represents your period. 

Participants **must** appear in armour that inspires others to excellence, having no glaringly un-documentable aspects beyond those required for safety, i.e., baskethilts, bargrills, cops, gauntlets, etc. (Rule of thumb: if you can document it, you can have it -- to include kits based on period works of art. If you cannot document it, you must make a reasonable attempt to hide it.)

Participants should be prepared to document their choices in kit.
Guaranteed rejections: 
•	Exposed modern footwear. Period footwear is preferred. All effort must be made to make modern footwear appear as period as possible. 
•	Street hockey gloves **unless** covered or colored to look like real gauntlets or gloves. 
•	Exposed plastic to include plastic lamellar 
•	"Casserole" armour. Casserole: any mis-mash of time periods, e.g. Churburg breastplate with a Dura helm and Wisby gauntlets, etc. (All these are documentable by themselves, but centuries apart.) 
•	Inappropriate persona/arms combination such as Viking with a heater, great-swording Roman, madu, etc.
•	A t-tunic over football pads or similar look. 
•	Armour in poor condition or disrepair, undyed leather, etc. 
Two winners will be selected. (We ask that entrants or friends of competitors donate prizes for the winners' cache.) 
•	The Tournament Winner (martial prowess) will receive the title "Fedoratii Primus Pilus". 
•	The second winner will be chosen from amongst the participants as "best kit in show" and receive the title "Fedoratii Signifer". 
•	Both will be inducted into the VDK "Order of the Fedoratii".

name: West African Percussion (*Djembe*, *Dunun*)
description_book: History, tradition, context for beginners on up in the art of West African percussion. Technique, rhythms. Bring your drum. Some will be available.
description_web:
History, tradition, and context for beginners on up in the art of West African percussion. 

Daniel has studied and performed *djembe* and *dunun* for over two decades, having had the opportunity to learn from and perform with some of the best players from Guinea, Mali, Senegal and other countries in West Africa. He was once given the name Tegebuson by Abdoul Doumbia which means 'whip-hand.' He will show you proper technique, demonstrate various rhythms, and get you playing accessible, fun rhythms. 

If you have questions about drum-building or what to do about a broken, rope-tuned hand drum, he can answer those as well.

name: Known World Players - Open Auditions: Pennsic 44
description_book: Known World Players Pennsic 44 Auditions: Shakespeare's "The Merchant of Venice." Actors of all experience levels are welcome to come audition!
description_web: Known World Players Pennsic 44 auditions for next year's production of Shakespeare's "The Merchant of Venice", directed by Master Lorcan Dracontius.  Actors of all experience levels are welcome to come audition!

name: Don Edmund the Lame Memorial Two-Handed Tournament
description_book: Dedicated to the form Edmund so dearly loved, the two-handed sword. Single elimination, random pairings. Pennsic two-handed conventions.
description_web:
We invite everyone to join us to celebrate our beloved friend, Don Edmund The Lame. The tourney is dedicated to the form Edmund so dearly loved - the two-handed sword. The tourney format is a simple one. It is single elimination, random pairing tourney. Double kills count as a loss for both parties. Standard Pennsic two-handed conventions are in effect, and can be found in the Pennsic Rapier Rulebook. Tournament MIC: Don Caine Ramsey and Don Nathaniel Wyatt.

 After the tourney, there will be a small service to honor our fallen friend.

name: Beyond Ax, Knife and Spear
description_book: Tent stakes, military shovels, farm implements, pizza cutters and the Deadly Throwing Chickens. By THL John the Bear and Lord Ruttiger Lutz
description_web: Tent stakes, military shovels, farm implements, pizza cutters and the Ostgardr Deadly Ninja Throwing Chickens. Show and tell for weird thrown weapons to demonstrate, pending marshal approval. By THL John the Bear and Lord Ruttiger Lutz

name: Dwarves vs Giants
description_book: This is a series of combats and melées between fighters five and a half feet and under and fighters six and a quarter feet and over.

name: Thank You Tourney
description_book: A fundraiser tournament for the Leukemia Lymphoma Society to thank those who helped bring awareness to childhood cancers from a ten year survivor.
description_web: Torstien Thorgrimson would like to thank all those who helped him ten years ago when his battle with cancer started.  He is now a ten year survivor and able to fight as an adult and would like to engage in combat with all comers to raise money for cancer research by supporting the Lukemia Lymphoma Society!  Please come and donate what you can and have **FUN**!

name: Beyond Brewing: Vinegar
description_book: Learn some history about vinegar, how to use it and, most importantly, how to make it at home.
description_web: Learn some history about vinegar, how to use it and, most importantly, how to make it at home. Limited handouts; the information will be available online after Pennsic. Bring a spoon to class to get a taste of homemade vinegar while samples last.

name: Puzzlework Initials and Pen Flourishing
description_book: Decorate your scrolls with pen flourishing and puzzlework initials. Learn historical background and practical techniques in this hands-on class.
description_web: Decorate your scrolls with pen flourishing and puzzlework initials. Learn historical background and practical techniques in this hands-on class. Bring these materials, if you have them: several colors of ink, small paintbrushes, dip pens with pointed nibs, pencil, paper or pergamenata.

name: Running an Event: Basics to Best Practices
description_book: Discover best practices from around the Society for making new or annual events run more smoothly. Appropriate for newcomers and the not-so-new.
description_web: What are the basic things you need to remember if you're running an event? What are some of the "best practices" (or recommended) ways to organize a new or returning event? How can you make an annual event run even smoother? This class uses focused discussion to discover some of the best practices we've seen around the Society, and how to apply them to your own local events. This class will not cover how to run a feast (please see the class schedule for a different complete class on that topic), and will focus primarily on local or baronial level events. The instructor has mundane experience running events for two other non-profit organizations in addition to SCA events.

name: Wildly Weedy Herbs
description_book: Learn about some medieval and Renaissance herbs now growing wild in the U.S. No walking required.
description_web: Interested in learning how to spot some of the herbs known to our medieval and Renaissance forebears that have escaped and become weeds here? Were they weeds at home? How are they/were they used? We'll cover probably 20 herbal invaders. Instructor will strive to bring examples of most if not all plants to handle.

name: Bardic Cat Herding
description_book: Methods and tactics for directing performances by bards. Will also discuss methods and tactics for bards to take direction.
description_web: Methods and tactics for directing performances by bards. Will also discuss methods and tactics for bards to take direction.

name: *Kenjutsu*: The Art of Japanese Swordsmanship
description_book: Dojo-style class, covering basics of Japanese sword. Japanese practice sword or equivalent (wood or metal) required. Limited loaners available.
description_web:
A traditional-style class on Japanese *kenjutsu*, drawn from multiple sources, including modern and traditional arts. The class will be arranged to emphasize techniques that are known to have been used pre-1600. Emphasis will be on physical repetition more than scholarly discussion. The latter will be available after class, informally, as requested.
About the instructor: I have over 15 years of experience in Japanese sword arts, including *Nakamura Ryu Battodo (IBF 4-dan), ZNKR Kendo (1-kyu), Mugai Ryu Iaihyodo*, and *Shindo Muso Ryu Jodo*.

name: Fool's School Performances and Graduation
description_book: Come watch the graduation performances and commencement ceremonies of the Pennsic War "Fool's School"!
description_web: Come watch the graduation performances and commencement ceremonies of the Pennsic War "Fool's School"! To participate, you must attend "Fool School". (See Pennsic University classes). This will be your graduation performance. You will perform for no more than 5 minutes during an emceed variety show. Upon completion you will receive a certificate and be a "Licensed Fool".

name: Viking Age Clothing: The Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of the major finds of Viking Age clothing, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make accurate reproductions; 45-page handout.
description_web: A brief survey of the major finds of Viking Age clothing, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make reasonably accurate reproductions. We will cover Thorsbjerg, Mammen, Viborg, Damendorf, Birka, Eura, and other finds; 45-page handout is available.

name: Brewing With Egil: Reconstructed Viking Brewing
description_book: Ever wondered how the Vikings brewed? Come learn about an evidence-based reconstruction of a plausible Viking-era brewing system!
description_web: The sagas tell us that Vikings had ale, but no written records detailing its production survive. How was it made? What was it like? Using literary, linguistic, archaeological, and scientific sources from several cultures (along with experimental creation), I will present my hypothesis detailing the production of two distinct classes of cereal beverage in the Viking age. Come listen, learn, and discuss!

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to Gypsy Persona
description_book: Don't know how/where to start with this persona? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a Gypsy persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.

name: First Aid or CPR Challenges
description_book: Individuals can challenge to recertify by taking the written and physical tests. These will be ASHI challenges, unless other instructors can be found.
description_web: Individuals can challenge to recertify by taking the written and physical tests. If the challenge is unsuccessful, the recommendation is for the full class. These will be ASHI challenges, unless other instructors can be found. Individual challenges take approximately 1 hour.

instructor: Lady Nina Amaya of Bright Hills
name: How to Perform with Live Music: Performance Track
description_book: Professionals give tips on how to look and feel confident performing with a band behind you. Live music in class with ISHTAR. Be in the Concert!
description_web: There were no CDs in the Middle Ages. Using their 30 years of combined Middle Eastern music performance experience, Melissa of Ishtar and Nina Amaya, dancer, will offer tips and techniques on how to look and feel confident performing with a band behind you. Ishtar will perform Oriental-style music for the class to dance. Prior dance and performance experience - to live music or recordings - is highly recommended. Participants are invited to perform afterwards in a concert!

name: The Hammered Dulcimer Unleashed
description_book: Join Vince Conaway (THL Vincenzo da Brescia) as he explores period and original music on hammered dulcimer, interspersed with his tales from the road.
description_web: Join Vince Conaway (THL Vincenzo da Brescia) as he explores period and original music on hammered dulcimer, interspersed with his tales from the road. Vincenzo is a professional dulcimer player, or *salterista*, who tours extensively in Europe in addition to keeping a full schedule of festivals and events in the US and Canada.

name: Darkyard Tree Ceremony
description_book: Annual Tree Ceremony/ Forgan tribute on Runestone Hill for Household members and friends

name: Iron *Commedia* World Premiere at the Amphitheater
description_book: Actors from your favorite improvisational *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes craft, cast, perform & premiere a brand-new play in just one afternoon!
description_web: Earlier this same day, a group of foolish players came together to craft, cast, and create a brand new sixteenth-century *Commedia dell'Arte* play to premiere before your very eyes! Sorry, we can't give you a plot synopsis but we only just built the plot a few hours before the performance! Come see the zany foolishness in extremely live theatre! Note: Possibly some material inappropriate for younger children but it's unknown until the play is created at the workshop earlier that day.

name: Museums and Archaeological Sites of Europe
description_book: This presentation travels through Europe and Scandinavia looking at artifacts from museums and investigating archaeological sites.
description_web: This presentation looks at artifacts from museums and archives from around Europe and Scandinavia and investigates archaeological sites that have been excavated and visited by Dread Viscountess Seelie (mka Barb Klessig, M.A., Archaeology).

name: Anglo-Saxon Kings
description_book: From Offa to Harold, Redwald to Ethelred, the Kings of England gave us some of the best stories about kings ever!
description_web: From Offa to Harold, Redwald to Ethelred, the Kings of England gave us some of the best stories about kings ever! Just a collection of great stories about Anglo-Saxon Kings. From the earliest kings to the latest, from fighting Celts, to Vikings, to Normans, dealing with queens and saints, these guys had so much energy and wit and craziness an hour is not enough, but I'll talk fast!

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children at Runestone Hill.
description_web: 7pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend, must have adult escort.

name: Chess Night
description_book: Join us in the Games Tent for a friendly game of chess.

name: Period Lamp and Blowpipe Soldering, Plus Welding
description_book: Braze and weld with lamp and blowpipe on charcoal blocks.
description_web: Braze and weld with lamp and blowpipe on charcoal blocks.

name: John Inchingham, Cerian Cantwr & House Sans Nomen
description_book: John Inchingham, Cerian Cantwr, and House Sans Nomen in concert. Come and listen to the music and mayhem of some of the Midrealm's best known bards.
description_web: Come and listen to the music and mayhem of some of the Midrealm's best known bards. **Warning:** Sightings of polar cows, were-llamas, and ladies with swords and spears are likely.

name: A Night with Knights
description_book: We invite members of the Chivalry from all kingdoms to get in armor and come to the youth list! Give our young fighters the benefit of your expertise.
description_web: We invite members of the Chivalry from all kingdoms to get in armor and come to the youth list! You can give our young fighters the benefit of your expertise. Sparring between adults and youths will be allowed under these special training conditions. All weapons, calibration and conventions will be as per Youth Combat rules. Parents/guardians are advised that allowing your child to participate shall be understood as permission for this type of training.

name: *i Verdi Confusi* (Ampitheater)
description_book: Players' Patchwork Theatre Company returns for more zany *Commedia dell'Arte* as the final act of an evening of foolishness at the Amphitheatre!
description_web: Players' Patchwork Theatre Company returns for more zany *Commedia dell'Arte* as the final act of an evening of foolishness at the Amphitheatre!  Note: Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.

name: Marian of Heatherdale and Friends: Bardic Concert
description_book: Marian of Heatherdale and Friends present a bardic concert of song and story.
