description_web: Well-known bard Mistress Marian of Heatherdale (modern recording artist Heather Dale) will be joined on stage by other bardic performers for a lively evening of song and story. Please join us as you wander through Merchant's Row! Great for all ages.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Youth Combat morning sessions, 8-10:30 AM.  Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.
description_web: Youth Combat morning sessions, 8-10:30 AM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: Food Lab Study Hall
description_book: Playtime for cooks! We got fire--You bring food! Bring your own food and recipes. Historically accurate cooking equipment, fuel and fire provided.
description_web:
Ever wanted to try hearth cooking but only had access to an electric range?  Thought about braizing in pottery but all you own is All-Clad? This is the place for you! In association with the Food Lab Classes, we have set up a Food Lab Study Hall. Bring your redacted recipes and see how they work out in our historically accurate equipment over real fire. Experts in open fire cooking will be available to help if needed. Come let your Feast Flag fly!

All participants entering the Food Lab Study Hall will be required to read the fire safety handout that will be available on site at all times.
fee_itemization: The $1 suggested donation is to cover the cost of reproducing the fire safety handout and pottery cooking handout for the Food Lab.  the $5 suggested donation is to help defray the cost of the materials for the Food Lab (fuel, cleaning supplies, etc.).

name: Populace Archery War Point Practice
description_book: Come to the archery range; practice the War Point shoots from 9-11 am during War Week except for Wednesday, August 6.
description_web: All archers can come to the archery range and practice the War Point shoots from 9 am to 11 am during War Week except Wednesday, August 6th, when the range is closed except for Archery Champions.

name: Pewtercasters Day
description_book: We carve molds in soap stone from 10-12, then cast the mold from 12-2 pm, followed by work on *repoussée* and *intaglia* gems from 2-4 pm.

name: Pleatwork Day
description_book: Pleatwork is period smocking. Try your hand at it and learn how to achieve different shaped necklines and other fascinating tidbits.
description_web: Pleatwork is period smocking. Try your hand at it and learn how to achieve different shaped necklines and other fascinating tidbits. This day is sponsored by Genoveva von Lubeck and Rainillt de Bello Marisco.

name: Soap Making Day
description_book: Making and using soap for washing, laundry and treating stains. See the process for making boiled soap and try your hand at making it.
description_web: Making and using soap for washing, laundry and treating stains. See the process for making boiled soap and try your hand at making it. Passers-by and participants will have the chance to test the cleaning abilities of various products on fabric, hands and hair.

name: The Greenland Gown
description_book: We will explore the fabric, patterns, and construction of the group of extant garments found in a graveyard  in Greenland.

name: How to Wrap a Sari
description_book: Discussion of several methods of wearing that new sari.

name: Waste-Free Garment Cutting
description_book: Twice the clothes from half the fabric...or at least, better clothes from less fabric. Come prepared to take notes.
description_web: Hand-spun, hand-woven, hand-finished...they never wasted a single thread. You don't have to! An overview of the thriftiest cutting and sewing tricks used in the SCA's target centuries. We cover only pre-17th century Western European clothing.

name: Long-Armed Cross Stitch: Attractive and Authentic
description_book: More than just a background stitch in Assisi work, it goes faster, and is prettier, than common cross stitch. Versatile and widely used late period!
description_web: More than just a background stitch (as in Assisi work), it goes faster, and is prettier, than common cross stitch. In late period, it was used on a broad variety of household objects, often to beautiful effect. We will do the stitch, then look at photos of widely varied extant examples.

name: Buttons: Woven in the Diagonal Ottoman Style
description_book: Learn to make the diagonally-woven buttons like often found on Ottoman kaftans. Note: there is a lot of manual dexterity and patience needed.
description_web: Many Ottoman buttons are threads woven on the diagonal over an oval wooden base. Come learn to make these Ottoman-style buttons. Note that there is a lot of manual dexterity and patience needed! These buttons are not easy to make. There will be a limit of 10 kits.
fee_itemization: kit includes needle, wax, floss, and bead bases to make several buttons.

name: Bellatrix: Individual Session
description_book: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.
description_web: An hour with Duke Paul for individuals or small groups, covering any martial topic. Contact Duke Paul at paul@bellatrix.org to schedule.

name: Known World Ladies' Championship Tournament
description_book: The Known World Ladies' Championship Tournament is only open to qualifiers from previous Tournaments.
description_web: The top Ladies in the Known World will battle it out for the Known World Championship. To qualify, you must finish in the top group in each of the previous qualifiers. The good news is there is a qualifying tournament at Pennsic. See the schedule for details. The tournament will be round-robin with the top four fighting a single elimination playoff to determine the champion.

name: SCA Rapier Combat for Historic Martial Artists
description_book: Field time for HMA-interested fencers to meet, teach, learn, and spar.
description_web:
This is a place and time for SCA fencers who are interested in, or are actively pursuing, the study of historic martial arts in the context of SCA rapier rules. During this time, you can meet others with similar interests, offer to teach, look to learn, or just come out to spar with the like-minded.

A daily sign-up sheet will allow those in attendance to connect with others with matched goals for the day (e.g. someone willing to teach Fabris can find students wanting to learn, or vice versa, or someone looking for a fight can get one), and each day will end with special HMA-related sparring challenges.

name: Thrown Weapons War Point Tournament
description_book: Thrown Weapons War Point, 9 am before Bridge Battle. Competitors by invitation of your kingdom.
description_web: Thrown Weapons War Point, 9 am before Bridge Battle. Competitors by invitation of your kingdom.

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia*, before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.

name: Middle Eastern Dance Concert with Ishtar and Nina
description_book: After a week of Pennsic's fabulous Middle Eastern Dance classes and workshops, dancers are bringing their best, to entertain and delight!
description_web: After a week of Pennsic's fabulous Middle Eastern Dance classes, and "How to Perform with Live Music" workshop, dancers are bringing their best, to entertain and delight! All performances are improvisational, from the heart, to the live music of Ishtar, the New World's premier 'bellydance' band!

name: How to Draw Manuscript Flora
description_book: If you passed kindergarten art class, you can draw a 14th-century French scroll.
description_web: If you passed kindergarten art class, you can draw a 14th-century French scroll. This class will break down the elements and have you leaving confident and ready to illuminate.

name: Adv. Calligraphy: *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*
description_book: Learn Rotunda lowercase, Rotunda caps, Italic, and cadels. Take your calligraphy to the next level. Four two-hour sessions. Not for beginners.
description_web: The *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta* is a late-period Renaissance master’s showcase. In this four-day, in-depth study, students will learn scripts used in this manuscript: Rotunda lowercase, Rotunda caps, Italic, and cadels. Take your calligraphy to the next level with our tips on analyzing scripts. Plan to attend all four two-hour sessions. Not suitable for beginners.
fee_itemization: calligraphy marker, watercolor paper, specialty nib, supplies, color handouts.  $10 fee, payable 8/4, covers all 4 classes.

name: Viking Navigation and the Sunstone
description_book: Early navigation methods up through Viking times, plus the use of sunstones. What the History Channel's 'Vikings' series almost got right - sort of.
description_web: The methods of navigation employed by the Viking navigators are slowly being verified by archaeological evidence. However, the search for answers goes on. This class will present early navigational aids based on discussions with two of the experts in this field: Soren Thirslund's research on the 'Viking Compass' at the Danish National Maritime Museum and Leif Karlsen's and our own research into sunstones. The published works of Thirslund and Karlsen are available from the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde, Denmark. We provide hands-on demonstrations and primary source documentation of these authors’ navigation theories.

name: Wire-Wrapped Jewelry
description_book: Learn the basics of wire-wrapped jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. Bring tools and materials if you have them.
description_web: Learn the basics of wire-wrapped jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. Please bring tools, wire and beads if you have them. There will be some tools available to borrow and some to purchase at cost.

name: Baby Carrier Survival Guide
description_book: Babywearing 101 to advanced. Help with any carrier, history, safety, feeding. Lots of hands-on and trouble-shooting. Bring baby. Latecomers welcome.
description_web: Babywearing 101 to advanced. Do you want to use a carrier at Pennsic but just can't "get" it? We have learned over time that holding your baby is good for them - and you. We have also experienced a baby that wants to be in arms most of the time. A quality carrier or a simple piece of cloth can give you that extra pair of hands you always think about. We will talk about historical carriers, extreme temperature baby-wearing, and how women managed in the hot fields world-wide and wore their baby. Expect lots of hands-on. You will learn new baby-wearing skills. Bring your carrier. I will be able to trouble shoot with you and show you how to be more comfortable with it. If your baby is fussy in a carrier, we can work together and see if there is a way he/she DOES like to be worn. While I will discuss historical carriers and babywearing in hot temperatures, trouble-shooting and getting everyone comfortable with a carrier is the focus of this class. This class was slotted for 2 hours; you can come any time even if the class is going on. Bring a flash drive to download my information.

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang
name: Basic Jewelry-Making, or How to Float a Pearl
description_book: Basics on design/recreation of jewelry including closures, spacing, double/triple strands, scalloping, extra adornments, fixing broken items.
description_web: Basics on design or recreation of jewelry including closures, spacing, double/triple strands, achieving scalloping, adding extra adornments, fixing a broken item, making a floating bead necklace, dropping a knot where you want it.
fee_itemization: kit with wire, string, beads, trinkets, closures

name: Viking Treasure Necklace for Families
description_book: Children and their responsible adults. Come make a Viking treasure necklace and learn why they wore so many layers!

name: Livery Collars
description_book: An exploration of this elite accessory, with a focus on earlier examples and historical significance, plus a discussion of how to adapt to SCA use.

name: The Game of Tarot
description_book: A simple trick-taking card game played with a Tarot deck.
description_web: A simple trick-taking card game played with a Tarot deck.

name: Armored Bridge Battle
description_book: Five battles, 15 minutes each, with 15 minute reset.
description_web: Five battles, 15 minutes each, with 15 minute reset.

name: Beginning Belly Dance
description_book: Covers very basic belly dance steps
description_web: We will work on basic hip, arm and walking movements.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: KW Choir: Known World Choir Open Rehearsal
description_book: Join the Known World Choir and prepare a concert of *a capella* choral music! Enthusiastic amateurs-expert singers are all welcome!
description_web: Join the Pennsic Known World Choir! Enthusiastic amateurs-expert singers are all welcome! Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on the final Thursday of War week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is extremely helpful, but not required if you are willing to put in the effort to learn the music in advance. Sheet music and part-learning tracks are available online now at the KWChoir Yahoo group: https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/KWChoir/info.
fee_itemization: Limited packets of sheet music available for $3.00. Otherwise, download pre-Pennsic or you may print at Mystic Mail

name: Beyond Lucet Basics
description_book: Variations, loops, and monkey wrenches.
description_web: Starts with a basic refresher class for everyone. We then proceed to variations, loops, and monkey wrenches. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. String provided.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: For all levels and teachers. Drills focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Études* for drill; elements from drill used to work in groups.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Beginners' *Atlatl* Throwing (Morning)
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.
description_web: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class.We have three wonderful, new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: A Brief History of the Hammered Dulcimer
description_book: An introduction to the dulcimer with a little hands-on activity if time allows.
description_web: A brief introduction to the hammered dulcimer from its origins to its final fade from grace in the eyes of the nobility. There will be hands-on activity if time allows.

name: Blood Of Heroes: Rapier 5-on-5 Tournament
description_book: Blood of Heroes is a sport with rapiers where 5-on-5 try to score points against the other team. No grant restrictions on teams.
description_web: If you like the rapier 5-on-5 at Pennsic, you'll love Blood of Heroes. In this round-robin tourney, you will try to score on your opponent by moving the dog skull and placing it on your opponent's goal. It is fast-paced and a lot of fun. It is the best spectator sport rapier has ever seen. There are no White Scarf/Ogre/etc. restrictions on teams, so get your team together and learn how to play BoH. You'll love it.

name: Archery Populace War Point
description_book: Archery Populace War Point
description_web: All archers young and old are encouraged to come and lend their support to their kingdom's efforts, and to display their skill at archery. There will be 3 challenging populace shoots to test skills. Each Kingdom will be competing to earn the 3 War Points for each shoot.

name: *Suikan*, and So Can You!
description_book: Japanese *suikan*: An informal, upper-body over-garment similar in function to a European surcoat. Learn to make this garment and its embellishments.
description_web: A Japanese *suikan* is an informal, upper-body over-garment similar in function to a European surcoat. It is unlined, and usually made from hemp or linen fabric. The fabric can be fancy or plain, thin or heavy, depending on your station. It is appropriate for everyone from performers to royal retainers.This garment is basically the same from the Heian period until modern times, including the *kikutoji *decorative accents. The *suikan* has sleeve lacing and a neck cord, so it is a wonderful way to show off *kumihimo* braids. Learn to make this garment and its embellishments by viewing photos, studying finished garments, and reviewing cutting and sewing patterns.

name: Basic *Ka-Kha-Ga-Gha*
description_book: Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *devanagari* script used by Hindi, Sanskrit and other Indic languages.
description_web:
Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *devanagari* script used by Hindi and other North Indic languages (including Sanskrit, post-period). While the focus of this class is on Hindi usage, the characters and pronunciation are nearly identical for the others. There will be examples in Hindi. Please bring a writing utensil which makes a dark, easily-visible line. This is not a calligraphy class.
1st hour: Basic characters and pronunciation.
2nd hour:  Vowels and half-letters; more if time and student interest allow.

name: Wood: Working with the Undead
description_book: This is a class about wood and the conditions in which it continues to move long after the tree is dead.
description_web: We will talk about the structure of the tree, processing it into lumber, and why the material continues to move afterwards. Then we will also discuss strategies for using that movement to your advantage or trying to limit the movement.

name: Performing in the SCA, Coxcomb Style
description_book: The Precious Candy Making Secrets of performing in the SCA, crammed into two hours. Wanna be a performer? Show up with a notepad. 'Nuff said.
description_web: A professional entertainer looks at performing in the SCA. Topics covered will include developing an act through research, imagination, practice, and rehearsal; how to use a director and how to be your own director when you can’t find one; pros and cons of performing venues in the SCA and how to make the best of each; finding your perfect audience; dealing with stage fright and hecklers; serving autocrats and kings; how to recover from disasters and how to keep them from happening in the first place. At only two hours, this class will be bursting with Precious Candy Making Secrets, so bring a notepad.

name: Beginning Reed Baskets
description_book: Learn the fundamentals of making a reed basket; make and take a small basket utilizing a wooden base technique.
description_web: Students will learn the fundamentals of making a reed basket. Individuals will make and take a small basket utilizing a wooden base technique.

name: Beginning *Bassadanza*
description_book: Learn the basics of this graceful style of dance from 15th-century. Italy. Focus is more on how to dance than on learning a particular dance.

name: Intro to 6-on-2 Chainmail
description_book: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail. All materials provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
description_web: Intro class for 6-on-2 chainmail prevalent throughout period across multiple cultures. All materials necessary to complete class project provided but bring two pairs of pliers.
fee_itemization: Sufficient hand-turned & cut enameled copper rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter; to complete class project

name: Melodic Middle Eastern Drumming
description_book: Join us for Middle Eastern drumming with a twist! Includes melodic and harmonic playing with hand drumming fundamentals. All exp. levels welcome.

name: Writing Humorous Songs
description_book: Discussion of different comedic elements and how they can be used in song writing.
description_web: Discussion of different comedic elements and how they can be used in song writing.

name: Slavery in Viking Culture
description_book: Discussion of slavery and how it was treated in Viking culture.
description_web: A class discussing slavery in Viking cultures. How it was started in myth as well as the laws and devices used in the slave trade. Recreation of items from the time may be available for use as examples.

name: Easy Heraldic Standards
description_book: How to design and make quick and easy heraldic standards with inexpensive materials.
description_web: The design of period-style SCA heraldic standards, and directions for how to make them with inexpensive materials. These are appropriate for display from a pole or from the tops of tents.

name: Embroidery: A Beginning
description_book: Learn a few simple stitches to start a project. Create a sampler to take home.
description_web: Learn a few simple stitches to start a project. Create a sampler to take home.
fee_itemization: Hand out, sampler materials - linen, needle, thread, hoop.

name: Mammen Needlebinding Stitch
description_book: Another Viking Age needle-binding stitch to add to the collection. Needle-binders of any level welcome. Free handout.
description_web: Another Viking Age needle-binding stitch to add to the collection. Needle-binders of any level welcome. Free handout. Yarn and needles will be available for class, but please feel free to bring your own. Needles are also available for purchase.
fee_itemization: If you want to keep the needle, it is $5.

name: Decoding Russian and Ukrainian Embroidery
description_book: Review and discussion of traditional elements of old Russian and Ukrainian embroidery, many of which date from pre-Christian era.
description_web: The old Slavic embroidery is intricate and beautiful, but do you know what it means? In this class we will review and discuss the meanings and evolution of old elements of traditional embroidery, such as the tree of life, the goddess, etc.

name: Introduction to Beginning Period Cookery
description_book: Want to cook in period but don’t know where to start? No problem! For beginners who want a quick intro to some basics of modern period cookery.
description_web: Want to cook in period, but don’t know where to start? Your apartment doesn't have a handy open fireplace? No idea what an *eyroun* is or where to buy one?  No problem! This class is designed for those beginners who have never cooked a period recipe before but want a quick introduction into some of the basics of modern period cookery.

instructor: Lady Hara of the Debatable Lands
name: Sixteen-Strand *Kumihimo* on the Marudai
description_book: This hands-on class teaches 3 different 16-strand braids on the Japanese *marudai*. Braid material and *marudai* provided. Limit 12 participants.
description_web: This hands-on class teaches 3 different 16-strand braids on the Japanese *marudai*. Braid material and *marudai* provided. Limit 12 participants.

name: Something for Six: Balli for Sets of Three Couples
description_book: Come learn two 15th-century Italian dances for sets of three couples: stately *Colonnese* and flirtatious *Gelosia*. Beginners welcome.
description_web: Come learn two 15th-century Italian dances for sets of three couples: stately *Colonnese* and flirtatious *Gelosia*. Knowledge of steps is helpful but not required.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Bellydance: Advanced Layers, Combos, and **More**
description_book: Clean layers, isolated combinations, and unique ways to get from point A to point B. Folkloric tribal fusion (the best of all worlds) with Shaheen.
description_web: Do you want to get from stage left to stage right with something other than your tried-and-true 3/4 shimmy? How about getting those isolation combos that make people quiver with antici...pation? Or layers that don't make you look like you're being electrocuted? Come learn it all! Best yet, **also** learn how to make your own. Bring water, hipscarf, and notebook.

name: Pre-16th-C. Musical Modal Improvisation
description_book: This is a practical application class for musicians to learn improvisational skills that were practiced in the Middle Ages for ages.
description_web: Musician class for acoustic instruments to learn medieval modal improvisation that will teach the student to create melodies on the spot for both free form and structured rhythmic forms. Students are required to be very familiar with their instruments. Reading is not require but really helps (especially your major and natural minor scales).

name: Rehearsal (Closed);  KWC-Dress
description_book: Space in Use
description_web: Space in Use

name: Youth Rapier Fencing Practice
description_book: Youth rapier practice, ages 6 to 17. Come out and fence.
description_web: Youth rapier fencing practice, ages 6 to 17. Come out and fence.

name: Care and Feeding of a *Commedia* Troupe in the SCA
description_book: Ever watched a *Commedia dell'Arte* show, laughed, and wanted to do that, too? Come learn about creating and running your own troupe in the SCA!
description_web: Ever watched a *Commedia dell'Arte* show, laughed yourself silly, and said, "Hey, I wanna do that, too?" If you find yourself far from any existing troupe, consider creating your own. Learn from some *commedia* players who did just that on how to research the art form, find some co-conspirators, and how to make your own troupe live and thrive in the Society!

name: Mini-Bardic Madness
description_book: If you can't come to Bardic Madness, it can come to you. The challenges for one Fyt of Madness are at http://tilted-windmill.com/mini_madness.html
description_web: Heard about Bardic Madness, but been unable to attend? Now's your chance. We will be answering one Fyt of Madness at Pennsic. The challenges for it can be found at http://tilted-windmill.com/mini_madness.html. This is an excellent opportunity for new and experienced performers alike. Gentles wishing to participate as a supportive audience are most welcome to attend.

name: Scribal Bootcamp
description_book: Hands-on instruction and practice making an SCA-style scroll start to finish, working closely with an experienced scribe from concept to completion.
description_web: Hands-on instruction and practice making an SCA-style scroll start to finish, working closely with an experienced scribe from concept and wording to calligraphy, drawing and painting, to completion. This is a class for beginners (with some small experience) to intermediate scribes looking to improve their skills at putting pencil, paint and ink to paper. Class size will be limited! Please sign up at AEthelmearc hospitality the morning of class.

name: Three Pies from Christorforo's Kitchen
description_book: German-style apple pie, peach pie, and a veal pie from the 1549 cookbook the *Banchetti* by Christoforo Messisbugo.

name: Beginning Wire Weaving
description_book: Students will learn to make intricate chains in the manner of the Vikings and other cultures, without need for heat or complicated tools.
description_web: This class will teach beginning students to make intricate chains in the manner of the Vikings and other ancient cultures, without the need for heat or complicated tools. With the techniques presented, you will learn to create items like the ones found in Viking burials and treasure hoards across the Nordic countries dating from the 9th century to the late 12th century. Wire chains made in this fashion have also been discovered in the British Isles (875 AD) and in the Roman, Greek and Byzantine civilizations from the 4th century BC to the 1st century AD. Timeless items can be created that are still beautiful and wearable today. If you have needle-nose pliers and wire cutters, please bring them. If you need glasses for close or small work, please bring them. The fee for the class includes the materials needed to complete the leather cord necklace. To view this unique jewelry, please visit www.AncientWire.com/book.htm

name: *Eura* Mitten Needle-Binding Stitch
description_book: The *Eura* mitten is Viking age, from a Finnish burial.Come and learn a new stitch. All levels are welcome! Free handout.
description_web: The *Eura* mitten is Viking age, from a Finnish burial.Come and learn a new stitch. All levels are welcome! Yarn and needles will be available, if you want to keep the needles afterwards, it is $5. Free handout.
fee_itemization: If you want to keep the needle, it is $5

name: The Astrolabe in Theory and Practice
description_book: This class will discuss the history and theory of the astrolabe and provide extensive hands-on practical experience.
description_web: This class will discuss the history and theory of the astrolabe and provide extensive hands-on practical experience. Details at http://astrolabeproject.com
fee_itemization: Fee covers part of the cost of a large (50+ page) handout.

name: Teaching in the SCA
description_book: Want to share what you know and feel good about it afterwards? Covers planning, preparation, presentation, problems, publicity, and "post-mortem”.
description_web: Nervous about teaching? Want to share what you know and feel good about it afterwards? Covers planning, preparation, presentation, problems, publicity, and "post-mortem". For those who would like to improve their classes, as well as those who have never taught but want to. Instructor has 25+ years of classroom experience.

name: Narrowwork Guild meeting
description_book: Narrowwork Guild meeting, open to anyone interested in making cord or trim using period methods.
description_web: Meeting of the Worshipful Company of Narrowworkers of the East Kingdom. This meeting is open to gentles from any kingdom who are interested in making cord or trim using period techniques such as fingerloop, lucet, *kumihimo*, tablet weaving, inkle weaving, etc.

name: Dayboards and Sideboards
description_book: A lecture-discussion on organizing light buffet-style meals for events on a budget with period and period-style foods. Recipes.

name: Bellatrix System: Great Weapons
description_book: Bellatrix techniques for great weapons, for use against all weapons and at all ranges, as well as techniques for different physical capabilities.
description_web: Learn the Bellatrix system for the use of great sword and glaive, focusing on the close-in techniques against other great-weapons, and against sword and shield. Modify these techniques for different physical capabilities. It will also cover fighting at medium and long range. The class can be taught armored, unarmored, or with helms and gauntlets. Participation in the exercises will vary, depending. At a minimum, students must have gloves and a great sword, long bastard sword, or pole weapon. Some students should bring swords and shields for use in training.

name: *Shukyo*: Samurai Religion
description_book: An introduction to pre-modern Japanese religious and magical beliefs and practices.
description_web: An introduction to pre-modern Japanese religious and magical beliefs and practices.

name: Eight is Enough: *Pizochara*
description_book: Come learn *Pizochara*, a flirtatious 15th-century Italian dance for four couples. Knowledge of steps is very helpful.
description_web: Come learn *Pizochara*, a flirtatious 15th-century Italian dance for four couples. Knowledge of steps is very helpful.

name: Card Games
description_book: This class will review the card games previously taught and let you practice playing them with an instructor's assistance.
description_web: This class will review the card games previously taught and let you practice playing them with an instructor's assistance.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a trim strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a trim strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: Heckler's Tournament
description_book: Try to hit the target while your friends make you laugh by heckling you. Humor that's family-friendly will be heaped upon you. Limit of 20 throwers.
description_web: Try to hit the target while your friends make you laugh by heckling you. Humor that's family-friendly will be heaped upon you. Limit of 20 throwers.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Early Period Instruments
description_book: Early period (Roman and Viking) instruments: how they might have looked and sounded. Part "instrument petting zoo", part "how to make them".

instructor: Baroness Una de Saint Luc, OL, OP
name: Painting Pearls and Gems
description_book: Learn how to paint gems and pearls that are found in some *trompe l'oeil* style scrolls.
description_web: In this class, we will be focusing on how to paint gems and pearls that are found in some *trompe l'oeil* style scrolls. While it is not required to attend the two previous classes, we will be combining some of the color theory as well as the perspective and shading techniques.

name: Ships in the SCA Period: A Chronological Overview
description_book: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.
description_web: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.

name: Heraldic Flag Design
description_book: Learn about the various types of heraldic flags that existed in period, their design and application. Then design your own!
description_web: What does one do with those fantastic animals, interesting designs and brilliant colors needed for a good heraldic design? And where does one apply said design? Before heraldry ever appeared on shield and surcoat, those heraldic designs fluttered over the heads of kings and peasants, like majestic birds, in the form of banners, pennons, standards and gonfalons. Learn about the various types of heraldic flags that existed in period, their design and application. Then design your own!

name: A New Way to Wire Weave: Anglo-Saxon Interweave
description_book: Discussion and hands-on of a wire weaving technique unique to Anglo-Saxon areas. Knowledge of "Viking" wire weaving is assumed but not required.
description_web:
This will be a discussion of a historical wire weaving pattern and its differences from the Baltic area examples often called "Viking" wire weaving. We will be discussing the archaeological evidence for its construction and use. Ten kits will be available for $5 on a first-come basis for interested participants to practice the method and take home the materials to finish a chain. Observers are welcome.
The Baltic method, commonly known in the SCA as "Viking" wire weaving, will be discussed but not directly taught.
fee_itemization: Kits include wire spool and tool for hands on practice

name: Wine Choosing and Judging
description_book: Introduction to the American Wine Society's system to evaluate wine for personal use and judge wines in competitions.
description_web:
American Wine Society was one of the first wine making and appreciation societies in the country. They have developed a wine evaluation sheet that they use for judging wines in formal competitions as well as by participants in their monthly local meetings.
 
It is not hard to learn, and it allows a more consistent way of judging wines and understanding the qualities of a wine. At this point thousands of people have learned this system and are better able to appreciate wine because of it. The  amateur and commercial wine competitions have helped winemakers of all levels improve their craft.
 
Copies of the Evaluation chart will be available to those who complete the class.
 
To give people practice, I will use 2-3 unusual  wines that have history that goes back to the middle ages. I will accommodate 1-2 wines that people would like to have judged

name: 14th-Century Sumptuary Laws of Western Europe
description_book: An overview of 14th-century sumptuary laws in Italy and England. Handout with transcriptions of some laws and breakdowns of how the law functioned.

name: Beginner Dance: Review by Request Part 1
description_book: Having trouble remembering a dance you learned earlier? This is the place to be! We'll go back over any dance and maybe also teach you something new.
description_web: Having trouble remembering a dance you learned earlier? This is the place to be! We'll go back over any dance and maybe also teach you something new.

name: Rapier Broken Field Battle
description_book: Rapier Broken Field Battle
description_web: Rapier Broken Field Battle

name: Echoes of the Dumbek
description_book: Mark of Orluk Oasis will play a rhythm or phrase and the class repeats. Students may have a chance to "call" a phrase or rhythm if they wish.
description_web: Mark of Orluk Oasis will play a rhythm or phrase and the class repeats. Students may have a chance to "call" a phrase or rhythm if they wish.

name: Historical Facets of *Commedia dell'Arte* Troupes
description_book: Ideas on how to manage *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes in the SCA based on research regarding *commedia* troupes in period.
description_web: Have you been interested in joining, creating or potentially finding new members for a *Commedia dell'Arte* group? *Commedia dell'Arte* differs from traditional theater in many ways. This class will present research about how to run an SCA troupe based on the structure and profession in period. Whether you are *Comici* or a *Capicomico*, learn how to interact in a troupe with courtesy, diligence and commitment to the art. During the second hour, all students are welcome to network and discuss with artists from various kingdoms. All are welcome to attend.

name: Gettin' Down with the Hip Down!
description_book: Hip down variations, combinations and drills.

name: Intermediate Medieval Music Notation
description_book: Ligatures and perfection, for those comfortable with long note values, no bar lines, and funky clefs. Bring melody instruments you play fluently.
description_web: For those already comfortable with long note values, unbarred music, *musica ficta*, and clefs other than treble and bass. We'll learn some more advanced stuff: ligatures for combinations of *breves* and *longas*, and the weird world of triple meter, where the same note-head can mean several different durations in the same piece depending on context. Bring melody instruments (recorder, harp, fiddle, lute, etc.) that you play fluently. Voice is OK if you have good pitch sense. If recorder, bring several sizes if possible.

name: PA Afternoon Series: Storytelling Arts Exhibition
description_book: Come and enjoy an amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of storytellers from around the Known World!
description_web: Come and enjoy an amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of storytellers from around the Known World!

name: Couching 2: Medievalest Embroidery Stitch of All
description_book: Part 2: This class focuses on variations of the couching stitch done in gold thread (*or nué*), surface couching and underside couching.
description_web: Part 2: This class focuses on variations of the couching stitch done in gold thread (*or nué*), surface couching and underside couching. Bring embroidery supplies if you have them. I will have supplies available for those who don't have everything they need.

name: Acid Etching Copper
description_book: We will be using readily available materials to create an etched copper plaque; can be used for *Basse-taille* Enamel Class
fee_itemization: Kit includes small box with copper plate cut to fit lid to etch

name: Medieval Food Myths
description_book: Ever get sick of the old myth about people using spices because they were serving rotting meat? Then this is the class for you.

name: V&A Study Room: See the Embroideries
description_book: See photos of over 100 period embroideries from the Victoria and Albert Textile Study Room.
description_web: See photos of over 100 period embroideries from the Victoria and Albert Textile Study Room. Due to low light conditions, color values are not always great, but the stitches can be seen in many of the close-ups. The handout lists each with online access codes and background information.

name: Bardic Collegium #4: Bardic In Your Kingdom
description_book: Each kingdom has different approaches to the Bardic arts, and ways of promoting and encouraging performers. What's different in **your** Kingdom?
description_web: Different kingdoms have different approaches to the Bardic arts, and different ways of promoting and encouraging performers. How does **your** kingdom encourage bards? Is there a reward system? Contests? Champions? What kind of bardic or bardic-friendly events are held in your kingdom or barony? How often are they held? Is there a predominance in your area for spoken or sung performances...or none at all? Join this open discussion to give and get new ideas!

name: Copper-Etched Needle Cases
description_book: Hands-on project to make etched copper needle cases using ferric chloride. Students will make and take one needle case.
description_web: Using ferric chloride to etch copper tubing to make needle cases. Students will learn the technique to prepare, etch and finish metals for etching and the process of using chemicals to etch copper and brass. Other methods for etching will also be discussed.
fee_itemization: Copper tubing, chemicals and protective items.

name: Historical Uses of Poisons
description_book: A rundown of the weaponization of poisons in history garnered from various resources.
description_web: A review of the weaponization of poisonous plants (and two rocks) as recorded in history. A summary garnered from various resources, the compilation paints a unique picture of warfare and weaponization techniques from several cultures.

name: Spinning Fine
description_book: We will discuss what contributes to making a fine yarn or thread. Topics will include fiber type, fiber prep, spinning technique, etc.
description_web: We will discuss what contributes to making a fine yarn or thread. Topics will include fiber type, fiber prep, spinning technique, etc. Bring your spindle and/or wheel. We may also play the technique guessing game.

name: Tea for Needle-Binders
description_book: Gathering of all needle-binders to enjoy stitches galore! Will be held in the Cynnabar camp.
description_web: Welcome all needle-binders to a small tea, where we can meet and share needle-binding stitches and information. I hope this will be the first of many meetings. It will be held at the Cynnabar Camp. If the time changes, it will be posted at the Pennsic University.

name: Beginner Dance: Review by Request Part 2
description_book: Having trouble remembering a dance you learned earlier? This is the place to be! We'll go back over any dance and maybe also teach you something new.
description_web: Having trouble remembering a dance you learned earlier? This is the place to be! We'll go back over any dance and maybe also teach you something new.

name: Happy Japanese Games
description_book: Three leisure games of Japan will be discussed. Reproductions of each game will be available to play for the duration of class.
description_web: Three leisure games of Japan will be discussed. Reproductions of each game will be available to play for duration of class. May not be appropriate for small children; some game pieces can be a choking hazard.

name: The Turkish Bath
description_book: Pennsic is our vacation; why not pamper ourselves? Learn about the history of the Turkish bath, try beauty treatments and desserts. Bring a towel.
description_web: Pennsic is our vacation, so why not pamper ourselves? Come learn about the history of the Turkish bath, try out some beauty treatments and sample Turkish desserts. Please bring a towel. For privacy, this is open to self-identified women and girls only.
fee_itemization: Henna, beauty supplies, desserts and tea.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: Bling on a Budget
description_book: Use glass jewels, beads, and metal to add dignity and ostentation to clothes without going broke. Dark Ages through Renaissance.
description_web: How to use glass jewels, beads, and metal to add dignity and ostentation to clothes without going broke. From minor flourishes to full-bore excess, planning and execution, covered by instructor with 25+ years experience working with these forms of embellishment. No purchase necessary. Supplies available for purchase; prices vary depending on patterns chosen.
fee_itemization: Fee depends on choices made. No purchase necessary.

name: The Polearm Techniques of Paulus Hector Mair
description_book: A look at several techniques from the 16th-century manual of arms of Paulus Hector Mair.
description_web: A look at several techniques from the 16th-century manual of arms of Paulus Hector Mair.

name: Beginners' *Atlatl* Throwing (Afternoon)
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.
description_web: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.

name: Tablet Weavers' Tea
description_book: A social gathering for tablet weavers of all levels to show off current work, see projects from other people, and schmooze.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Youth Combat afternoon sessions, 3-5 PM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.
description_web: Youth Combat afternoon sessions, 3-5 PM. Time may change to accommodate tournaments. Check the schedule at YC list.

name: Youth Combat at the Castle
description_book: The final afternoon Youth Combat session of the week is held at the Castle. Participants must have previously participated in YC during Pennsic 43.
description_web: The final afternoon Youth Combat session of the week is held at the Castle. Participants must have previously participated in YC during Pennsic 43.

name: Norse Apron Dress
description_book: How to pattern and construct a Norse apron dress. If possible, bring 2 yards of fabric, scissors, and fabric pen, though not necessary for the class.
description_web: How to pattern and construct a Norse apron dress. If possible,bring 2 yards of fabric, scissors, and fabric pen, though not necessary for the class.

name: Beginning Knotwork
description_book: Learn two ways to do basic knotwork! Starts with interlacing without erasing, and gridding-path drawing. Please bring a pencil with eraser.

name: Children's Hood Making
description_book: Come and make a fleece hood to keep you warm on cold nights. This is a child friendly class. Bring an adult to help you sew the two necessary seams.
description_web: Geared for children ages 10 and under, come and make your very own fleece hood to help keep you warm on those cold nights. All you need is to bring an adult with you to help you when needed to sew the two necessary seams. Instruction is given as are all needed supplies. This class is family-friendly and youth/children are encouraged to participate.

name: Making Period Measuring Sticks
description_book: Hands-on; make either a 24” or 12” ruler from a 16th-century pattern found on the ship the Mary Rose. Hands-on part limited to six people.
description_web: Making period measuring sticks.

name: Meet the Board and Corporate Officers
description_book: Members of the Board of Directors and Corporate Staff answer your Society-level questions. All are welcome.
description_web: Have questions about life at the Society level? Wonder what it would be like to hold such a position? Members of the Board of Directors and Corporate Staff will be available to answer these questions and more. All are welcome.

name: Scented Waters: Early Perfumes You Can Make
description_book: Explores the various scented waters found in Renaissance cosmetics handbooks.  Here you can learn to make perfumes for a variety of uses.
fee_itemization: Donations to cover costs of herbs and handout.

name: Easy ECD for All Experience Levels
description_book: Not only a beginner class, this is for anyone who would like to learn more in depth. Includes *Gathering Peascods, Half Hannikin, Sellenger's Round.*
description_web: Not only a beginner class, this is for anyone who would like to learn English Country Dance as reconstructed directly from Playford, and not necessarily as done in current tradition. Includes *Gathering Peascods, Half Hannikin, Sellenger's Round.*

name: Tuchux Charity Tournament
description_book: Random weapon draw, bear pit tournament, to benefit children's oncology charity. Donation of $5 to enter; bring full gauntlets.
description_web: We will be hosting another charity tournament this year to benefit CureSearch for children's cancer. Four bear pits with weapons drawn randomly before each match. Bring full gauntlets. The cost to enter is $5. Always a fun time.

instructor: Lady Nina Amaya of Bright Hills
name: Enchant with Your Dance: Performance Track
description_book: How to be an enchanting and memorable performer. Emotion, breath, movement, stillness, vision, face... Use your moves for best effect! All levels.
description_web: How to be an enchanting and memorable performer. Mesmerize your audience as you take them on a journey. Exercises in breath, movement, stillness, emotion, weight, tension... Use the moves you know to best effect. Write a visual poem in dance!

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

name: Throwback Thursday Épée/Foil Tournament
description_book: Remember when? Come and celebrate Throwback Thursday with a foil/épée tournament. Round-robin will seed single-elimination final bracket.

name: Two-Handed Weapon Tournament
description_book: A "bring your own weapon" tourney -- but it must be two-handed. By Lord Magnus de Londres.
description_web: A "bring your own weapon" tourney -- but it must be two-handed. By Lord Magnus de Londres.

name: A Cross-Curricular Study of *Commedia dell'Arte*
description_book: This class will analyze *Commedia dell'Arte* in scope with other performing arts of the Renaissance such as courtly dance, theater, and bardic arts.
description_web: Have you ever wondered how *Commedia dell'Arte* influenced other performing arts of the Renaissance? Caroso, an Italian dance master, and other artisans alluded to *Commedia dell'Arte*. This class will feature related research and roundtable discussion about *Commedia dell'Arte* in scope with other performing arts of the Renaissance.

name: *Cantigas d'Amigo*: Songs of My Boyfriend
description_book: Introduction to the songs and poems of the women troubadours and *trouveres*, plus *Cantigas d'Amigo* from Iberia. Handout includes poems and music.
description_web: An introduction to the songs and poems of the women troubadours and *trouveres*, and the *cantigas d'amigo* from Iberia. The *Cantigas d'Amigo* were written by men, but are from a woman's point of view, usually a young unmarried woman, but sometimes her mother. Handout includes poems and music, plus some original, singable English translations/compositions by the instructor.

name: Keeping Bees in the Knowne World
description_book: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.
description_web: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.

name: *Basse-taille* Enameling
description_book: Introduction to *basse-taille* enameling, using transparent colors on a textured background.
description_web: We will be using blanks from the previous "Etched Copper" class to create *basse-taille* enamel pieces, layering translucent colors onto a textured surface to create designs.
fee_itemization: Fees include use of enamels and kiln, requires kit from Acid Etching class

name: Applied Viking-Era Brewing
description_book: Want to brew like a Viking but don't want to hollow out logs and dig a kiln? Come find out how to make a plausible version with modern equipment!

name: Warping a Warp-Weighted Loom
description_book: Warp-weighted looms can be imposingly large and strange. Let's learn how to warp one on a smaller and more human scale.
description_web: A full-size warp-weighted loom, as built in period, can be imposingly large and strange. We're going to learn how to warp one on a smaller and more human scale. We'll be working in pairs, with space for up to 12 people working hands-on. We'll have a follow-up class with hands-on practice weaving on the warp we've created.

name: Small, Simple Period Notebook
description_book: No experience needed! Make a small notebook for your pouch or purse, appropriate for most mid- to late-period personas. All supplies included.
description_web: No experience needed! Make a small stab-stitch notebook for your pouch or purse, appropriate for most mid- to late-period personas. All supplies included. If you have any of the following tools, please bring them: ruler, pencil, awl, sharp scissors, embroidery needle with large eye.

name: Once Upon a Time
description_book: A 40-year member of the SCA tells stories, asks (and answers) questions, and suggests ways to "keep it fresh" or keep the magic in the SCA experience.

name: *Kenjutsu*: The Art of Japanese Swordsmanship
description_book: Dojo-style class, covering basics of Japanese sword. Japanese practice sword or equivalent (wood or metal) required. Limited loaners available.
description_web:
A traditional-style class on Japanese *kenjutsu*, drawn from multiple sources, including modern and traditional arts. The class will be arranged to emphasize techniques that are known to have been used pre-1600. Emphasis will be on physical repetition more than scholarly discussion. The latter will be available after class, informally, as requested.
About the instructor: I have over 15 years of experience in Japanese sword arts, including *Nakamura Ryu Battodo (IBF 4-dan), ZNKR Kendo (1-kyu), Mugai Ryu Iaihyodo*, and *Shindo Muso Ryu Jodo*.

name: Ball Prep: Numerological Ball
description_book: Want to dance at the ball, but have no or little idea how? This is the class for you! All steps will be taught, plus etiquette and survival tips.
description_web: Want to dance at Thursday night's ball, but have no or little idea how? This is the class for you! All steps will be taught, along with etiquette & survival tips.

name: Ealdormere Court
description_book: Ealdormere Court
description_web: Ealdormere Court

name: Concert of the Masters
description_book: A unique concert of 14th-Century music from the *Llibre Vermell* (Red Book) of Montserrat performed by masters of their craft.
description_web: The Concert of the Masters - Music from the *Llibre Vermell.* Performed by Albert Cofrin (Istanpitta), Daveed Korup (Turku) and Michael Gartner (Wolgemut), all masters of their craft (and Masters of the Laurel) perform a unique concert of 14th Century music from the *Llibre Vermell* (Red Book) of Montserrat. They are joined by guest vocalist Judith Overcash (Contrapunctus).

name: Beekeepers of Late Period
description_book:
Right on the edge of 1600, we have some very interesting advances in beekeeping.
I'll give a run down.
description_web:
Right on the edge of 1600, we have some very interesting advances in beekeeping.
I'll give a run down on the approaches.

name: Making and Using Goose Quill Pens for Calligraphy
description_book: Cleaning, trimming and using goose quill pens in calligraphy.
description_web: Cleaning, trimming and using goose quill pens in calligraphy.

name: Beginning Mead Brewing
description_book: Brewing mead for those who have not done so before or have very little experience. We will be covering the basic process and equipment. Over 21 only.
description_web: Brewing mead for those who have not done so before or have very little experience. We will be covering the basic process and equipment for your first few batches. Over 21 only.

name: Clan Blue Feather Encampment Party
description_book: We'll have booze, snacks and entertainment; you bring yourselves and have a good time.
description_web: The annual party. We'll have booze, snacks and entertainment; you bring yourselves and have a good time.

name: Known World Choir and Friends Performance
description_book: Known World Choir and Friends present an evening of period choral music. A major focus this year is the music of Scotland under the Stewart monarchs.
description_web:
Show time: 6:45 - 8:15pm
The gentles of the Pennsic Known World Choir, Children's Choir, Youth Choir, and *Chorulus Pennsicus* request your presence at a concert of period choral music. A major focus this year is on the music of Scotland under the Stewart monarchs.

name: Known World Players Annual Meeting
description_book: KWP's annual meeting. Company members and newcomers alike are invited to hear officer reports and discuss KWP's future.
description_web: The Known World Players annual Guild meeting. Company members and newcomers alike are invited to come share ideas about the company's future, hear officers' annual reports, and discuss future productions.

name: SCA Librarians' Roundtable
description_book: A gathering for librarians, library fans and bibliophiles. First half hour to be devoted to swapping research tips.
description_web: A gathering for librarians, library fans and bibliophiles. First half hour to be devoted to swapping research tips.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children at Runestone Hill.
description_web: 7pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend, must have adult escort.

name: Anglo-Saxon Pottery
description_book: What sort of pottery would your Anglo-Saxon persona have used depending on from where and when you came, and how it was used.
description_web: From hand-built, unglazed funeral urns in the migration period, to wheel-thrown and earliest glazed pieces, we'll cover what sort of pottery Anglo-Saxons have used in what centuries and which regions of England, plus how it was used from table to storage.

name: *Muhekian*: The Taste of Tea
description_book: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothing with white socks or tabi, and bring a fan if you have one.
description_web: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothing with white socks or tabi, and bring a fan if you have one. Please do not wear any jewelry or weapons in the tea room.
fee_itemization: cost of tea and sweets - 12 per sitting.

name: Youth Combat Alumni Tourney and Open Field
description_book: Open to all Adult Authorized Graduates of the YC Program. Various singles and melée activities.
description_web: Open to all Adult Authorized Graduates of the YC Program. Tourney format to be determined. Various singles and melée activities.

name: Middle Kingdom Court
description_book: Middle Kingdom Court
description_web: Middle Kingdom Court

name: Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: A *commedia dell'arte* play put together primarily at Pennsic with actors from all over the Known World.
description_web: A *commedia dell'arte* play put together primarily at Pennsic with actors from all over the Known World. Inspired by the Known World Players, this troupe is different every year and comes together in person only at Pennsic.

name: Movement from *Mysore*
description_book: Mistress Lakshmi will be performing a collection of solo pieces from her lineage of *Mysore Bharata Natyam*, a style of courtesans.
description_web: Mistress Lakshmi will be performing a collection of solo pieces from her lineage of *Mysore Bharata Natyam*, a style of courtesans, having trained in the traditional manner for 12 years under the tuteleage of guru Aparna Sindhoor, student of Venkatalakshamma, student of Jati Thayamma. Lakshmi is performing shorter dance selections in preparation for her professional debut in the next year.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: Populace Archery War Point Practice
description_book: Come to the archery range; practice the War Point shoots from 9-11 am during War Week except for Wednesday, August 6.
description_web: All archers can come to the archery range and practice the War Point shoots from 9 am to 11 am during War Week except Wednesday, August 6th, when the range is closed except for Archery Champions.

name: Making Friends with Your Sewing Machine
description_book: Easy sewing machine basics for the newbie and novice sewers. All children under the age of 10 must be accompanied by an adult.
description_web: Easy sewing machine basics for the newbie and novice sewers. Simple patterns available so you won't go to the events naked or embarrassed! Advanced sewers invited to share your knowledge as well! Easy and fun class! All children under the age of 10 must be accompanied by an adult.
fee_itemization:
5-page handout on sewing basics and info.
6-10 page easy patterns and measurements

name: *Or Nué*: Colored Goldwork Embroidery
description_book: Learn the basics of *Or Nué* embroidery by creating a small piece. Beginners welcome. Kits provided.
description_web: Learn the basics of *Or Nué* embroidery by creating a small piece. *Or Nué* (shaded gold) embroidery done in Europe, particularly in Belgium, France, Netherlands, and to high levels in Italy and Flanders from roughly 1400 – 1550s. The technique uses different colored silk threads to couch gold or silver threads strategically placed to form patterns, designs, figures or narrative scenes. This class is for beginners and kits will be provided.
fee_itemization: gold thread, silk thread, linen, embroidery hoop, needles, handout (inc. in material fee)

name: Writing for the Compleat Anachronist
description_book: How to write and submit a publication for the CA.

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang
name: Basic Bookbinding
description_book: Basic binding of books, history, hands-on, practical application. Learn different stitches and page attachment; leave with a small bound book.
description_web: Basic binding of books, a bit of history, hands-on, and practical application. Participants will learn different types of stitching and page attachment, plus covers, and will leave with a small bound book and/or a girdlebook cover.

name: Prostitution in SCA Period
description_book: History of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 A.D. Topics include contraception, garb, law, and the organization of brothels.
description_web: A survey of the history of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 A.D. We will be covering such topics as the formation of red light districts, brothel management, contraception, municipal laws, church law, and the garb and identification of a prostitute within this time period.

name: Dance Floor Break Down
description_book: Come out and help us break down the dance floor.

name: Thrown Weapons Marshal Class
description_book: Proof of paid membership and be at least 18 years of age to begin training. All 3 classes must be attended unless other arrangements are made.
description_web: This class is for anyone who wishes to become a Thrown Weapons Marshal. Class is held in three parts, with a practical session. Participants **must** attend all three parts and have at least 3 hours of range time to complete the course (unless you make other arrangements with the Marshal in Charge). Minimum requirements for participants are membership in the SCA and a minimum age of 18. There are suggested classes also offered later in the week. At the time of the printing of the Pennsic book, the East and Middle are holding classes. There may be other kingdoms holding classes; check at the range for a complete list.

name: Scribal Bootcamp
description_book: Hands-on instruction and practice making an SCA-style scroll start to finish, working closely with an experienced scribe from concept to completion.
description_web: Hands-on instruction and practice making an SCA-style scroll start to finish, working closely with an experienced scribe from concept and wording to calligraphy, drawing and painting, to completion. This is a class for beginners (with some small experience) to intermediate scribes looking to improve their skills at putting pencil, paint and ink to paper. Class size will be limited! Please sign up at AEthelmearc hospitality the morning of class.

name: How to Run "It Takes My Child to Raze a Village"
description_book: The basics of running a parent-child focused event to help further the future generation's involvement in the SCA.
description_web: The basics of running a parent-child focused event to help further the future generation's involvement in the SCA. <----- Sorry that sounds boring, but I had to keep it short for the book description! I will explain and answer and try to answer any questions!

name: Nalbinding Heels and Thumbs
description_book: Do you know at least one nalbinding stitch? This hands-on class will show you a number of options for completing socks and mittens. Bring your needle.
description_web: Socks and mittens are common nalbinding artifacts. This class will explore a number of options for completing your own, no matter what stitch you may know. If you have never made a sock or mitten, or are looking for new design ideas, you are welcome. We will explore at least 3 heel and 2 thumb construction techniques. We will work on samples, but feel free to bring partially completed projects. Bring your needle.

name: English Rosaries and Paternosters
description_book: This class focuses on prayer beads (paternosters) in England from the 11th to 16th centuries, especially the impact of the English Reformation.

name: Introduction to *Go*
description_book: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.
description_web: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.

name: Armored Castle Battle
description_book: Begins at 10:00 am; two 30-minute battles with 15-minute switch time.
description_web: Begins at 10:00 am; two 30-minute battles with 15-minute switch time.

name: Beginning Belly Dance
description_book: Covers very basic belly dance steps
description_web: We will work on basic hip, arm and walking movements.

name: Greybeards' Rapier Tournament
description_book: A double elimination tournament depending on the number of entrants. Entrants must be 50 years old or older in the current calendar year.
description_web: We will be holding either a round robin or double elimination tournament depending on the number of entrants. Entrants must be 50 years old or older in the calendar year of 2014. AEthelmearc rapier rules apply.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class.We have three wonderful, new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Getting to Know Your Archetype (Workshop)
description_book: For students already familiar with *commedia*. Dive deep into your *commedia dell'arte* character through an active workshop.
description_web: Often in *commedia dell'arte* you have no more than the rehearsal time to develop your character. In this class we'll be work-shopping each of the archetypes. Everyone in the class will have a chance to address their personal portrayal of their favorite face, with feedback and constructive criticism from the class. Handouts with a basic overview of some of the common traits of each character will be provided for reference. Whether you've been clowning for years and want to fine-tune your approach, or you're looking forward to your first show, this is a time to flesh out your portrayal, work on your movements and crowns, and get inside the head of your character.  Students should have a basic knowledge of *commedia dell'arte*.
fee_itemization: It would be a suggested donation.I have to print at my local library for a fee, so the handout fee is to offset that cost.

name: Archery Populace War Point
description_book: Archery Populace War Point
description_web: All archers young and old are encouraged to come and lend their support to their kingdom's efforts, and to display their skill at archery. There will be 3 challenging populace shoots to test skills. Each Kingdom will be competing to earn the 3 War Points for each shoot.

name: Hand-Sewing Eyelets
description_book: Take your garb up a notch! Learn to use an awl and hand-sew eyelets to finish your bodice or to make lacing points.
description_web: Take your garb up a notch! Metal grommets don't have the look and they result in less-durable clothing. Come learn how to use an awl and needle to hand-sew your own eyelets.
fee_itemization: Each student will receive a tailor's awl.

name: Norse Apron Dress
description_book: How to pattern and construct a Norse apron dress. If possible, bring 2 yards of fabric, scissors, and fabric pen, though not necessary for the class.
description_web: How to pattern and construct a Norse apron dress. If possible,bring 2 yards of fabric, scissors, and fabric pen, though not necessary for the class.

name: Three-person Catherine Wheel Fingerloop Braid
description_book: Intermediate class on a three-person braid, the Catherine Wheel. Basic fingerloop experience is needed, partners are not.
description_web: Intermediate class on the braid known as the Catherine Wheel. This complicated braid is made by three fingerloop braiders working together. Basic fingerloop braiding experience needed, partners are not (but bringing friends is highly encouraged).

name: Beginners' *Atlatl* Throwing (Morning)
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.
description_web: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively. By THL Anlaithe ingen Trena and Lord Grimolfr Ormalfrson.

name: Mini-Bardic Madness
description_book: If you can't come to Bardic Madness, it can come to you. The challenges for one Fyt of Madness are at http://tilted-windmill.com/mini_madness.html
description_web: Heard about Bardic Madness, but been unable to attend? Now's your chance. We will be answering one Fyt of Madness at Pennsic. The challenges for it can be found at http://tilted-windmill.com/mini_madness.html. This is an excellent opportunity for new and experienced performers alike. Gentles wishing to participate as a supportive audience are most welcome to attend.

name: Feasts Are More Than Cooking
description_book: A discussion of the many things needed for a successful feast that are not in the kitchen.

name: 1000 Years of Irish History
description_book: What was happening in Ireland during our time period? Come and find out.

name: Weaving on a Warp-Weighted Loom
description_book: Warp-weighted looms can be large and strange. Let's learn how to weave on one on a smaller scale. [Follow-up to "Warping" class. Others welcome!]
description_web: A ful- size warp-weighted loom, as built in period, can be imposingly large and strange. We're going to learn how to weave on one on a smaller and more human scale. Using the warp we created in the previous class, we'll be working in pairs, learning how to weave a tabby weave, with discussions on working with more complex weaves. We'll have space for up to 12 people working hands-on. This is a follow-up class for the "Warping a Warp-Weighted Loom" class.

name: Rehearsal (Closed) - Youth *Commedia* Dress
description_book: Space in use

name: Thrown Weapons Marshals' Closing Meeting
description_book: Open to all TW marshals and MiTs. Includes a brain-storming session of possible improvements for next year's Pennsic. Please stay for clean up.
description_web: Open to all TW marshals and MiTs. Includes a brain-storming session of possible improvements for next year's Pennsic. Please stay for clean up.

name: Write a Traditional *Commedia dell'Arte* Play
description_book: Traditional *commedia* didn't use scripts but brief outline summaries called scenarios. Learn the general plot lines and how you can write them.
description_web: *Commedia* has been called "the actor's theatre" because of its improvisation and lack of scripts. But it's also "the writer's theatre". Learn about the brief outline summaries of the plot called scenarios, the general structure of a typical plot and how it can be molded into new forms, and how to write a brand new 16th-century play yourself! We'll also cover some of the more obscure plots from period troupes!

name: Medieval Pirates: Eustance the Monk
description_book: This class is based on the *The Romance of Eustance the Monk*, the pirate who fought both for and against King John.

name: Secrets in Messages
description_book: Survey of cryptography in historical period: Egyptian through Renaissance.
fee_itemization: To cover printing cost of a 10-page handout

name: Seeds in the Heart: Writing Japanese Poetry
description_book: A participatory exploration of Japanese poetics with poetic forms from the early classical period to the development of *tanka, haikai*, and *hokku*.
description_web: A participatory exploration of Japanese poetics. Includes Japanese poetry from the early classical period to the development of *tanka, haikai, hokku*, and *renga*. We will consider both formal poetic forms and less formal poetry. Learn about the role of *kigo, kiriji*, and *makurakotoba*. Participants will have an opportunity to experiment with creating their own poetry. Please bring writing materials.

name: Working Your Story
description_book: It takes work, practice and feedback to turn words into a good story. This class allows you to practice and get feedback from two master storytellers.
description_web: Storytelling takes more than just opening your mouth and letting words fall out. It takes work, practice and feedback to turn words into a good story. This class offers you a chance to practice and receive feedback from two storytellers: a professional storyteller and a storytelling Laurel.

name: Bellatrix Techniques
description_book: Fundamental and advanced Bellatrix techniques of armored sword and shield fighting. Unarmored class appropriate for all levels of proficiency.
description_web:
This class teaches fundamental and advanced techniques of the Bellatrix system of armored sword and shield fighting. It is appropriate for all levels of proficiency. Technique is one of the main pillars of successful fighting. No matter what your level of proficiency, efficient and effective technique will help you to improve your game, and avoid injury through faulty bio-mechanics.
The class is taught unarmored. Students will need a sword and preferably a shield, or something similar. Neither need to be SCA legal, but must be safe.

name: Closing Ceremonies: After Castle Battle
description_book: Closing Ceremonies will be after Castle Battle, either in front of the Fort or in the Great Hall if raining.
description_web: Closing Ceremonies will be after Castle Battle, either in front of the Fort or in the Great Hall if raining.

name: Closing Ceremonies
description_book: Closing Ceremonies will follow immediately after Castle Battle as is prudent.
description_web: Closing Ceremonies will follow immediately after Castle Battle as is prudent.

name: KW Choir Open Auditions: *Chorulus Pennsicus*
description_book: Known World Choir Open auditions for anyone interested in trying out for KW's select choir, *Chorulus Pennsicus".
description_web: Known World Choir open auditions for anyone interested in trying out for Known World Choir's select choir, *Chorulus Pennsicus*.

name: Known World Players - Open Auditions: Pennsic 44
description_book: Known World Players Pennsic 44 Auditions: Shakespeare's "The Merchant of Venice." Actors of all experience levels are welcome to come audition!
description_web: Known World Players Pennsic 44 auditions for next year's production of Shakespeare's "The Merchant of Venice", directed by Master Lorcan Dracontius.  Actors of all experience levels are welcome to come audition!

name: Strike: Ampitheater and Rehearsal Tent
description_book: Strike the Amphitheater and Rehearsal Tent: remove signs, re-stack chairs, clean up any trash and other properties left from PA classes and events.
